hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, הָתָם — מִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וּמִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן.
human_translation: And Rava, there, from this by itself and from that by itself, And he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan,
llm_translation: Rava, there — from this by itself and from this by itself, and he holds like Rabbi Yonatan.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״, וּתְנַן: יֵשׁ לָהֶן פִּדְיוֹן וְלִתְמוּרוֹתֵיהֶן, חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וּמִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר, אַלְמָא לָא מַהֲנֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: But isn’t there an animal tithe which the Merciful One states: “It shall not be redeemed” And we learned are subject to redemption and their substitutes except for the firstborn and the tithe Apparently, is not effective, a conclusive refutation of Abaye.
llm_translation: And behold, the tithe, as the Merciful One said "it shall not be redeemed," and we learned: they have redemption and substitutions, except for the firstborn and for the tithe, which implies that it does not apply, the statement of Abbaye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּיָלֵיף ״עֲבָרָה״ ״עֲבָרָה״ מִבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: say to you: It is different there, as one derives from “ avara ” “ avara ” a firstborn
llm_translation: He said to you: It is different there, for it is derived "transgression" "transgression" from firstborn.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי הִקְדִּימָהּ תְּרוּמָה לַבִּיכּוּרִים, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״מְלֵאָתְךָ וְדִמְעֲךָ לֹא תְאַחֵר״, וּתְנַן: הַמַּקְדִּים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי!
human_translation: isn’t there teruma prior to the first fruits, which the Merciful One states: “You shall not delay to offer of the fullness of your harvest and the outflow of your presses” And we learned one prior although he has a prohibition, what he did is done,
llm_translation: Behold she precedes it terumah to the bikurim, as the Merciful One said, "Your fullness and your tears shall not be delayed." And we learned: One who precedes, even though it is without an action - what he did is considered done!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״מִכֹּל מַעְשְׂרוֹתֵיכֶם תָּרִימוּ תְּרוּמָה״.
human_translation: Rava say to you: It is different there, as the verse states: “From all that is given you, you shall set apart teruma ”
llm_translation: Rava said to you: It is different there, as the verse says, "From all your tithes you shall give a contribution."

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, כִּדְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי נָמֵי נִיפְּטַר!
human_translation: And according to Abaye is required as Rav Pappa said to Abaye If that is so, even preceded in a pile, we should exempt as well.
llm_translation: And for Abbaye, it is necessary for him, as Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, even if they preceded him with a sharp knife, he would be exempt!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא ״מִכֹּל מַעְשְׂרוֹתֵיכֶם תָּרִימוּ״.
human_translation: said to With regard to your the verse states: “From all that is given you, you shall set apart.”
llm_translation: He said to him: Upon you said the verse "From all your tithes you shall give."

hebrew_text: מָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַכְּרִי וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַשִּׁיבֳּלִין? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַכְּרִי, שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּכְלַל דִּיגּוּן, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֶת הַשִּׁיבֳּלִין, שֶׁאֵינָן בִּכְלַל דִּיגּוּן.
human_translation: What did you see to include the pile and to exclude the stalks? I include the pile, as it is included in the category of grain, and I exclude the stalks, as is not included in the category of grain
llm_translation: "What did you see to include the cari and to exclude the shibboleth? I include the cari, because it is included in the category of digun, and I exclude the shibboleth, because they are not included in the category of digun."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה... לֹא יִקָּח״, וּתְנַן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִדּוּשִׁין וְיֵשׁ עֲבֵירָה — הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם.
human_translation: But isn’t there a widow to a High Priest, which the Merciful One stated: “A widow, or one divorced, shall he not take; And we learned Any case where there is betrothal and there is a transgression, the offspring follows the flawed
llm_translation: Behold, a widow to a high priest, for the Merciful One said, "A widow and a divorcee... he shall not take," and we learned: Any place where there are sanctities and there is transgression - the offspring follows the blemish.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse states: he shall not profane [ lo yeḥallel ] his seed.”
llm_translation: The two cases here, as the verse says: "He shall not profane his seed."

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי, נֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא יַחֵל״, מַאי ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״? אֶחָד לוֹ, וְאֶחָד לָהּ.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, let the verse state Lo yaḥel , What Lo yeḥallel ? One for him, and one for her,
llm_translation: To Abbaye, say: Scripture says "he shall not profane," what is "he shall not desecrate"? One for him, and one for her.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי הִקְדִּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ מוּם לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״, וּתְנַן: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא!
human_translation: But isn’t there consecrated blemished for the altar, which the Merciful One states: whatsoever has a blemish, that you shall not bring; And we learned one consecrates blemished for on the altar, even though he has a prohibition, what he did is done, a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: Behold, one who sanctified blemished animals to the altar, for the Merciful One said: "Whatever has a blemish, you shall not offer," and we learned: One who sanctified blemished animals regarding the altar, even though it is a prohibition - what he did is done, the statement of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וּלְנֶדֶר לֹא יֵרָצֶה״ — רִצּוּי הוּא דְּלָא מְרַצֵּה, הָא מִיקְדָּשׁ קָדְשִׁי.
human_translation: Rava say to you: It is different there, as the verse states “But for a vow it shall not be accepted” that it is which does not effect acceptance, consequently consecrates they are consecrated.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: It is different there, as the verse says "and he shall not break his word" - it is fitting that he not break it, for he sanctifies My holy things.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי, אִי דְּלָא אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וּלְנֶדֶר לֹא יֵרָצֶה״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּעוֹבֵר מִצְוָה וְכָשֵׁר, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, if the Merciful One had not stated: “But for a vow it shall not be accepted,” I would say like transgressed a mitzva but fit teaches us
llm_translation: And to Abbaye, if the Merciful One did not say "and he shall not annul his vow," I would say: like one who transgresses a commandment and is valid, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַקְדִּישׁ תְּמִימִין לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא:
human_translation: But there is consecrates unblemished for Temple maintenance, which the Merciful One states:
llm_translation: And behold, one consecrates unblemished animals for the inspection of the house, as the Merciful One said:

hebrew_text: ״נְדָבָה תַּעֲשֶׂה אֹתוֹ״ — זֶה קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וּתְנַן: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ תְּמִימִין לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא!
human_translation: that may you offer for a gift; This consecrated Temple maintenance. And we learned one who consecrates unblemished Temple maintenance, even though he has a prohibition, what he did is done. a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: "Voluntary shall you make it" - this refers to the consecrated funds of the Temple treasury. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who consecrates unblemished animals for the Temple treasury, even though it is not an obligatory offering - what he did is valid. This is the statement of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ [רָבָא]: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, נִתְרַבּוּ תְּמִימִין לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rava say to you: From the place that blemished are included, for on the altar unblemished are included, for Temple maintenance
llm_translation: He said to you Rava: From the place where the blemished have multiplied in relation to the altar, the unblemished have multiplied for inspecting the house.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי גָּזֵל, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״לֹא תִגְזוֹל״, וּתְנַן: הַגּוֹזֵל עֵצִים וַעֲשָׂאָן כֵּלִים, צֶמֶר וַעֲשָׂאָן בְּגָדִים — מְשַׁלֵּם כִּשְׁעַת הַגְּזֵילָה, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא!
human_translation: But there is robbery, which the Merciful One states: you shall not rob and we learned One who robs wood and fashions it vessels, wool and fashions it garments, pays according to the time of the robbery, a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: And behold, regarding theft, for the Merciful One said "You shall not steal," and we learned: One who steals wood and makes them into vessels, wool and makes them into garments - he pays at the time of the theft, the statement of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אֲשֶׁר גָּזָל״ — כְּמָה שֶׁגָּזַל.
human_translation: Rava say to you: It is different there, as the verse states: that he took by robbery” like which he took by robbery
llm_translation: Rava said to you: It is different there, as the verse says "that he stole" - the amount that he stole.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי, הַאי ״אֲשֶׁר גָּזָל״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: עַל גְּזֵילוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, עַל גְּזֵילוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו אֵינוֹ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, this “That he took by robbery,” is necessary add a fifth for his robbery, for his father’s robbery not add fifth.
llm_translation: To Abbaye, this "that he stole" from where does he require it: regarding his own theft he adds a fifth, regarding the theft of his father he does not add a fifth.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַשְׁכּוֹן, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתוֹ לַעֲבוֹט עֲבוֹטוֹ״, וּתְנַן: מַחֲזִיר אֶת הַכַּר בַּלַּיְלָה וְאֶת הַמַּחֲרֵישָׁה בַּיּוֹם — תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא!
human_translation: But there is collateral, which the Merciful One states: you shall not go into his house to fetch his pledge” And we learned he returns a mattress by night, and a plow, by day. a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: Behold the Mishkan, for the Merciful One said: "Do not enter his house to take his pledge." And we learned: One who returns the millstone at night and the mortar during the day - this is the teaching of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״הָשֵׁב תָּשִׁיב״.
human_translation: Rava say to you: It is different there, as the verse states: you shall restore [ hashev tashiv ]
llm_translation: Rava said to you: It is different there, as the verse says, "You shall surely return."

hebrew_text: וּלְאַבָּיֵי, אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״הָשֵׁב תָּשִׁיב״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אִיסּוּרָא עֲבַד, אִי בָּעֵי נַיהְדַּר וְאִי בָּעֵי לָא נַהְדַּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. (חסר לישנא אחרינא)
human_translation: And according to Abaye, If the Merciful One had not stated: “ Hashev tashiv ,” I would say performed a prohibition, if he desires, he may return and if he desires, he may not return teaches us
llm_translation: To Abbaye, if not that the Merciful One said "you shall surely return," I would have said he performed a prohibition, whether he wanted to be stringent or whether he did not want to be stringent, it is implied to us. (Another version lacks this).

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי פֵּאָה, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תְכַלֶּה פְּאַת שָׂדְךָ בְּקוּצְרֶךָ״, וּתְנַן: מִצְוַת פֵּאָה לְהַפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה, לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה — יַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעֳמָרִים, לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הָעֳמָרִים — יַפְרִישׁ מִן הַכְּרִי עַד שֶׁלֹּא מֵירְחוֹ.
human_translation: But there is produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], which the Merciful One stated: you shall not wholly reap the corner of your field” And we learned the mitzva of pe’a to separate from the standing he did not separate from the standing he separates from the sheaves he did not separate from the sheaves, he separates from the pile as long as he has not smoothed
llm_translation: Behold, regarding Pe'ah, for the Merciful One said: "You shall not finish the corner of your field in your harvesting." And we learned: The mitzvah of Pe'ah is to set aside from the standing crop, if one did not set aside from the standing crop - one should set aside from the sheaves, if one did not set aside from the sheaves - one should set aside from the pile until it is not needed.

hebrew_text: מֵירְחוֹ — מְעַשְּׂרוֹ וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ; מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: אַף מַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעִיסָּה, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי!
human_translation: he smooths he tithe and give to said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: he separates even from the dough a conclusive refutation of Abaye.
llm_translation: From his dough - he separates and gives to him; in the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said: Also separates from the dough, the preference of Abbaye!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבַּיֵּי: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״תַּעֲזוֹב״, ״תַּעֲזוֹב״ יַתִּירָא.
human_translation: Abaye say to you: It is different there, as the verse states: “You shall leave “You shall leave superfluous
llm_translation: Abaye said to you: It is different there, as the verse says "leave," "leave" implies excess.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: יֵשׁ לְךָ עֲזִיבָה אַחֶרֶת שֶׁכָּזוֹ, וְאֵיזוֹ? זֶה הַמַּפְקִיר כַּרְמוֹ.
human_translation: And Rava, say to you there is another leaving that is like this. And what is that? It is one who renounces ownership of his vineyard.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: You have another abandonment like this, and which one? This is one who declares his vineyard ownerless.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַמַּפְקִיר כַּרְמוֹ, וְהִשְׁכִּים לַשַּׁחַר וּבְצָרוֹ — חַיָּיב בְּפֶרֶט וְעוֹלֵלוֹת, בְּשִׁכְחָה וּבְפֵאָה, וּפָטוּר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: As it is taught one renounced ownership of his vineyard, and he rose early in the morning, and harvested it, he is obligated in individual fallen [ peret ], and incompletely formed clusters [ olelot ], in forgotten and in pe’a , but he exempt from the tithe
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who forsakes his vineyard, and arises early in the morning and harvests it — he is liable for Pe'ah and gleanings, for forgetfulness and corners, and exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּשַׁנִּינַן כֹּל הָנֵי שִׁינּוּיֵי, דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: And now that we have given all of these answers, with regard to what Abaye and Rava disagree?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: And now that we have learned all those changes, in what do Abaye and Rava disagree?

hebrew_text: בְּרִבִּית קְצוּצָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי, וְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רִבִּית קְצוּצָה יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין,
human_translation: They disagree with regard to fixed [ ketzutza ] interest, and like of Rabbi Elazar As Rabbi Elazar said: fixed interest is repossessed by judges
llm_translation: In ribbit ketsutzah kamifalgi, and kid'Rabbi Elazar, d'amr Rabbi Elazar: ribbit ketsutzah yotz'ah b'dayyanin.

hebrew_text: אֲבַק רִבִּית אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ רִבִּית קְצוּצָה אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: a hint of interest is not repossessed by judges And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even fixed interest is not repossessed by judges.
llm_translation: The interest of ribbit does not go out with judgments, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if the ribbit is cut, it does not go out with judgments.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם בִּסְבָרָא פְּלִיגִי? הָתָם בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי! דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בַּנֶּשֶׁךְ נָתַן וְתַרְבִּית לָקַח וָחָי לֹא יִחְיֶה״, לְחַיִּים נִיתַּן וְלֹא לְהִישָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: said to There, disagree with regard to logical reasoning, they disagree there with regard to verses, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan? The verse states: “[He] has given forth upon interest, and has taken increase; shall he then live? He shall not live; is subject for life, but not to returning.
llm_translation: He said to him: There they argue in reasoning? There they argue in verses! As Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan's opinion? The verse says: "He gave on interest and took increase; shall he then live? He shall not live! He has done all these abominable deeds; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶיךָ... אֲנִי ה׳״ — לְמוֹרָא נְתַתִּיו, וְלֹא לְהִישָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Adda said from here: but fear your God, I am the Lord” I have made subject to fear but not to returning.
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Adda said from here: "And you shall fear your God... I am the Lord" - I have given it for fear, and not for relaxation.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל עָשָׂה מוֹת יוּמָת דָּמָיו בּוֹ יִהְיֶה״, ״וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן פָּרִיץ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּם״ — הוּקְּשׁוּ מַלְוֵי רִבִּית לְשׁוֹפְכֵי דָמִים: מָה שׁוֹפְכֵי דָּמִים לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לְהִישָּׁבוֹן, אַף מַלְוֵי רִבִּית לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לְהִישָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: Rava said from here: He has done all these abominations; he shall be put to death; his blood shall be upon him” “If he fathers a son that is a robber, a shedder of blood” Usurers are juxtaposed to shedders of blood, Just as shedders of blood cannot be undone, so too, usurers cannot be undone.
llm_translation: Rava said from here: "These abominations he did, he shall surely be put to death, his blood shall be upon him," "And he begot a son, a breaker, a shedder of blood" - Malvei ribbit were juxtaposed to shedders of blood: just as shedders of blood were not given the opportunity to repent, so too malvei ribbit were not given the opportunity to repent.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״ — אַהְדַּר לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֵיחֵי עִמָּךְ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar? As the verse states: that your brother may live with you” return to so that he will live with you.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's statement? As the verse says: "And let your brother live with you" — restore him, so that he may live with you.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא? בְּשִׁינּוּי קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: But with regard to what do Abaye and Rava disagree? with regard to deviation effective.
llm_translation: And rather, with what do Abaye and Rava disagree? With acquisition through exchange.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, בְּהָנֵי שִׁינּוּיֵי דְּשַׁנִּינַן, בְּרִבִּית קְצוּצָה — לְאַבָּיֵי לָא מַהְדַּר רִבִּית, לְרָבָא מַהְדַּר רִבִּית.
human_translation: an alternative version with the answers we answered with regard to fixed interest. According to Abaye does not return interest, according to Rava return interest,
llm_translation: The other one, in the case of changes that we have taught, with a cut ribit - according to Abbaye, he does not retract ribit, according to Rava, he retracts ribit.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַבָּיֵי נָמֵי סָבַר מַפְּקִינַן רִיבִּית קְצוּצָה בְּדַיָּינִין! דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָדֵין דְּמַסֵּיק בְּחַבְרֵיהּ אַרְבַּע זוּזֵי בְּרִיבִּיתָא, וִיהַביה לֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה (בְּחָנוּתֵיהּ) [בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ] גְּלִימָא דְּשָׁוֵי חַמְשָׁא בְּאַרְבְּעָה — כִּי מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, אַרְבְּעָה מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, וְהַאי זוּזָא בְּמַתָּנָה הוּא דִּיהַב לֵיהּ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: חַמְשָׁא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? כּוּלַּהּ בְּתוֹרַת רִיבִּיתָא קָאָתֵי לִידֵיהּ!
human_translation: But Abaye also holds we repossess fixed interest by judges, as Abaye said: this who was collecting from another, four dinars as interest, and gave to the creditor, in his store, a cloak that was worth five in four when we repossess from we repossess four from him. And that dinar, gave to him as a gift. And Rava said: We repossess five from him. What is the reason? All of it came into his possession by virtue of interest.
llm_translation: And this, Abaye indeed thought that we collect a cut interest in judgments! For Abaye said: Just as one who collects four zuz in interest from his fellow, and gives it to a lender (in his shop) in his store a cloak worth five, in four — for we collect from him, four we collect from him, and this coin is a gift to him. And Rava said: Five we collect from him. What is the reason? All of it is coming under the category of interest that is coming into his hands!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא בְּשִׁינּוּי קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: Rather, when Abaye and Rava disagree, with regard to deviation effective.
llm_translation: Rather, when Abaye and Rava were arguing about the acquisition through exchange.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ מוּם לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם בְּ״לֹא תִשְׁחֲטוּ״ — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר לְמַטָּה! אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּל תַּקְרִיבוּ״? — ״בַּל תַּקְדִּישׁוּ״. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Why the verse state: “But whatever has a blemish, you shall not offer; If you may not slaughter that is stated below, Rather, why the verse state you may not offer you may not consecrate From here, stated One who consecrates blemished for on the altar violates five categories
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Anything with a blemish in it, you shall not offer." What is the Talmud coming to teach? If it says "you shall not slaughter," it has already been stated below! Rather, what is the Talmud coming to teach with "you shall not offer"? - "You shall not sanctify." From here they said: One who sanctifies blemished animals in relation to the altar transgresses five prohibitions.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּקְרִיבוּ״, ״בַּל תַּקְדִּישׁוּ״, ״בַּל תִּשְׁחֲטוּ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תִּזְרְקוּ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ כּוּלּוֹ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ מִקְצָתוֹ״. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמְרוּ: אַף קַבָּלַת הַדָּם.
human_translation: for You may not offer you may not consecrate you may not slaughter and for You may not sprinkle and for You may not burn all of it and for You may not burn part of it. said in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda: also the collection of the blood.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Due to "do not bring near," "do not sanctify," "do not slaughter," and due to "do not sprinkle," and due to "do not burn it all," and due to "do not burn part of it." Due to Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda they said: Also the acceptance of the blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִם ״בַּל תִּשְׁחֲטוּ״ — הֲרֵי אָמוּר לְמַטָּה. הֵיכָן אָמוּר? דְּתַנְיָא: ״עַוֶּרֶת אוֹ שָׁבוּר אוֹ חָרוּץ אוֹ יַבֶּלֶת לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ — מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם ״בַּל תַּקְדִּישׁוּ״ — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר לְמַעְלָה, אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּל תַּקְרִיבוּ״? — ״בַּל תִּשְׁחֲטוּ״.
human_translation: The Master said If you may not slaughter that is stated below, Where is stated? As it is taught Why the verse state: “Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a cyst, you shall not offer” If you may not consecrate that is already stated above, Rather, why the verse state you may not offer you may not slaughter
llm_translation: Master said: If "do not slaughter" - behold it is said below. Where is it said? As it was taught: "A blind one, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, you shall not offer" - what is the teaching to say? If "do not sanctify" - behold it was already said above, rather what is the teaching to say "do not offer"? - "Do not slaughter."

hebrew_text: ״וְאִשֶּׁה לֹא תִתְּנוּ מֵהֶם״ — אֵלּוּ אִשִּׁים, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא כּוּלָּן, מִקְצָתָן מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵהֶם״.
human_translation: “Nor make an offering by fire of them These fires I have only all of From where some of The verse states: “Of them,”
llm_translation: "And a woman you shall not give from them" - these are women, I have only all of them, from where some of them? The Talmud teaches: "from them."

hebrew_text: זְרִיקַת דָּמִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, ״לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ.
human_translation: From where sprinkling the blood The verse states: “Upon the altar,” “Unto the Lord,” to include the scapegoat
llm_translation: The throwing of blood, from where? The Talmud teaches: "On the altar," "to the Lord" - to include the scapegoat that is sent away.

hebrew_text: וְ״לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אִי ״קׇרְבָּן״ — שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אַף קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ ״קׇרְבָּן״, כְּעִנְיָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַנַּקְרֵב אֶת קׇרְבַּן ה׳״!
human_translation: And “Unto the Lord,” to include But isn’t it taught If “offering,” I derive even consecrated for Temple maintenance for they are called an offering, as it is stated: “And we have brought the Lord’s offering,
llm_translation: "And 'to the Lord' - to include He? And it was taught: If 'offering' - I would say even the holy items of the Temple courtyard, which are called 'offering,' as it is stated: 'And we brought the offering of the Lord!'"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְאֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד וְגוֹ׳״ — הָרָאוּי לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שׁוֹחֲטֵי חוּץ, שֶׁאֵין רָאוּי לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שׁוֹחֲטֵי חוּץ.
human_translation: the verse states: “And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” one is liable for fit to entrance of the Tent of Meeting due to slaughtering outside one is not liable for not fit to entrance of the Tent of Meeting due to slaughtering outside
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, etc." — One that is fitting for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, those outside are obligated concerning it as those who slaughter outside, but one that is not fitting for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, those outside are not obligated concerning it as those who slaughter outside.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֶת אֵלּוּ, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא פָּרַת חַטָּאת וְשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, שֶׁהֵן רְאוּיִין לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לַה׳״, מִי שֶׁמְּיוּחָדִין לַה׳, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין לַה׳.
human_translation: I exclude these but not exclude the heifer of purification, and scapegoat, as they are fit to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. the verse states: “Unto the Lord,” those that are exclusively the Lord’s These, are excluded, as they are not exclusively the Lord’s
llm_translation: I will exclude these, but I will not exclude the cow of the sin offering and the scapegoat, for they are fit to be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting - the Talmud teaches to say "to the Lord," those that are designated for the Lord, these have been excluded, for they are not designated for the Lord.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָתָם, מֵעִנְיָינָא דִּקְרָא, ״וְאֶל פֶּתַח״ — לְרַבּוֹת, ״לַה׳״ — לְהוֹצִיא; הָכָא, דְּ״אִשֶּׁה״ — לְהוֹצִיא, ״לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: There, from the context of the verse. “And to the entrance to include “Unto the Lord,” to exclude Here, where “fire” to exclude “Unto the Lord,” to include
llm_translation: Rava said: There, in the matter of the verse, "and at the entrance" - to include "to the Lord" - to exclude; here, with regard to "a woman" - to exclude, "to the Lord" - to include.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב קְרָא ״לַה׳״ הוּא דְּלָא מַיְיתֵי שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, הָא לָא רַבִּי קְרָא ״לַה׳״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ בַּעַל מוּם שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. מִכְּדִי, אֵין הַגּוֹרָל קוֹבֵעַ אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר הָרָאוּי!
human_translation: the reason may not be brought scapegoat that the verse writes: “Unto the Lord.” had the verse not included “Unto the Lord,” I would say permitted a blemished scapegoat. Now, the lottery can establish only is fit
llm_translation: The reason that the verse writes "to the Lord" is so that a goat that is designated for Azazel should not come. For if the verse had written "to the Lord," I would have said that a blemished goat is fit. However, since the lottery only determines matters that are fitting!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא מַנִּי? חָנָן הַמִּצְרִי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ דָּם בְּכוֹס — מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ וּמְזַוֵּוג לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: whose is this It is Ḥanan the Egyptian, who said even blood in the cup, brings another and pairs it with
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is the meaning of this? It is Chanin the Egyptian, who said: Even if there is blood in a cup - he brings his fellow and mixes it for him.

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְחָנָן הַמִּצְרִי, דְּלָא הָוֵי דִּיחוּי, דְּלָא צְרִיךְ הַגְרָלָה — מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? דִּילְמָא מַיְיתֵי וּמַגְרִיל!
human_translation: Granted that you learn from Ḥanan the Egyptian that there is no deferral do you learn from him need not be a lottery? Perhaps brings and performs a lottery
llm_translation: Let it be heard for Hanan the Egyptian, for it is not a coincidence, for it does not require a lottery - who heard him? Perhaps he will come and cast lots!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן — מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ בְּלֹא הַגְרָלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught one of dies, brings another without lottery; the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Is this a dispute? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: If one of them dies, his companion brings another without a lottery, the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא נִצְרְכָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוּמַם בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם וְחִילְּלוֹ עַל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: No, is necessary where became blemished on that day and desacralized it onto another
llm_translation: Rava said: Not necessary, for example, that he was confused in it during the day and he desecrated it regarding his fellow.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי הַאי מִיקְּבַע לַשֵּׁם, אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִינְּכַר שֵׁם — לָא לָקֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say granted, initially, we do not know if this be designated to the Lord But here, since it is clear Lord, not flogged teaches us
llm_translation: I will ascend to your understanding: I say, in truth, from the outset, we did not know if this is established for the sake of Heaven, but here, since the name is not recognized - it does not adhere, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַף קַבָּלַת הַדָּם. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת וְנָתוּק וְכָרוּת וְגוֹ׳״ — זוֹ קַבָּלַת הַדָּם, שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Master said in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda: the collection of the blood as well. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse states: “That which has its testicles bruised, or crushed, or torn, or cut, this the collection of the blood, which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said
llm_translation: Master said: In the name of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, even the receiving of the blood. What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda? Scripture says: "And twisted, and crushed, and torn, and cut off, etc." - this is the receiving of the blood, as Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda said.

hebrew_text: וּלְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הַאי ״לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִזְרִיקַת דָּמִים. וְהָא נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״? אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא דְּמִשְׁתַּעֵי הָכִי.
human_translation: And according to the first tanna , why do I this “You shall not offer,” He requires to sprinkling the blood. But he derives this from “Upon the altar” the manner of the verse that it speaks like this.
llm_translation: And to the first Tanna, this "do not offer" - why do I need it? He requires it for the sprinkling of blood. But hasn't it already been derived from "from upon the altar"? The verse's path goes like this.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא הוּא? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא קַבָּלַת הַדָּם מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵהָא: ״וּמִיַּד בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ — זוֹ הִיא קַבָּלַת הַדָּם שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But also Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, this is the manner of the verse. Yes, it is indeed so. Rather, from where does he collection of the blood? He derives it from this “Neither from the hand of a foreigner shall you offer This is the collection of the blood which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda said, is this the way of the verse? It is not so. Rather, what does he derive from the acceptance of the blood? He derives it from here: "But a foreigner shall not approach you" — this is the acceptance of the blood that Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda stated.

hebrew_text: וּלְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הַאי ״לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהַאי: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וְלֹא נִצְטַוּוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ אֶלָּא עַל מְחוּסַּר אֵבָרִים, לָא שְׁנָא בְּמִזְבֵּחַ דִּידְהוּ וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּמִזְבֵּחַ דִּידַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And according to the first tanna , why do I this Neither shall you offer? He requires to this enter your mind to say since the descendants of Noah are commanded only with regard to lacking limbs there is no difference on their altar or on our altar teaches us
llm_translation: And to the first Tanna, this "do not offer" - why do I need it? He answers him: I would say according to your reasoning, since the sons of Noah were not commanded except regarding the prohibition of eating a limb from a living animal, it makes no difference for their altar or for our altar, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל קַבָּלַת הַדָּם. מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת... לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ — זוֹ קַבָּלַת הַדָּם, וּזְרִיקָה נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: an alternative version Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: for the collection of the blood as well. What is the reasoning As it is written: “That which has its testicles bruised, or crushed, you shall not offer This the collection of the blood. And he derives sprinkling from “Upon the altar”
llm_translation: Another teaching: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even regarding the receiving of the blood. What is the reason? As it is written: "And twisted and crushed... you shall not offer" — this refers to the receiving of the blood, and the sprinkling is derived from "from upon the altar."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי תִּיפּוֹק לְהוּ זְרִיקָה מִן ״עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״! הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאֶלָּא ״לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ דְּמָעוּךְ לְמַאי אֲתָא? מַפְּקִינַן [לֵיהּ] לְבָמַת יָחִיד.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis as well, let them derive sprinkling from “upon the altar.” indeed But for what comes “You shall not offer” with regard to bruised We learn of a private altar,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And for the Rabbis, let them come out to him a sprinkling from 'upon the altar'! So they say, but rather 'you shall not offer' - for what purpose does this come? We bring it out to him to the private altar."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְבָמַת יָחִיד? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא ״תַּקְרִיבוּ״ דְּקַבָּלָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? ״מִיָּד בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא תַקְרִיבוּ״ — זוֹ קַבָּלַת הַדָּם.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, he requires this to a private altar. Yes, is indeed so. Rather, where does he “shall offer” for collection “Neither from the hand of a foreigner shall you offer This the collection of the blood.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, does he require for an individual's altar? It is not so, but "you shall offer" - from where does he derive it from tradition? "A foreigner's son shall not offer immediately" - this is the tradition of the blood.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּבְנֵי נֹחַ אֵין מְצוִּּוין אֶלָּא עַל מְחוּסַּר אֵבֶר בְּבָמָה דִּלְהוֹן, דִּלְמָא אֲנַן נָמֵי נְקַבֵּיל מִינְּהוֹן? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״מִכׇּל אֵלֶּה״ דְּלָא מְקַבְּלִינַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis necessary may enter your mind to say since the descendants of Noah are commanded only with regard to lacking a limb on their altar perhaps we accept from them as well. teaches us “of any of these” that we do not accept
llm_translation: The sages required, as your mind may suggest: Since the sons of Noah are only commanded regarding the prohibition of a limb from a living animal on their altar, perhaps we too should accept it from them? It is derived for us from "from all these" that we do not accept it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁמָּא לֹא שָׁנִינוּ אֶלָּא בְּתָם שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה בַּעַל מוּם, וְעוֹבֵר, דְּאִי בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרָא — דִּיקְלָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: Reish Lakish objects to this: Perhaps we learned only with regard to an unblemished that became blemished, and transgresses As, if blemished from the outset, it is a mere date palm,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish objects to him: Perhaps we only taught this in the case of an animal that became blemished after it was consecrated, and it passed the time of its consecration, for if it was blemished from the outset, it is like any other animal!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: ״שָׂרוּעַ וְקָלוּט״ כְּתִיב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וְהָנֵי בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין מֵעִיקָּרָא נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said to that has anything too long or too short” are written in the passage and these are blemished from the outset.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: "Saru'a and Kalut" is written in the portion, and these Ba'alei Mumim are inherently disqualified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא לֹא שָׁנִינוּ אֶלָּא בִּתְמוּרָה, דִּתְנַן: חוֹמֶר בַּתְּמוּרָה מִבַּזֶּבַח, שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁה חָלָה עָלֶיהָ עַל בַּעַל מוּם קָבוּעַ.
human_translation: said to Perhaps we learned only with regard to substitution, as we learned greater stringency with regard to a substitute than with regard to an offering, as, with a permanent blemish is imbued with sanctity.
llm_translation: He said to him: Perhaps we only taught regarding an exchange, as we learned: The stringency of an exchange is greater than that of a sacrifice, for sanctity takes effect upon it in the case of a blemished animal.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי, בַּחֲבוּרָה נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ בַּעַל מוּם לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת, וְאִי בִּתְמוּרָה נָמֵי — שִׁשָּׁה הָוְויָין, דְּאִיכָּא נָמֵי לָאו דִּתְמוּרָה! אֶלָּא מַאי — בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ? אַמַּאי לָקֵי? דִּיקְלָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Didn’t you hear that which Rabbi Yannai says, in a group, were counted and they concluded: One who consecrates blemished for on the altar violates five categories But if also substitution, there are six as there is the prohibition of substitution. Rather, what of blemished from the outset? Why is he flogged? It is a mere date palm.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: Do you not hear what Rabbi Yannai said, they were counted in a group and concluded: One who consecrates a blemished animal towards the altar transgresses on account of five names, and if it is a substitution, there are six entities, for there is no substitution! Rather, what is it - is it from its inception blemished? Why is it fit? Because it is essentially fit!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּיקְלָא — לָאו זִילָא מִילְּתָא, מִין עֵצִים הוּא; בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרָא — זִילָא מִילְּתָא, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁבֵיק תְּמִימִים וְאַקְדֵּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין — מִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: said to a date palm, the matter is not disgraceful, it is a type of wood blemished from the outset, the matter is disgraceful. Since he forsook unblemished and consecrated blemished he is liable
llm_translation: He said to him: A palm tree - is not a matter, it is a type of wood; a blemished animal from the outset - it is a matter, since it renders the unblemished impure and sanctifies the blemished.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי בַּזְיָא מִילְּתָא, דְּדֶקֶל לֵיכָּא בְּמִינוֹ — לָא לָקֵי, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּעַל מוּם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בְּמִינוֹ — לָקֵי.
human_translation: an alternative version said to Nevertheless, the matter is disgraceful. For a date palm, there is no of its type he is not flogged to the exclusion of a blemished since there are of its type he is flogged
llm_translation: The other student said to him: Even if there is a disgraceful matter concerning a palm tree, if there is none like it in its species - it is not disqualified; if there is a blemish - once there is one like it in its species, it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲמוּר טַעְמָא דְּבַעַל מוּם דְּלָקֵי — מִשּׁוּם דְּבַזְיָא מִילְּתַיְיהוּ, אֲפִילּוּ (למקדיש) [מַקְדֵּישׁ] לֵיהּ לִדְמֵי נְסָכִים — נָמֵי לָקֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Now that it has been said the reason that a blemished is flogged due to the matter is disgraceful, even one who consecrates it to money for libations flogged as well,
llm_translation: Rava said: Now that the reason for disqualifying a blemished animal is stated - because their disgrace is apparent, even if one consecrates it for the value of libations, it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא:
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava:
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava:

hebrew_text: ״נְדָבָה תַּעֲשֶׂה אֹתוֹ״ — זֶה קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא נְדָבָה, נֶדֶר מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְנֵדֶר״.
human_translation: “You may offer it for a gift” is consecrated Temple maintenance. And I have only a gift; from where a vow The verse states: and for a vow.”
llm_translation: "״Nedavah ta'aseh oto״ — zeh kodshei bedek habayit, ve'ein li ela nedavah, neder minayin? Talmud lomar: ״ul'nedar״." Translation: "A freewill offering you shall make it" — this refers to the funds for the maintenance of the Temple courtyard, and I have only freewill offerings, where is the source for a vow? The Talmud teaches: "and for a vow."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּלְנֵדֶר לֹא יֵרָצֶה״, זֶה קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ. וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא נֶדֶר, נְדָבָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״נְדָבָה״. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יֵרָצֶה״ — בְּהַרְצָאַת גּוּפוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: might even offerings the altar. the verse states: “And for a vow it shall not be accepted.” This offerings the altar, And I have only a vow From where a gift The verse states: “A gift Rabbi says: “It shall not be accepted,” the verse is speaking of the acceptance of body,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible even with the holy items of the altar? The Torah teaches "And he shall not accept a vow," this refers to the holy items of the altar. And I have only a vow, where is a freewill offering derived from? The Torah teaches "freewill offering." Rabbi says: "And he shall not accept" - the Scripture is speaking about the acceptance of his body.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ אַקְדְּשֵׁיהּ לִדְמֵי נְסָכִים — נָמֵי לָקֵי, וְרַבִּי סָבַר: בְּהַרְצָאַת גּוּפוֹ — נָמֵי לָקֵי, אֲבָל בִּדְמֵי נְסָכִים — לָא לָקֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is the first tanna . What, is it not they disagree with regard to this, that the first tanna holds even consecrates it to money for libations, he is flogged as well; and Rabbi holds in acceptance of body, is indeed flogged, but money for libations, he is not flogged. Learn from
llm_translation: This is the first Tanna! What is the reason he does not agree with that? For the first Tanna holds: Even if he consecrates it for the value of libations — it is fit, and Rabbi holds: With the valuation of his body — it is fit, but with the value of libations — it is not fit. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״אוֹתוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״נְדָבָה תַּעֲשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ״ — ״אוֹתוֹ״ תַּעֲשֶׂה נְדָבָה, וְאִי אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה תָּמִים נְדָבָה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת. מִיכָּן אָמְרוּ: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ תְּמִימִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: But why do I “it,” for that which is taught “You may offer it for a gift,” you may offer this as a gift but you may not offer an unblemished as a gift for Temple maintenance. From here said: One who consecrates unblemished for Temple maintenance transgresses a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: "And rather, 'it' why do I need? As it was taught: 'A freewill offering you shall make it' — 'it' you shall make a freewill offering, and if you do not make it perfect, a freewill offering alone for inspecting the house. From here they said: One who consecrates perfect animals for inspecting the house — he transgresses a positive commandment."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן אַף בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה לֵּאמֹר״ — לִימֵּד עַל הַפָּרָשָׁה שֶׁהִיא בְּלָאו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And from where a prohibition as well? As it is stated “And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying [ lemor ]” teaches that the passage is a prohibition. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And from where do we learn even the prohibition of without doing - as it says "And Hashem spoke to Moshe saying" - this teaches us regarding the matter that it is a negative commandment, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְבַר קַפָּרָא: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אֲמַר לֵיהּ דִּכְתִיב ״לֵאמֹר״ — ״לֹא״ נֶאֱמַר בַּדְּבָרִים. בֵּי רַבִּי אָמְרִי: ״לֹא אֱמוֹר״.
human_translation: Rabbi said to bar Kappara: From where may be inferred said to him as it is written: “ Lemor ,” No [ ], is stated [ ne’emar ] with regard to matters. In the school of Rabbi they say: No [ lo ] shall you say [ emor ]
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Levar Kapara: What does it imply? He said to him, as it is written "saying" - "no" is not said in matters. In the school of Rabbi they say: "Do not say."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמַּעֲלֶה אֵבְרֵי בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, אָמַר רָבָא: עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ כּוּלּוֹ״ וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּקְטִירוּ מִקְצָתוֹ״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת.
human_translation: was stated: one who brings up the limbs of blemished onto the altar, Rava says he violates of “You may not burn all of it;” and of “You may not burn part of it,” Abaye says: One is not flogged for a general prohibition.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who offers the limbs of blemished animals on the altar, Rava said: he transgresses both "do not burn it all" and "do not burn part of it." Abaye said: One is not liable for a negative commandment that is inclusive.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ — עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection One who consecrates blemished for on the altar violates five categories a conclusive refutation of Abaye.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who sanctifies blemished animals upon the altar - transgresses on account of five names, the argument of Abbaye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּגַבְרֵי קָתָנֵי! אִי בְּגַבְרֵי — ״עוֹבֵר״?! ״עוֹבְרִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּחַד גַּבְרָא, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: is teaching with regard to men, If of men, Violates, should have Violate, Rather, obvious to one man, and a conclusive refutation of Abaye.
llm_translation: Abaye said: With regard to men of small stature! If with regard to men of small stature — "he passes"?! "They pass" is what he meant! Rather, it is obvious with one man, and the conclusion is in accordance with Abaye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַפֵּיק ״הַקְטָרַת מִקְצָתוֹ״, וְעַיֵּיל ״קַבָּלַת הַדָּם״. קַבָּלַת דָּם — לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִית לֵיהּ, לְתַנָּא קַמָּא לֵית לֵיהּ? קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Abaye said: remove burning part of and insert collection of the blood, collection of the blood, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, is of the first tanna is not of difficult.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Bring out "its handful of the incense," and bring in "the receiving of the blood." The receiving of the blood — does Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, have it, and the first Tanna does not have it? It is difficult!

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: an alternative version But that the latter clause is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, the first clause the Rabbis. The refutation of Abaye a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The other version: And this, from the end, is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, the first part is of the Rabbis. The preference of Abbaye, the preference.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּהֲנִים מְמִירִין בְּשֶׁלָּהֶן, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִירִין בְּשֶׁלָּהֶן. אֵין הַכֹּהֲנִים מְמִירִין לֹא בְּחַטָּאת וְלֹא בְּאָשָׁם וְלֹא בִּבְכוֹר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין מְמִירִין בִּבְכוֹר? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן, וּבְכוֹר מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן. מָה חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם אֵין מְמִירִין בּוֹ, אַף בְּכוֹר אֵין מְמִירִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: The priests substitute for their and Israelites substitute for their The priests substitute neither for a sin offering, nor for a guilt offering, nor for a firstborn Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: For what not substitute for a firstborn Rabbi Akiva said to him: A sin offering and a guilt offering a gift to the priest, and the firstborn a gift to the priest. Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering, cannot substitute for it, so too a firstborn cannot substitute for it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The priests exchange their own consecrated animals, and Israelites exchange their own consecrated animals. The priests do not exchange animals designated for sin-offerings, guilt-offerings, or firstborn animals. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: Why do they not exchange firstborn animals? Rabbi Akiva said to him: A sin-offering and a guilt-offering are gifts to the priest, and a firstborn animal is a gift to the priest. Just as one does not exchange consecrated animals in the case of a sin-offering and a guilt-offering, so too one does not exchange consecrated animals in the case of a firstborn animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: מָה לוֹ אִם אֵינוֹ מֵמִיר בְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם, שֶׁאֵין זָכִין בָּהֶן בְּחַיֵּיהֶן, תֹּאמַר בִּבְכוֹר שֶׁזָּכִין בּוֹ בְּחַיָּיו! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְהָיָה הוּא וּתְמוּרָתוֹ יִהְיֶה קּוֹדֶשׁ״, הֵיכָן קְדוּשָּׁה חָלָה עָלָיו? בְּבֵית הַבְּעָלִים, אַף תְּמוּרָה בְּבֵית הַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: What for him? If does not substitute for a sin offering and a guilt offering, which do not acquire during lifetimes, will you say with regard to a firstborn, which do acquire during lifetime? Rabbi Akiva said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “Then both it and its substitute shall be sacred” Where is imbued with sanctity? in the house of the owner. So too, substitute in the house of the owner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: What does he gain if he does not exchange his animal for a sin-offering and guilt-offering, for one does not acquire them in their lifetime? You might say he gains regarding a firstborn, for one acquires it in their lifetime! Rabbi Akiva said to him: Has it not already been stated, "And it shall be, he and his exchange shall be holy," where does holiness come upon him? In the house of the husband, so too exchange occurs in the house of the husband.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: בְּכוֹר מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּם חַי, וּבַעַל מוּם חַי וְשָׁחוּט, וּמְקַדְּשִׁין בּוֹ הָאִשָּׁה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, הוֹאִיל וְאִית לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּויהּ (הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ לַכֹּהֵן שׁוּתָּפוּת בּוֹ), אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כֵּיוָן דְּתָם לְהַקְרָבָה הוּא דְּקָאֵי — אֵין מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּמִים חַי.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere a firstborn one may sell it unblemished alive, And blemished, alive or slaughtered. And can betroth a woman with it, Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: They taught only with regard to the present, since the priest has acquire But when the Temple is standing, since unblemished stands for sacrifice, not sell it unblemished alive.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We learned there: A firstborn animal, they sell it whether it is whole i.e., without blemish and alive, or blemished and alive and slaughtered, and one may betroth a woman with it. Rav Nahman said in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: They only taught this law in this time, since there is merit for the priest in its sale (since the priest has a share in it), but at a time when the Temple stood, since it is fit for offering, that is when it stands - they do not sell it whole and alive.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּמִים חַי — חַי אִין, שָׁחוּט לָא. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — מִי אִיכָּא תָּם שָׁחוּט? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, וְקָתָנֵי נָמֵי: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּמִים חַי, (אַלְמָא אִית לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּויהּ)!
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: one may sell an unblemished alive. alive, yes, slaughtered, not When If we say in the present, is there an unblemished, slaughtered, Rather, obvious when the Temple is standing. And still teaches one may sell an unblemished alive,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If one sells an unblemished live animal - it is not alive, if it is slaughtered. When is this? If you say in our time - is there a blemished live animal? Rather, it is obvious that this is the case when the Temple is standing, and it is taught: One may sell an unblemished live animal, (implying that the priest has a merit in its sale)!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, מִי קָתָנֵי: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּמִים חַי — אִין, שָׁחוּט — לָא? הִא גּוּפַאּ אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן, דְּבִזְמַן הַזֶּה נָמֵי מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ תָּמִים חַי.
human_translation: No; actually in the present. Does teach: One may sell an unblemished alive, yes, slaughtered, no? it is coming to teach us the that even in the present, one may sell it unblemished alive.
llm_translation: Not, always, in this time, who sells it unblemished alive - no, slaughtered - yes? The body itself comes to teach us, that in this time indeed they sell it unblemished alive.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: בִּבְכוֹר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא תִפְדֶּה״ וְנִמְכָּר הוּא, בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״וְאֶת דָּמָם תִּזְרוֹק עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה מִי אִיכָּא מִזְבֵּחַ? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: raised an objection to With regard to a firstborn is stated: you shall not redeem; But it may be sold What are we dealing with If we say in the present, say the latter clause “And you shall sprinkle their blood against the altar.” Is there an altar in the present? Rather, obvious when the Temple is standing.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: In the case of a firstborn, it is stated "it shall not be redeemed," yet it can be sold. With what are we dealing? If you say in our time, say the latter part: "And you shall pour their blood upon the altar." In our time, is there an altar? Rather, it is obvious that we are dealing with a time when the Temple is standing.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּבַעַל מוּם — אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״וְאֶת דָּמָם תִּזְרוֹק עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְאֶת חֶלְבָּם תַּקְטִיר״ — מִי חֲזֵי לְהַקְרָבָה?! אֶלָּא לָאו בְּתָם, וְקָתָנֵי נִמְכָּר הוּא, אַלְמָא אִית לְהוּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּיהּ!
human_translation: And what with If we say to a blemished say the latter clause “And you shall sprinkle their blood against the altar, and burn their fat.” Is fit for sacrifice? Rather, is it not to an unblemished And teaches it may be sold. Evidently, the priest has acquisition to
llm_translation: With what? Perhaps with a blemished animal — say the latter clause: "And you shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar, and you shall offer up their fat" — who sees to bring it near?! Rather, it is not with an unblemished one, and the Mishnah teaches that it has been sold, implying that the priest has merit in its purchase!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? רֵישָׁא — בְּבַעַל מוּם, סֵיפָא — בְּתָם.
human_translation: Are comparable? The first clause with regard to a blemished the latter clause with regard to an unblemished
llm_translation: From the hands of Irya? The beginning - in a blemished animal, the end - in an unblemished one.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: כֹּהֶנֶת שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵבה וְלָדָהּ בִּוְלַד שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הִגְדִּילוּ הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת — מְשַׁחְרְרִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם אוֹכְלִין בִּתְרוּמָה, וְחוֹלְקִין חֵלֶק אֶחָד עַל הַגּוֹרֶן. בְּכוֹרָן יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raises an objection a priestess’s offspring who was comingled with her maidservant’s offspring, the comingled have grown up, they free each other, And they both partake of teruma , And they receive one share in the granary, their firstborn graze until they become unfit and they may be eaten with their blemish.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: If a Kohenet who became mixed up and gave birth to a child from her maidservant, and the mixtures grew up - they may free each other, both may eat terumah, and they divide one portion on the threshing floor. Their firstborn animals graze until they develop a blemish, and then they may be eaten with a blemish.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — מַאי שְׁנָא דִּידַן וּמַאי שְׁנָא דִּידְהוּ? דִּידַן נָמֵי מוּמִין בָּעֵינַן! אֶלָּא לָאו בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אִית לְהוּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּויהּ — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֵית לֵיהּ — לֵיתֵי גִּזְבָּר וְלִישְׁקְלֵהּ!
human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say in the present, what is different our and what is different their Ours also require blemishes Rather, is it not when the Temple is standing? Granted, if you say the priest has acquisition to well. But if you say does not have let treasurer [ gizbar ] come and take
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? Perhaps in our time — what is the difference between us and them? We also require blemished animals! Rather, is it not because in a time when the Temple stood? If you say, if there is merit for the priest in its purchase — excellent, but if you say there is no merit — let a treasurer come and take it!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: מַאי שְׁנָא דִּידַן וּמַאי שְׁנָא דִּידְהוּ? אֲנַן יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן בְּמוּמַיְיהוּ, אִינְהוּ — כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בְּהוּ מִקְצָת כֹּהֵן, מַפְקַע לֵיהּ לְכֹהֲנִים.
human_translation: Actually, of the present. And that which difficult for you: What is different our and what is different their we give to a priest once they are blemished. they, since there is part of a priest in them dislodge the priests
llm_translation: Always in this time, and it is difficult for you: What is the difference between us and what is the difference between them? We give it to the priest with their blemishes, they — once there is some priestly lineage in them, they give it to the priests.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, מַאי אִירְיָא בְּכוֹרוֹת דְּהָלֵין סְפֵיקוֹת? אֲפִילּוּ דִּידַן נָמֵי יִרְעוּ! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, וְאִי בְּבַעַל מוּם — יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ? הָא מְסוֹאָבִין וְקָיְימִין! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּתַמִּין, וְהָכִי הוּא דְּלָא מְזַבְּנִי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: an alternative version to the present, why specifically firstborn of these uncertain Even our should graze Rather, obvious to when the Temple is standing. And if speaking of a blemished They graze until they become unfit They are already unfit. Rather, obvious to unblemished and it is such as this, that they definitely may not sell
llm_translation: Another teaching: In this time, what is the status of firstborn animals that are doubtful? Even our animals should graze! Rather, it is obvious that when the Temple is standing, and if it has a blemish — they should graze until they become blemished? They are fattened and remain standing! Rather, it is obvious that they should be left to graze, and this is so that they are not sold and certainly.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, מַאי קַשְׁיָא לָךְ, אֲפִילּוּ דִּילַן נָמֵי יִרְעוּ? לָא (מָצִינוּ) [מָצֵינַן] מְדַחֵינַן לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן, דְּלָא אִית כָּאן סְפֵק כְּהוּנָּה. הָנֵי סְפֵיקוֹת מְדַחוּ לְכֹהֵן, כֹּל חַד וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן: דַּאֲנָא כֹּהֵן וַאֲנָא כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Actually, to the present. What difficult for you, even our graze We are unable to deny the priest as there is no priesthood, uncertain, here these uncertain deny the priest, both of them say to the priest: I am a priest, and I am a priest.
llm_translation: Always in this time, what is difficult for you, even if ours will graze? No (we find) we push to him to the priest, for there is no doubt of priesthood here. Those doubts we push to the priest, each and every one says to him to the priest: "I am a priest and I am a priest."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״בְּהֶמְתָּהּ״ — פְּרָט לְבֶהֱמַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁבָּהּ, ״שְׁלָלָהּ״ — פְּרָט לְכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon says: “its animals” to exclude firstborn animals and tithe that are in “its spoil” to exclude money second tithe that is in
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: Rabbi Shimon says: "Its livestock" - excluding the firstborn animal and the tithe of it, "its spoil" - excluding the second tithe money of it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — מִי אִיכָּא עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say in the present, can there be an idolatrous city But didn’t we learn may be designated an idolatrous city only in a court of seventy-one Rather, obvious to when the Temple is standing.
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? Perhaps in our time — is there a city of refuge? But we have learned: A city of refuge is established only by a court of seventy-one! Rather, it is obvious that in a time when the Temple is standing.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי? אִי נֵימָא בְּבַעַל מוּם — הַיְינוּ ״בְּהֶמְתָּהּ״! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּתָם. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אִית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּיהּ — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֵית לֵיהּ — לְמָה לִי מִבְּהֵמָה? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״שְּׁלָלָהּ״, וְלֹא שְׁלַל שָׁמַיִם!
human_translation: And to what If you say to a blemished this is “its animals,” Rather, obvious to an unblemished And granted, if you say has acquisition to well, But if you say does not have why do I from animals”? One should derive its from “its spoil,” But not the spoils of Heaven.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And with what? If you say with a blemished animal - that is "with her animal"! Rather, it is obvious with an unblemished one. And if you say, "If it has merit in itself, it is fine," but if you say, "It does not have merit," why do I need from an animal? Let him take from "its spoil," and not from the spoils of heaven!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּבַעַל מוּם, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ הַיְינוּ ״בְּהֶמְתָּהּ״ — מִי שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל בְּתוֹרַת ״בְּהֶמְתָּהּ״, יָצְאוּ בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר (שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּכְלַל) [שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָלִין בְּתוֹרַת] ״בְּהֶמְתָּהּ״.
human_translation: Actually, of a blemished And that which difficult for you, this is “its animals,” that which is eaten in the manner of its animals, excludes firstborn and tithe which is not in the category of “its animals.”
llm_translation: Always with a blemish, and it is difficult for you, that is "in its animal" - one who ate from the Torah of "in its animal," firstborn and tithe have been fulfilled (which are not included) that are not eaten in the Torah of "in its animal."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כׇּל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין נִמְכָּרִין בָּאִיטְלִיז, וְנִשְׁחָטִין בָּאִיטְלִיז, וְנִשְׁקָלִין בְּלִיטְרָא, חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וּמִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁהֲנָאָתָן לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: as we learned All disqualified consecrated sold in the butchers’ market [ ba’itliz ], And they are slaughtered in the butchers’ market, and is weighed by the litra , with the exception of a firstborn and tithe as their benefit to their owners.
llm_translation: We have learned: all disqualified consecrated items are redeemed with Italian coins, and are slaughtered with Italian coins, and are weighed with a litra, except for the firstborn and the tithe, for their benefit goes to the owners.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וּמָעֲלָה מַעַל בַּה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים, שֶׁהֵן מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: raises an objection “And commit a trespass against the Lord,” to include offerings of lesser sanctity as they are the property of owner, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And he acts treacherously against the Lord" - to include light holy items, which are the property of their owners, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: לְרַבּוֹת שְׁלָמִים. אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹסַאי אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי אֶלָּא בִּבְכוֹר בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Ben Azzai says: to include a peace offering Abba Yosei ben Dosai says: Ben Azzai stated only with regard to a firstborn
llm_translation: Ben Azzai says: to include peace offerings. Abba Yosei ben Dosai says: Ben Azzai only said this regarding the firstborn alone.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — הָא דּוּמְיָא דִּשְׁלָמִים קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say in the present, doesn’t teach similar to a peace offering? Rather, obvious to when the Temple is standing.
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? Perhaps with the present time — this is similar to the case of Shelamim! Rather, it is obvious that we are dealing with a time when the Temple stood.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּבַעַל מוּם — הָא דּוּמְיָא דִּשְׁלָמִים קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו בְּתָם, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אִית לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּויהּ.
human_translation: And what are we dealing with? If we say to a blemished doesn’t it teach similar to a peace offering? Rather, is it not to an unblemished And Learn from it the priest has acquisition to
llm_translation: And with what are we dealing? If you say with a blemished animal - but that which is similar to peace offerings is taught! Rather, it is not with an unblemished one, and we learn from it that a priest has a share in its redemption.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בְּתָם, וּבִבְכוֹר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא דְּאָמַר: אִם בָּאוּ תְּמִימִין יִקְרְבוּ.
human_translation: Abaye says: No, actually, to an unblemished of a firstborn outside of Eretz and it is Rabbi Shimon, who said: If unblemished came they may be sacrificed
llm_translation: Abaye said: No, always with an unblemished animal, and a firstborn outside the Land, and Rabbi Shimon is the one who said: "If the perfect ones come, they shall approach."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: מָה לִי אִם אֵינוֹ מֵימֵר בְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֵין זָכִין בָּהֶן בְּחַיֵּיהֶן, תֹּאמַר בִּבְכוֹר שֶׁזָּכִין בְּחַיָּיו. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּבַעַל מוּם — הָא דּוּמְיָא דְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם קָאָמַר, אֶלָּא לָאו בְּתָם, וְקָתָנֵי זָכִין בּוֹ בְּחַיָּיו!
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said to him: What for me? If does not substitute for a sin offering and a guilt offering, which do not acquire during lifetimes, will you say with regard to a firstborn, which acquire during lifetime? What are we dealing with If we say to a blemished isn’t saying similar to a sin offering and a guilt offering, Rather, is it not to unblemished And it teaches: acquire during lifetime.
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said to him: What do I gain if he does not say regarding sin-offering and guilt-offering, for they do not acquire the status of ownership for their owners in their lifetimes, you should say regarding a firstborn animal that they acquire the status of ownership for him in his lifetime. With what are we dealing? If you say with a blemished animal — he is speaking about a comparison to sin-offering and guilt-offering, but not with an unblemished animal, and the Mishnah teaches that they acquire the status of ownership for him in his lifetime!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הָא נָמֵי בִּבְכוֹר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אִם בָּאוּ תְּמִימִים — יִקְרְבוּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: This too to a firstborn outside of Eretz and it is Rabbi Shimon, who said: If unblemished came they may be sacrificed
llm_translation: Ravina said: Here is an example of a firstborn animal outside the land, and it is Rabbi Shimon who said: "If they are unblemished, they shall be brought near."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: בְּכוֹר, בְּבֵית הַבְּעָלִים — עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, בְּבֵית הַכֹּהֵן — אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁבָּא לִידֵי כֹהֵן — אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im . a firstborn in the house of owner, can render a substitute in the house of the priest, cannot render a substitute Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Once it has entered the possession of the priest, cannot render a substitute
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: regarding a firstborn, in the house of the husband — they make an exchange, in the house of the priest — they do not make an exchange. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: once it comes into the possession of the priest — they do not make an exchange.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! מַאי לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּבֵית כֹּהֵן — הוּא עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, וְאֵין בַּעַל עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, אַלְמָא אִית לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן זְכִיָּיה בְּגַוֵּויהּ.
human_translation: is the first tanna . What, is it not this is saying: in the house, of the priest, can render a substitute but owner cannot render a substitute Apparently, holds the priest has acquisition to
llm_translation: This is what the first Tanna taught! What is the reason he did not say it like this: In the house of a Kohen — he performs an exchange, and the owner does not perform an exchange, implying that the Kohen has a merit in his body.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, הָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: not difficult; this Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri that Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Not difficult, as Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, as Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן, אֲבָל כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּלְמָא אָזֵיל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְשָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא, וּמַמְטֵי לְחָכָם, וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״בְּכוֹר זֶה נָתַן לִי כֹּהֵן בְּמוּמוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: taught only a priest to a priest, but a priest to an Israelite, prohibited What is the reason? perhaps the Israelite will go and inflict a blemish on and bring to a halakhic authority and say to him: A priest gave me this firstborn when it blemished.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: They only taught the law of a Kohen to a Kohen, but a Kohen to a Yisrael — is forbidden. What is the reason? Perhaps the Yisrael will go and find a blemish in him, and bring him to a sage, and say to him: "This firstborn he gave to me is a Kohen with a blemish."

hebrew_text: וּמִי שָׁרֵי חָכָם הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַב: אֵין רוֹאִין בְּכוֹר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן כֹּהֵן עִמּוֹ!
human_translation: And may a halakhic authority permit such as this? But didn’t Rav say: may not look at a firstborn by an Israelite unless a priest with him,
llm_translation: And who is permitted to eat the choicest parts of the offering? And this is what Rav said: The firstborn is not seen by Israel unless a priest is with him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּכֹהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said: This is the reason why prohibited an Israelite: Because looks like a priest who assists at the threshing floor
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: The reason why wine of Israel is forbidden is because it appears as if a priest is assisting in the granary.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לִטְעוֹם מָר מִידֵּי. אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ בִּישְׂרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵיכוֹל מָר, דְּמַיבְרֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּבוּכְרָא הוּא. מְנָא לְכוּ הָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דְּזַבֵּן לַן פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Mar Zutra arrived at the home of Rav Ashi. said to him: Let Master taste some They brought meat before him. said: Let Master eat, as is healthful, because it is a firstborn. From where did you this They said to him: that so-and-so priest sold to us.
llm_translation: Mar Zutra came to the house of Rav Ashi. They said to him: "Taste, Master, from this." They brought it before him in a dish. He said to them: "Let the Master be able, for it is spoken in the name of Bukhra." Where did they bring it from? They said to him: "So-and-so, the priest, sold it to us."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא סְבִירָא לְכוּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּכֹהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא סְבִירָא לַן, דַּאֲנַן מִיזְבָּן קָא זָבְנִינַן.
human_translation: said to them: Do you not hold that which Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said, because it looks like a priest who assists at the threshing floor? They said to We hold not as we purchased
llm_translation: He said to them: Do you not agree with this that Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said, because he appears like a priest assisting in the granary? They said to him: We do not agree, for we are purchasing and not selling.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְלָא סְבִירָא לְכוּ הָדִתְנַן: עַד כַּמָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיב לִיטַּפֵּל בַּבְּכוֹר? בַּדַּקָּה — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, ובגסה — חמשים יום. וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי בְּתוֹךְ זְמַנּוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתְּנֶנּוּ לוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מָה טַעַם? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּכֹהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת!
human_translation: said to them: But do you not hold that which we learned Until when an Israelite obligated to tend to a firstborn of a small thirty and of a large fifty days. And if said to Give it to me within its period, may not give it to him. And Rav Sheshet says: What is reason Because it looks like a priest who assists at the threshing floor,
llm_translation: He said to them: And it does not seem to you as it was taught: Until when is a Jew obligated to redeem the firstborn? In a small city — thirty days, and in a large city — fifty days. And if he says to him, "Give it to me within its time," behold, this one shall not give it to him. And Rav Sheshet said: What is the reason? Because he appears like a priest assisting in the granary!

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָתָם מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, הָכָא מִזְבָּן קָא זָבְנִינַן.
human_translation: They said to There the matter prove Here, we purchased it
llm_translation: They said to him: There the matter is proven, here we are purchasing a table.

hebrew_text: לָשׁוֹן אַחֵר, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָכָא לָא יָהֵיב דְּמֵי, הָכָא קָא יָהֵיב דְּמֵי. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ? מוֹזֵיל כֹּהֵן גַּבֵּיהּ, דְּסָבַר כֹּהֵן דְּכִי הָוֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוֹר אַחֲרִינָא יָהֵיב נִיהֲלֵיהּ? לָא, דְּמַסֵּיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ:
human_translation: an alternative version They said to There does not give payment Here, gives payment what you say priest lowered for as the priest thinks that when have another firstborn will give it to him, not as he thinks:
llm_translation: Language another, said to him: here not give money, here give money. What do you say? Takes priest his back, for priest who when be to him first another give manage? No, for distracts his mind.

hebrew_text: בּוּצִינָא טָב מִקָּרָא.
human_translation: A zucchini is better than a gourd
llm_translation: Butzina tav mikra.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְמִירִין מִן הַצֹּאן עַל הַבָּקָר, וּמִן הַבָּקָר עַל הַצֹּאן, וּמִן הַכְּבָשִׂים עַל הָעִזִּים, וּמִן הָעִזִּים עַל הַכְּבָשִׂים, מִן הַזְּכָרִים עַל הַנְּקֵבוֹת, וּמִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת עַל הַזְּכָרִים, מִן הַתְּמִימִים עַל בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, מִן בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין עַל הַתְּמִימִים.
human_translation: One substitutes from the flock upon the herd and from the herd upon the flock. And from the sheep upon the goats, and from the goats upon the sheep; from the males upon the females, and from the females upon the males; from the unblemished upon the blemished from the blemished upon the unblemished
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We may exchange from sheep onto cattle, and from cattle onto sheep, and from goats onto sheep, and from sheep onto goats, from males onto females, and from females onto males, from unblemished animals onto blemished animals, and from blemished animals onto unblemished animals.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יַחֲלִיפֶנּוּ וְלֹא יָמִיר אוֹתוֹ טוֹב בְּרָע אוֹ רַע בְּטוֹב״, וְאֵיזֶהוּ ״טוֹב בְּרָע״? בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין שֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן.
human_translation: as it is stated: “He shall neither exchange it, nor substitute it, good for bad, or bad for good” And which is good for bad blemished whose consecration preceded their blemish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "He shall not exchange it, nor shall he substitute it, good for bad or bad for good." And what is considered "good for bad"? Those with blemishes that were consecrated before their blemish occurred.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּהֵמָה בִּבְהֵמָה״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁמְּמִירִין מִן הַצֹּאן עַל הַבָּקָר, וּמִן הַבָּקָר עַל הַצֹּאן, מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים עַל הָעִזִּים, וּמִן הָעִזִּים עַל הַכְּבָשִׂים, וּמִן הַזְּכָרִים עַל הַנְּקֵבוֹת, וּמִן הַנְּקֵבוֹת עַל הַזְּכָרִים, וּמִן בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין עַל הַתְּמִימִים, וּמִן הַתְּמִימִים עַל בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין.
