human_translation: Rather, Rabba says: according to calculation of vessels and is Yosef ben Ḥoni.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabba said: According to the calculation of vessels, and Yosef ben Honi is it.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹשֶׁת לוּגִּין מַיִם שְׁאוּבִין שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לַמַּיִם, בִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כֵּלִים, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּאַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה כֵּלִים — פּוֹסְלִים אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה. יוֹסֵף בֶּן חוֹנִי אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כֵּלִים (פוסל) [פּוֹסְלִין] אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה, בְּאַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה — אֵין פּוֹסְלִין אֶת הַמִּקְוֶה.
human_translation: As it is taught three log of drawn water fell into the water from two or three vessels, or even from four or five vessels, invalidates the ritual bath. Yosef ben Ḥoni says: in two or three vessels invalidates the ritual bath. in four or five does not invalidate the ritual bath.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Three log of drawn water that fell into the mikveh, in two and three vessels, and even in four and five vessels — disqualify the mikveh. Yosef ben Ḥoni says: In two and three vessels (they disqualify) disqualify the mikveh, but in four and five vessels — they do not disqualify the mikveh.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מֵי חַטָּאת (נַעֲשֶׂה) [נַעֲשִׂין] מֵי חַטָּאת כּוּ׳. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And the water of purification becomes water of purification only Who is the tanna Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said that not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: "And the waters of the sin offering are not made as the waters of the sin offering, etc. Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Not like Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הִקְדִּים עָפָר לַמַּיִם — פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: As it is taught dust before the water, unfit, but Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one placed dust before the water - it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּכְתִיב ״וְלָקְחוּ לַטָּמֵא מֵעֲפַר שְׂרֵפַת הַחַטָּאת וְנָתַן עָלָיו מַיִם חַיִּים״, וְתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: וְכִי עָפָר הוּא? וַהֲלֹא אֵפֶר הוּא!
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written “And for the impure they shall take of the dust of the burning of the purification from sin, and place on it flowing water And it is taught Rabbi Shimon said: But is it dust [ afar ] Isn’t it ashes [ efer ]?
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? For it is written, "And they shall take for the unclean person some of the ashes of the burnt sin offering, and running water shall be put on them." And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Is it really ashes? Is it not dust!

hebrew_text: שִׁינָּה הַכָּתוּב מִמַּשְׁמָעוֹ, לָדוּן הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עָפָר״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עָפָר״. מָה לְהַלָּן — עָפָר עַל גַּבֵּי הַמַּיִם, אַף כָּאן — עָפָר עַל גַּבֵּי הַמַּיִם. וּמָה כָּאן הִקְדִּים עָפָר לַמַּיִם — כָּשֵׁר, אַף כָּאן הִקְדִּים עָפָר לַמַּיִם — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: the verse altered its usage to derive a verbal analogy from it: “Dust” is stated here, and “dust” is stated there, Just as there, dust on top of the water, so too here, dust, on top of the water. And just as here, dust before the water, fit so too there, dust before the water, fit
llm_translation: The written comparison is to judge from it a similar decree: It is stated here "dust," and it is stated there "dust." Just as there - dust on top of the water, so too here - dust on top of the water. And just as there it preceded the water - valid, so too here it preceded the water - valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא מְנָלַן? תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״וְנָתַן עָלָיו״, אַלְמָא אֵפֶר בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר כְּתִיב ״מַיִם חַיִּים אֶל כֶּלִי״. הָא כֵּיצַד? רָצָה עָפָר לְמַטָּה, רָצָה עָפָר לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: And here, from where do we Two phrases are written. and place on it.” Apparently, ashes first And then it is written: “Running water in a vessel,” How these he desires dust, below, he desires dust above
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here we learn? Two verses are written: 'And he shall put upon it,' which means ashes first, and then it is written, 'living water into a vessel.' How so? If the ashes wanted to go down, and the ashes wanted to go up."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר לָךְ: סֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא דַּוְקָא, ״וְנָתַן עָלָיו״ — לְעָרְבָן.
human_translation: And the tanna of our what is reasoning? say to you the last clause of the verse: specifically, and place on it,” to mix
llm_translation: And it was taught in our Mishnah, what is the reason? He said to you: The end of the verse specifically, "and he shall place upon it" — to mix it.

hebrew_text: מַאי חָזֵית דְּאָמְרַתְּ סֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא דַּוְקָא, דִּלְמָא רֵישָׁא דַּוְקָא? לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, מָה מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם מַכְשִׁיר לְמַעְלָה, אַף כָּאן מַכְשִׁיר לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: What did you see that you say the last clause of the verse specifically? Perhaps the first clause specifically. You cannot say just as we find in every instance facilitating item above, so too here, facilitating item above.
llm_translation: "What did you see that you said specifically the end of the verse, perhaps the beginning of the verse specifically? You did not say, just as we find everywhere it is effective above, so too here it is effective above."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בֵּית הַפְּרָס עוֹשֶׂה בֵּית הַפְּרָס כּוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס עוֹשֶׂה בֵּית הַפְּרָס.
human_translation: And beit haperas does not create beit haperas . The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: beit haperas creates beit haperas .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the House of Persia does not make the House of Persia like so. Mishnaic teaching that is not like Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: The House of Persia makes the House of Persia."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, עַד כַּמָּה? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא:
human_translation: And the Rabbis, how far When Rav Dimi came Reish Lakish said Rabbi Shimon bar Abba said:
llm_translation: The sages, until when? When Rav Dimi came, Rav Dimi said Reish Lakish said Rabbi Shimon bar Abba:

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ שָׂדוֹת וּשְׁתֵּי מַעֲנוֹת. וְכַמָּה מְלֹא מַעֲנֶה? מֵאָה אַמָּה, כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַחוֹרֵשׁ אֶת הַקֶּבֶר — עוֹשֶׂה בֵּית הַפְּרָס מְלֹא מַעֲנֶה מֵאָה אַמָּה.
human_translation: three fields, But two furrows, And how much full a furrow [ ma’ana ]? one hundred cubits, as it is taught One who plows a grave, renders a beit haperas the full a furrow, one hundred cubits.
llm_translation: Three fields and two caves. And how much is the capacity of a cave? One hundred cubits, as it was taught: One who digs a grave - he makes a burial chamber full of a hundred cubits.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין תְּרוּמָה אַחַר תְּרוּמָה כּוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הַשּׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁתָּרְמוּ זֶה אַחַר זֶה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תְּרוּמַת שְׁנֵיהֶם תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And there is no teruma after teruma . Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Akiva, as we learned joint who separated teruma one after the other, Rabbi Eliezer says: The teruma of both of them is teruma ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And there is no terumah after terumah." Mishnah: Who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi Akiva, as we learned: Partners who consecrated one after the other, Rabbi Eliezer says: The terumah of both is terumah."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין תְּרוּמַת שְׁנֵיהֶם תְּרוּמָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אִם תָּרַם הָרִאשׁוֹן כַּשִּׁיעוּר — אֵין תְּרוּמַת הַשֵּׁנִי תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לֹא תָּרַם כַּשִּׁיעוּר — תְּרוּמַת הַשֵּׁנִי תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The teruma of neither of them is teruma . And the Rabbis say: If the first one separated teruma of measure, the teruma of the second is not teruma ; but if did not separate teruma of measure, the teruma of the second is teruma .
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "The contribution of both of them is a contribution," and the sages say: "If the first one contributed the prescribed amount - the contribution of the second one is not a contribution, and if he did not contribute the prescribed amount - the contribution of the second one is a contribution."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין תְּמוּרָה עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּתְמוּרָתוֹ״, וְלֹא תְּמוּרַת תְּמוּרָתוֹ.
human_translation: And a substitute does not render a substitute; What is the reason, The verse states: and that for which it is substituted but not the substitute of its substitute.
llm_translation: And exchange does not make an exchange as it is. What is the reason? The verse says: "And his exchange," not the exchange of his exchange.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין הַוָּלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא״ — הוּא וְלֹא וָלָד.
human_translation: And the offspring does not render a substitute. that the verse states: it it, but not offspring,
llm_translation: And the newborn does not effect substitution. As the verse says: "He" - He and not a newborn.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַוָּלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״יִהְיֶה״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַוָּלָד. וְרַבָּנַן: לְרַבּוֹת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The offspring renders a substitute. that the verse states: “Shall be to include the offspring. And the Rabbis, to include unwittingly, as intentionally.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The newborn creates a substitution. As the verse says "it shall be" to include the newborn. And the Rabbis: to include accidental as intentional.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹפוֹת וְהַמְּנָחוֹת אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא בְּהֵמָה. הַצִּיבּוּר וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יַחֲלִיפֶנּוּ וְלֹא יָמִיר״. יָחִיד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, וְאֵין הַצִּבּוּר וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה. קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: The birds and the meal offerings do not render substitutes, as only “an animal” is stated the community or partners does not render a substitute, as it is stated “He shall neither exchange it nor substitute an individual renders a substitute, but the community and partners do not render a substitute. consecrated for Temple maintenance do not render substitutes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Birds and meal-offerings do not undergo exchange, as it is only stated regarding animals. The community and partners do not make an exchange, as it is said, "He shall not alter it, nor change it." An individual may make an exchange, but the community and partners do not make an exchange. The consecrated items of the Temple treasury do not undergo exchange.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר בַּכְּלָל הָיָה, וְלָמָּה יָצָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: animal tithe was in category and why was it out
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: And behold, tithing was included, so why did it go out?

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר — קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, יָצְאוּ קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר; וּמָה מַעֲשֵׂר — קׇרְבַּן מִזְבֵּחַ, יָצְאוּ קׇרְבָּנוֹת בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: to tell you: Just as tithe an individual offering, excluding communal offerings And just as tithe an offering altar, excluding consecrated for Temple maintenance
llm_translation: To say to you: What is Ma'aser - individual offering, public offerings have fulfilled; and what is Ma'aser - altar offering, have fulfilled offerings of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל יְהוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״קׇרְבָּן״ — מִי שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ ״קׇרְבָּן״, יָצְאוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁלֹּא נִקְרְאוּ ״קׇרְבָּן״.
human_translation: The Sages taught might consecrated for Temple maintenance render substitutes. the verse states: an offering that which is called an offering, excluding consecrated for Temple maintenance, which are not called an offering.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Is it possible that consecrated items in the Temple courtyard can be exchanged? The verse teaches: "sacrifice" - only those items that are called "sacrifice" can be exchanged, but consecrated items in the Temple courtyard that are not called "sacrifice" cannot be exchanged.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אִי ״קׇרְבָּן״ — שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ ״קׇרְבָּן״, כָּעִנְיָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַנַּקְרֵב אֶת קׇרְבַּן ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught If “offering,” I derive even consecrated for Temple maintenance, as are called offerings, as is stated in the matter “And we have brought the Lord’s offering,
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught: If "korban" - I hear, even the holy things of the Temple courtyard, which are called "korban," as it is said: "And we brought the offering of the Lord, etc."

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְאֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד לֹא הֱבִיאוֹ״ — כׇּל הַבָּא אֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שְׁחוּטֵי חוּץ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּא לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שְׁחוּטֵי חוּץ. אַלְמָא אִיקְּרוּ ״קׇרְבָּן״.
human_translation: the verse states: “And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting he did not bring it” for any that come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, one is liable for it due to slaughtering offerings outside And for any that not come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, one is not liable for it due to slaughtering offerings outside Evidently, are called an offering,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And at the entrance of the tent of meeting, they did not bring him" — anyone who comes to the entrance of the tent of meeting is liable for violating the prohibition of slaughtering outside, but anyone who does not come to the entrance of the tent of meeting is not liable for violating the prohibition of slaughtering outside. This implies that they are called "sacrifices."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא רַבָּנַן. לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִיקְּרִי ״קׇרְבָּן״, לְרַבָּנַן לָא אִיקְּרִי ״קׇרְבָּן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: not difficult. This Rabbi Shimon, that the Rabbis. According to Rabbi Shimon, are called an offering, According to the Rabbis, are not called an offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: It is not difficult, this is Rabbi Shimon, this is the Rabbis. To Rabbi Shimon it is called "korban," to the Rabbis it is not called "korban."

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַנַּקְרֵב אֶת קׇרְבַּן ה׳״! ״קׇרְבַּן ה׳״ אִיקְּרִי, ״קׇרְבָּן לַה׳״ לָא אִיקְּרִי.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it written: “And we have brought the Lord’s offering” are called: “The Lord’s offering,” they are not called: “An offering to the Lord,”
llm_translation: And not? And it is written: "And we brought the offering of the Lord"! "Offering of the Lord" is what it is called, "offering to the Lord" is not what it is called.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא יְבַקֵּר בֵּין טוֹב לָרַע וְלֹא יְמִירֶנּוּ״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יַחֲלִיפֶנּוּ וְלֹא יָמִיר אוֹתוֹ טוֹב בְּרָעוְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “He shall not inquire whether it is good or bad, neither shall he substitute it; Why is stated Isn’t it already stated “He shall not alter it, nor substitute it, good for bad,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He shall not inquire between good and bad, nor shall he exchange it." Why is it stated? Has it not already been stated: "He shall not alter it, nor shall he exchange it, good for bad"?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יַחֲלִיפֶנּוּ וְלֹא יָמִיר אוֹתוֹ״, מַשְׁמַע קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, קׇרְבַּן צִבּוּר, וְקׇרְבַּן מִזְבֵּחַ וְקׇרְבַּן בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא יְבַקֵּר״.
human_translation: Since it is stated: “He shall not alter it, nor substitute it,” indicates an individual offering a communal offering, and an offering altar or an offering consecrated for Temple maintenance. the verse states “He shall not inquire.”
llm_translation: According to what is stated, "He shall not exchange it, nor shall he substitute it," we learn individual sacrifice, communal sacrifice, altar sacrifice, and Temple chamber sacrifice. The Torah teaches us, "He shall not investigate."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר בַּכְּלָל הָיָה, וְלָמָּה יָצָא? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, וְקׇרְבַּן מִזְבֵּחַ, וְדָבָר שֶׁבָּא בְּחוֹבָה, וְדָבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת — אַף כֹּל קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, וְקׇרְבַּן מִזְבֵּחַ, וְדָבָר שֶׁבָּא בְּחוֹבָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said tithe was in category and why was it out? to tell you: Just as tithe an individual offering, and an offering altar, and an item that comes as an obligation, and an item that is not in partnership, so too, all an individual offering, and an offering altar, and an item that comes as an obligation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: And behold, tithing was included, so why was it excluded? To tell you: Just as the tithe is an individual offering, and an offering of the altar, and a matter that comes with an obligation, and a matter that is not shared - so too, every individual offering, and offering of the altar, and a matter that comes with an obligation.

hebrew_text: וְדָבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּא בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת.
human_translation: and an item that not in partnership.
llm_translation: And a matter that does not come with partnership.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה יָצָא מַעֲשֵׂר מֵעַתָּה? לִידּוֹן בִּ״תְמוּרַת שְׁמוֹ״ וּבִ״תְמוּרַת גּוּפוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi says: Why was tithe out now, to discuss with regard to substitution of its name. And to the substitution of its body,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: Why did the tithe go out from now on? To judge in "the exchange of his name" and in "the exchange of his body."

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: תְּמוּרַת שְׁמוֹ — קְרֵיבָה, תְּמוּרַת גּוּפוֹ — אֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה; תְּמוּרַת שְׁמוֹ — נִגְאֶלֶת, תְּמוּרַת גּוּפוֹ — אֵינָהּ נִגְאֶלֶת.
human_translation: tells you the substitute of the name of sacrificed the substitute of its body is not sacrificed the substitute of the name of redeemed the substitute of its body is not redeemed,
llm_translation: To say to you: exchange of his name - bring near, exchange of his body - it is not bring near; exchange of his name - redeemed, exchange of his body - it is not redeemed.

hebrew_text: תְּמוּרַת גּוּפוֹ — חָלָה עַל דָּבָר הָרָאוּי וְעַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי, וּתְמוּרַת שְׁמוֹ — אֵינָהּ חָלָה אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר הָרָאוּי בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: the substitution of the body of takes effect upon an item that is fit and upon an item that is unfit but the substitution of its name takes effect only upon an item that is fit
llm_translation: Exchange of his body - it is effective for something fitting and for something unfitting, and exchange of his name - it is effective only for something fitting.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ תְּמוּרַת שְׁמוֹ, אִיגְּרוֹעֵי אִיגְּרַע? אִין, דְּאָמְרִינַן: מַאי דְּרַבִּי — רַבִּי, וּמַאי דְּלָא רַבִּי — לָא רַבִּי.
human_translation: say because the Merciful One includes that it has the substitution of its name, is diminished, Yes, as we say: which included it included, and which it did not include, it did not include.
llm_translation: They said: Because of Rabbi Rachamana who has in it a substitution of His name, should I cut it off? No, as we say: What is the meaning of "Rabbi" - Rabbi, and what is the meaning of "not Rabbi" - not Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהֵיכָא תֵּיתֵי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה דָּבָר הַבָּא לִידּוֹן בְּדָבָר הֶחָדָשׁ, וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא חִידּוּשׁוֹ בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: And from where would this be derived, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: since a matter, where comes to discuss a novel matter, and has only its novelty,
llm_translation: And this, from where is it derived? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Because it is a matter that comes to be judged in a new matter, and it contains nothing but its novelty alone.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר הַבָּא בְּחוֹבָה — עוֹלַת חוֹבָה הִיא דְּעָבְדָה תְּמוּרָה, הָא עוֹלַת נְדָבָה — לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עוֹלַת נְדָבָה נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּקַבְּלַהּ עֲלֵיהּ — עַבְדַּהּ תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: According to Rabbi Shimon, who said that come as an obligation, it is an obligatory burnt offering that renders a substitute, but a voluntary burnt offering does not? said to him: A voluntary burnt offering also Since he accepted upon himself renders a substitute.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rava: To Rabbi Shimon who said that a matter that comes as an obligation - it is an obligatory burnt offering that one made a substitution for, but a voluntary burnt offering - no? He said to him: A voluntary burnt offering too, once it is accepted upon it - it is made a substitution.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא נִצְרְכָה, אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָה הַבָּאָה מִן הַמּוֹתָרוֹת.
human_translation: And is necessary only to a burnt offering that came from surplus
llm_translation: And not needed, rather for a burnt offering that comes from the permissible.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוֹתָרוֹת לְנִדְבַת צִבּוּר אָזְלִי — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא עָבְדָה תְּמוּרָה, הָא אֵין תְּמוּרָה בְּצִבּוּר!
human_translation: What hold If he holds in accordance with the one who said surplus go toward communal gift offerings, obvious that does not render a substitute, as there is no substitution with regard to a communal
llm_translation: What does he hold? If he holds like the one who says that offerings for the community are permitted, then it is obvious that he did not perform a substitution, for there is no substitution in the case of the community!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוֹתָרוֹת לְנִדְבַת יָחִיד אָזְלִי. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר! הָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ בְּהֶדְיָא דְּעָבְדָה תְּמוּרָה, דְּתַנְיָא: ״עוֹלָה הַבָּאָה מִן הַמּוֹתָרוֹת עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר!
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with the one who said surplus go toward voluntary of an individual. whom did you hear this reasoning? Rabbi Eliezer, we heard explicitly that renders a substitute. As it is taught A burnt offering that came from surplus renders a substitute. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon holds like the one who says that animals designated for voluntary offerings of an individual may go out to pasture. Who is it that you heard holds this opinion? Rabbi Eliezer! We have heard about him in the case of an animal that underwent a substitution, as it was taught: "An olah offering that comes from those that are permissible may undergo substitution," the words of Rabbi Eliezer!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: עוֹלָה הַבָּאָה מִן הַמּוֹתָרוֹת עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, וְאִיהוּ סָבַר: אֵין עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to as Rabbi Eliezer maintains a burnt offering that came from surplus renders a substitute, and he, maintains does not render a substitute.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds according to his opinion in one matter, and disagrees with him in one matter, for Rabbi Eliezer holds: An offering that comes from the permissible items makes an exchange, and he holds: It does not make an exchange.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי אָבִין: הִפְרִישׁ אָשָׁם לְהִתְכַּפֵּר בּוֹ, וְהֵמִיר בּוֹ, וְנִתְכַּפֵּר בְּאָשָׁם אַחֵר, וְנִיתַּק זֶה לְעוֹלָה — מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחְזוֹר וְיָמִיר בּוֹ?
human_translation: If so, that dilemma raised by Rabbi Avin: separated a guilt offering by which to achieve atonement, and he effected substitution for it, and achieved atonement by another a guilt offering; and this consigned to a burnt offering, what is to he can again effect substitution for it?
llm_translation: So, this is what Rabbi Avin inquired: If one set aside a guilt-offering to atone with it, and then exchanged it, and atoned with another guilt-offering, and then designated the first one as a burnt-offering - may one go back and exchange it?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הָא אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ: עוֹלָה הַבָּאָה מִן הַמּוֹתָרוֹת אֵין עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה!
human_translation: In accordance with whose If we say in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, you said Rabbi Shimon maintains a burnt offering that came from surplus does not render a substitute.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alibba de'man? Ileima alibba de'Rabbi Shimon - ha amratt Rabbi Shimon sevira lei: Olah haba'ah min ha'mutarot ein osah temurah!" English translation: "In whose opinion? If you say in the opinion of Rabbi Shimon - for Rabbi Shimon said: An offering that comes from the permitted ones does not make a substitution!"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אָבִין הָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: אִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ תַּנָּא דְּקָאֵי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר אֵין מְמִירִין וְחוֹזְרִין וּמְמִירִין, וּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר עוֹלָה הַבָּאָה מִן הַמּוֹתָרוֹת עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחְזוֹר וְיָמִיר בּוֹ?
human_translation: this is the dilemma that Rabbi Avin was raising: If a tanna is found who holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said one cannot effect substitution and again effect substitution and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said a burnt offering that came from surplus renders a substitute, what is whether one can again effect substitution with
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin the Elder asked him: If you forget a Mishnah that Rabbi Shimon stands by, who says we do not exchange back and forth and exchange back and forth, and he holds like Rabbi Eliezer, who says an offering that comes from the permissible makes an exchange, what should one do to return and make an exchange with it?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנֵי גוּפִין וּקְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת, מַאי?
human_translation: with regard to two bodies, and one sanctity, What
llm_translation: In two bodies and one holiness, what?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצָא לוֹמַר: קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת (אוֹ לָא), אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת וְגוּף אֶחָד, מַאי? תִּיבְּעֵי.
human_translation: And If you say one sanctity. But two sanctities and one body, what the dilemma remains [ tiba’ei ].
llm_translation: "And if you might suggest: 'One sanctity (or not),' rather two sanctities and one body, what? It should ask."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַכֹּל מְמִירִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you, everything can be changed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת יָחִיד שֶׁאֵין בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר, וְיֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר שֶׁאֵין בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד, שֶׁקׇּרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, וְאֵין קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: There are with regard to offerings of an individual that are not with regard to communal offerings; and there are with regard to communal offerings that are not with regard to offerings of an individual. as offerings of an individual render a substitute, and communal offerings do not render a substitute.
llm_translation: It was taught: There are individual offerings that do not have communal offerings, and there are communal offerings that do not have individual offerings, for individual offerings can be exchanged, but communal offerings cannot be exchanged.

hebrew_text: קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד נוֹהֲגוֹת בֵּין בִּזְכָרִים בֵּין בִּנְקֵבוֹת, וְקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר אֵין נוֹהֲגִין אֶלָּא בִּזְכָרִים. קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד חַיָּיבִין בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן וּבְאַחְרָיוּת נִסְכֵּיהֶם, וְקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר אֵין חַיָּיבִין בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן וְלֹא בְּאַחְרָיוּת נִסְכֵּיהֶן, אֲבָל חַיָּיבִין בְּאַחְרָיוּת נִסְכֵּיהֶן מִשֶּׁקָּרַב הַזֶּבַח.
human_translation: Offerings of an individual apply to, both males and females, but communal offerings apply only to males. offerings of an individual obligated to their compensation and compensation their libations but communal offerings obligated to neither their compensation nor compensation their libations But obligated to compensation their libations once the offering is sacrificed.
llm_translation: Individual offerings are practiced both with males and with females, while communal offerings are only practiced with males. Individual offerings require succession and the succession of their libations, while communal offerings do not require succession nor the succession of their libations, but they do require the succession of their libations once the sacrifice has been brought.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר מַה שֶּׁאֵין בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת יָחִיד, שֶׁקׇּרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְקׇרְבְּנוֹת יָחִיד אֵינָן דּוֹחוֹת לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: There are with regard to communal offerings that are not with regard to offerings of an individual, as communal offerings override Shabbat, and ritual impurity, and offerings of an individual override neither Shabbat nor ritual impurity.
llm_translation: There are in communal offerings what is not in individual offerings, for communal offerings override the Sabbath and impurity, while individual offerings do not override either the Sabbath or impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: וַהֲלֹא חֲבִיתֵּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּפַר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד הֵן, וְדוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה! אֶלָּא שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: But aren’t the High Priest’s griddle-cake and the bull of Yom Kippur offerings of an individual, and they override Shabbat and ritual impurity. Rather, whose time is fixed
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: But aren't the woodpiles of the High Priest and the bull of Yom Kippur individual offerings, and they override the Sabbath and impurity! Rather, their time is fixed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה כּוּ׳. וּכְלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲרֵי עוֹפוֹת דְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה! כִּי קָתָנֵי — בִּבְהֵמָה קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: offerings of an individual render a substitute. And this principle? But birds, which an offering of an individual, but they do not render a substitute? When teaches is teaching with regard to an animal
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemara: A private offering makes an exchange, and this is a principle? But behold, regarding birds of a private offering, they do not make an exchange! For it was taught - it was taught regarding an animal."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי וָלָד דְּקָרְבַּן יָחִיד הוּא, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה! הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הַוָּלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: But offspring which is an offering of an individual and does not render a substitute? whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said the offspring renders a substitute.
llm_translation: Behold, a firstborn is considered an individual offering, and one does not make an exchange! Is this not so? It is Rabbi Yehuda who said: A firstborn makes an exchange.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּמוּרָה עַצְמָהּ, דְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד הִיא, וְאֵין תְּמוּרָה עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה! כִּי קָתָנֵי — בְּעִיקַּר זִיבְחָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But a substitute itself, which is an offering of an individual, and a substitute does not render a substitute? When teaches is teaching with regard to the primary offering,
llm_translation: And behold, the exchange itself, for it is an individual offering, and an exchange does not make an exchange! For it was taught - primarily it was taught regarding the offering.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, בְּעִיקַּר זִיבְחָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this you even say the Rabbis, is teaching with regard to the primary offering,
llm_translation: The case where you come to this, even if you say "the sages," primarily it is referring to the offering.

hebrew_text: קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַיָּחִיד נוֹהֲגוֹת בֵּין בִּזְכָרִים בֵּין בִּנְקֵבוֹת. וּכְלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲרֵי עוֹלָה, דְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, וְזָכָר אָתְיָא, נְקֵבָה לָא אָתְיָא!
human_translation: Offerings of an individual apply to, both males and females. Is principle, But a burnt offering, which is an offering of an individual, and comes a male not come a female
llm_translation: Offerings of the individual are brought both by males and by females. And is this a general principle? Behold, the burnt offering, which is an individual offering, comes with a male, and does not come with a female!

hebrew_text: הָאִיכָּא עוֹלַת הָעוֹף, דְּתַנְיָא: תַּמּוּת וְזַכְרוּת בִּבְהֵמָה, וְאֵין תַּמּוּת וְזַכְרוּת בָּעוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: there is a bird burnt offering, As it is taught unblemished status and male status animal but unblemished status and male status not birds
llm_translation: Here is the burnt offering of birds, as it was taught: "tamut" and "zakhurut" in a beast, but there is no "tamut" and "zakhurut" in birds.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי חַטָּאת, דְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד הִיא, וּנְקֵבָה אָתְיָא, זָכָר לָא אָתְיָא? הַאִיכָּא שְׂעִיר נָשִׂיא, דְּמַיְיתֵי זָכָר.
human_translation: But a sin offering, which is an offering of an individual, and comes a female not come a male there is the goat sin offering of a king, which is brought a male
llm_translation: Behold the sin offering, which is a sacrifice of an individual, and a female comes, a male does not come? Is there not the scapegoat of the leader, which represents a male.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא אֲשַׁם יָחִיד, דְּזָכָר אָתֵי, נְקֵבָה לָא אָתֵי? כִּי קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן קׇרְבָּן דְּשָׁוֵי בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִיבּוּר — אָשָׁם בְּיָחִיד אִיתֵיהּ, בְּצִבּוּר לֵיתֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִי קָתָנֵי ״כׇּל קׇרְבְּנוֹת״? ״יֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת״ קָתָנֵי, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — שְׁלָמִים, וְאִי בָּעֵי נְקֵבָה מַיְיתֵי, וְאִי בָּעֵי זָכָר מַיְיתֵי.
human_translation: But there is individual guilt offering, which comes a male not come a female When the Sages stated an offering that is equivalent, both an offering of an individual and a communal a guilt offering is an offering of an individual is not a communal And if you wish, say Does teach: All offerings teaches: There are offerings and what are they? Peace offerings; and if wants he brings a female and if wants he brings a male
llm_translation: And where is the guilt offering of an individual, that if a male comes, a female does not come? For the Rabbis say: A guilt offering that is brought whether by an individual or by the community — a guilt offering is brought by an individual, it is not brought by the community. And if you wish, say: Who teaches "all offerings"? It teaches "there are in offerings," and what is it — peace offerings. And if a female desires, she may bring, and if a male desires, he may bring.

hebrew_text: קׇרְבְּנוֹת יָחִיד חַיָּיבִין בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן [כּוּ׳]. מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: offerings of an individual obligated to their compensation From where do we
llm_translation: Offerings of an individual are obligated in their succession Ku'. From where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״דְּבַר יוֹם״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל הַיּוֹם כָּשֵׁר לְמוּסָפִין, ״בְּיוֹמוֹ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאִם עָבַר הַיּוֹם וְלֹא הֱבִיאָן אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: As the Sages taught each day teaches that the entire day is fit for additional “On its own day,” teaches that if the day has passed and did not bring one is not obligated to their compensation,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Davar Yom" — teaches that the entire day is valid for additional offerings. "Beyomo" — teaches that if the day passed and one did not bring them, he is not obligated in their subsequent offering.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּת נִסְכֵּיהֶם, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁקָּרַב הַזֶּבַח? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״ בַּלַּיְלָה, ״מִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״ לְמָחָר.
human_translation: might one should not be obligated to compensation their libations even if the offering has been sacrificed, the verse states, “Their meal offerings and their libations” in the night “their meal offerings and their libations” on the following day.
llm_translation: He can not be obligated in their libations, even though the sacrifice is brought near? The verse teaches "their meal offering and their libations" at night, "their meal offering and their libations" for the next day.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״מִלְּבַד שַׁבָּתוֹת ה׳״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said beside the Shabbatot of the Lord”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said from here: "Besides the Sabbaths of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מִלְּבַד שַׁבְּתוֹת ה׳״ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בַּיּוֹם — אִין, וּבַלַּיְלָה — לָא. אָמַר קְרָא ״וּמִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״ וְלָא כְּתַב ״מִלְּבַד שַׁבְּתוֹת ה׳״ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: (בלילה) [בְּלֵילְיָה] — אִין, בִּימָמָא — לָא.
human_translation: And necessary, as if the Merciful One had written “Beside the Shabbatot of the Lord,” I would say on the day yes, but on the night no, the verse states: “And their meal offerings and their libations.” And if the Merciful One had written “Their meal offerings and their libations,” and not written: “Beside the Shabbatot of the Lord,” I would say at night, yes, but on the day not
llm_translation: The matter is, if the Merciful One wrote "besides the Sabbaths of the Lord" - I would say: during the day - yes, and at night - no. The verse says "and their meal offerings and their drink offerings." And if the Merciful One wrote "their meal offerings and their drink offerings" and did not write "besides the Sabbaths of the Lord" - I would say: at night - no, during the day - no.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא? מִשּׁוּם דִּבְקָדָשִׁים לַיְלָה הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַיּוֹם, צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And what is different from that with regard to sacrificial night follows the day. are necessary.
llm_translation: And what is the difference? Because the holy items of the night follow after the day, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וּנְסָכִים מִי קָרְבִי בַּלַּיְלָה? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לִיקְרַב בַּלַּיְלָה, כְּגוֹן אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים, שֶׁמַּקְרִיבִין מִבּוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וּמִתְעַכְּלִין וְהוֹלְכִין כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And libations, may they be sacrificed at night? Didn’t we learn I have only items that are normally sacrificed at night, for example, the limbs and the fats that one sacrifices after sunset and they are consumed throughout the entire night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And libations, who brings them at night? And we learned: I have only things that their way is to be brought at night, such as limbs and fats, that are brought from the entrance of the sun and are inspected and are brought the entire night."

hebrew_text: דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לִיקְרַב בַּיּוֹם, כְּגוֹן הַקּוֹמֶץ, הַלְּבוֹנָה, וּמִנְחַת נְסָכִים, שֶׁמַּעֲלָן מִבּוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ. מִבּוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! וְהָאָמְרַתְּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לִיקְרַב בַּיּוֹם נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא עִם בֹּא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, שֶׁמִּתְעַכְּלִין וְהוֹלְכִין כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הָעֹלָה״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: items that are normally sacrificed in the day, for example the handful the frankincense, and the meal offering the libations, that one may bring them up after sunset? enter your mind after sunset? But didn’t you say items that are normally sacrificed in the day? Rather, From where with sunset, in they are consumed throughout the entire night The verse states: “This is the law of the burnt offering” included
llm_translation: Words that their way is to be brought near during the day, such as the incense, the frankincense, and the meal offering of libations, that are brought from the coming of the sun. From the coming of the sun, is your mind at ease?! And you said that words that their way is to be brought near during the day are they! Rather, with the coming of the sun, that they are inspected and go all night from where? The Talmud teaches: "This is the law of the burnt offering" — it increases.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהָא נְסָכִים בַּיּוֹם! אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא — כָּאן לִיקְדַּשׁ, כָּאן לִיקְרַב.
human_translation: In any event, teaches libations in the day, Rami bar Ḥama said not difficult. Here, to consecrating There, to sacrificing
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in a Baraita: libations during the day! Ramei Bar Hama said: It is not difficult - here for sanctification, here for drawing near."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי מִיקְדָּשׁ קָדְשִׁי קָרוֹבֵי מִיקָּרְבִי, וְהָא תַּנְיָא: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַקָּרֵב בַּיּוֹם — אֵין קָדוֹשׁ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, וְכׇל הַקָּרֵב בַּלַּיְלָה — קָדוֹשׁ בַּלַּיְלָה, בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בְּלַיְלָה — קָדוֹשׁ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: סְמִי ״מִנְחַת נְסָכִים״ מֵהָא מַתְנִיתָא.
human_translation: Rava said to If can be consecrated to be sacrificed isn’t it taught This is the principle: Any that is sacrificed in the day is consecrated only in the day; and any that is sacrificed at night is consecrated at night; both in the day and at night is consecrated in the day and at night. Rather, Rav Yosef said: delete from this baraita the libations,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If my holy things are close, they will come close to me. But isn't it taught: This is the principle: anyone who comes close during the day — holiness is only during the day, and anyone who comes close at night — holiness is at night, whether during the day or at night — holiness is whether during the day or at night! Rather, Rav Yosef said: rely on "the meal offering of libations" from that Mishnah.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רַב דִּימִי, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב יִרְמְיָה דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מִנַּיִן לִנְסָכִים הַבָּאִים עִם הַזֶּבַח שֶׁאֵין קְרֵיבִין אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּלְנִסְכֵּיכֶם וּלְשַׁלְמֵיכֶם״ — מָה שְׁלָמִים בַּיּוֹם, אַף נְסָכִים בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi ascended he found Rav Yirmeya sitting and saying in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: From where libations that come with offering may be sacrificed only in the day? The verse states: and your libations, and your peace offerings” just as peace offerings the day, so too libations the day.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi ascended, he found Rav Yirmeya sitting and saying in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: From where do we derive that libations that accompany the sacrifice are only brought during the day? The verse states, "And for your libations and for your peace offerings" - just as peace offerings are brought during the day, so too libations are brought during the day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: אִי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּכָתֵיב אִיגַּרְתָּא, שְׁלַחִי לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף,
human_translation: said If I find who write a letter, send it to Rav Yosef
llm_translation: He said: If you find the letter "Igarta" written, send it to Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: וְלָא תִּיסְמֵי ״מִנְחַת נְסָכִים״ מִמַּתְנִיתָא. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא — כָּאן בִּנְסָכִים הַבָּאִין עִם הַזֶּבַח, כָּאן בִּנְסָכִים הַבָּאִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: and he will not delete The meal offering the libations, from the baraita . And not difficult; here, to libations that come with offering, there, to libations that come by themselves,
llm_translation: "And do not include 'Minchat Nesachim' from the Mishnah. And it is not difficult - here with libations that come with the sacrifice, here with libations that come separately."

hebrew_text: וְאִי הֲוָה לֵיהּ אִיגַּרְתָּא, מִי אֶפְשָׁר לְמִישְׁלְחַהּ? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כּוֹתְבֵי הֲלָכוֹת (כְּשׂוֹרֵף) [כְּשׂוֹרְפֵי] תוֹרָה, וְהַלָּמֵד מֵהֶן אֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל שָׂכָר.
human_translation: And if he had a letter would possible to send it? But didn’t Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: who write halakhot are like burn the Torah, and one who learns from does not receive reward
llm_translation: And if he had a letter, who is able to send it? But didn't Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Writers of Halachot (are like) Torah burners, and one who learns from them does not receive reward."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר נַחְמָנִי מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כְּתׇב לְךָ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״ — לוֹמַר לָךְ: דְּבָרִים שֶׁעַל פֶּה אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְאוֹמְרָן בִּכְתָב, וְשֶׁבִּכְתָב אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְאוֹמְרָן עַל פֶּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Naḥmani, the disseminator for Reish Lakish, expounded One verse says: “Write you these words,” and one verse says, “For by the mouth of these words” to say to you: Words that were orally you may not recite in writing, and that are written you may not recite orally,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Nachmani sought the interpretation of his translator, who interpreted for Reish Lakish: It is written, one verse says, "Write for yourself these words," and another verse says, "For by these words" — to tell you: Words that are oral, you are not permitted to say in writing, and words that are in writing, you are not permitted to say orally.

hebrew_text: וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״כְּתׇב לְךָ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״ — אֵלֶּה אַתָּה כּוֹתֵב, אֲבָל אֵין אַתָּה כּוֹתֵב הֲלָכוֹת!
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “write you these words” these you may write, but you may not write halakhot ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: 'Write for yourself these words' - these you write, but you do not write halakhot!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: דִּלְמָא מִילְּתָא חַדְתָּא שָׁאנֵי, דְּהָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מְעַיְּינִי בְּסִיפְרָא דְּאַגַּדְתָּא בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְדָרְשִׁי הָכִי: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״, אָמְרִי: מוּטָב תֵּיעָקֵר תּוֹרָה, וְאַל תִּשְׁתַּכַּח תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: They said Perhaps a new matter is different, that Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish read from a scroll of aggada , on Shabbat. And they taught as follows: “It is time to work for the Lord; they have made void your Torah” They said it is better to uproot Torah, and that the Torah is not forgotten from the Jewish people
llm_translation: They said: Perhaps a new matter is different, for Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish would delve into the book of Aggadah on Shabbat, and they expounded thus: "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah." They said: It is better for the Torah to be uprooted, and not to forget the Torah from Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ נְסָכִים הַבָּאִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן קְרֵיבִין אֲפִילּוּ בַּלַּיְלָה, נִזְדַּמְּנוּ נְסָכִים בַּלַּיְלָה — מַקְדִּישִׁין בַּלַּיְלָה וּמַקְרִיבִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Now that you have said libations that come by themselves are sacrificed even at night, happened libations at night, consecrated at night and sacrificed
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Now that you have said that libations that come on their own are brought even at night, if libations presented themselves at night - we sanctify them at night and offer them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמַעְיָה לְרַב פָּפָּא: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ, ״זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַקָּרֵב בַּיּוֹם — אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, וְכׇל הַקָּרֵב בַּלַּיְלָה — קָדוֹשׁ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Shemaya, said to Rav Pappa: is taught that supports your This is the principle: Any that is sacrificed in the day is consecrated only in the day; but any that is sacrificed at night is consecrated both in the day and at night.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef, son of Rav Shemaya, said to Rav Papa: It was taught in a Baraita that supports you, "This is the general principle: Anyone who offers sacrifices during the day is only considered holy during the day, and anyone who offers sacrifices at night is considered holy whether during the day or at night."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: וַעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר פּוֹסֶלֶת בָּהֶן, כְּאֵבָרִין.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: And dawn disqualifies them, like limbs
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "The morning offerings invalidate them, like limbs."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: ״אֵלֶּה תַּעֲשׂוּ לַה׳ בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם״ — אֵלּוּ חוֹבוֹת הַבָּאוֹת חוֹבָה בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: “These you shall offer to the Lord in your appointed seasons,” these obligatory that come obligatory on the pilgrimage Festival,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: "These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed times" - these are the obligatory offerings that come as an obligation on pilgrimage.

hebrew_text: ״לְבַד מִנִּדְרֵיכֶם וְנִדְבוֹתֵיכֶם״ — לִימֵּד עַל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת שֶׁקְּרֵבִין בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: “Beside your vows and your voluntary offerings.” teaches with regard to vows and voluntary offerings that they are sacrificed on the intermediate days of a Festival.
llm_translation: "Besides from your vows and your freewill offerings" - teaches about vows and freewill offerings that are brought on a weekday of a festival.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְעוֹלוֹתֵיכֶם״ — בְּמָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִי בְּעוֹלַת נֶדֶר — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר ״נִדְרֵיכֶם״, וְאִי בְּעוֹלַת נְדָבָה — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר ״וְנִדְבוֹתֵיכֶם״! הָא אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּעוֹלַת יוֹלֶדֶת וְעוֹלַת מְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: “And your burnt offerings.” With regard to what is the verse speaking? If to a vow burnt offering, already said: “Your vows.” And if to a voluntary burnt offering, already said: “Your voluntary offerings.” Consequently, it is speaking of nothing other than a burnt offering of a woman who gave birth, and a burnt offering of a leper,
llm_translation: "and for your burnt offerings" — in what is the Scripture speaking? If in a burnt offering of a vow — behold, it already says "your vows," and if in a burnt offering of a freewill offering — behold, it already says "and your freewill offerings"! Rather, it is speaking only of the burnt offering of a woman after childbirth and the burnt offering of a leper."

hebrew_text: ״וּלְמִנְחוֹתֵיכֶם״ — בְּמָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִי בְּמִנְחַת נֶדֶר — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר, אִי בְּמִנְחַת נְדָבָה — הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר! הָא אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּמִנְחַת סוֹטָה וּבְמִנְחַת קְנָאוֹת.
human_translation: “And your meal offerings.” With regard to what is the verse speaking? If to a meal offering a vow, already said: If to a voluntary meal offering, already said: Consequently, it is speaking of nothing other than meal offering of a sota , and that meal offering of jealousy.
llm_translation: "And for your meal offerings" - in what is the Scripture speaking? If in the meal offering of a vow - behold, it has already been stated; if in the meal offering of a freewill offering - behold, it has already been stated! Rather, it is speaking only of the meal offering of a suspected adulteress and the meal offering of jealousy."

hebrew_text: ״וּלְנִסְכֵּיכֶם וּלְשַׁלְמֵיכֶם״ — מַקִּישׁ נְסָכִים לִשְׁלָמִים: מָה שְׁלָמִים בַּיּוֹם, אַף נְסָכִים בַּיּוֹם. ״וּלְשַׁלְמֵיכֶם״ — לְרַבּוֹת שַׁלְמֵי נָזִיר.
human_translation: “And your libations and your peace offerings.” juxtaposes libations to peace offerings: Just as peace offerings during the day, so too, libations during the day, “And your peace offerings.” to include the peace offering of a nazirite,
llm_translation: "And for your drink offerings and for your peace offerings" — it draws an analogy between libations and peace offerings: just as peace offerings are offered during the day, so too libations are offered during the day. "And for your peace offerings" — to include the peace offerings of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלֵימָא מָר שַׁלְמֵי פֶסַח, דְּאִי שַׁלְמֵי נָזִיר — נִידָּר וְנִידָּב הוּא.
human_translation: Abaye said to But let the Master say peace offering a Paschal offering. as, if the peace offering of a nazirite, it is vowed or contributed
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And why not say, "Shalmei Pesach," for if "Shalmei Nazir" - it is a vow and a freewill offering.

hebrew_text: דְּהָתַנְיָא זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא נִידָּב וְנִידָּר — קָרֵב בְּבָמַת יָחִיד, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נִידָּב וְנִידָּר — אֵינוֹ קָרֵב בְּבָמַת יָחִיד.
human_translation: As isn’t it taught This is the principle: Any that is vowed or contributed is sacrificed on a private altar. And that is not vowed or contributed may not be sacrificed on a private altar.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: This is the principle: Anything that is vowed and dedicated - is brought near on an individual's altar, and that which is not vowed and dedicated - is not brought near on an individual's altar.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: הַמְּנָחוֹת וְהַנְּזִירוֹת קְרֵיבִין בְּבָמַת יָחִיד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר! סְמִי מִכָּאן ״נְזִירוֹת״.
human_translation: And we learned The meal offerings and the a nazirite are sacrificed on a private altar; this is the statement of Rabbi Meir. Delete a nazirite from here,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The meal offerings and the Nazirites are brought on a private altar, according to the words of Rabbi Meir! Learn from here "Nazirites."

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּנָזִיר לָאו נִידָּר וְנִידָּב הוּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵלְכָה נָּא וַאֲשַׁלֵּם אֶת נִדְרִי אֲשֶׁר נָדַרְתִּי לַה׳ בְּחֶבְרוֹן כִּי נֵדֶר נָדַר עַבְדְּךָ וְגוֹ׳״, מַאי לָאו אַקׇּרְבָּן?
human_translation: Is there one who said that a nazirite is not vowed or contributed But isn’t it written: “And it came to pass at the end of forty years, that Absalom said to the king: Please let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed to the Lord, in Hebron. For your servant vowed a vow What, is it not to an offering
llm_translation: Who is there to support the one who says that a Nazirite is not a vow and a freewill offering? And it is written: "At the end of forty years, Avshalom said to the king, 'Let me go and pay my vow that I vowed to the Lord in Hebron, for your servant vowed a vow...'" What is the reason that it is not a sacrifice?

hebrew_text: לָא, אַעִיקַּר נִדְרוֹ אָמְרִי. עִיקַּר נִדְרוֹ בְּחֶבְרוֹן הֲוָה? וַהֲלֹא בִּגְשׁוּר הֲוָה!
human_translation: No, said that the principal vow Was his principal vow in Hebron? But wasn’t in Geshur?
llm_translation: Not, primary vow his said. Primary vow in Hebron was? And not in Geshur was!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן: לֹא הָלַךְ אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶלָּא לְהָבִיא כְּבָשִׂים מֵחֶבְרוֹן. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי תֵּימָא לְאַקְרוֹבֵי הוּא דְּאָזֵיל — שָׁבֵיק יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וְאָזֵיל וּמַקְרֵיב בְּחֶבְרוֹן?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa said, and some say Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan Absalom went to Hebron only to bring sheep this also stands to reason, as, if you say that went to sacrifice abandoned Jerusalem and gone to sacrifice in Hebron?
llm_translation: Rav Ahah said, and it was stated by Rabbah bar Rav Hanan: Absalom only went to bring sheep from Hebron. Is it not logical, for if you say he went to be close, then he left Jerusalem and went and offered in Hebron?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי? לְהָבִיא כְּבָשִׂים מֵחֶבְרוֹן? הַאי ״אֲשֶׁר נָדַרְתִּי לַה׳ בְּחֶבְרוֹן״, ״מֵחֶבְרוֹן״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: But rather, what to bring sheep from Hebron? this which I have vowed to the Lord, in Hebron” should have from Hebron.
llm_translation: And rather what? To bring sheep from Hebron? This "which I vowed to the Lord in Hebron," "from Hebron" it requires!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם לְאַקְרוֹבֵי, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: אַמַּאי שָׁבֵק יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וּמַקְרֵיב בְּחֶבְרוֹן? תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ גִּבְעוֹן, דְּמָקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ הוּא! אֶלָּא, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוּתְּרוּ הַבָּמוֹת — כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּבָעֵי מַקְרֵיב.
human_translation: Rather, actually to sacrifice And that difficult for you, why abandoned Jerusalem and sacrificed in Hebron, Gibeon should pose a difficulty for you, as it was a sanctified place. Rather, since the altars were permitted, sacrifice wherever he wished,
llm_translation: Rather, it is preferable for those who are close, and it is difficult for you: Why did King David leave Jerusalem and offer sacrifices in Hebron? It is difficult for you to understand, for Gibeon is also a holy place! Rather, since the high places were permitted — wherever one wishes, one may offer sacrifices.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה, לְמַאן? תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה״ שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ לָהֶם מֶלֶךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ לָהֶם מֶלֶךְ, אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה עֲשִׂירִית שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָיְתָה.
human_translation: Forty years, according to whose is taught Rabbi Nehorai says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: to the end of forty years when requested for themselves a king, As it is taught that year when they requested for themselves a king, that year was the tenth of Samuel.
llm_translation: Forty years, according to whom? It was taught: Rabbi Nehorai says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: "At the end of forty years" that they asked the king, as it is taught: That year that they asked the king, that year was the tenth year of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים מָלַךְ שְׁמוּאֵל בְּעַצְמוֹ, שָׁנָה אַחַת שֶׁמָּלַךְ שָׁאוּל וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וּשְׁתַּיִם שֶׁמָּלַךְ שָׁאוּל בְּעַצְמוֹ, וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֶׁבַע שֶׁמָּלַךְ דָּוִד.
human_translation: ten years Samuel reigned alone, and year that Saul reigned and Samuel and two that Saul reigned by himself, thirty-seven which David ruled,
llm_translation: Ten years reigned Samuel by himself, one year he and Saul reigned, and two years Saul reigned by himself, and thirty-seven years David reigned.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חַטַּאת הַיָּחִיד שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ — מֵתָה, וְשֶׁל צִבּוּר — אֵינָהּ מֵתָה.
human_translation: An individual sin offering whose owner achieved atonement die, but a communal is not die.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A sin offering brought by an individual, once its owners have achieved atonement - it dies. But that of the community - it does not die.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תָּמוּת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מָה מָצִינוּ בִּוְלַד חַטָּאת, וּבִתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת, וּבְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ — דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים בְּיָחִיד וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר, אַף שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ וְעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ — בְּיָחִיד דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים וְלֹא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: shall die. Rabbi Shimon says: Just as we found with regard to the offspring of a sin offering, and with regard to the substitute for a sin offering, and with regard to a sin offering whose owner died, these matters apply to an individual and not to a communal so too, whose owner achieved atonement and whose year has passed, matters stated with regard to an individual and not with regard to a communal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Tamut." Rabbi Shimon says: "What have we found regarding the offspring of a sin-offering, and the exchange of a sin-offering, and a sin-offering whose owners have died - these matters are said in the case of an individual and not in the case of a congregation, even though her owners have atoned for her and passed a year - in the case of an individual these matters are said and not in the case of a congregation."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַהוּ אוֹמֵר חַטָּאת ״יָבִיא״? מִנַּיִן לְמַקְדִּישׁ חַטָּאתוֹ וְאָבְדָה, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וְנִמְצֵאת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קַיֶּימֶת, וַהֲרֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹמְדוֹת — מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יָבִיא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״חַטָּאת״. יָכוֹל יָבִיא שְׁתֵּיהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יְבִיאֶנָּה״ — אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: The Sages taught What is says: he bring a sin offering, From where to one who separated his sin offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its place and the first one was found alive, and they both stand from where that he may bring whichever of them he wishes? The verse states: “A sin offering.” might he bring both of them. the verse states: “He shall bring it.” one but not two
llm_translation: The sages taught: What does it mean when it says "he shall bring" regarding a sin offering? From where do we derive that if one consecrates his sin offering and it becomes lost, and he designates another in its place, and then the first one is found, and both are standing, from where do we know which one he should bring? The Torah teaches "sin offering." Could he bring both of them? The Torah teaches "he shall bring it" - one and not two.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתָהּ שְׁנִיָּה מָה תְּהֵא עָלֶיהָ? אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא, תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תִּרְעֶה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תָּמוּת.
human_translation: And that second what will be with it? Rav Hamnuna says it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: left to graze Rabbi Shimon says: shall die,
llm_translation: "And that second one, what should be done with it? Rav Hamnuna said, it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: it should graze, Rabbi Shimon says: it should be put to death."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה תִּרְעֶה? וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״תָּמוּת״ שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ! אֵיפוֹךְ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תָּמוּת, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תִּרְעֶה. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תִּרְעֶה? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת!
human_translation: But did Rabbi Yehuda say left to graze? But didn’t we hear Rabbi Yehuda shall die? Reverse Rabbi Yehuda says: shall die; Rabbi Shimon says: left to graze. But did Rabbi Shimon say left to graze? But didn’t Rabbi Shimon say: five sin offerings that die,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said Rabbi Yehuda 'tireh'? But didn't we hear Rabbi Yehuda say 'tamut'! Turn it around: Rabbi Yehuda says 'tamut,' Rabbi Shimon says 'tireh.' And who said Rabbi Shimon 'tireh'? But didn't Rabbi Shimon say: 'Five sins result in death!'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא (אֲמַר לֵיהּ) לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בַּאֲבוּדָה בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה, כָּאן — בַּאֲבוּדָה בִּשְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, do not reverse and it not difficult. Here, to lost at the time of the separation There, to lost at the time of atonement,
llm_translation: Rather (he said) to him, always do not turn over, and not difficult: here — in loss at the time of separation, here — in loss at the time of atonement.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא — הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that at the time of the separation and not difficult. Here Rabbi Yehuda in accordance with of Rabbi There Rabbi Yehuda in accordance with of the Rabbis
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Both this and that at the time of the separation, and it is not difficult - this is Rabbi Yehuda according to Rabbi, and this is Rabbi Yehuda according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַטַּאת צִיבּוּר שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים מֵתָה?
human_translation: But is there one who said a communal sin offering whose owners achieved atonement die?
llm_translation: And who is there according to the one who said that the sin offering of the congregation atones when the owners are dead?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: ״וְהַבָּאִים מֵהַשְּׁבִי בְנֵי הַגּוֹלָה הִקְרִיבוּ עוֹלוֹת... פָּרִים בְּנֵי בָקָר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר... אֵילִים תִּשְׁעִים וְתִשְׁעָה, כְּבָשִׂים שִׁבְעִים וְשִׁבְעָה, שְׂעִירֵי חַטָּאת שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר — הַכֹּל עוֹלָה לַה׳״.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Similarly, Rabbi Yosei said: “The children of the captivity that came out of exile sacrificed burnt offerings twelve bulls ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, twelve goats for a sin offering; all this was a burnt offering unto the Lord”
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught: Similarly, Rabbi Yosei said: 'And those who came from the captivity, the sons of the exile, brought burnt offerings... bulls, twelve; rams, ninety-six; lambs, seventy-seven; male goats for sin offerings, twelve — all as burnt offerings to the Lord.'"

hebrew_text: וְחַטָּאת מִי קָרְבָה עוֹלָה? אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי עוֹלָה, מָה עוֹלָה אֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת — אַף חַטָּאת אֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֱבִיאוּם, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁעָשׂוּ בִּימֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: But is a sin offering sacrificed a burnt offering? Rava said: of a burnt offering: Just as a burnt offering may not be eaten, so too, sin offering not eaten. As Rabbi Yosei would say: They brought these for idol worship; and Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: for the idol worship they committed in the days of Zedekiah.
llm_translation: And sin offering who brings burnt offering? Rava said: Just as burnt offering, what burnt offering is not eaten — so sin offering is not eaten, for Rabbi Yosei used to say: They brought them for idol worship, and Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For idol worship that they did in the days of Zedekiah.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין, לְמַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ חַטַּאת צִבּוּר שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ — מֵתָה, אִית לֵיהּ נָמֵי חַטַּאת צִבּוּר שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ — מֵתָה, וְהָא הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא דְּמֵתוּ בַּעֲלֵיהּ, וְקָא קָרְבָה!
human_translation: enter our mind according to the one who holds a communal sin offering whose owners achieved atonement die, also holds a communal sin offering whose owners died die. But here, this is of whose owners died, And they were sacrificed.
llm_translation: The matter was raised: according to the one who holds that the communal sin-offering whose owners have died — if she dies, and according to the one who holds that the communal sin-offering whose owners have died — if he dies, and here where the owners have died, and she is approaching!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַטַּאת צִבּוּר שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ מֵתָה, חַטַּאת צִבּוּר שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ אֵינָהּ מֵתָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַצִּבּוּר מֵתִים.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Even according to the one who said a communal sin offering whose owners achieved atonement die, a communal sin offering whose owners died is not die. because a community does not die.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even according to the one who says that if the sin offering of the congregation was atoned for by its owners, it dies, the sin offering of the congregation that its owners died, it does not die, because the congregation does not die.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַב פָּפָּא הָא? אִי נֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״תַּחַת אֲבוֹתֶיךָ יִהְיוּ בָנֶיךָ״, אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ יָחִיד נָמֵי!
human_translation: From where does Rav Pappa derive this If we say because it is written: “Your sons shall be instead of your fathers” if so, even an individual as well.
llm_translation: He asked Rav Papa: Is this so? If you say it is because it is written, "Your sons shall be under you," even so, this applies even to an individual!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, שֶׁאֵין הַצִּיבּוּר מֵתִים, מִשְּׂעִירֵי רְגָלִים וְרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: אַיְיתִינְהוּ מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. וְדִלְמָא מִתוּ מָרַיְיהוּ דְּהָנֵי זוּזֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֵין הַצִּבּוּר מֵתִים.
human_translation: Rather, this is reasoning that a community does not die. from the goats pilgrimage Festivals and New Moons, as the Merciful One states: Bring them from the collection of the chamber, But perhaps the owners of these coins have died Rather, isn’t it conclude from a community does not die?
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason: that the community does not die, from the goats of the festivals and the heads of the months, as the Merciful One said: "Bring them as a contribution for the chamber." But perhaps their masters died and left these coins? Rather, do not infer from this that the community does not die.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי אַקְרוּבִינְהוּ לְהָנֵי חַטָּאוֹת — אַחַיֵּי אַקְרֻבִינְהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרַבִּים מֵהַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְרָאשֵׁי הָאָבוֹת הַזְּקֵנִים אֲשֶׁר רָאוּ אֶת הַבַּיִת הָרִאשׁוֹן בְּיׇסְדוֹ זֶה הַבַּיִת... בּוֹכִים בְּקוֹל גָּדוֹל וְרַבִּים בִּתְרוּעָה״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say when they sacrificed these sin offerings they sacrificed them for the living, As it is written: “But many of the priests, Levites, and heads of fathers’ houses, the old men that had seen the first house standing on its foundation, wept with a loud voice when this house and many shouted aloud
llm_translation: And if you will say: When we bring them close to those sins — let us bring them close, as it is written: "And many of the priests, the Levites, and the heads of the fathers' houses, the old men that had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid... wept with a loud voice, and many shouted aloud."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא הָנָךְ מִיעוּטָא? לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דִּכְתִיב ״וְלֹא הִכִּירוּ הָעָם בַּתְּרוּעָה וְשִׂמְחָה לְקוֹל בְּכִי הָעָם״.
human_translation: But perhaps those the minority, You cannot say as it is written “So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people;
llm_translation: Perhaps there is a small amount there? You did not find what you said, as it is written, "And the people did not recognize the sound of the shout of joy from the sound of the people's weeping."

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי מַקְרְבִי לְהוּ? וַהֲרֵי מְזִידִין הֲווֹ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: But how could they sacrifice they were intentional Rabbi Yoḥanan says It was a provisional edict
llm_translation: And how can I bring them close to him? But they were intentional sinners! Rabbi Yochanan said: It was a temporary ruling.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי — בִּשְׁלָמָא פָּרִים וּשְׂעִירִים כְּנֶגֶד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים, אֶלָּא כְּבָשִׂים כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אֶלָּא הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: this also stands to reason, as, if you do not say so, Granted, bulls and goats, correspond to twelve tribes. But to what the sheep correspond? Rather, it was a provisional edict.
llm_translation: Thus it is logical, for if you do not say so - with regard to the twelve tribes, bulls and goats correspond, but sheep correspond to whom? Rather, it was a temporary directive.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מִשֶּׁמֵּת יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה וְיוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹחָנָן אִישׁ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, בָּטְלוּ הָאֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת. אִישׁ שֶׁהַכֹּל בּוֹ.
human_translation: we learned there From when Yosef ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida and Yosef ben Yoḥanan of Jerusalem died, the clusters [ eshkolot ] ceased, a man who contains all [ ish shehakol bo ],
llm_translation: We learned there: From the time that Yosef ben Yoezer of Tzreidah and Yosef ben Yochanan of Jerusalem died, the clusters of grapes ceased. A man in whom all things were.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת שֶׁעָמְדוּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה עַד שֶׁמֵּת יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר — הָיוּ לְמֵדִין תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — לֹא הָיוּ לְמֵדִין תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: All clusters who stood of the Jewish people, from the days of Moses until Yosef ben Yo’ezer died, would study Torah of Moses, our teacher. From that forward they would not study Torah of Moses, our teacher.
llm_translation: And said Rav Yehudah, said Shmuel: All grapevines that stood for the Israelites from the days of Moses until the death of Joseph ben Yo'ezer — they studied Torah like Moses our teacher, from here and onwards — they did not study Torah like Moses our teacher.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים הֲלָכוֹת נִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה! דְּאִישְׁתְּכֻח לְהוּ — אִישְׁתְּכֻח, וְדִגְמִירָן לְהוּ — הֲווֹ גְּמִירִי כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel said: Three thousand halakhot were forgotten during the days of mourning for Moses. that they forgot, were forgotten, but that they studied, they would study of Moses, our teacher.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Three thousand halakhot were forgotten in the days of mourning for Moshe! For if they were forgotten to him — they were forgotten, and if they were learned by him — they were learned like our teacher Moshe.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: מִשֶּׁמֵּת מֹשֶׁה, אִם רַבּוּ מְטַמְּאִין — טִמֵּאוּ, אִם רַבּוּ טְהוֹרִין — טִיהֵרוּ!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught From when Moses died, if the majority deem impure, they impure, if the majority deem pure, they pure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: From the time of the death of Moses, if their majority renders them impure - they are impure, if their majority renders them pure - they are pure!

hebrew_text: לִיבָּא דְּאִימְּעִיט, מִיגְמָר הֲווֹ גְּמִירִי לְהוּ כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ.
human_translation: the heart was limited [ libba de’ime’it ], they studied, they would study them of Moses, our teacher.
llm_translation: The heart of the matter, from when he began, they would learn it to them like Moses our teacher.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: כׇּל אֶשְׁכּוֹלוֹת שֶׁעָמְדוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה עַד שֶׁמֵּת יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה — לֹא הָיָה בָּהֶם שׁוּם דּוֹפִי, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — הָיָה בָּהֶן שׁוּם דּוֹפִי.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : All clusters who stood of the Jewish people from the days of Moses until Yosef ben Yo’ezer died had no flaw in them. From this forward had flaws in them.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: All grapevines that stood for the Israelites from the days of Moses until the death of Joseph ben Yo'ezer of Zeredah - there was no blemish in them. From here and onwards - there was a blemish in them.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָסִיד אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה גּוֹנֵחַ מִלִּבּוֹ, וְשָׁאֲלוּ לָרוֹפְאִים, וְאָמְרוּ: אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁיִּינַק חָלָב רוֹתֵחַ שַׁחֲרִית, וְהֵבִיאוּ עֵז וְקָשְׁרוּ לוֹ בְּכַרְעֵי מִיטָּתוֹ, וְהָיָה יוֹנֵק מִמֶּנָּה חֵלֶב.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught an incident involving a certain pious man who was groaning, due to his heart. And they asked the physicians and they said: There is no other remedy for him but that he should suckle warm milk morning. And they brought a goat and tied it to the leg of the bed for him, and he would suckle milk from it.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: There was an incident involving a certain pious individual who was suffering from an ailment in his heart, and they consulted the physicians, who said: He will not have a remedy until he suckles the milk of a white goat in the morning. So they brought a goat and tied it to the legs of his bed, and he would suckle milk from it.

hebrew_text: לְמָחָר נִכְנְסוּ חֲבֵירָיו לְבַקְּרוֹ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ הָעֵז אָמְרוּ: לִיסְטִים מְזוּיָּין בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וְאָנוּ נִכְנָסִים לְבַקְּרוֹ?! יָשְׁבוּ וּבָדְקוּ, וְלֹא מָצְאוּ בּוֹ עָוֹן אֶלָּא שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעֵז בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: On the following day, his friends entered to visit him. When they saw the goat they said: an armed bandit in this house, and we are entering to visit him? sat and examined and they could not find transgression to him other than of that goat alone.
llm_translation: On the next day, his friends entered to visit him. When they saw the goat, they said: "Thieves are common in his house, and we are entering to visit him?!" They sat and examined, and found no fault in him except for that same goat alone.

hebrew_text: וְאַף הוּא בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ אָמַר: יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי בְּעַצְמִי שֶׁאֵין בִּי עָוֹן, אֶלָּא שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעֵז בִּלְבַד, שֶׁעָבַרְתִּי עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירַי, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין מְגַדְּלִין בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And that also said at the time of his death: I know with regard to myself that I have no transgression to me but of that goat alone, as I transgressed the statement of my colleagues, As the Sages said One may not raise small domesticated animals, in Eretz Yisrael,
llm_translation: And he also at the time of his death said: I know in myself that there is no sin in me, except for that she-goat alone, for I transgressed the words of my colleagues, for the sages said: One may not raise a small animal in the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר ״מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָסִיד אֶחָד״ — אוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִילְעַאי, וְרַבָּנַן בָּתַר יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אִישׁ צְרֵידָה דָּרֵי דָּרֵי הֲווֹ.
human_translation: And we maintain anywhere that it says: an incident involving a certain pious either Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava or Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai. And Sages many generations after Yosef ben Yo’ezer of Tzereida.
llm_translation: We have established for ourselves, wherever it is stated "the incident involving a certain pious individual" — whether it be Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava or Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai, and the Sages after Yosef ben Yo'ezer of Tzreidah, they were all of the same opinion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: דּוֹפִי שֶׁל סְמִיכָה קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said is teaching flaw of placing hands
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The law of leaning is taught.

hebrew_text: וְהָא יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר גּוּפֵיהּ מִיפְלָיג פְּלִיג בִּסְמִיכָה! כִּי אִיפְּלִיג בַּהּ בְּסוֹף שְׁנֵיהּ, דִּבְצַר לִיבָּא.
human_translation: But Yosef ben Yo’ezer himself disputed of placing hands When they disputed it, at the end of the years when his heart was limited,
llm_translation: And this: Yosef ben Yoezer, his body was separating, he separates in proximity! For he separated in it at the end of his two, for he desired his heart.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים הֲלָכוֹת נִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁאַל! אָמַר לָהֶם: ״לֹא בַשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״.
human_translation: the itself. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Three thousand halakhot were forgotten during the days of mourning for Moses. said to Joshua: Ask said to them: “It is not in heaven”
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Three thousand halakhot were forgotten in the days of mourning for Moses. They said to Joshua: Ask! He said to them: "It is not in heaven."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לִשְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁאַל! אָמַר לָהֶם: ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״ — שֶׁאֵין הַנָּבִיא רַשַּׁאי לְחַדֵּשׁ דָּבָר מֵעַתָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: אַף חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ נִשְׁתַּכְּחָה בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה.
