human_translation: said to Samuel: Ask He said to them: “These are the commandments that from now a prophet is not permitted to introduce any element Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: Also, a sin offering whose owner has died was forgotten during the days of mourning for Moses.
llm_translation: They said to Shmuel: Ask! He said to them: "These are the commandments" - that the prophet is not permitted to innovate a matter from now. Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: Even the sin offering whose owners died was nullified during the mourning period of Moses.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לְפִנְחָס: שְׁאַל! אָמַר לָהֶם: ״לֹא בַשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְאֶלְעָזָר: שְׁאַל! אָמַר לָהֶם: ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״, שֶׁאֵין נָבִיא רַשַּׁאי לְחַדֵּשׁ דָּבָר מֵעַתָּה.
human_translation: said to Pinehas: Ask said to them: “It is not in heaven” said to Elazar: Ask He said to them “These are the commandments,” that a prophet is not permitted to introduce any element from now
llm_translation: They said to Pinchas: Ask! He said to them: "It is not in heaven." They said to Elazar: Ask! He said to them: "These are the commandments," that a prophet is not permitted to innovate a matter from now on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּפְטַר מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לְגַן עֵדֶן, אָמַר לוֹ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁאַל מִמֶּנִּי כָּל סְפֵיקוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, כְּלוּם הִנַּחְתִּיךָ שָׁעָה אַחַת וְהָלַכְתִּי לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר? לֹא כָּךְ כָּתַבְתָּ בִּי ״וּמְשָׁרְתוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן נַעַר לֹא יָמִישׁ מִתּוֹךְ הָאֹהֶל״? מִיָּד תָּשַׁשׁ כֹּחוֹ שֶׁל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְנִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת הֲלָכוֹת, וְנוֹלְדוּ לוֹ שְׁבַע מֵאוֹת סְפֵיקוֹת, וְעָמְדוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהׇרְגוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: the time when Moses, our teacher, left to the Garden of Eden, he said to Joshua: Ask from me all uncertainty that you have, said to him: My teacher, did I leave you one moment and go to another place? Didn’t you write this about me “But his minister, Joshua, son of Nun, a young man, did not depart out of the tent” Immediately Joshua’s strength weakened, and three hundred halakhot were forgotten by him, and seven hundred uncertainty emerged before him, and the entire Jewish people arose to kill him,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: At the time when our teacher Moses departed to the Garden of Eden, he said to Joshua: Ask me all the doubts you have. He said to him: My teacher, have I left you for even one moment and gone to another place? Did you not write about me, "And his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, a lad, would not depart from within the tent"? Immediately Joshua's strength weakened, and three hundred laws were forgotten from him, and seven hundred doubts arose, and all of Israel arose to kill him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לוֹמַר לָךְ אִי אֶפְשָׁר, לֵךְ וְטוֹרְדֵן בְּמִלְחָמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי מוֹת מֹשֶׁה עֶבֶד ה׳ וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said impossible to tell you go and exhaust them in war, As it is stated: “Now it came to pass after the death of Moses, the servant of the Lord, that the Lord spoke
llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He: to say to you "impossible," go and engage them in battle, as it is stated: "And it came to pass after the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, that the Lord spoke, etc."

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתִין תָּנָא: אֶלֶף וּשְׁבַע מֵאוֹת קַלִּין וַחֲמוּרִין, וּגְזֵירוֹת שָׁווֹת, וְדִקְִדּוּקֵי סוֹפְרִים נִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: It is taught in a baraita : One thousand and seven hundred a fortiori inferences, and verbal analogies, and minutiae of the scribes were forgotten during the days of mourning for Moses.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: One thousand seven hundred measures of wine and oil, and equal decrees, and the precise details of the scribes were forgotten in the days of mourning for Moses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן הֶחְזִירָן עׇתְנִיאֵל בֶּן קְנַז מִתּוֹךְ פִּלְפּוּלוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּלְכְּדָהּ עׇתְנִיאֵל בֶּן קְנַז אֲחִי כָלֵב וַיִּתֶּן לוֹ אֶת עַכְסָה בִתּוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״עַכְסָה״? שֶׁכׇּל הָרוֹאֶה אוֹתָהּ כּוֹעֵס עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Even so, Othniel, son of Kenaz, restored them through his sharp [ pilpulo ], as it is stated: And Othniel, son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it; and he gave him Achsah his daughter as a wife” And why is she called Achsah? that anyone who sees her became angry [ ko’es ] about his wife,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Even so, Othniel the son of Kenaz restored them from his degradation, as it is stated: "And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, captured it; and he gave him Achsah his daughter as a wife." And why was she called "Achsah"? Because anyone who saw her became angry with his wife.

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי בְּבוֹאָה וַתְּסִיתֵהוּ לִשְׁאֹל מֵאֵת אָבִיהָ שָׂדֶה וַתִּצְנַח מֵעַל הַחֲמוֹר, מַאי ״וַתִּצְנַח״? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָמְרָה לוֹ, מָה חֲמוֹר זֶה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַאֲכָל בַּאֲבוּסוֹ — מִיָּד צוֹעֵק, כָּךְ אִשָּׁה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאֵין לָהּ תְּבוּאָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ — מִיָּד צוֹעֶקֶת.
human_translation: “And it came to pass, when she came to him, that she persuaded him to ask of her father a field; and she alighted from off her donkey; What “And she alighted [ vatitznaḥ ],” Rava says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: said to Just as this donkey, when it has no food in its trough it immediately cries out, so too a woman, when she has no produce in her house she immediately cries out.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was, as she pressed him to ask of her father a field, and she alighted from the donkey. What is 'and she alighted'? Rava said, Rabbi Yitzchak said: She said to him, 'What is this donkey, since it has no food in its manger - immediately it brays, so too a woman, since she has no produce in her house - immediately she cries out."

hebrew_text: וַתֹּאמֶר תְּנָה לִּי בְרָכָה כִּי אֶרֶץ הַנֶּגֶב נְתַתָּנִי, בַּיִת שֶׁמְּנוּגָּב מִכׇּל טוֹבָה, ״וְנָתַתָּה לִי גּוּלּוֹת מָיִם״ — אָדָם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה בִּלְבַד. ״וַיִּתֶּן לָהּ כָּלֵב אֵת גּוּלּוֹת עִלִּיּוֹת וְאֵת גּוּלּוֹת תַּחְתִּיּוֹת״ — אָמַר לָהּ: מִי שֶׁדָּר עֶלְיוֹנִים וְתַחְתּוֹנִים יְבַקֵּשׁ מִמֶּנּוּ מְזוֹנוֹת?!
human_translation: “And she said: Give me a blessing; for that you have set me in the land of the South [ negev ], a home dried [ menugav ] of all goodness. “And you have given me springs of water”; a man who has nothing other than Torah, “And gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.” said to her: who dwells in the upper and the lower require sustenance be requested for him?
llm_translation: And she said, "Give me a blessing, for you have given me the land of the Negev, a house that is in the south, from all goodness." "And you shall give me springs of water" - a person who has nothing but Torah alone. "And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs" - he said to her: One who sent the upper and lower springs should seek sustenance from him?!

hebrew_text: וְכָלֵב בֶּן קְנַז הוּא? וַהֲלֹא ״כָּלֵב בֶּן יְפוּנֶּה״ הוּא! מַאי ״יְפוּנֶּה״? שֶׁפָּנָה מֵעֲצַת מְרַגְּלִים.
human_translation: And Caleb, he the son of Kenaz? Wasn’t he Caleb, son of Jephunneh What Jephunneh that he turned [ sheppana ] from the advice of the spies
llm_translation: "And Caleb son of Kenaz, is he not? But is he not 'Caleb son of Jephunneh'? What is 'Jephunneh'? Because he turned away from the counsel of the spies."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי בֶּן קְנַז הוּא? בֶּן חֶצְרוֹן הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָלֵב בֶּן חֶצְרוֹן הוֹלִיד אֶת עֲזוּבָה״. אָמַר רָבָא: חוֹרְגֵיהּ דִּקְנַז הוּא.
human_translation: But still, he the son of Kenaz? He was the son of Hezron, as it is written: “And Caleb, son of Hezron, begot children of Azubah Rava said: he was the stepson of Kenaz.
llm_translation: "And Achati, son of Kenaz, is he? He is son of Hezron, as it is written: 'And Caleb son of Hezron fathered Azubah.' Rava said: He is the brother-in-law of Kenaz."

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא: הוּא עׇתְנִיאֵל, הוּא יַעְבֵּץ, וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? יְהוּדָה אָחִי שִׁמְעוֹן שְׁמוֹ. ״עׇתְנִיאֵל״ — שֶׁעֲנָאוֹ אֵל, ״יַעְבֵּץ״ — שֶׁיָּעַץ וְרִיבֵּץ תּוֹרָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: A tanna is Othniel he is Jabez. And what is his name? Judah, brother of Simeon, is his name. Othniel, as God answered [ ana’o El ] Jabez [ yabetz ] because he advised and spread [ ya’atz veribetz ] Torah among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Mishna: He was Otniel, he was Yabetz, and what is his name? Yehudah is his name, the brother of Shimon. "Otniel" - because he answered to God, "Yabetz" - because he counseled and spread Torah in Israel.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן שֶׁעֲנָאוֹ אֵל? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא יַעְבֵּץ לֵאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר אִם בָּרֵךְ תְּבָרְכֵנִי וְהִרְבִּיתָ אֶת גְּבוּלִי וְהָיְתָה יָדְךָ עִמָּדִי וַעֲשֵׂה מֵרָעָתִי לְבִלְתִּי עׇצְבִּי וַיָּבֵא אֱלֹהִים אֵת אֲשֶׁר שָׁאָל״.
human_translation: And from where do we that God answered him? As it is written: “And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying: If You will bless me indeed, and enlarge my border, and that Your hand may be with me, and that You will work deliverance from evil, that it may not pain me! And God granted him that which he requested”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that he prayed to Him? As it is written: "And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, 'Oh, that You would bless me indeed, and enlarge my territory, that Your hand would be with me, and that You would keep me from evil, that I may not cause pain!' So God granted him what he requested."

hebrew_text: אִם בֵּרַךְ תְּבָרְכֵנִי — בַּתּוֹרָה, ״וְהִרְבִּיתָ אֶת גְּבוּלִי״ — בְּתַלְמִידִים, ״וְהָיְתָה יָדְךָ עִמָּדִי״ — שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּכֵּחַ תַּלְמוּדִי מִלִּבִּי, ״וַעֲשֵׂה מֵרָעָתִי״ — שֶׁיִּזְדַּמְּנוּ לִי רֵיעִים כְּמוֹתִי, ״לְבִלְתִּי עׇצְבִּי״ — שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׂגְּבֵנִי יֵצֶר הָרָע מִלִּשְׁנוֹת. אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵינִי הוֹלֵךְ (לִנְסִיסִי) [בִּנְסִיסִי] לַשְּׁאוֹל. מִיָּד, ״וַיָּבֵא אֱלֹהִים אֵת אֲשֶׁר שָׁאָל״.
human_translation: “If You will bless me indeed,” with regard to Torah. “And enlarge my border,” with regard to students. “And that Your hand be with me,” that my studies not be forgotten from my heart. “And that You will work deliverance from evil [ mera’ati ],” that I will find friends [ re’im ] like me. “That it may not pain me,” that the evil inclination should not grow stronger me from studying If You do so, good; and if not, I will go depressed [ linsisi ] to the netherworld. Immediately, “And God granted him that which he requested.”
llm_translation: If you bless, bless me - in the Torah, "and you shall enlarge my border" - in students, "and let your hand be with me" - so that my learning should not be forgotten from my heart, "and do me harm" - that friends like me should not become arrogant, "so that I will not be grieved" - that the evil inclination should not overpower me to speak evil. If you do so - good, and if not - behold, I am going (to the testing) to the testing to Sheol. Immediately, "and God brought what he asked for."

hebrew_text: כְּיוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״רָשׁ וְאִישׁ תְּכָכִים נִפְגָּשׁוּ מֵאִיר עֵינֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם ה׳״. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַתַּלְמִיד הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל רַבּוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״לַמְּדֵנִי תּוֹרָה״, אִם מְלַמְּדוֹ — ״מֵאִיר עֵינֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם ה׳״, וְאִם לָאו — ״עָשִׁיר וָרָשׁ נִפְגָּשׁוּ עוֹשֵׂה כֻלָּם ה׳״. מִי שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ חָכָם לָזֶה — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ טִיפֵּשׁ, טִיפֵּשׁ לָזֶה — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ חָכָם. זוֹ מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: On a similar you say “The poor man and the oppressor [ tekhakhim ] meet together; the Lord gives light to the eyes of both of them” When the student, goes to his teacher, and says to him: Teach me Torah, if teach him, the Lord gives light to the eyes of both of them, But if not “the rich and the poor meet together; the Lord is the maker of them all” Who made this one wise makes him foolish, that one foolish makes him wise. This is the exposition of Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: As an expert Talmud scholar, I will now provide the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse: Talmudic text: "As an example in the matter you say: 'The poor and the rich meet; the Lord enlightens the eyes of both of them.' When the student goes to his teacher and says to him: 'Teach me Torah,' if he teaches him - 'the Lord enlightens the eyes of both of them,' and if not - 'the rich and the poor meet; the Lord is the maker of them all.' One who makes this one wise - makes him foolish, and one who makes this one foolish - makes him wise. This is the teaching of Rabbi Natan."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם בָּרֵךְ תְּבָרְכֵנִי״ — בִּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, ״וְהִרְבִּיתָ אֶת גְּבוּלִי״ — בְּבָנִים וּבְבָנוֹת, ״וְהָיְתָה יָדְךָ עִמָּדִי״ — בְּמַשָּׂא וּבְמַתָּן, ״וְעָשִׂיתָ מֵרָעָתִי״ — שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בִּי מֵיחוֹשׁ רֹאשׁ וּמֵיחוֹשׁ אׇזְנַיִם וּמֵיחוֹשׁ עֵינַיִם, ״לְבִלְתִּי עׇצְבִּי״ — שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׂגְּבֵנִי יֵצֶר הָרָע מִלִּשְׁנוֹת. אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵינִי הוֹלֵךְ בִּנְסִיסִי לַשְּׁאוֹל, ״וַיָּבֵא לוֹ אֱלֹהִים אֵת אֲשֶׁר שָׁאָל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says “If You will bless me indeed” with procreation. “And enlarge my border” with sons and with daughters. “And that Your hand may be with me,” in business. “And that You will work deliverance from evil,” that I will not have a headache or an earache or an eye ache. “That it may not pain me,” that the evil inclination will not grow strong against me me from studying If you do so, good; and if not, I will go depressed to the netherworld. Immediately, And God granted him that which he requested.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda the Prince says: "If you bless, you shall bless me" - in fruitfulness and multiplication, "and you shall enlarge my border" - with sons and daughters, "and let Your hand be with me" - in giving and receiving, "and you shall keep me from harm" - that there shall not be in me anxiety of head, anxiety of ears, and anxiety of eyes, "that it may not grieve me" - that the evil inclination should not prevail upon me to slander. If you do so - it is good, but if not - behold, I go with my trials to Sheol, "and God granted him what he asked for."

hebrew_text: כְּיוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״רָשׁ וְאִישׁ תְּכָכִים נִפְגָּשׁוּ מֵאִיר עֵינֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם ה׳״, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָנִי הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְאָמַר: פַּרְנְסֵנִי, אִם מְפַרְנְסוֹ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — ״עָשִׁיר וָרָשׁ נִפְגָּשׁוּ עוֹשֵׂה כֻלָּם ה׳״, מִי שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ עָשִׁיר לָזֶה — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ עָנִי, עָנִי לָזֶה — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ עָשִׁיר.
human_translation: On a similar you say “The poor man and the oppressor meet together; the Lord gives light to the eyes of both of them” When a poor goes to a homeowner and says: Provide for me, if he provides for him, good. But if not, “The rich and the poor meet together; the Lord is the maker of them all” Who made this one wealthy makes him poor, that one poor makes him wealthy.
llm_translation: As it were in the matter, you say: "The poor and the rich meet; the Lord enlightens the eyes of both of them." When a poor person goes to the master of the house and says: "Provide for me," if he provides for him - good. But if not - "The rich and the poor meet; the Lord is the maker of them all." One whom He made rich for this one - He makes him poor, and one whom He made poor for this one - He makes him rich.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה מָצִינוּ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as we found
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: What have we found?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת, וְלַד חַטָּאת, וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Rabbi Shimon says: Five sin offerings die, An offspring to sin offering, and the substitution of a sin offering, and a sin offering whose owner has died; and a sin offering whose owner achieved atonement and a sin offering whose year has passed,
llm_translation: The sages taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Five sin-offerings that are liable to death, and a sin-offering for childbirth, and a substitute sin-offering, and a sin-offering whose owners died, and a sin-offering whose owners atoned, and a sin-offering that exceeded its year.

hebrew_text: אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר וְלַד חַטָּאת בְּצִיבּוּר — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין חַטָּאת נְקֵבָה בְּצִיבּוּר, וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר תְּמוּרַת חַטָּאת בְּצִיבּוּר — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין צִיבּוּר עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ בְּצִיבּוּר — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַצִּיבּוּר מֵתִים.
human_translation: You cannot say an offspring of a sin offering in the case of a community, because there no female sin offerings by the community. And you cannot say a substitution for a sin offering in the case of a community, because a community cannot render a substitute. And you cannot say a sin offering whose owners have died in the case of a community, because a community cannot die.
llm_translation: You are unable to say a communal sin-offering, because there is no female sin-offering in the community, and you are unable to say a substitute sin-offering in the community, because the community does not make substitutions, and you are unable to say a sin-offering whose owners have died in the community, because the community members do not die.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ, וְשֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ — לֹא מָצִינוּ. יָכוֹל יְהוּ נוֹהֲגוֹת בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִיבּוּר?
human_translation: whose owners achieved atonement and whose year has passed, we have not found might that are in effect both for an individual and a communal
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They appeased her husband, and she miscarried her fetus - we did not find. Can it be that she is accustomed, whether in private or in public?"

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: יִלְמַד אָדָם סָתוּם מִמְּפוֹרָשׁ, מָה מְפוֹרָשׁ בְּיָחִיד וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר, אַף בְּשֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ וְשֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ בְּיָחִיד דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים וְלֹא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: you say: A person can learn not specified from are specified. Just as specified, to of an individual and not to a communal so too, whose owner achieved atonement, and whose year has passed, these matters are said with regard to an individual, but not with regard to a communal
llm_translation: You said: One should learn a closed matter from that which is explicit. Just as that which is explicit is in private and not in public, so too when her husband annuls it and she completes her year in private, matters are spoken and not in public.

hebrew_text: וְכִי דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּחַד מָקוֹם גְּמִיר לְהוּ.
human_translation: But can one derive possible from impossible? Rabbi Shimon learns this tradition as one unit,
llm_translation: "And when we judge, is it possible 'from impossible' possible? Rabbi Shimon in one place concludes for them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַרְבָּעָה נִתְּנוּ לָהֶן, וְהֶעֱמִידוּם עַל חָמֵשׁ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּצִבּוּר — הָנָךְ מִי אִיתַנְהוּ בְּצִבּוּר? אֶלָּא עַל כׇּרְחָיךְ — יִלְמַד סָתוּם מִמְּפוֹרָשׁ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says four were given to But established these with regard to five And if it enters your mind to communal are these as communal Rather, perforce derive unspecified from specified.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Four were given to them, and they established them on five. And if it enters your mind regarding the congregation — where are they established in the congregation? Rather, on your own initiative — one should learn the implicit from the explicit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אַחַת נִתְּנָה לָהֶן, וְהֶעֱמִידוּהָ עַל חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: one was given to them But established it to five
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan says: One was given to them, and they established it on five.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי בְּהֵי סִידְרָא גְּמִירִי לְהוּ, אִי בְּיָחִיד אִי בְּצִבּוּר?
human_translation: But see with regard to which category they learned whether to an individual, or to of a community?
llm_translation: And to Yehzei in the order of Gmirei to him, whether in private or in public?

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי שִׁכְחָיוֹת שָׁכְחוּ, וְקַשְׁיָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: They forgot two forgot And difficult for them,
llm_translation: Two forgetfulnesses they forgot, and a difficulty to them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּצִבּוּר, הָנָךְ מִי אִיתַנְהוּ בְּצִבּוּר? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יִלְמַד סָתוּם מִמְּפוֹרָשׁ — מַה מְפוֹרָשׁ בְּיָחִיד וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר, אַף סָתוּם בְּיָחִיד וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that communal are these communal Rather, conclude from it learns unspecified from specified: Just as specified to an individual and not to a communal so too, not specified to an individual, but not to a communal
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind regarding a congregation, where are they found in a congregation? Rather, learn from it: Just as that which is explicit is applicable in private and not in a congregation, so too that which is implicit is applicable in private and not in a congregation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוֹמֶר בַּקֳּדָשִׁים מִבַּתְּמוּרָה, וְחוֹמֶר בַּתְּמוּרָה מִבַּקֳּדָשִׁים. חוֹמֶר בְּקָדָשִׁים מִבַּתְּמוּרָה — שֶׁהַקֳּדָשִׁים עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, וְאֵין תְּמוּרָה עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה. הַצִּבּוּר וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין מַקְדִּישִׁין, אֲבָל לֹא מְמִירִין. וּמַקְדִּישִׁין עוּבָּרִין וְאֵבָרִים, אֲבָל לֹא מְמִירִין.
human_translation: stringency with regard to sacrificial than with regard to a substitute, and stringency with regard to a substitute than with regard to sacrificial stringency with regard to sacrificial than with regard to a substitute, as sacrificial render a substitute, but a substitute does not render a substitute. the community and the partners consecrate but they do not substitute And one consecrates fetuses and limbs, but one cannot substitute
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is a stringency in consecrated items over redeemed items, and a stringency in redeemed items over consecrated items. The stringency in consecrated items over redeemed items is that consecrated items can effect redemption, but redemption cannot effect redemption. The community and partners can sanctify, but they cannot exchange. They can sanctify unborn animals and limbs, but they cannot exchange.

hebrew_text: חוֹמֶר בַּתְּמוּרָה מִבַּקֳּדָשִׁים, שֶׁהַקְּדוּשָּׁה חָלָה עַל בַּעֲלַת מוּם קָבוּעַ, וְאֵין יוֹצְאָה לְחוּלִּין
human_translation: stringency with regard to a substitute than with regard to sacrificial as, with a permanent blemish is imbued with sanctity, And do not emerge to non-sacred
llm_translation: Material in exchange for sanctified items, that sanctity takes effect on a permanent blemished owner, and it does not go out to common items.

hebrew_text: לִיגָּזֵז וְלֵיעָבֵד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד בַּתְּמוּרָה, וְלֹא עָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד בַּמּוּקְדָּשִׁין.
human_translation: to shear and to perform labor Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says rendered unwittingly like intentionally with regard to substitution, But did not render unwittingly like intentionally with regard to consecrated
llm_translation: To steal and to serve. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One who unintentionally commits a transgression is considered intentional in the case of a substitute, but one who intentionally commits a transgression is not considered intentional in matters of sanctity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַכִּלְאַיִם, וְהַטְּרֵפָה, וְהַיּוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, וְטוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין, וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: diverse kinds, and a tereifa , and born by caesarean section, and a tumtum and a hermaphrodite not sacred and they do not sanctify
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Kil'ayim, and Treifah, and the offspring of a bird of prey, and Tumtum, and Androgynos - they are not sanctified, and do not sanctify.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא ״יִהְיֶה קֹּדֶשׁ״, לְרַבּוֹת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, the verse states: shall be holy” to include unwittingly like intentionally,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse says, "It shall be holy," to include unintentional transgressions as intentional.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: כְּסָבוּר שֶׁהוּא מוּתָּר לְהָמִיר. גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה — לָקֵי, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances unwittingly like intentionally Ḥizkiyya said: of who thinks that it is permitted to substitute With regard to a substitute, lashes in sanctified not lashes,
llm_translation: "How are the monetary laws of unintentional transgression comparable to intentional transgression? Chizkiyah said: He thinks that it is permitted to exchange. Regarding exchange - he is liable; regarding consecrated items - he is not liable."

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה — קָדֵישׁ, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — לָא קָדֵישׁ.
human_translation: an alternative version With regard to a substitute, consecrated, with regard to sacrificial not consecrated.
llm_translation: Another teaching: regarding exchange - holy, regarding consecrated items - not holy.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: כְּסָבוּר לוֹמַר ״תְּמוּרַת עוֹלָה״, וְאָמַר ״תְּמוּרַת שְׁלָמִים״. לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרַת שְׁלָמִים — קָדֵישׁ, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — לָא קָדֵישׁ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish and Rabbi Yoḥanan state who thinks to say: a substitute for a burnt offering but said: a substitute for a peace offering an alternative version: With regard to a substitute of a peace offering, is consecrated. With regard sacrificial not consecrated.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish and Rabbi Yochanan said: He thought to say "exchange for a burnt offering," and he said "exchange for peace offerings." Another version: Regarding exchange for peace offerings - it is sanctified, regarding exchange for holy items - it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחְרִינָא, כְּסָבוּר לוֹמַר ״שָׁחוֹר״ וְאָמַר ״לָבָן״ — גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה לָקֵי, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: alternative version of who thinks to say: black but he said: white With regard to a substitute, lashes in sacrificial not lashes.
llm_translation: The other scholars say, he intended to say "black" but said "white" - regarding redemption it is effective, regarding holy items it is not effective.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בְּאוֹמֵר ״תֵּצֵא זוֹ וְתִיכָּנֵס זוֹ״. גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים, בְּאוֹמֵר שֶׁנּוֹלַד בָּהֶם מוּם נֶאֱכָלִין בְּלֹא פִּדְיוֹן — לָא לָקֵי, גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה — לָקֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says of says: this emerge and that enter With regard to sacrificial where he says: that have developed a blemish may be eaten without redemption, not receive lashes. with regard to a substitute, receive lashes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: When one says, "Let this one go out and this one come in," regarding holy items, if a blemish was born in them, they are not redeemed - they are not redeemed regarding exchange.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בְּאוֹמֵר ״אֶכָּנֵס לַבַּיִת זֶה וְאַקְדִּישׁ״ וְאָמִיר מִדַּעְתִּי, וְנִכְנַס וְהֵמִיר וְהִקְדִּישׁ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ — גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה לָקֵי, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says of says: I will enter this house and consecrate and substitute intentionally, and he entered and substituted or consecrated unintentionally, with regard to substitution receive lashes, with regard to sacrificial not receive lashes.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: When one says, "I will enter this house and consecrate," and he enters and consecrates without intent, regarding exchange he is liable, but regarding consecrated items he is not liable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַכִּלְאַיִם וְהַטְּרֵפָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין בִּתְמוּרָה, וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: diverse kinds, and a tereifa , Shmuel says are not sanctified by substitution, And do not sanctify to render a substitute
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "Kil'ayim, treifah, etc." Shmuel said: "We do not sanctify with an exchange, and we do not sanctify to make an exchange."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: וּמֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵין קְדוֹשִׁין, מֵהֵיכָן מַקְדִּישִׁין? אֶלָּא אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא בְּמַקְדִּישׁ בְּהֵמָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִטְרְפָה, בְּמַקְדִּישׁ וָלָד וְיָצָא [דֶּרֶךְ] דּוֹפֶן. אֲבָל כִּלְאַיִם וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא בְּוַלְדֵי קָדָשִׁים, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: הַוָּלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir said: But since do not become sanctified, how can they sanctify Rather, you find only when sanctifies an animal and afterward it became a tereifa , when sanctifies a fetus and it emerged by caesarean section. But diverse kinds, and a tumtum , and a hermaphrodite, you can find only in the offspring of consecrated And in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, who said the offspring renders a substitute.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said, "And since they are not holy, from where do we sanctify? Rather, you can only find an answer in the case of one who sanctified an animal and afterwards it became blemished, or one who sanctified an offspring and it came out in a way resembling a wall. But in the case of hybrids, hermaphrodites, and androgynous individuals, you can only find an answer in the case of the offspring of consecrated animals, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda who said: The offspring effects an exchange."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? כִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה — מָה בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה לָא קָרְבָה וְלָא נָחֲתָא לַהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, אַף הָנָךְ לָא קָרְבִי וְלָא נָחֲתָא לְהוּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar? like a non-kosher animal: Just as a non-kosher animal is not sacrificed and inherent sanctity does not rest upon it, so too, these may not be sacrificed and inherent sanctity does not rest upon them.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's opinion? Just as an impure animal - what impure animal does not come close or settle for the sanctity of the body, so too, they do not come close or settle for the sanctity of the body.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: וַהֲרֵי בַּעַל מוּם, דְּלָא קָרֵיב, וְנָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּעַל מוּם קָרֵב בְּמִינוֹ. אִי הָכִי, טְרֵפָה נָמֵי קָא קָרְבָה בְּמִינָהּ!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: But a blemished which may not be sacrificed but inherent sanctity rest upon it? said to a blemished its type, is sacrificed If so, a tereifa , of its type are sacrificed.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: "But what about a blemished animal that is not brought as an offering, yet its sanctity remains attached to it!" He said to him: "A blemished animal is brought according to its kind. If not, a trefah animal also should be brought according to its kind!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה, מָה בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה פְּסוּל הַגּוּף, אַף כֹּל פְּסוּל הַגּוּף, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּעַל מוּם דִּפְסוּל חִסָּרוֹן נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: like a non-kosher animal, Just as a non-kosher animal is an inherent disqualification, so too any is an inherent disqualification, to exclude blemished which are disqualified lack
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Just as with an impure animal, where the body is disqualified, so too, with any disqualification of the body, they are to be excluded like a blemished animal, which is disqualified due to its deficiency.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא לְרָבָא: וַהֲלֹא ״שָׂרוּעַ״ וְ״קָלוּט״ כְּתִיב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וְהָא הָנֵי פְּסוּל הַגּוּף נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: Rav Adda said to Rava: But isn’t Too long or closed written in the passage and these are inherent disqualifications.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda to Rava: But isn't "sarua" and "kalut" written in the portion, and these are disqualified as the body!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּבְהֵמָה [טְמֵאָה], מָה בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה דְּלֵיכָּא בְּמִינַהּ, אַף כֹּל דְּלֵיכָּא בְּמִינַהּ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּעַל מוּם דְּהָא אִיכָּא בְּמִינַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: like a non-kosher animal: Just as a non-kosher animal is not of its type, so too any is not of its type. to exclude a blemished because its type are
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Like an unclean animal, just as an unclean animal has no distinction in its species, so too, anything that has no distinction in its species, is to exclude an animal with a blemish, for there is a distinction in its species.

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרַתְּ: טְרֵפָה אִיכָּא בְּמִינַהּ? לָא דָּמְיָא לְבַעַל מוּם, בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה אֲסוּרָה בַּאֲכִילָה, וּטְרֵפָה אֲסוּרָה בַּאֲכִילָה, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּעַל מוּם דְּמוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: What you say a tereifa , there are of its type is not similar to a blemished animal, a non-kosher animal is forbidden for consumption, and a tereifa is forbidden for consumption. to exclude a blemished which is permitted for consumption.
llm_translation: What do you say: Is there a case of a Tereifah in its own kind? It is not similar to a blemished animal, an unclean animal is forbidden for consumption, and a Tereifah is forbidden for consumption, to exclude a blemished animal which is permitted for consumption.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה צְרִיכָה מוּם קָבוּעַ לִפְדּוֹת עָלָיו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים?
human_translation: Shmuel says: who consecrates a tereifa is required a permanent blemish, of which he may redeem it. learn from redeems sacrificial to feed them to the dogs?
llm_translation: Shmuel said: One who consecrates a treifah animal requires a permanent blemish to redeem it. Can we infer from this that one may redeem consecrated items to feed them to dogs?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עוֹשָׂה קְדוּשָּׁה (לְמִיתָה, כְּסָבוּר מוּתָּר לְהַקְדִּישׁ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה — קָדֵישׁ, גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — לָא קָדֵישׁ) לָמוּת, וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא כְּמַקְדִּישׁ עֵצִים וַאֲבָנִים בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rather, say becomes sanctified to die, And Rabbi Oshaya says: like nothing other than consecrates mere wood and stones,
llm_translation: Rather say: One who performs a sanctification (for death, he holds that it is permissible to sanctify blemished animals in relation to the altar, in relation to redemption — it is sanctified, in relation to consecrated items — it is not sanctified) for the purpose of dying, and Rabbi Oshaia says: It is only like one who sanctifies wood and stones alone.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כָּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ טְרֵפָה, אֵין פּוֹדִין אוֹתָן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִין הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים. טַעְמָא שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ, הָא הָיוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא — פּוֹדִין אוֹתָן! דִּלְמָא הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְגוּפַהּ, לָא נָחֲתָא לַהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: We learned all sacrificial that became tereifa , one may not redeem them because one does not redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs. The reason they became Consequently, they were from the outset, may redeem them. Perhaps this tanna holds anywhere that itself not fit inherent sanctity does not rest upon it
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: All consecrated items that became tereifah, one does not redeem them, because one does not redeem consecrated items to feed them to dogs. The reason is that they became tereifah; if they were originally fit — one would redeem them! Perhaps this Tanna holds: In any case where it is not fitting for its own body, it is not fitting for the sanctity of the body.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַכִּלְאַיִם, וְיוֹצֵא דוֹפֶן, וּטְרֵיפָה, וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין בִּתְמוּרָה, וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Come hear, Rabbi Elazar says: diverse kinds, and a tereifa , and born by caesarean section, and a tumtum and a hermaphrodite not sacred and they do not sanctify And Shmuel says are not sacred with regard to substitution, and do not sanctify to render a substitute
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Elazar says: Kil'ayim, and a hybrid, and a treifah, and a tumtum and an androgynos - they do not sanctify and are not sanctified. And Shmuel said: They do not sanctify through exchange, and one does not sanctify to make an exchange.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵין קְדוֹשִׁין, מֵהֵיכָן מַקְדִּישִׁין? אֶלָּא אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא בְּמַקְדִּישׁ בְּהֵמָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִטְרְפָה, הָא הָיְתָה טְרֵפָה מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא נָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Meir said: But since they do not become sanctified, how can they sanctify Rather, you find only when sanctifies an animal and afterward it becomes a tereifa . This was a tereifa from the outset, inherent sanctity does not rest upon it;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Meir said: And when there are no sacrifices, from where do we sanctify? Rather, you can only find it in one who sanctifies an animal and afterwards it becomes treifah, if it was treifah from the outset — the holiness of the body does not descend upon it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: דִּלְמָא הָךְ תַּנָּא נָמֵי סָבַר כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְגוּפַהּ — לָא נָחֲתָא לַהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: Perhaps this also holds anywhere that is not fit itself inherent sanctity does not rest upon it.
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: perhaps this Tanna, in front of whom everyone is like not seeing his body - did not descend to the holiness of the body.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת.
llm_translation: We will return to you, there are in sacrifices.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ קָדָשִׁים שֶׁוַּולְדוֹתֵיהֶן וּתְמוּרוֹתֵיהֶן כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, וְלַד שְׁלָמִים וּתְמוּרָתָן, וְלָדָן וּוְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם — הֲרֵי הֵן שְׁלָמִים, וּטְעוּנִין סְמִיכָה וּנְסָכִים וּתְנוּפַת חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק.
human_translation: These are the sacrificial their offspring and substitutes like their own The offspring of peace offerings, and their substitute the offspring and the offspring of their offspring, until the end of all time [ ad sof kol ha’olam ]. They are peace offerings, and they require placing hands and libations, and the waving of the breast and the thigh
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the holy offerings whose offspring and substitutions are like them, and the offspring of peace offerings and their substitutions, and the offspring of their offspring, and the offspring of the offspring of their offspring, until the end of all time — they are peace offerings. And they require leaning of hands, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כֵּיוָן דִּתְנָא ״וְלָדָן וּוְלַד וְלָדָן״, ״עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם״ לְמָה לִי? תַּנָּא דִידַן שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמַר ״וְלַד שְׁלָמִים לֹא יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים״, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ תַּנָּא דִידַן: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בִּוְולָדָן דְּלָא מוֹדֵינָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם לָא מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ.
human_translation: Since taught: The offspring and the offspring of their offspring, why do I Until the end of all time? The tanna of our heard that Rabbi Elazar said the offspring of a peace offering is not sacrificed as a peace offering, and the tanna of our said to him: It is not necessary with regard to their offspring that I do not concede but even until the end of time I do not concede to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as it was taught: "And their offspring, and their offspring's offspring," "until the end of all worlds," why do I need it? Our Mishna teaches in accordance with Rabbi Elazar who said, "A peace-offering offspring may not be brought as a peace-offering." And he said to him, our Mishna: We do not require their offspring that we do not admit, but even until the end of the world, we do not admit to you.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זָכָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַוָּלָד.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught “male” to include the offspring
llm_translation: What are these words? For the Rabbis taught: "male" - to include the newborn.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא: וּמָה תְּמוּרָה, שֶׁאֵין גִּידּוּלֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ — קְרֵיבָה, וָלָד, שֶׁגִּידּוּלֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּקְרַב?
human_translation: But not inference: If a substitute which is not grown from consecrated is sacrificed the offspring which is grown from consecrated is it not logical that it be sacrificed
llm_translation: And isn't it so: And what is the exchange, that the consecrated sinews - offering, and offspring, that the consecrated sinews - is it not the law that it should be brought near?

hebrew_text: מָה לִתְמוּרָה, שֶׁכֵּן נוֹהֶגֶת בְּכׇל הַקֳּדָשִׁים, תֹּאמַר בְּוָלָד, שֶׁאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בְּכׇל הַקֳּדָשִׁים? אֵינוֹ קָרֵב הוֹאִיל וְאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בְּכׇל הַקֳּדָשִׁים. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״זָכָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַוָּלָד, ״נְקֵבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת הַתְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: What about a substitute? that applies to all sacrificial Shall you say with regard to the offspring, which does not apply to all sacrificial is not sacrificed since does not apply to all sacrificial the verse states “male” to include the offspring, “female” to include the substitute
llm_translation: What about a substitution, that it is practiced with all the holy things, you might say in the case of a male, that it is not practiced with all the holy things? It is not brought close since it is not practiced with all the holy things. The Talmud teaches "male" - to include the offspring, "female" - to include the substitution.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא תְּמוּרַת תְּמִימִין, וּוְלַד תְּמִימִין, וְלַד בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין וּתְמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִם זָכָר״ לְרַבּוֹת וְלַד בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, ״אִם נְקֵבָה״ לְרַבּוֹת תְּמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין.
human_translation: I have only the substitute of an unblemished and the offspring of an unblemished From where the offspring of blemished and the substitute of blemished The verse states “If male,” to include the offspring of blemished “if female,” to include the substitute of blemished
llm_translation: I have only the exchange of the perfect, and the offspring of the perfect, and the offspring of the blemished, and the exchange of the blemished, from where? The Talmud teaches, "If male" to include the offspring of the blemished, "If female" to include the exchange of the blemished.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבְּתָה תְּמוּרַת תְּמִימִין נִתְרַבְּתָה תְּמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין.
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Abaye: But I reverse stands to reason from the place that the substitute of unblemished is included, the substitute of blemished included,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Abbaye: And what about me! It is logical, from the place where the exchange of perfect animals has increased, the exchange of blemished animals has also increased.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ לֵיפוֹךְ ״אִם זָכָר״ ״אִם נְקֵבָה״? אֲנָא כּוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא קָאָמֵינָא! אֵימָא: ״זָכָר״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַתְּמוּרָה, ״נְקֵבָה״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַוָּלָד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וָלָד״ לְשׁוֹן זָכָר מַשְׁמַע, ״תְּמוּרָה״ לְשׁוֹן נְקֵבָה מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: said to Did I say to you to reverse “if male” “if female”? I said the entire verse Say “male” to include the substitute “female” to include the offspring said to him offspring [ valad ] indicates a masculine form, substitute [ temura ] indicates a feminine form.
llm_translation: He said to him: Who said to you to reverse "if male" "if female"? I am saying the entire verse! Say: "male" to include the substitution, "female" to include the offspring. He said to him: "offspring" implies male, "substitution" implies female.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לִיקְרַב, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: For what halakha Shmuel said: to sacrificing And in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? Shmuel said: To come close, and the heart of Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: דְּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר עוֹלָה, דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ, אֲבָל הָנֵי וְלָדוֹת לָא קָרְבִי — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say when Rabbi Elazar says a burnt offering, that there is burnt offering status as its mother, But these offspring are not sacrificed, teaches us
llm_translation: The text: "D'mahu d'teima: ki ka'amar Rabbi Elazar olah, d'eikha shem olah al imo, aval hanei v'ladot lo karvi - kamashma lan." Translation: "What is the reasoning of the one who says: When Rabbi Elazar said 'olah,' where there is a name of an olah upon its mother, but these and their offspring are not brought near - it is evident to us."

hebrew_text: בַּר פְּדָא אָמַר: לִרְעִיָּה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל. דְּאִתְּמַר: רָבָא אָמַר: לִיקְרַב, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לִרְעִיָּה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Bar Padda said: to grazing As it was stated Rava said to sacrificing and in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, Rav Pappa said to grazing, and in accordance with all
llm_translation: Bar Peda said: for friendship, and not in accordance with the words of everyone. As it was stated: Rava said: for closeness, and not in accordance with the words of Rabbi Elazar. Rav Papa said: for friendship, and not in accordance with the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵהָכָא.
human_translation: But this tanna cites from here:
llm_translation: And this Tanna brings it from here.

hebrew_text: ״רָק קֳדָשֶׁיךָ״ — אֵלּוּ תְּמוּרוֹת, ״אֲשֶׁר יִהְיוּ לָךְ״ — אֵלּוּ הַוְּולָדוֹת, ״תִּשָּׂא וּבָאת״.
human_translation: “Only your holy things,” these are the substitutes; “that you have,” these are the offspring. “You shall take and go
llm_translation: "Only your holy ones" - these are exchanges, "which shall be yours" - these are the offspring, "you shall lift up and come."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַכְנִיסֶנּוּ לְבֵית הַבְּחִירָה, וְיִמְנַע מֵהֶם מַיִם וּמָזוֹן כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּמוּתוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ עוֹלוֹתֶיךָ הַבָּשָׂר וְהַדָּם״, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹהֵג בְּעוֹלָה — אַתָּה נוֹהֵג בִּתְמוּרָה, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹהֵג בִּשְׁלָמִים — אַתָּה נוֹהֵג בְּוַולְדֵי שְׁלָמִים וּבִתְמוּרָה.
human_translation: might one should bring them into the Temple but withhold water and food from them so that they die. the verse states: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, in the manner that you treat a burnt offering, you should treat the substitute in the manner that you treat a peace offering, you should treat the offspring of a peace offering and the substitute
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible to bring him into the Beit HaB'chirah, and withhold from them water and food so that they die? The Torah teaches: "And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood," just as you are accustomed with the burnt offering - you are accustomed with substitution, just as you are accustomed with peace offerings - you are accustomed with the offspring of peace offerings and substitution. English translation:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל כׇּל קָדָשִׁים כֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״רַק״ — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אָשָׁם הוּא אָשֹׁם אָשַׁם לַה׳״ — הוּא קָרֵב, וְאֵין תְּמוּרָתוֹ קְרֵיבָה.
human_translation: might this all sacrificial the verse states: “Only the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: is unnecessary, it states “It is a guilt offering; he is certainly guilty before the Lord” it, is sacrificed but its substitute is not sacrificed.
llm_translation: "Is it possible for all holy things to be so? The Torah teaches 'only' - the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, for he said, 'It is a guilt offering, a guilt offering to the Lord' - it is brought, and its exchange is not brought."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״תִּשָּׂא וּבָאת״, יָכוֹל יַכְנִיסֶנּוּ לְבֵית הַבְּחִירָה?
human_translation: The Master said “You shall take and go,” might one should bring into the Temple
llm_translation: Master said: "You shall lift up and come," can one say that he may bring it into the Temple?

hebrew_text: מְנָא תֵּיתֵי הָא? כֵּיוָן דְּגָמְרִי חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת, הָנָךְ מִקְרָב קָרְבִי!
human_translation: From where this derived, Since five sin offering is learned these are sacrificed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Where is he? Once he has completed five sin-offerings, let him come close to my proximity!"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וְהָנָךְ יָמוּתוּ בְּבֵית הַבְּחִירָה — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say five sin offerings die in any location, but these, die in the Temple. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Five sins incur the penalty of death everywhere, and these are to be executed by the court - this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל אַף כָּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים כֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״רַק קָדָשֶׁיךָ״. וָלָד דְּמַאן? אִי דְּעוֹלָה — זָכָר הוּא, וְלָאו בַּר אוֹלוֹדֵי הוּא! וְאִי דְּחַטָּאת — גְּמִירִי לַהּ דִּלְמִיתָה קָיְימִי!
human_translation: The master said might this even all sacrificial the verse states: “Only your holy things,” The offspring of which If of a burnt offering, is male, and is not capable of giving birth. And if of a sin offering, is learned that left to die.
llm_translation: Master said: Can all the holy things also be redeemed in this way? Scripture states "only your holy things." And a child, whose status is he? If he is from the world above, he is male, and if not, he is from the world below! And if it is regarding a sin offering, we learn from it that perhaps it is still standing!

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאָשָׁם — גְּמִירִי לַהּ דְּלִרְעִיָּיה אָזְלָא, דְּכֹל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת מֵתָה בָּאָשָׁם רוֹעֶה. לְעוֹלָם בְּחַטָּאת, וְהִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ לְמִיתָה, וּקְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי לְהַקְרָבָה.
human_translation: if to a guilt offering, is learned that goes to graze, as any where a sin offering die, in a guilt offering, graze to a burnt offering. Actually, to a sin offering, and halakha was learned with regard to die, and the verse to exclude from being sacrificed
llm_translation: If it is an Asham - it is certain for her that she went to the wrong, for all that in a sin-offering dies, in an Asham she grazes. Forever in a sin-offering, and the teaching is certain for her for death, and the verse is for the few to bring near.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בְּהָא תַּלְיָא, כֵּיוָן דִּלְמִיתָה אָזְלָא — מִמֵּילָא לָא קָרְבָה! אֶלָּא הִלְכְתָא לְחַטָּאת, וְקָרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי תְּמוּרַת אָשָׁם.
human_translation: But this, depends on that, Since it goes to its death, self-evident it is not sacrificed. Rather, the halakha to a sin offering, and the verse to exclude a substitute of a guilt offering.
llm_translation: And this is dependent on that, since if she went out — she did not come close by herself! Rather, it is a halacha for a sin-offering, and the verse is for the exclusions of the substitute of a guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, דְּאָמְרִי: כֹּל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת מֵתָה, בָּאָשָׁם רוֹעֶה. אֶלָּא קְרָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, דְּאִי עָבַר וּמַקְרֵיב — קָאֵי בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: this halakha was also learned as they said any where a sin offering die, in a guilt offering, graze. Rather, the verse is necessary that if one transgressed and sacrificed he stands of a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: The Gemara raises a dilemma: for they say, "Anyone who brings a sin offering is liable to bring a guilt offering." Rather, a verse is needed to teach it, for if one transgresses and brings the offering, he fulfills the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ כּוּ׳. הוּא קָרֵב וְאֵין תְּמוּרָתוֹ קְרֵיבָה. לְמָה לִי קְרָא, וְהָא הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לָהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says is unnecessary it, is sacrificed, but its substitute is not offered. Why do I a verse Didn’t learn this halakha ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: He does not need it. He is close and his substitute is not close. Why do I need a verse, and this is a tradition that we have learned!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא קְרָא לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אָשָׁם שֶׁנִּיתַּק לִרְעִיָּיה וּשְׁחָטוֹ סְתָם — כָּשֵׁר לְשֵׁם עוֹלָה.
human_translation: Yes, is indeed so, Rather, why do I the verse? It is necessary to that Rav Huna as Rav Huna said: a guilt offering that was consigned to grazing, and slaughtered it an unspecified it is valid for the sake of a burnt offering.
llm_translation: So it is not so, rather, why do I need it? He asked it according to Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: A guilt-offering that was detached for its fellow and slaughtered without specific intent — it is valid for the purpose of a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: נִיתַּק — אִין, לֹא נִיתַּק — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? הוּא — בַּהֲוָויָיתוֹ יְהֵא.
human_translation: consigned yes, not consigned no, What is the reason? “It is it shall remain in its present
llm_translation: נִיתַּק — cut off, אִין — no, לֹא נִיתַּק — not cut off, לָא — no. מַאי טַעְמָא? what is the reason? הוּא — it, בַּהֲוָויָיתוֹ — in its existence, יְהֵא — shall be.

hebrew_text: וּלְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָא יָלֵיף מֵהָנֵי קְרָאֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לִי מִ״זָּכָר״ וּ״נְקֵבָה״? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִוְלַד בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, וְלִתְמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין.
human_translation: And according to this tanna who derives from these verses: let him derive from “male” and “female.” He requires that to offspring of a blemished to the substitute of a blemished
llm_translation: And for this Mishna that deduces from those verses, should it come out to me from "male" and "female"? That one requires it for offspring with blemishes, and as an exchange for offspring with blemishes.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי כּוּלְּהוּ מֵהַאי קְרָא? ״אִם״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And him derive all of from this verse: He does not learn “if,”
llm_translation: And let all of them come out to me from this verse? "If" does not imply to it.

hebrew_text: וּלְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״זָּכָר״ ״אִם נְקֵבָה״, תִּשָּׂא וּבָאתָ מָה עָבֵיד לְהוּ! אֲפִילּוּ מִמִּירְעַיְיהוּ. לִישָּׁנָא אַחְרִינָא: מִמּוֹרִגַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And according to this tanna who derives from male if female,” what does he do with “You shall take and go”? even from their grazing, Another version from their threshing,
llm_translation: And to this Mishna that emerged to him from "male" "or female," you shall accept and come, what does he do for them! Even from their enemies. To another teaching: from their creditors.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: וְלַד שְׁלָמִים לֹא יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִקְרַב.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The offspring of a peace offering is not sacrificed a peace offering; And the Rabbis say: It is sacrificed
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says: "A firstborn animal designated for peace offerings may not be brought as a peace offering." And the Sages say: "It may be brought."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ עַל וְלַד וְלַד שְׁלָמִים, וְעַל וְלַד וְלַד תְּמוּרָה שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרַב. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ? עַל הַוָּלָד, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִקְרַב, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִקְרַב.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: do not disagree of the offspring of the offspring of a peace offering or of the offspring of the offspring of the substitute that is not sacrificed With regard to what do they disagree? of the offspring Rabbi Eliezer says: It is not sacrificed whereas the Rabbis say: It is sacrificed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: They did not dispute regarding a complete offspring, and regarding a surrogate offspring that it should not draw near. What did they dispute about? Regarding the actual offspring. Rabbi Eliezer says: It should not draw near, and the Sages say: It should draw near.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס עַל וְלַד שְׁלָמִים שֶׁיִּקְרַב שְׁלָמִים. אָמַר רַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס: אֲנִי מֵעִיד שֶׁהָיְתָה לָנוּ פָּרָה שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים, וַאֲכַלְנוּהָ בַּפֶּסַח, וְאָכַלְנוּ וְלָדָהּ שְׁלָמִים בֶּחָג.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Pappeyas testified about the offspring of a peace offering that it is sacrificed a peace offering. Rabbi Pappeyas said: I testify that we had a cow a peace offering, and we ate it on Passover, and we ate its offspring a peace offering on Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Pappayas testified concerning a firstborn animal designated for peace offerings. Rabbi Pappayas said: I testify that we had a cow designated for peace offerings, and we ate it on Passover, and we ate its offspring as peace offerings on the festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? אֲמַר קְרָא ״וְאִם זֶבַח שְׁלָמִים קׇרְבָּנוֹ לַה׳״, וְאֵם — וְלֹא וָלָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, the verse states “And if his offering be a sacrifice of peace offerings for the Lord” “and if [ ve’im ],” but not the offspring.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Amei said Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? He said a verse "And if it is a peace offering sacrifice to the Lord", and 'if' — and not 'and'.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״אִם עַל תּוֹדָה יַקְרִיבֶנּוּ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאֵם וְלֹא וָלָד? וְכִי תֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: וְלָדָהּ, וּתְמוּרָתָהּ, וְחִילּוּפֶיהָ — מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִם עַל תּוֹדָה״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Ami: If that is so, “If [ im ] he offer it for a thanksgiving” so too that the mother [ em ] but not the offspring And if you would say indeed isn’t it taught the offspring and its substitute and its replacement, From where The verse states: “If for a thanksgiving,” in any case.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba to Rabbi Ami: Rather, from now on, "if he shall offer it for a thanksgiving offering," is it thus said, that it is for the mother and not for the offspring? And if you would say it is thus said, but it was taught: its offspring, its exchange, and its replacement — from where? The Talmud teaches to say "if he shall offer it for a thanksgiving offering" — from every place.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְגַדֵּל מֵהֶם עֲדָרִים עֲדָרִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, decree lest raise herds from them
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, a decree lest they grow in flocks, flock by flock.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: do not disgree
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: They did not argue.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי תָּנֵי? ״לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרְבוּ, אֶלָּא יִקְרְבוּ״, אוֹ דִילְמָא: ״לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ, אֶלָּא לֹא יִקְרְבוּ״?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before How is taught? do not disagree they are not sacrificed, rather sacrificed? Or perhaps they do not disagree are sacrificed rather not sacrificed.
llm_translation: He asked them: How should it be taught? "They did not dispute that they should not come close, rather they should come close," or perhaps: "They did not dispute that they should come close, rather they should not come close"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מִסְתַּבְּרָא ״לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרְבוּ, אֶלָּא יִקְרְבוּ״. מַאי טַעְמָא? עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבָּנַן אֶלָּא בְּוָלָד, אֲבָל וְלַד וָלָד — אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rabba said: stands to reason they do not disagree whether are not sacrificed, rather sacrificed. What is the reason? Rabbi Eliezer disagrees with the Rabbis only with regard to the offspring, but offspring of the offspring, it is merely a chance,
llm_translation: Rabba said: It is logical that "they did not dispute that they should not come close, but they should come close." What is the reason? Up to this point, Rabbi Eliezer did not argue with the Rabbis except regarding a fetus, but regarding a child and a child's child - it is a general principle.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: ״לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ, אֶלָּא לֹא יִקְרְבוּ״. מַאי טַעְמָא? עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אֶלָּא בְּוָלָד, אֲבָל וְלַד וָלָד — מִתּוֹךְ (מַעֲשֶׂיהָ) [מַעֲשָׂיו] נִיכֶּרֶת מַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ דִּלְגַדֵּל קָא בָעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says They do not disagree whether are sacrificed, rather are not sacrificed. What is the reason? the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer only with regard to the offspring, but offspring of the offspring, from actions it, his intention is evident that he wants to raise it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: "They did not dispute that they should come close, rather they should not come close." What is the reason? Until here the Rabbis did not argue with regard to Rabbi Eliezer, except in the case of a fetus, but with regard to a fetus within a fetus, his intention is discerned from his actions that he seeks to grow it.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְסַיּוֹעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: ״אִם כֶּשֶׂב הוּא מַקְרִיב״ — וָלָד רִאשׁוֹן קָרֵב, וָלָד שֵׁנִי אֵינוֹ קָרֵב.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches to support of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, “If he sacrifices a lamb the first offspring, is sacrificed, the second offspring, is not sacrificed.
llm_translation: Rebbe Chiya taught to assist Rebbe Yehoshua ben Levi: "If it is a lamb, he brings the firstborn, but the secondborn he does not bring."

hebrew_text: הוּא — קָרֵב, וְאֵין וְלַד כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים קָרֵב.
human_translation: “he [ hu ]” is sacrificed, but the offspring of all sacrificial is not sacrificed.
llm_translation: He - close, and no and offspring all the holy offerings close.

hebrew_text: וָלָד דְּמַאי? אִי דְּעוֹלָה וְאָשָׁם — זְכָרִים הֵם, וְלָא בְּנֵי וָלָד הֵם. אִי דְּחַטָּאת — הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ דִּלְמִיתָה אָזְלָא.
human_translation: The offspring of which If of a burnt offering or guilt offering, they are male and not capable of offspring. If of a sin offering, learned this halakha that it is left to die
llm_translation: "And a child of Demai? If it is from a burnt offering or guilt offering - they are males, and not children of Demai. If it is from a sin offering - the Gemara concluded that it went to the place where it was taken."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי וְלַד הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת, וְלַד הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת לְמָה לִי קְרָא? ״עֲבָרָה״ ״עֲבָרָה״ מִבְּכוֹר קָא גָמַר לַהּ!
human_translation: Ravina said: to include, the offspring of tithe Why do I a verse the offspring of tithe? It is derived through passing [ avara ] passing [ avara ] a firstborn
llm_translation: Ravina said: For the redemption of the firstborn and for the redemption of the rich woman's son. And why do I need the verse for the redemption of the rich woman's son? "Transgression, transgression," it is concluded for him from the firstborn!

hebrew_text: אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֲמִינָא: אֵין דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: necessary, enter your mind to say one does not derive the possible from the impossible, teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: we do not judge "perhaps it is possible" from "perhaps it is possible," as it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Pappeyas testified
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Pappayas testified: "Thus."

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא דְּאָמַר: קָדָשִׁים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶם רֶגֶל אֶחָד, כָּל יוֹם וָיוֹם עוֹבֵר עֲלֵיהֶם בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״, מֵעֲצֶרֶת בָּעֵי מֵיכְלֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֶה בַּעֲצֶרֶת.
human_translation: And according to Rava, who said sacrificial once one pilgrimage Festival has passed each day he transgresses with regard to them of: You shall not delay, from Shavuot he must eat Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: for example, was ill on Shavuot ba’Atzeret .
llm_translation: And for Rava who said: "Holy things," once one has transgressed upon them with one foot, every day he transgresses upon them with "do not delay," the Festival requires from his sustenance! Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: For example, if he was sick on the Festival.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַאי ״חַג״ נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי? — חַג שָׁבוּעוֹת. וְאִידַּךְ, כֹּל הֵיכִי דְּקָתָנֵי ״פֶּסַח״ תָּנֵי ״עֲצֶרֶת״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said What ḥag that is taught the festival of Shavuot , And the other Wherever teaches Pesaḥ he teach atzeret
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is the meaning of "Chag" that is specifically stated? — The Festival of Weeks. And the other festival, in any way that it is stated "Pesach," it teaches "Shavuot."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אַסְהָדוּתֵיהּ? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר ״וְלַד שְׁלָמִים לֹא יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים״, קָמַסְהֵיד הוּא דְּקָרֵב.
human_translation: If so, what the testimony to exclude of Rabbi Eliezer, who said the offspring of a peace offering is not sacrificed as a peace offering. testifies that is sacrificed
llm_translation: If so, what is its testimony? To go out from Rabbi Eliezer, who said, "And a child of peace shall not bring peace offerings," he testified that he brought.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְלַד תּוֹדָה וּתְמוּרָתָהּ, וְלָדָן וְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּתוֹדָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁאֵין טְעוּנִין לֶחֶם.
human_translation: The offspring of a thanks offering and the substitute the offspring and the offspring of their offspring until the end of all time, they are like thanks offerings, only that they do not require loaves,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A Thanksgiving offering and its exchange, and a Laden offering, and a Lad and a Laden offering until the end of all generations - these are like a Thanksgiving offering, except that they do not require bread."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַהוּ אוֹמֵר ״יַקְרִיבֶנּוּ״?
human_translation: From where is this matter As the Sages taught What “offer it [ yakrivenu ]” say?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of these words? The Rabbis taught: What does it mean when it says, "He shall bring it near"?

hebrew_text: מַפְרִישׁ תּוֹדָה, וְאָבְדָה, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וְנִמְצֵאת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַהֲרֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹמְדוֹת. מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵיזוֹ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יַקְרִיב וְלַחְמָהּ עִמָּהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תּוֹדָה יַקְרִיב״.
human_translation: designates a thanks offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its place, and the first was found, and both of them stand before him From where that he may sacrifice whichever he wants and its loaves with it? The verse states: “He offers a thanks offering,”
llm_translation: He separates a thanksgiving offering, and it got lost, and he separated another one beneath it, and the first one is found, and behold, both of them stand. From where do we know that whichever one he wants, he may bring it with its bread? The Talmud teaches: "He shall bring the thanksgiving offering."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל תְּהֵא שְׁנִיָּה טְעוּנָה לֶחֶם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יַקְרִיבֶנּוּ״ — אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת וְלָדוֹת תְּמוּרוֹת וַחֲלִיפוֹת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְאִם עַל תּוֹדָה״. יָכוֹל יְהוּ כּוּלָּן טְעוּנוֹת לֶחֶם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַל זֶבַח הַתּוֹדָה״ — תּוֹדָה טְעוּנָה לֶחֶם, וְלֹא וְלָדָהּ וּתְמוּרָתָהּ וַחֲלִיפָתָהּ טְעוּנָה לֶחֶם.
human_translation: might the second should require loaves. the verse states: “Offer it,” one and not two. From where the offspring, substitutes, and replacement included The verse states: “And if…as a thanksgiving,” might all of them require loaves. the verse states: “With the sacrifice of thanksgiving,” the thanks offering requires loaves, but its offspring and its substitute and its replacement do not require loaves.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Could a second be obligatory for bread? The Torah says "he shall offer it" - one and not two. How do we know to include substitutes and exchanges? The Torah says "and if it is for a thanksgiving offering." Could they all be obligatory for bread? The Torah says "for a thanksgiving offering" - a thanksgiving offering is obligatory for bread, not its offspring, substitute, or exchange, which are not obligatory for bread.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תְּמוּרַת עוֹלָה, וְלַד תְּמוּרָה, וְלַד וְלַד וְלָדָהּ עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּעוֹלָה, וּטְעוּנִין הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ וְכָלִיל לָאִשִּׁים. הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה וְיָלְדָה זָכָר — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו עוֹלָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב עוֹלָה.
human_translation: the substitute of a burnt offering, the offspring of the substitute, the offspring of the offspring of its offspring until the end of all time, they are like burnt offerings and they require flaying and cutting and completely in the fire. one who designates a female as a burnt offering, and gave birth to a male, it graze until it becomes unfit [ sheyista’ev ] and it is sold, and he brings a burnt offering with money its Rabbi Elazar says: itself is sacrificed as a burnt offering.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The exchange for a burnt offering, and the exchange for a guilt offering, and the exchange for a guilt offering, and the exchange for the exchange, until the end of the world - these are like burnt offerings, and they require skinning, flaying, and complete burning. One who designates a female animal for a burnt offering and it gives birth to a male - he should let it graze until it develops a blemish and then sell it, and bring with its value a burnt offering. Rabbi Elazar says: The animal itself should be brought as a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא פְּלִיגִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דִּפְלִיגִי?
human_translation: What is different the first clause that they do not disagree, and what is different the latter clause that they disagree?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between the beginning where they do not argue, and the end where they do argue?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חַנָּה: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא פְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי מַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה, דְּאִימֵּיהּ לָא קְרֵיבָה, אֲבָל תְּמוּרָה דְּאִימֵּיהּ נָמֵי קְרֵיבָה — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: taught as dispute and is Rabbi Elazar. And Rava said: You even say the Rabbis, disagree with Rabbi Elazar only with regard to designates a female for a burnt offering, because its mother may not be sacrificed. But a substitute, since its mother, may also be sacrificed, even the Rabbis concede
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: In a dispute that is repeated, and it is Rabbi Elazar. And Rava said: Even if you say the Rabbis, until here they do not argue on it of Rabbi Elazar, except regarding separating a female for a burnt offering, her mother does not bring her, but a substitute for her mother also brings her - even the Rabbis agree.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר יִקְרַב עוֹלָה הוּא עַצְמוֹ? וּרְמִינְהוּ: תְּמוּרַת אָשָׁם, וְלַד תְּמוּרָה, וְלָדָן, וְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם — יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar say offspring itself is sacrificed as a burnt offering? But raise a contradiction The substitute of a guilt offering, the offspring of that substitute, their offspring the offspring of their offspring, until the end of all time, graze until they become unfit, and then is sold, and money is allocated for gift offerings.
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Elazar himself should bring the burnt offering? And they raised an objection: The exchange of a guilt offering, and for a child an exchange, and for a fetus, and for a child and a fetus until the end of the world - they shall graze until they become blemished, and then be sold, and their value shall be given as a donation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָמוּתוּ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹלָה. בַּדָּמִים — אִין, הוּא עַצְמוֹ — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: they die. Rabbi Elazar says: bring burnt offering with money its with money yes, itself, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: They shall die. Rabbi Elazar says: Let them bring a burnt offering with their money. With the blood - no, he himself - yes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ, לְדִידִי סְבִירָא לִי דַּאֲפִילּוּ וָלָד נָמֵי קָרֵב עוֹלָה, לְדִידְכוּ דְּאָמְרִיתוּ רוֹעֶה — אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת דְּמוֹתָרוֹת לְנִדְבַת יָחִיד אָזְלִי, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מוֹתָרוֹת לְנִדְבַת צִיבּוּר אָזְלִי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Elazar was speaking to them in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis, According to me, I hold that even the offspring is also sacrificed a burnt offering. according to you, who say graze concede to me at least that the remainder goes for individual gift And said to him the remainder goes for communal gift
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: With regard to the words of the Sages, Rabbi Elazar is saying to them, according to my opinion, it seems to me that even if a child is brought near the burnt offering, according to your opinion that you stated, a shepherd — I would go to him from where the leftovers for an individual donation go, and they say to him: the leftovers for a communal donation go there.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: עַד כַּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב עוֹלָה, אֶלָּא בְּמַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה, דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ,
human_translation: Rava said Rabbi Elazar says itself is offered a burnt offering only where he designated a female as a burnt offering since there is burnt offering status its mother.
llm_translation: Rava said: Until here, Rabbi Elazar did not say that the offering itself should be brought close, rather, with regard to separating a female for an offering, for there is the name of the offering upon its mother.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרַת וְלַד אָשָׁם, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ, מוֹדֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דִּבְדָמָיו אִין הוּא עַצְמוֹ לָא קָרֵב.
human_translation: But with regard to the offspring of the substitute of a guilt offering, where there is no burnt offering status for its mother, Rabbi Elazar concedes that with its money, yes, itself is not sacrificed
llm_translation: Regarding a substitution offering and a guilt offering, where there is no mention of the mother's elevation offering, the sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer that in the case of its blood, it does not render itself invalid.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכִי בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְפִסְחוֹ — תִּרְעֶה עַד (שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב) [שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב], וְתִמָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ פֶּסַח. יָלְדָה — יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection And does Rabbi Elazar require that there be burnt offering status for its mother, But isn’t it taught one who designates a female for his Paschal offering, graze until it becomes unfit, and it is sold and he brings a Paschal offering with money its gave birth it graze until it becomes unfit, and it is sold and he brings a Paschal offering with money its
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Does Rabbi Elazar require the name of the burnt offering to be upon his mother? But it was taught in a Baraita: One who designates a female animal for his Passover offering—she shall graze until she becomes blemished, then be sold, and he shall bring a Passover offering with its value. If she gives birth—a male shall graze until he becomes blemished, then be sold, and he shall bring a Passover offering with its value.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה אַחַר הַפֶּסַח, תִּרְעֶה עַד (שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב) [שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב], וְיָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ שְׁלָמִים. יָלְדָה, יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו שְׁלָמִים. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: remained after Passover, it graze until it becomes unfit, and he brings a peace offering with money its it gave birth graze until it becomes unfit, and it is sold, and he brings a peace offering with money its Rabbi Elazar says: itself is sacrificed as a peace offering.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If a female animal gives birth after the Passover, it shall graze until it becomes fit, and one shall bring it as a peace offering with its blood. If it gives birth, it shall graze until it becomes fit, then it shall be sold, and one shall bring its blood as a peace offering. Rabbi Elazar says: It itself shall be brought as a peace offering."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם שְׁלָמִים עַל אִמּוֹ, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר יִקְרַב שְׁלָמִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ (רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר) [רָבָא]: ״אַחַר הַפֶּסַח״ קָא אָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי אַחַר הַפֶּסַח, דְּמוֹתַר פֶּסַח גּוּפֵיהּ קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: But here, where there is no peace offering status for its mother, and Rabbi Elazar says is sacrificed a peace offering. said to Do you say Rabbi Elazar after Passover after Passover is different, as a leftover Paschal offering itself is sacrificed as a peace offering.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, where there is no name of peace-offerings upon its mother, and Rabbi Elazar said, 'Let peace-offerings be brought near.' Rava said to him, 'After the Passover' are you saying? It is different after the Passover, for the Passover itself permits peace-offerings to be brought near."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נִיפְלוֹג נָמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: If so, let also disagree in the first clause said to Yes, is indeed so, and they disagree
llm_translation: Thusly, they disagreed at the outset! He said to him: "It is not thusly at the outset, but rather they disagreed."
