hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לָא פְּלִיג מִידֵּי, דִּגְמִירִי לִמְקוֹם שֶׁהַמּוֹתָר הוֹלֵךְ — הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ; לְאַחַר הַפֶּסַח, דְּמוֹתָר קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים — וָלָד נָמֵי קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: nobody disagrees; As is learned to the place that the leftover goes, the offspring goes after Passover, when the leftover is sacrificed a peace offering, the offspring is also sacrificed as a peace offering.
llm_translation: Abaye said: He does not argue from his own reasoning, for we have learned in a place where it is permitted for the mother to go, the offspring may go; after Passover, when it is permitted to bring peace offerings, the offspring of peace offerings may be brought.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח, אִימֵּיהּ לְמַאי אַקְדְּשַׁהּ? לִדְמֵי פֶסַח, וָלָד נָמֵי לִדְמֵי פֶסַח.
human_translation: But before Passover, what is the mother consecrated? for the value of a Paschal offering, the offspring as well for the value of a Paschal offering.
llm_translation: Before Pesach, what should she sanctify it for? For Pesach, and for the offspring before the offspring.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן מִדְּאִימֵּיהּ לִדְמֵי, וָלָד נָמֵי לִדְמֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לַפֶּסַח — הִיא וּוַלְדוֹתֶיהָ יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶם פֶּסַח. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama raises an objection And do we say that as its mother for the value of the offspring as well for the value of But isn’t it taught One who designates a female as a Paschal offering, it and its offspring graze until they become unfit, and they are sold, and he brings a Paschal offering with money their Rabbi Elazar says: itself is sacrificed a Paschal offering.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ukva bar Chama asks: Do we say that the mother sets aside money for the redemption of her firstborn son, and the son himself sets aside money for his own redemption? But it was taught in a Baraita: One who designates a female animal for the Paschal offering—both it and its offspring must graze until they develop a blemish, then they are to be sold, and the proceeds used to purchase a Paschal offering. Rabbi Elazar says: The animal itself should be brought as the Paschal offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּאִימֵּיהּ לִדְמֵי, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ קָרֵב פֶּסַח, וְלָא מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ בְּאִימֵּיהּ!
human_translation: But here where its mother for the value of and Rabbi Elazar said itself is sacrificed as a Paschal offering, and we do not establish of the mother.
llm_translation: And here, that his mother is similar, and Rabbi Elazar said: He himself should offer the Passover sacrifice, and we do not establish it for him through his mother!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: בְּמַפְרִישׁ בְּהֵמָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת עָסְקִינַן, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: אִם שִׁיְּירוֹ מְשׁוּיָּיר, דְּעוּבָּר לָאו יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא, וְאִמּוֹ הִיא דְּלָא קָדְשָׁה קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, אֲבָל הִיא קָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: Ravina says: we are dealing with who designates a pregnant animal, Rabbi Elazar holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said if he left it out, left out that a fetus is not the thigh of its mother, its mother that is not sanctified with the inherent sanctity But is consecrated
llm_translation: Ravina said: When dealing with a pregnant animal, we are dealing with a fetus. Rabbi Elazar holds like Rabbi Yochanan, who said: If it is left as leftovers, it is considered a leftover, but a fetus is not considered a thigh of its mother, and its mother is not sanctified with the sanctity of the body, but it is sanctified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּבִבְהֵמָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת עָסְקִינַן, מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״הִיא וּוַלְדוֹתֶיהָ״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: This, too, stands to reason, that we are dealing with a pregnant animal, from that teaches: It and its offspring. Conclude from here
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Zutra, son of the Master Mari, to Ravina: Thus it is fitting that we are dealing with a pregnant animal, as it is taught, "She and her offspring," infer from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּמַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם דְּאֵין בְּנָהּ קָרֵב אָשָׁם. פְּשִׁיטָא! עַד כַּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא בְּמַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה, דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי מַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם אָשָׁם עַל אִמּוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מוֹדֶה דְּלֹא קָרֵב אָשָׁם!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: And Rabbi Elazar concedes where designates a female for a guilt offering, that its offspring is not sacrificed a guilt offering. obvious? Rabbi Elazar states only if designates a female for a burnt offering that there is burnt offering status its mother. But with regard to designates a female as a guilt offering, where there is no guilt offering status for its mother, even Rabbi Elazar concedes that is not sacrificed a guilt offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: And Rabbi Elazar concedes regarding separating a female for a guilt-offering that her son does not bring the guilt-offering. It is obvious! Until here Rabbi Elazar did not say, except regarding separating a female for a burnt-offering, for there is a name of a burnt-offering upon its mother, but regarding separating a female for a guilt-offering, for there is no name of a guilt-offering upon its mother — even Rabbi Elazar concedes that the guilt-offering is not brought!

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו דְּאַשְׁמְעִינַן, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּשֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזֵי וָלָד לְהַקְרָבָה, וְהַאי נָמֵי הָא חֲזֵי לְהַקְרָבָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: if not informed us I would say the reason of Rabbi Elazar, is not due to that burnt offering status as its mother; rather because the offspring is fit as an offering, and this too, is fit as an offering, teaches us
llm_translation: If we do not hear, I would say the reason of Rabbi Elazar is not because the name of the burnt offering is upon its mother, but because he sees the offspring for bringing near, and this one also sees for bringing near, it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַדְּמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאֵין בְּנָהּ קָרֵב אָשָׁם, נַישְׁמְעִינַן דְּאֵין בְּנָהּ קָרֵב עוֹלָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְאָשָׁם!
human_translation: If so, Rather than teach us that the offspring is not sacrificed a guilt offering, let him teach us that its offspring is not sacrificed a burnt offering, And the same is true as a guilt offering.
llm_translation: So it is, we hear that if her son is not close to an Asham offering, we infer that if her son is not close to an Olah offering, and it is the same for an Asham!

hebrew_text: אִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן עוֹלָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עוֹלָה הוּא דְּלָא קָרְבָה, דְּלָא אַקְדְּשַׁהּ לְאִמַּהּ (קְדוּשָּׁה עוּבָּרָהּ) [קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָה], אֲבָל אָשָׁם — [כֵּיוָן דְּאַקְדְּשַׁהּ לְאִימֵּיהּ לְאָשָׁם] — אֵימָא: וָלָד קָרֵב אָשָׁם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If he would teach us a burnt offering, I would say a burnt offering that is not sacrificed, because he did not consecrate the mother sanctity the fetus But a guilt offering, say the offspring is sacrificed as a guilt offering. teaches us
llm_translation: If you would say "an Olah," I would say: An Olah is one that has not been brought, that has not been sanctified for its mother (its sanctity has passed). But an Asham — since it has been sanctified for its mother for an Asham — I would say: a child brings an Asham, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם, תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב, וְתִימָּכֵר, וְיָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ אָשָׁם. וְאִם קָרַב אֲשָׁמוֹ, יִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: one who designates a female for a guilt offering, it graze until it becomes blemished and it is sold, and he brings a guilt offering with money its And if his guilt offering was sacrificed, money is allocated for gift offerings.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who designates a female animal for guilt-offering, it shall graze until it becomes blemished, and then it shall be sold, and he shall bring an offering of guilt with its blood. And if its guilt-offering became disqualified, its blood shall be poured out as a donation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תִּימָּכֵר שֶׁלֹּא בְּמוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: it may be sold without a blemish,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "It shall be sold without a blemish."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּלְמָה לִי תִּסְתָּאֵב? תִּימָּכֵר! כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְמִילְּתָא — הַיְינוּ מוּמָא!
human_translation: And why do I becomes blemished Let it be sold Since it is unfit for the matter this is a blemish.
llm_translation: Gemara: "And why should I desire it? Let it be sold! Since one does not see the matter - that is a blemish!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: הַיְינוּ טַעַם דְּאָמְרִינַן, מִיגּוֹ דְּנָחֲתָא לַהּ קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים — נָחֲתָא נָמֵי קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף. אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, הִקְדִּישׁ זָכָר לְדָמָיו — קָדוֹשׁ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the reason for we say as sanctity value has descended on it, inherent sanctity has descended on it as well. Rava says: That is to say consecrated a male the money its sanctified inherent sanctity.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is the reason we say, from the aspect of the blood's resting - it is similar to the sanctity of the body. Rava said: This means, if one consecrated a male for his blood - he is holy with the holiness of the body.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הִקְדִּישׁ זָכָר לְדָמָיו, רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: קָדוֹשׁ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, רָבָא אָמַר: אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף. וַהֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא לִדְרַב כָּהֲנָא, מִדְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב.
human_translation: was stated consecrated a male money its Rav Kahana says sanctified inherent sanctity, Rava says is not sanctified inherent sanctity. But Rava retracted of Rav Kahana, due to Rav Yehuda Rav said,
llm_translation: It was stated: One who consecrates a male for his value. Rav Kahana said: "He is holy, the holiness of the body." Rava said: "He is not holy, the holiness of the body." Rava then returned to Rav Kahana, from Rav Yehuda who said in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תִּימָּכֵר שֶׁלֹּא בְּמוּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִיגּוֹ דְּנָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, תֵּיחוֹת לֵיהּ נָמֵי קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says may be sold without a blemish, Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: as sanctity value has descended on it, inherent sanctity should descend on it as well,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "It shall be sold without a blemish." Rav Chiya bar Avin said to Rabbi Yochanan: "Because the sanctity of blood is placed below the sanctity of the body!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: כֹּל מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ — לָא נָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, דְּתַנְיָא: אָשָׁם בֶּן שָׁנָה וֶהֱבִיאוֹ בֶּן שְׁתַּיִם, בֶּן שְׁתַּיִם וֶהֱבִיאוֹ בֶּן שָׁנָה — כְּשֵׁירָה, וְלֹא עָלוּ לַבְּעָלִים לְשֵׁם חוֹבָה.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he says anything that is not fit itself inherent sanctity does not descend upon it. As it is taught a guilt offering in its year, but brought it in its second in its second and brought it in its year, is fit, but it does not satisfy the obligation of the owner
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Shimon, according to his reasoning, as he said: Anything that is not fitting for itself - the holiness of the body does not rest upon it, as it is taught: If one brought a guilt-offering of a one-year-old and then brought one of two years, or brought one of two years and then brought one of one year - they are fit, but they do not fulfill the obligation for the owners.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עַצְמָן אֵינָן קְדוֹשִׁין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says themselves are not consecrated,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: all bones not holy.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, דְּלָא חֲזֵי, וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּקָדוֹשׁ, שָׁאנֵי מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, דַּחֲזֵי לִמְחַר.
human_translation: But whose time has not yet which is unfit and Rabbi Shimon said that it is sanctified whose time has not yet is different, as it is fit tomorrow,
llm_translation: Behold, it is lacking time, for it is not seen, and Rabbi Shimon the Holy said, "This is considered lacking time, for it is seen tomorrow."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אָשָׁם בֶּן שְׁתַּיִם וֶהֱבִיאוֹ בֶּן שָׁנָה, הָא חֲזֵי לְשָׁנָה, אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן, דְּיָלֵיף לֵיהּ מִבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: If so, a guilt offering in its second but brought it in its year, fit in year. Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Shimon in whose time has not yet as he derives it from a firstborn.
llm_translation: If so, a guilt offering for a two-year-old and he brought a one-year-old, see for a year, rather this is the reason of Rabbi Shimon in a case of lacking time, that he may redeem it from the firstborn.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מְחוּסַּר זְמַן נִכְנָס לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, וַהֲרֵי הוּא כִּבְכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ, אַף מְחוּסַּר זְמַן קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: whose time has not yet enters the pen to be tithed And it is like a firstborn: Just as a firstborn is sanctified before the time it and it is sacrificed after its time, so too, whose time has not yet is sanctified before its time and is sacrificed after its time.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: One who is lacking time may enter the chamber to become wealthy, and he is like a firstborn. Just as a firstborn is holy before his time and close after his time, so too, one lacking time is holy before his time and close after his time.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָתוֹ
human_translation: The Sages taught one who consecrates a female for his burnt offering
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sanctifies a female animal for his burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וּלְפִסְחוֹ וְלַאֲשָׁמוֹ — עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: or for his Paschal offering or for his guilt offering, renders a substitute,
llm_translation: And for his Passover offering and for his guilt offering - he makes an exchange.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָתוֹ — עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, לְפִסְחוֹ וְלַאֲשָׁמוֹ — אֵין עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: for his burnt offering, it renders a substitute, for his Paschal offering or for his guilt offering it does not render a substitute.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: For his burnt offering - he makes an exchange, for his Passover offering and his guilt offering - he does not make an exchange.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, אֶלָּא הָרוֹעֶה לְהִסְתָּאֵב.
human_translation: no renders a substitute except graze to become blemished,
llm_translation: There is no thing doing exchange, but the shepherd to be intoxicated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: אֵין אֲנִי רוֹאֶה דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּפֶּסַח, הוֹאִיל וּמוֹתַר הַפֶּסַח קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi says, I do not agree with the statement of Rabbi Shimon with Paschal offering, since a leftover Paschal is sacrificed a peace offering,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi: I do not see the words of Rabbi Shimon regarding Pesach, since the Pesach offering is closer to peace offerings.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: אֵין אֲנִי רוֹאֶה דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּאָשָׁם, הוֹאִיל וּמוֹתַר אָשָׁם קָרֵב עוֹלָה! רַבִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: מוֹתָרוֹת לְנִדְבַת צִיבּוּר אָזְלִי, וְאֵין תְּמוּרָה בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: And let him say: I do not agree with the statement of Rabbi Shimon to a guilt offering, since a leftover guilt offering is sacrificed as a burnt offering, Rabbi holds in accordance with of the Rabbis, who say: Leftover are used for communal gift offerings, and a substitute cannot for a communal
llm_translation: And say: I do not see his words of Rabbi Shimon in the guilt-offering, since a guilt-offering is closer to a burnt-offering! Rabbi holds like the Rabbis, who say: The surplus goes for a communal offering, and there is no substitution in a communal offering.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן גַּבֵּי מַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, דְּהָאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלֶה עָלֶיהָ גַּבֵּי עוֹלַת הָעוֹף.
human_translation: enter your mind this is the reason for Rabbi Shimon with regard to designates a female for his burnt offering: renders a substitute due to that that it has burnt offering status of a bird burnt offering,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ka sakla datach, hainu taama d'Rabbi Shimon gabei mafresh nekevah le'olato, mi'shum hachi osah temurah, d'ha'ikka shem oleh aleha gabei olat ha'of." Translation: "When your mind was made up, that is the reason of Rabbi Shimon regarding separating a female for his burnt offering, because he is making an exchange, as there is a name of an offering upon it in place of the bird offering."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ פָּרָה לְפָרוֹ — תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ, דְּהָאִיכָּא פָּרַת חַטָּאת! קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הוּא, וְקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לָא עָבְדִי תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: if that is so, of a High Priest who designated a female cow of his bull it should be sanctified is the heifer of purification it is consecrated Temple maintenance, and consecrated Temple maintenance do not render a substitute.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, in the case of a High Priest who set aside a cow for his cow - it is considered sanctified, for there is the cow of sin offering! It is the consecrated property of the Temple treasury, and the consecrated property of the Temple treasury cannot be exchanged.

hebrew_text: יָחִיד שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ שָׂעִיר לִשְׂעִירָתוֹ — תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ, דְּהָאִיכָּא שְׂעִיר נָשִׂיא! אִי נָמֵי, נָשִׂיא שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ שְׂעִירָה לִשְׂעִירוֹ — תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ, דְּהָא יָחִיד מַפְרִישׁ שְׂעִירָה!
human_translation: an individual, who designated goat of his female goat, it should be sanctified as it has goat the king. Alternatively, a king, who designated a female goat his goat, it should be sanctified as an individual designates a female goat
llm_translation: Individual who separated goat for his goat - sanctification, for there is a goat of a leader! If so, leader who separated goat for his goat - sanctification, for individual separates his goat!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי תְּרֵי גּוּפֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: these, are two bodies,
llm_translation: These are two distinct entities.

hebrew_text: חָטְאוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְמַנּוּ, כִּי מַפְרֵישׁ שָׂעִיר לִשְׂעִירָתוֹ — תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ, דְּהָא אִילּוּ חָטָא הַשְׁתָּא — בַּר אֵיתוֹיֵי שָׂעִיר הוּא! הָא לָא חָטָא — לָא אִיחַיַּיב בְּשָׂעִיר.
human_translation: sinned prior to being appointed if he designates goat of female goat it should be sanctified as, if he sinned now, he is obligated to bring goat. as did not sin was not obligated to goat,
llm_translation: They sinned before they were designated, for he separates a he-goat for his she-goat - it is sanctified, for if he sinned now - it is a he-goat for Azazel! If he did not sin - he is not obligated with a he-goat.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָכָא נָמֵי, הָא לָאו עוֹלַת הָעוֹף קָמַיְיתֵי!
human_translation: If so, here too, does not bring a bird burnt offering.
llm_translation: If so, here it is stated, but this is not the case with the burnt offering of birds!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דִּתְנַן: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה״ — יָבִיא כֶּבֶשׂ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹ תּוֹר אוֹ בְּנֵי יוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, As we learned It upon me a burnt offering, brings a lamb, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: a dove or pigeons
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, as we learned: "If one says, 'I am obligated to bring a burnt offering,' he shall bring a sheep." Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: "Or a turtledove or young pigeons."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְכָסָיו, וְהָיָה בָּהֶן בְּהֵמָה רְאוּיָה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere one who consecrates his possessions and among them there is an animal that is suitable on the altar, males and females,
llm_translation: We learned there: One who sanctifies his possessions, and among them is an animal fitting for the altar, males and females.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זְכָרִים יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי עוֹלוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי שְׁלָמִים, וּדְמֵיהֶן יִפְּלוּ עִם שְׁאָר נְכָסִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: males be sold for the needs of burnt offerings, And females, be sold for the needs of peace offerings, And their monetary value allocated with the rest of his property for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Males shall be sold for the needs of burnt offerings, and females shall be sold for the needs of peace offerings, and their value shall be included with the rest of the property for the maintenance of the house.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: זְכָרִים עַצְמָן יִקְרְבוּ עוֹלוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי שְׁלָמִים, וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹלוֹת, וּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים יִפְּלוּ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: males themselves be sacrificed as burnt offerings, and females, be sold for the needs of peace offerings, and their monetary value bring burnt offerings. And the rest of the property, is allocated for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Males themselves shall draw near for burnt offerings, and females shall be sold for the needs of peace offerings, and he shall bring with their blood burnt offerings, and the rest of the property shall fall to the Temple treasury.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּאָמַר זְכָרִים עַצְמָן יִקְרְבוּ עוֹלוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת הֵיכִי (מקרבן) [קָרְבָן] שְׁלָמִים? הָא מִכֹּחַ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָּיה קָאָתְיָין!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to Rabbi Yehoshua, who said males themselves be sacrificed as burnt offerings, how can sacrifice the females peace offerings? Their stems from deferred sanctity,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba to Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to Rabbi Yehoshua who said, "Male animals themselves may be brought as burnt offerings, but how can female animals be brought as peace offerings?" This is because they come from a lower level of sanctity.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחְרִינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ זְכָרִים עַצְמָן יִקְרְבוּ עוֹלוֹת, לְמֵימְרָא דִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף אַקְדְּשִׁינְהוּ? אִי הָכִי, נְקֵבוֹת אַמַּאי יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי שְׁלָמִים? בָּעֲיָא רְעִיָּיה!
human_translation: another version of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: that Rabbi Yehoshua said males themselves be sacrificed as burnt offerings, is this to say that he consecrated them inherent sanctity? If so, why are the females sold for the needs of peace offerings? required graze
llm_translation: The other disciples, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yohanan: Since Rabbi Yehoshua said, "The male animals themselves shall draw near for burnt offerings," does this mean that we should sanctify the male organs for the sake of the sanctity of the body? If so, why should the female organs be sold for the needs of peace offerings? This requires further examination!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: כֹּל מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ — לָא נָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תִּמָּכֵר שֶׁלֹּא בְּמוּם, וְאָמְרִינַן דְּטַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חַזְיָא נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם, לָא נָחֲתָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yehoshua holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said anything that is not fit itself inherent sanctity does not descend upon it. As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: it may be sold without a blemish, And we say that the reason of Rabbi Shimon as a female is not fit as a guilt offering, inherent sanctity does not descend upon it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehoshua thinks like Rabbi Shimon, who said: Anything that is not fitting for itself - the holiness of the body does not rest upon it. As we learned, Rabbi Shimon says: One may not sell an animal with a blemish, and we say the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion is: Since a female does not see guilt, the holiness of the body does not rest upon it.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן גַּבֵּי נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם,
human_translation: say that Rabbi Shimon with regard to a female for a guilt offering,
llm_translation: Statement that Rabbi Shimon said regarding a female regarding guilt-offering,

hebrew_text: דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם אָשָׁם עַל אִמּוֹ, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֶה!
human_translation: where there is no guilt offering status as its mother, But with regard to a female as a burnt offering, where there is burnt offering status as its mother, even Rabbi Shimon concedes
llm_translation: There is a name of guilt upon his mother, but regarding a female for a burnt offering, where there is a name of burnt offering upon her mother - even Rabbi Shimon agrees!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְעוֹלָתוֹ עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה!
human_translation: In addition, we have heard that Rabbi Shimon as a burnt offering renders a substitute.
llm_translation: And furthermore, we have heard from Rabbi Shimon: "For his burnt offering he shall make a substitution!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּאִידַּךְ תַּנָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אַף לְעוֹלָתוֹ אֵין עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yehoshua holds in accordance with the other tanna with regard of Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Even as his burnt offering does not render a substitute.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehoshua thinks like you, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Even for his burnt offering, one does not make an exchange.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תְּמוּרַת אָשָׁם, וְלַד תְּמוּרָה, וְלָדָן וְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם — יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִפְּלוּ (דָּמָיו) [דְּמֵיהֶן] לִנְדָבָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָמוּתוּ. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהּ עוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: the substitute of a guilt offering, the offspring of substitute, their offspring the offspring of their offspring, until the end of all time, graze until they become unfit, and they are sold, and money is allocated for gift offerings. Rabbi Eliezer says: they die. And Rabbi Elazar says: bring burnt offering with the money its
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The exchange for a guilt-offering, and the exchange for a burnt-offering, and for their offspring, and for the offspring of their offspring until the end of all time - they shall graze until they become blemished, and then be sold, and their value be designated for a voluntary offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: Let them die. And Rabbi Elazar says: Let him bring burnt-offerings with their value.

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלָיו, וְשֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלָיו — יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָמוּתוּ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ עוֹלָה.
human_translation: A guilt offering whose owner died, and that its owner gained atonement graze until they become unfit, and they are sold, and money is allocated gift offerings. Rabbi Eliezer says: die. Rabbi Elazar says: bring burnt offering with the money its
llm_translation: Guilt-offering that died in its owner, and its owner atoned - they shall graze until they become blemished, and they shall be sold, and its value shall be dedicated to the Temple treasury. Rabbi Eliezer says: they shall die. Rabbi Elazar says: she shall bring a burnt-offering with its blood.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא אַף נְדָבָה עוֹלָה הִיא, וּמָה בֵּין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים? אֶלָּא, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא בָּאָה עוֹלָה — סוֹמֵךְ עָלֶיהָ, וּמֵבִיא נְסָכִים, וּנְסָכֶיהָ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן — עֲבוֹדָתָהּ וְעוֹרָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: But isn’t a gift offering a burnt offering? And what is between the statement of Rabbi Elazar and the statement of the Rabbis? Rather, When comes burnt offering, places hands upon it and brings libations, and its libations from his If was a priest, its Temple service and its hide are his.
llm_translation: And isn't a voluntary burnt offering also considered a burnt offering? So what is the difference between the words of Rabbi Eliezer and the words of the Sages? Rather, when it the offering is coming as a burnt offering - one leans upon it, and brings libations, and its libations are his the offerer's. If he the offerer was a priest - its service and its hide are his.

hebrew_text: וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהִיא נְדָבָה — אֵינוֹ סוֹמֵךְ עָלֶיהָ, וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא עָלֶיהָ נְסָכִים, וּנְסָכֶיהָ מִשֶּׁל צִיבּוּר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא כֹּהֵן — עֲבוֹדָתָהּ וְעוֹרָהּ מִשֶּׁל אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר.
human_translation: And when it is a gift offering, does not place hands upon it, and he does not bring its libations; its libations from of the community. although is a priest, its Temple service and its hide among the members of the priestly watch
llm_translation: In a time when it is voluntary - one does not rely on it, and one does not bring libations upon it, and its libations are from communal funds, even though he is a priest - its service and hide are from the men of the watch.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּצְרִיכָא:
human_translation: necessary.
llm_translation: Gemara: and it is necessary.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אָשָׁם, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר יָמוּתוּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּגָזַר לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: As, had taught us the guilt offering in this Rabbi Eliezer says that die. because he decree concerning following atonement, due to before atonement.
llm_translation: If we hear a guilt offering, in this case Rabbi Eliezer said they should die, because he decreed after atonement before atonement.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרַת אָשָׁם, וְלַד תְּמוּרָתָהּ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But with regard to the substitute of a guilt offering the offspring of its substitute, say concedes to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Regarding the exchange of a guilt-offering, and its offspring, let us say that the Rabbis concede to him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָתָם, בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי אָשָׁם מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us there, in this the Rabbis say But with regard to a guilt offering they concede to Rabbi Eliezer are necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear there, in that case, what the Rabbis are saying, but regarding a guilt-offering, they concede to Rabbi Eliezer - it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב אָשָׁם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: dispute after atonement But before atonement everyone agrees itself is sacrificed a guilt offering,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Dispute after atonement, but before atonement - the words of everyone, he himself shall bring a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר, חֲדָא דְּאֵין אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּדָבָר הַבָּא בַּעֲבֵירָה, וְעוֹד, הָתָנֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָא לְסַיּוֹעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי דְּאָמַר וָלָד רִאשׁוֹן קָרֵב, וְלַד שֵׁנִי אֵינוֹ קָרֵב!
human_translation: Rava said: two refutations of statement: One that a person cannot achieve atonement through an item that comes from a transgression, And in addition, didn’t Rav Ḥananya teach in support of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, who said the first offspring is sacrificed, the second offspring, is not sacrificed?
llm_translation: Rava said: Two responses on the matter, one that a person is not atoned for a matter that comes through transgression, and furthermore, Rav Chananya taught to the assistants of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi that a firstborn animal is brought near, but a secondborn is not brought near!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַחְלוֹקֶת קוֹדֶם כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה — הוּא עַצְמוֹ קָרֵב עוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated like this: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: dispute before atonement But after atonement itself is sacrificed a burnt offering,
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Dispute before atonement, but after atonement - it itself is considered a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָא לְסַיּוֹעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Ḥananya teach in support of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is difficult.
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rav Chananya said to assist Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi! A difficulty.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר חִיָּיא מֵרַבִּי אָבִין בַּר כָּהֲנָא: הִפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם, בְּנָהּ מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְרַב לְעוֹלָה? וְתִיפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Ḥiyya inquired of Rabbi Avin bar Kahana: designated a female as a guilt offering what is its offspring is sacrificed as a burnt offering? And let him resolve from of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, who said Rabbi Elazar concedes never heard
llm_translation: Requested text: Rabbi Avin bar Chiya asked Rabbi Avin bar Kahanah: If a woman designated a female animal for a guilt-offering, what should her son bring as a burnt offering? And let him learn from the teaching of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, who said: Rabbi Elazar agrees. It is not heard from him.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנָהּ קָרֵב עוֹלָה. הַאי מַאי? עַד כַּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא מַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְעוֹלָה, דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי אָשָׁם דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם עוֹלָה עַל אִמּוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹדֶה!
human_translation: What said to Its offspring is sacrificed as a burnt offering. What is this? Rabbi Elazar says only he designates a female as a burnt offering that there is burnt offering status its mother. But with regard to a guilt offering where there is no guilt offering status as its mother, even Rabbi Eliezer concedes
llm_translation: What did he say to him: Build the altar. What is this? Until here Rabbi Elazar did not say, but separate a female for a burnt offering, for there is the name of the burnt offering upon its mother, but regarding a guilt offering, for there is not the name of the burnt offering upon its mother — even Rabbi Eliezer agrees!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּשֵׁם עוֹלֶה עַל אִמּוֹ, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזֵי לְהַקְרָבָה, וְהָא נָמֵי חֲזֵי לְהַקְרָבָה.
human_translation: said to him The reason of Rabbi Elazar, not because burnt offering status as its mother, rather because it is fit to be sacrificed and this is also fit to be sacrificed.
llm_translation: He said to him: The reason of Rabbi Elazar is not because he is disrespectful to his mother, but because he sees an opportunity to bring her closer, and this one also sees an opportunity to bring her closer.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: וְלָדָן וְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם יָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹלָה — בִּדְמֵיהֶן — אִין,
human_translation: raised an objection to the offspring and the offspring of their offspring until the end of all time, brings burnt offering with money their With money their yes,
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "And Ladan and Lad and Ladan, until the end of the world, shall they bring with their blood a burnt offering - with their blood - no."

hebrew_text: עַצְמוֹ — לֹא! הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁיָּלְדָה נְקֵבָה, וְעַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם לֹא אוֹלִיד חַד זָכָר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁנֵּינָא [לָךְ] שִׁינּוּיֵי דְּחִיקִי בַּבְלָאֵי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁיָּלְדָה נְקֵבוֹת עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: itself not What are we dealing with here? where gave birth to a female, But until the end of time not one male was born? said to him I answer forced answers, Babylonians, where it gave birth females, until the end of time.
llm_translation: Bone — no! Here, with what are we dealing? For example, a female gave birth, and until the end of the world did not give birth to a single male?! He said to him: We answer you with the sharp teeth of Babylonians, for example, a female gave birth to females until the end of the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תְּמוּרַת הַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְלָדָן וְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כִּבְכוֹר וּכְמַעֲשֵׂר, וְיֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: the substitute of a firstborn and tithe offspring the offspring of their offspring until the end of time, these is like a firstborn and like tithe and they may be eaten in their blemished by owners.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The exchange of the firstborn and the tithe, and the offspring and the offspring of the offspring until the end of the world—these are considered like firstborn and like tithe, and may be eaten by the owners with a blemish.

hebrew_text: מָה בֵּין בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר לְבֵין כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים? שֶׁכׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים נִמְכָּרִים בָּאִיטְלֵז, וְנִשְׁחָטִין בָּאִיטְלֵז, וְנִשְׁקָלִין בְּלִיטְרָא, חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: What is between a firstborn and tithe and all the sacrificial animals? that all the sacrificial animals are sold in the butchers’ market [ ba’itliz ] and slaughtered in the butchers’ market, and weighed by the litra , except for the firstborn and tithe
llm_translation: The difference between a firstborn and tithe and all other consecrated items? For all consecrated items are redeemed with a lamb, and are slaughtered with a lamb, and are weighed with a litra, except for the firstborn and the tithe.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן פִּדְיוֹן, וְלִתְמוּרוֹתֵיהֶן פִּדְיוֹן, חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וּבָאִין מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁאִם בָּאוּ תְּמִימִים — יִקְרְבוּ, וְאִם בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין — יֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: And are subject to redemption and their substitutes to redemption except for the firstborn and tithe And come from outside of Eretz except for the firstborn and tithe which if they came unblemished, they are sacrificed and if they are blemished they may be eaten in their blemished by owners.
llm_translation: And they have redemption, and for their exchanges redemption, except for the firstborn and the tithe. And they may come from outside the land, except for the firstborn and the tithe, for if they come whole — they may draw near, and if they have blemishes — they shall be eaten with their blemish by the owners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם שֶׁהַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לָהֶן פַּרְנָסָה מִמְּקוֹמָן, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנּוֹלַד בָּהֶם מוּם — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁתָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: What reason that the firstborn and tithe have a remedy in their place But all other sacrificial animals, even if a blemish develops in them, these in their sanctity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason that the firstborn and the tithe have sustenance from their place, and all other holy items, even if a blemish is born in them - behold, these are in their sanctity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב עַזָּא: בָּעַן בְּמַעְרְבָא — הַמֵּטִיל מוּם בִּתְמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קְרִיבָן — לָא מִיחַיַּיב, אוֹ דִילְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָדְשׁוּ — מִיחַיַּיב?
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Azza said they inquired in the West, What is one who inflicts a blemish on the substitute of a firstborn or tithe Do we say since they are not sacrificed is not liable, or perhaps since they are sanctified, he is liable
llm_translation: Gemara: Rava son of Rav Azza said: In the West, one who imposes a blemish on a substitute for a firstborn or tithe, what is the law? Do we say: Since it is not brought as an offering, he is not liable, or perhaps: Since it has been consecrated, he is liable?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ הַמֵּטִיל מוּם בִּתְשִׁיעִי שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: Abaye said to And let the dilemma be raised one who inflicts a blemish on the ninth tithe
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And you should demand the one who imposes a blemish on the ninth animal of the tithe!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי שְׁנָא תְּשִׁיעִי, דְּלָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לָךְ? דְּרַחֲמָנָא מַעֲטֵיהּ, ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — לְהוֹצִיא הַתְּשִׁיעִי.
human_translation: Rather, what is different ninth that you did not raise the dilemma because the Merciful One excluded it, “The tenth to exclude the ninth
llm_translation: Rather, what is different about the ninth day, that it does not require a separate blessing for you? Because the Merciful One shortened it, "the ninth" — to bring out the ninth blessing.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי, רַחֲמָנָא מַעֲטִינְהוּ, ״לֹא תִפְדֶּה קֹדֶשׁ הֵם״ — הֵם קְרֵיבִין, וְאֵין תְּמוּרָתָן קְרֵיבָה.
human_translation: Here, too, the Merciful One excluded it you shall not redeem; they are holy” they, are sacrificed, but their substitute is not sacrificed,
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: The Merciful One has made them few, "They shall not redeem the holy things" — they are offered, and their exchange is not offered.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי לַהּ הָכִי: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עַזָּא, בָּעַן בְּמַעְרְבָא: הַמֵּטִיל מוּם בִּתְשִׁיעִי שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ הַמֵּטִיל מוּם בִּתְמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teaches this Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Azza, said they inquired in the West, one who inflicts a blemish upon the ninth tithe what is said to him: And let the dilemma be raised one who inflicts a blemish upon the substitute of a firstborn or tithe
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches her thus: Rav Acha, son of Rav Azza, said in the West: One who causes a blemish in the ninth animal of the tithe, what is the law? He said to him: And should you ask, one who causes a blemish in the exchange for a firstborn and tithe!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי שְׁנָא תְּמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר דְּלָא מִיבַּעְיָא לָךְ? דְּרַחֲמָנָא מַעֲטִינְהוּ, ״קֹדֶשׁ הֵם״ — הֵן קְרֵיבִין וְאֵין תְּמוּרָתָן קְרֵיבָה. תְּשִׁיעִי שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי רַחֲמָנָא מַעֲטֵיהּ, ״הָעֲשִׂירִי״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַתְּשִׁיעִי.
human_translation: Rather, what is different the substitute of a firstborn or tithe that you did not raise the dilemma because the Merciful One excluded them, “They are holy,” they are sacrificed, but their substitutes are not sacrificed. the ninth tithe as well, the Merciful One excluded it, “The tenth,” to exclude the ninth
llm_translation: Rather, what is different about the redemption of the firstborn and the tithe that does not require your attention? For the Merciful One has made them less significant, "they are holy" — they are brought close, and their redemption is not brought close. The ninth of the tithe, the Merciful One has made it less significant, "the tenth" — to exempt the ninth.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּאוּ תְּמִימִין כּוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס הֶעֱלָה בְּכוֹרוֹת מִבָּבֶל וְלֹא קִבְּלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, הָא — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: if they came unblemished, raises a contradiction: ben Antigonus brought up firstborn from Babylonia and they did not accept them Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult: This Rabbi Yishmael, this Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if they came with t'mimim, etc." And they raised a dilemma: Ben Antigonus brought firstborn animals from Babylon and they did not accept them from him! Rav Ḥisda said: It is not difficult, here is Rabbi Yishmael, here is Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מִשּׁוּם שְׁלֹשָׁה זְקֵנִים, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַעֲלֶה אָדָם מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה וְיֹאכְלֶנּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם?
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says three matters in the name of three elders: Rabbi Yishmael says might a person may bring up second tithe in the present and eat it in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says: Three things because of three elders. Rabbi Yishmael says: Is it possible for a person to ascend with a second tithe at this time and eat it in Jerusalem?

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא: בְּכוֹר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, וּמַעֲשֵׂר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם. מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת. לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בִּבְכוֹר — שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, תֹּאמַר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר דְּלָא?!
human_translation: But logical inference A firstborn requires brought place, and tithe requires brought place. Just as a firstborn is eaten only in the presence of the Temple, so too, tithe is eaten only in the presence of the Temple. No, if you said with regard to a firstborn, as it requires placing the blood and sacrificial portions upon the altar, shall you say with regard to tithe, which is not
llm_translation: And the law is: the firstborn requires bringing to a specific place, and tithes require bringing to a specific place. Just as the firstborn can only be eaten in front of the house, so too tithes can only be eaten in front of the house. No, if you say regarding the firstborn - that it also requires the giving of blood and sacrificial portions on the altar, would you say the same for tithes which do not require it?!

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: בִּיכּוּרִים טְעוּנִין הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, וּמַעֲשֵׂר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם. מָה בִּיכּוּרִים אֵין נֶאֱכָלִין אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵין נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: say First fruits require brought place, and tithe requires brought place. Just as first fruits may be eaten only in the presence of the Temple, so too, tithe may be eaten only in the presence of the Temple.
llm_translation: You said: First fruits require bringing to the place, and tithe requires bringing to the place. Just as first fruits are not eaten except in front of the house, so too tithe is not eaten except in front of the house.

hebrew_text: מָה לְבִיכּוּרִים, שֶׁכֵּן טְעוּנִין הַנָּחָה, תֹּאמַר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר דְּלָא?!
human_translation: what about first fruits? that they require placement Shall you say to tithe, which is not
llm_translation: What about the "bikurim," that they also require "nahah," you will say regarding tithing that is not necessary?!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ... מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירוֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ וּבְכוֹרוֹת בְּקָרְךָ וְצֹאנֶךָ״, הִקִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂר לִבְכוֹר: מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵין נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: The verse states “And you shall eat before the Lord your God the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your cattle and sheep” compares tithe to the firstborn: Just as a firstborn is eaten only in the presence of the Temple, so too, tithe is eaten only in the presence of the Temple.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And you shall eat before the Lord your God... the tithe of your grain, your wine, your oil, and the firstborn of your cattle and your sheep." It equated the tithe to the firstborn: just as the firstborn is only eaten in front of the house, so too the tithe is only eaten in front of the house.

hebrew_text: וְלֶיהְדַּר דִּינָא, וְלֵיתֵי בְּ״מָה הַצַּד״!
human_translation: But let the inference return and let be derived by the common element [ bema hatzad ]
llm_translation: "And to honor the judgment, and let him come with 'What is the side'!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר, מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: because it can be said: What about the common element of these that they have an aspect the altar:
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Because there is to say, what to the side the equal that in them, so there is in them a side of the altar.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, לָא שְׁנָא בְּכוֹר וְלָא שְׁנָא מַעֲשֵׂר בְּנֵי הֲבָאָה נִינְהוּ. וְאִי קָסָבַר קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, אֲפִילּוּ בְּכוֹר נָמֵי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ!
human_translation: And what does he hold? If he holds initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever, a firstborn is no different and tithe is no different, are capable of being brought And if he holds initial consecration sanctified for its time but did not sanctify forever, raise the dilemma even firstborn.
llm_translation: And what does he hold? If he holds that the first sanctification was for its time and also for the future, it is no different from a firstborn or from tithing the produce of the subsequent year. But if he holds that the first sanctification was for its time only and not for the future, even a firstborn would require you to bring it!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר, קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּזְרַק דָּמוֹ שֶׁל בְּכוֹר בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת, וְחָרַב הַבַּיִת, וַעֲדַיִין בְּשָׂרוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: Actually, he holds initial consecration sanctified for its time but did not sanctify it forever, and here we are dealing with where the blood of a firstborn was sprinkled before the Temple and the Temple was destroyed, but its flesh was still in existence.
llm_translation: Always he holds, the first sanctity sanctified for its time and did not sanctify for the future, and here with what are we dealing — for example, when the blood of the firstborn was thrown in front of the house, and the house collapsed, yet its flesh is still intact.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִי אִיתֵיהּ לְדָם (לא) [לָאו] בַּר זְרִיקָה הוּא, אָתֵי בָּשָׂר יָלֵיף מִדָּם,
human_translation: Since if the blood is there not subject to sprinkling, the meat comes derived from the blood,
llm_translation: Since if there is blood, it is not a valid sprinkling, flesh will come and separate from the blood.

hebrew_text: וְאָתֵי מַעֲשֵׂר וְיָלֵיף מִבְּכוֹר. וּמִי יָלְפִינַן (קֹדֶשׁ) [בְּקָדָשִׁים] מֵהֲדָדֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לְמֵדִין לָמֵד מִן הַלָּמֵד, חוּץ מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁאֵין לְמֵדִין לָמֵד מִן הַלָּמֵד!
human_translation: And tithe comes and is derived from the firstborn. And can we derive sacrificial from one another? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: the entire Torah, we may derive derived from derived except for sacrificial where do not derive derived from derived
llm_translation: And comes tithe and adds from firstborn. And who will add (holy) from holies from Hadadei? And said Rabbi Yochanan: All the Torah entirely learn from the one who learns, except for the holies that one does not learn from the one who learns!

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר חוּלִּין הוּא. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּתַר לָמֵד אָזְלִינַן, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּתַר מְלַמֵּד אָזְלִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בָּשָׂר וָדָם חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: tithe is non-sacred. This works out well according to the one who said we follow derived. But according to the one who said we follow teaches, what is there to say? the meat and the blood are one matter.
llm_translation: Tithe of secular items it is. He left it for one who says we go after the latter, rather than for one who says we go after the former, what can be said? Flesh and blood is a single matter.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַעֲלֶה אָדָם בְּכוֹר מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים וְיַקְרִיבֶנּוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירוֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ וּבְכוֹרוֹת בְּקָרְךָ וְצֹאנֶךָ״ — מִמְּקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן, אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: might a person may bring up a firstborn from outside Eretz to Eretz when the Temple is standing and sacrifice it. the verse states: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock” from the place that you bring up the tithe of grain may you bring up a firstborn
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Can a person bring his firstborn outside of the land to the land when the Temple is standing and offer him? The Torah teaches: "And you shall eat before the Lord your God, in the place where He chooses to establish His Name, the tithe of your grain, your wine, your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and flock" — from the place where you bring the tithe of grain, you also bring the firstborn.

hebrew_text: וּמִמְּקוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן — אִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: But from a place that you may not bring up the tithe of grain, you may not bring up a firstborn
llm_translation: And from the place where you do not bring up the tithe of grain - you do not bring up the firstborn.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל (מַעֲלֶה אֶת) [יַעֲלֶה אָדָם] מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וְיֹאכְלֶנּוּ בְּכׇל הָרוֹאֶה? וְדִין הוּא: בְּכוֹר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, וּמַעֲשֵׂר טָעוּן הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם — מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה.
human_translation: Ben Azzai says might bring up second tithe and eat it in any that overlooks But logical inference: A firstborn requires brought place, and tithe requires brought place. Just as a firstborn is eaten only within the walls so too, tithe is eaten only within the walls
llm_translation: Ben Azzai says: Can a person bring up a second tithe and eat it wherever he wishes? And it is a judgment: The firstborn requires bringing to a specific place, and the tithe requires bringing to a specific place — just as the firstborn can only be eaten within the walls, so too the tithe can only be eaten within the walls.

hebrew_text: מָה לִבְכוֹר — שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, תֹּאמַר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר דְּלָא?! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ... מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירוֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ וּבְכוֹרוֹת בְּקָרְךָ וְצֹאנֶךָ״ — מַקִּישׁ מַעֲשֵׂר לִבְכוֹר: מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל אֶלָּא לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה.
human_translation: What about a firstborn? that it requires the placement of the blood and sacrificial portions upon the altar. Shall you say with regard to tithe, where is not the verse states: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock.” juxtaposes tithe firstborn, just as the firstborn is eaten only within the walls, so too, tithe is eaten only within the walls.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What about the firstborn? — for it also requires the giving of blood and verbal declarations at the altar, you might say, but what about tithing, which does not require it?! The Torah teaches: 'And you shall eat before the Lord your God... the tithe of your grain, your wine, your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and flock' — it compares tithing to the firstborn: just as the firstborn may only be eaten within the walls, so too tithing may only be eaten within the walls."

hebrew_text: מַאי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר ״יָכוֹל״? אָמַרְתָּ הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן: אֵין בֵּין שִׁילֹה לִירוּשָׁלַיִם אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּשִׁילֹה אוֹכְלִין קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּכׇל הָרוֹאֶה, וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה,
human_translation: What is difficult for that say: might You say since we learned The difference between Shiloh and Jerusalem is only that in Shiloh one eats offerings of lesser sanctity, and the second tithe, in any place that overlooks but in Jerusalem within the walls.
llm_translation: What is the difficulty for him that he says "able"? You said, since we learned: There is no difference between Shiloh and Jerusalem except that in Shiloh one may eat light holy items and second tithe anywhere, and in Jerusalem only within the wall.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לִפְנִים מִן הַקְּלָעִים, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם לַיְתֵי מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּכׇל הָרוֹאֶה? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And likewise, offerings of the most sacred order within the hangings, Lest you say in Jerusalem, they may bring second tithe in any that overlooks teaches us
llm_translation: "And so too, the holy of holies inside the curtains, what is the reasoning in Jerusalem for bringing the second tithe by anyone who sees? It is teaching us."

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: יָכוֹל יְהֵא בְּכוֹר שֶׁעִבְּרָה שְׁנָתוֹ כִּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, וְיִפָּסֵל?
human_translation: others say: might a firstborn whose first year has passed should as disqualified consecrated and be disqualified.
llm_translation: Others say: Is it possible that a firstborn animal, whose year has passed, should be disqualified like the blemished animals of the Temple, and be disqualified?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירוֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ״, מַקִּישׁ בְּכוֹר לְמַעֲשֵׂר, מָה מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינוֹ נִפְסָל מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ, אַף בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נִפְסָל מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ.
human_translation: the verse states: the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, juxtaposes a firstborn to tithe, just as tithe is not disqualified from year to the next, so too, a firstborn is not disqualified from year to the next.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "The tithe of your grain, wine, and oil," equates firstborn to tithe. Just as tithe is not disqualified through exchange with its counterpart, so too firstborn is not disqualified through exchange with its counterpart.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן, דְּמַפְּקִי לְהוּ לְטַעְמָא אַחֲרִינָא, מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ מְנָא לְהוּ? נָפְקָא לְהוּ מִ״לִּפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״, לִימֵּד עַל הַבְּכוֹר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִפְסָל מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, who expound for another explanation, from where do they from year to the next? They derive it from “You shall eat it before the Lord your God year by year.” teaching with regard to a firstborn that it is not disqualified from year to the next.
llm_translation: For the sages, when they bring forth another reason, from where do they derive it for their colleague? They derive it for him from "before the Lord your God you shall eat it year by year," to teach regarding the firstborn that he is not disqualified from his colleague.

hebrew_text: וְלַאֲחֵרִים, לִפְנֵי ״ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״, מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: יוֹם אֶחָד מִשָּׁנָה זוֹ, וְיוֹם אֶחָד מִשָּׁנָה אַחֶרֶת, לִימֵּד עַל הַבְּכוֹר שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלָיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: And according to the others, what do they interpret “You shall eat it before the Lord your God year by year”? It is necessary for that which is taught one day of this year, and one day of the next year. teaches with regard to a firstborn that it may be eaten for two days and one night
llm_translation: And to others, before "the Lord your God you shall eat it year by year," what did he expound in it? He should expound it according to what is taught: one day from this year, and one day from the next year, to teach about the firstborn that is eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, דְּנֶאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וָלָיְלָה אֶחָד מְנָא לְהוּ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״יִהְיֶה לָּךְ כַּחֲזֵה הַתְּנוּפָה״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they that may be eaten for two days and one night? the verse states shall be yours, like the breast of the waving
llm_translation: The sages, who eat for two days and one night, how do they count the days? The verse says: "It shall be for you as the waving of the offering."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ קָדָשִׁים.
llm_translation: We will return to you, these are the holy items.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְלַד חַטָּאת , וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ — יָמוּתוּ, וְשֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, וְשֶׁאָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם, אִם מִשֶּׁכִּפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים — תָּמוּת, וְאֵינָהּ עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: The offspring of a sin offering and the substitute for a sin offering, and a sin offering whose owner has died shall die. And its year has passed, and that was lost and found, blemished, if after the owner achieved atonement shall die, and it does not render a substitute.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A firstborn animal designated for a sin-offering, and a substitute for a sin-offering, and a sin-offering whose owners died — they shall die. If its year passed, or if it got lost and was found to have a blemish, if the owners atoned for it — it shall die, and it does not effect redemption."

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין, וְאִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא כִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים — תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב, וְתִמָּכֵר וְיָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ אַחֶרֶת, וְעוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: may not derive benefit but not misuse And if before the owner achieved atonement it shall graze until it becomes blemished, and it shall be sold. And he must bring another with the money And renders a substitute, and misusing it.
llm_translation: Not benefitting and not causing detriment, and if until the owners did not atone — it shall graze until it becomes blemished, and it shall be sold, and another shall be brought with its money, and he makes an exchange and causes detriment with it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי לְהוּ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי? רֵישָׁא — פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, וְסֵיפָא — לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason does not teach them together? the first clause, an absolute the latter clause, there is no absolute
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason that it does not teach regarding Hadadei? The beginning - it is a conclusion for it, and the end - it is not a conclusion for it.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנְיַיהּ גַּבֵּי מְעִילָה, לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנְיַיהּ גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה? תְּנָא הָכָא תְּמוּרָה, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא תְּמוּרָה — תְּנָא נָמֵי מְעִילָה, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא גַּבֵּי מְעִילָה מְעִילָה — תְּנָא נָמֵי תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: Why do I to teach in Me’ila why do I to teach it in Temura ? Here, taught substitution, And since it taught substitution, it also taught misuse of consecrated property. And since it taught in Me’ila misuse of consecrated property, it also taught substitution.
llm_translation: Why do I need to teach about a substitute regarding a cloak, why do I need to teach about a substitute regarding exchange? A Tanna taught here regarding exchange, and since he taught about exchange - he taught about a cloak. And since he taught about a cloak, he taught about a cloak. He taught about a substitute.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: חַטָּאת שֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ עוֹמֶדֶת בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְרוֹעָה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: a sin offering whose year has passed, one considers it as though it is standing in a cemetery, and graze
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: A sin-offering that has passed its year, we view it as if it is standing in the cemetery and grazing.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, וְאָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם, אִם אַחַר שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים — מֵתָה, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ!
human_translation: We learned whose year has passed and was lost and found blemished, if after the owner achieved atonement die. a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: We learned: If she passed her year, and got lost and was found to have a blemish, if after the owners had redeemed her - she dies, the teaching of Reish Lakish!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כִּי קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״מֵתָה״ — אַאָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם, אִם אַחַר שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים — תָּמוּת.
human_translation: Reish Lakish say to you: When teaches the first clause die, to lost and found blemished. if after the owner achieved atonement shall die.
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: When the first clause states "died" - it means lost and found with a blemish, if after the owners have redeemed her - she shall die.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא כִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב״, וְאִי בַּעֲלַת מוּם — הָא מְסָאֲבָא וְקַיְימָא!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause: If before the owner achieved atonement it shall graze until it becomes blemished. if blemished, Doesn’t stand blemished?
llm_translation: If so, say the conclusion: "If the owners did not atone, the animal will graze until it becomes blemished," but if it is a blemished female — it will be sold and will endure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָכִי קָאָמַר תַּנָּא: שֶׁאָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם עוֹבֵר, אִם אַחַר שֶׁכִּפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים — מֵתָה, אִם קוֹדֶם שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלִים — תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב בְּמוּם קָבוּעַ, וְתִימָּכֵר.
human_translation: Rabba said this the tanna is saying: where lost and found had a temporary blemish, if after the owner achieved atonement shall die. if before the owner achieved atonement it shall graze until it becomes blemished with a permanent blemish, and it shall be sold.
llm_translation: Rabba said: Thus did the Tanna say: If it got lost and was found with a blemish, the owner transgresses. If after the owners have atoned - it dies. If before the owners have atoned - it shall graze until it develops a permanent blemish, and then it shall be sold.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר, חֲדָא — דְּאִם כֵּן, ״יִשְׁמוֹר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי, וְעוֹד — ״שֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ״ לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא קָתָנֵי?
human_translation: Rava says: two refutations of statement: One that if so, should have taught: One observes And furthermore, whose year has passed, with regard to what halakha is taught?
llm_translation: Rava said: Two responses on the matter, one - if so, "he shall be careful" what is it needed for to teach, and furthermore - "since she has passed a year" what is the halakha that it teaches?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי קָתָנֵי, עִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ וְאָבְדָה, אוֹ אָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם — אַחַר שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים מֵתָה, קוֹדֶם שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב וְתִימָּכֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said This is teaching: whose year has passed and was lost, or was lost and found blemished, after the owner achieved atonement die. before the owner achieved atonement it shall graze until it becomes blemished and it shall be sold.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Thus it was taught: If her sin was revealed and she disappeared, or she disappeared and was found to have a blemish — after the owners have atoned, she shall die; before the owners have atoned, she shall graze until she fattens and is sold.

hebrew_text: וְצָרִיךְ לְמִיתְנֵי ״אִם אָבְדָה״ גַּבֵּי בַּעֲלַת מוּם, וְגַבֵּי עִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, דְּאִי תְּנָא גַּבֵּי שֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָתָם הוּא דְּמַהְנְיָא לַהּ אֲבֵדָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְמִילְּתַהּ, אֲבָל בַּעֲלַת מוּם דְּאִי לָא מוּמָא חַזְיָא — אֵימָא לָא תַּהֲנֵי לֵיהּ אֲבֵדָה.
human_translation: And necessary to teach: If it was lost, with regard to blemished, and with regard to whose year has passed. As if it taught with regard to whose year has passed, I would say: there that lost is effective because it is not fit for its purpose, But a blemished which would fit if not for its blemish, say lost is not effective
llm_translation: And it is necessary to teach "if it is lost" regarding a blemished animal owner, and regarding a pregnant animal that miscarried, for if a Mishnah were to teach regarding a pregnant animal that miscarried, I would say there it is relevant to it being lost, because it does not see its matter, but regarding a blemished animal, if it does not see a blemish, say it is not relevant to it being lost.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תָּנֵי גַּבֵּי בַּעֲלַת מוּם, הָתָם הוּא דְּמַהְנְיָא לַהּ אֲבֵדָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְהַקְרָבָה, אֲבָל עִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ דְּחַזְיָא לְהַקְרָבָה, אֵימָא לָא תַּהֲנֵי לַהּ אֲבֵדָה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught with regard to a blemished there that lost is effective because is not fit for sacrifice But whose year has passed, which is fit for sacrifice say lost is not effective necessary
llm_translation: If it is taught regarding a blemished animal, there it is because it is not fit for offering, since it cannot be brought close. But if it is a pregnant animal, which can be brought close, say it should not be fit for offering. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: אֲבֵידָה דְּלַיְלָה לָא שְׁמַהּ אֲבֵידָה!
human_translation: And did Rava say this, But didn’t Rava say: lost at night is not called lost?
llm_translation: Rava said thus? But didn't Rava say: "A lost object found at night is not called a lost object!"

hebrew_text: לָא דָּמֵי אֲבֵידָה דְּלֵילְיָא — לָא חַזְיָא לָא לְגוּפַהּ וְלָא לִדְמֵי, אֲבָל הָא — נְהִי דִּלְגוּפַהּ לָא חַזְיָא, לִדְמֵי חַזְיָא.
human_translation: not comparable lost at night, it is not fit neither for itself, nor for value, But this granted that it is not fit for itself, it is fit for value.
llm_translation: Not similar to a lost object of a child - not seen neither for itself nor for its likeness, but this - when it is not seen for itself, it is seen for its likeness.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת הַצִּיבּוּר מֵתָה. הָא דְּיָחִיד — מֵתָה!
human_translation: We learned the second shall graze until it becomes blemished, it will be sold, and the money its will be allocated for gift offerings. because a communal sin offering not die. of an individual die.
llm_translation: We learned: The second goat grazes until it becomes blemished, and is sold, and its value is designated as a donation, because the communal sin-offering does not die. As for an individual sin-offering — it dies!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין, וּכְשֶׁהוּא מִתְכַּפֵּר — בְּשֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי מִתְכַּפֵּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: living animals are rejected. And when achieves atonement achieves atonement with the second of the second pair [ zug ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Owners of animals are rejected, and when he atones - in the second of the pair, he atones.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, קַמָּא, הָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּי עִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, וְטַעְמָא דְּצִיבּוּר, הָא דְּיָחִיד — מֵתָה!
human_translation: And the other first is like whose year has passed, And the reason that communal but of an individual, die.
llm_translation: And the other one, the first, had it that when she became pregnant, the reason for the community was that of an individual — she died!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: דְּחוּיִין לְחוּד, וַאֲבוּדִין לְחוּד. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֲבוּדִין — דַּעְתֵּיהּ עֲלֵיהוֹן, דִּילְמָא מִשְׁתַּכְחִין. דְּחוּיִין — לָא הָדָרִי מִתְחֲזַיִין.
human_translation: say to you: rejected is discrete and lost is discrete, What is the reason lost mind is on them, perhaps they found rejected, they do not become fit again,
llm_translation: He said to you: the rejected for the rejected, and the lost for the lost. What is the reason? The lost - his mind is on them, lest they be found. The rejected - they do not return to be seen.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲבוּדָה דְּלַיְלָה לָא שְׁמַהּ אֲבוּדָה. אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן — מַאי אִירְיָא אֲבוּדָה דְּלַיְלָה? אֲפִילּוּ אֲבוּדָה דְּיוֹם נָמֵי, דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: אֲבוּדָה בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה רוֹעָה.
human_translation: the itself, Rava said: lost at night, is not called lost. In accordance with whose If we say in accordance with of the Rabbis, why specifically lost at night? Even if it was lost during the day as the Rabbis say: lost at the time designated graze
llm_translation: Body: Rava said: An item lost at night is not called a lost item. According to whose opinion? If you say according to the opinion of the Rabbis - what is the definition of an item lost at night? Even an item lost during the day, as the Rabbis say: A lost item during the time of separation grazes.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלָּא אֲבֵידָה דְּיוֹם, אֲבָל אֲבֵידָה דְּלַיְלָה — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מוֹדֶה דְּלִרְעִיָּיה אָזְלָא.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Rabbi states only lost during the day, but lost at night, even Rabbi concedes that it goes to graze
llm_translation: And rather, the statement of Rabbi, until here Rabbi did not say, rather a lost item of daytime, but a lost item of nighttime - even Rabbi agrees that it goes to its finder.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, וְהָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּאָבְדָה בִּשְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן אָבְדָה בִּשְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה מֵתָה, אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּעִיקַּר אֲבֵידָתָהּ בַּיּוֹם, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּעִיקַּר אֲבֵידָתָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה — לָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say: Actually, in accordance with of the Rabbis. And Here we are dealing with lost at the time atonement the Rabbis say lost at the time atonement die, only where the initial loss during the day, But where the initial loss at night, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you wish, say: Always according to the opinion of the Rabbis, and here we are dealing with what? — With a lost object at the time of atonement. Up to this point, the Rabbis did not say that if a lost object was lost at the time of atonement, it is considered dead. Rather, where its loss was established during the day, but where its loss was established at night — no. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן, אֲבֵידָה וְלֹא גְּנוּבָה, אֲבֵידָה וְלֹא גְּזוּלָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition lost but not stolen; lost but not robbed.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We have acquired, lost property and not stolen property, lost property and not robbed property.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי אֲבֵידָה? אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת בְּעֶדְרוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַחַת בְּאַחַת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲחוֹרֵי הַדֶּלֶת.
human_translation: What are the circumstances lost? Rabbi Oshaya says: Even one in flock, And even one with one And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: behind the door
llm_translation: "How are the laws of lost property determined?" Rabbi Oshaya said: "Even if one item is in its group, and even if one item is with another." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "Behind the door."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר? אֲחוֹרֵי הַדֶּלֶת הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּקָא חָזֵי לַהּ, אֲבָל אַבָּרַאי דְּאִיכָּא דַּחֲזֵי לַהּ — לָא הָוְיָא אֲבוּדָה, אוֹ דִילְמָא אֲחוֹרֵי הַדֶּלֶת דְּאִי מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ חָזֵי לַהּ — הָוְיָא אֲבוּדָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אַבָּרַאי דְּלָא קָחָזֵי לַהּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the what is he speaking? it is behind the door as there is no one who sees it, but outside where there are who see it, it is not lost? Or perhaps behind the door, where if turn his face he see it, is lost, and all the more so outside, where he does not see it, shall stand
llm_translation: He asked them: How does he say it? Behind the door is where it is not seen, but in the corner where it is seen - it is not considered lost, or perhaps behind the door, if he turns his face, it is seen - it is considered lost, and all the more so in a corner where it is not seen? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: גָּמְרִינַן אֲבוּדָה מִמֶּנּוּ וְלֹא מֵרוֹעָהּ — לָא הָוְיָא אֲבוּדָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אֲבוּדָה מֵרוֹעָהּ וְלֹא אֲבוּדָה מִמֶּנּוּ. אֲבוּדָה מִמֶּנּוּ וּמֵרוֹעָהּ, וְאֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם מַכִּיר בָּהּ — מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: We learn lost from but not from the shepherd it is not lost. And all the more so, lost from the shepherd but not lost from lost from and the shepherd, but one at the end of the world, recognizes what shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: We conclude that if the lost object is from him and not from his shepherd, it is not considered a lost object. Certainly, if the lost object is from his shepherd and not from him, it is considered a lost object. If the lost object is from him and from his shepherd, and one recognizes it at the end of the world - what is the law? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: אֲבוּדָה בַּכּוֹס מַהוּ? אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי — הָאָמַר אֲבוּדָה בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה מֵתָה!
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: lost, what is in a cup In accordance with whose If we say in accordance with of Rabbi didn’t say lost at the time designated die?
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Papa: Avudah bakos mah? Alibba de'man? Ileima alibba de'Rabbi - ha'amar Avudah bish'at hafarashah metah! Rav Papa asked: What is the status of a lost object in a cup? According to whom? Perhaps according to Rabbi - who said, "A lost object during the time of separation is considered dead!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, מִי אָמְרִינַן: כִּי אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה רוֹעָה, קוֹדֶם שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל דָּמָהּ בַּכּוֹס, אֲבָל הָכָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ: כָּל הָעוֹמֵד לִיזָּרֵק כְּזָרוּק דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, when raises the dilemma, according to of the Rabbis, Do we say when the Rabbis said: lost at the time designated graze, before one collects the blood in a cup; but here, the hold: Any that stands to be sprinkled is considered like sprinkled,
llm_translation: Rather, when Abaye sought to ask a question of the Sages, did we not say: When the Sages say "a shepherd," they mean before it receives its blood in the cup, but here it seems to them: Anyone who stands to pour out blood is considered as if he poured out blood.
