llm_translation: What is the reason? If we do not hear, I would say the reason of Rabbi Meir is not because of "taking the first language," but rather this is the reason - a sin offering mixed with a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ כִּי אָמַר ״חֶצְיָהּ חַטָּאת״, וַהֲדַר אָמַר ״חֶצְיָהּ עוֹלָה״, קְרֵיבָה — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: And even if one said: Half a sin offering, and then said: Half of it a burnt offering, is sacrificed. teaches us that not
llm_translation: "And even if he said, 'Half of it is a sin offering,' and then he said, 'Half of it is a burnt offering,' bringing it near - it is evident to us that it is not so."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אָמַר ״בְּהֵמָה זוֹ חֶצְיָהּ עוֹלָה וְחֶצְיָהּ שְׁלָמִים״ — קְדוֹשָׁה, וְאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה, עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, וּתְמוּרָתָהּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: It is taught another one who said: This animal, half of it a burnt offering and half of it a peace offering, is consecrated but is not sacrificed. renders a substitute, and its substitute like it,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other one said, "With this animal, half of it is a burnt offering and half of it is a peace offering" — it is sanctified, but it is not brought as an offering. It makes an exchange, and its exchange is like it.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, פְּשִׁיטָא דִּקְדוֹשָׁה וְאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה!
human_translation: whose It is Rabbi Yosei, obvious that consecrated but is not sacrificed?
llm_translation: Who is it? It is Rabbi Yosei, it is obvious that she is holy and not close!

hebrew_text: תְּמוּרָתָהּ אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, דְּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נְהִי דְּהִיא לָא קָרְבָה — תְּמוּרָתָהּ תִּקְרַב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. מַאי שְׁנָא הִיא דְּלָא קָרְבָה — דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָה, תְּמוּרָתָהּ נָמֵי מִכֹּחַ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָה קָאָתְיָא.
human_translation: It was necessary its substitute Lest you say: Granted that itself is not sacrificed, its substitute is sacrificed, teaches us What is different itself, that it is not sacrificed? because its sanctity is deferred So too its substitute, comes from the force of deferred sanctity,
llm_translation: Its exchange is necessary for it, for what reason? You might say: "If it did not come close - its exchange will come close," this is what he teaches us. What is the difference if it did not come close? - Because it would have a lesser degree of holiness, its exchange also comes from a lesser degree of holiness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִים, הִקְדִּישׁ חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְחָזַר וְלָקַח חֶצְיָהּ אַחֶרֶת וְהִקְדִּישָׁהּ — קְדוֹשָׁה וְאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה, וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, וּתְמוּרָתָהּ
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an animal to two partners, consecrated his half and then he acquired the other half and consecrated it, is consecrated but is not sacrificed. renders a substitute, and its substitute
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In an animal belonging to two partners, if one consecrated its half, then took another half and consecrated it - it is consecrated but not brought as an offering, and it makes an exchange, and its exchange.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ. שְׁמַע מִינָּה תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינָּה קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים (נִדְחָה) [מְדַחָה].
human_translation: like it, Conclude three from this Conclude from it sanctity value is deferred.
llm_translation: "Such as it is. Hear from it three: hear from it the holiness of blood (rejected) rejects."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינָּה, בַּעֲלֵי (מוּמִין) [חַיִּים] נִדְחִין, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דִּיחוּי מֵעִיקָּרוֹ הָוֵי דִּיחוּי.
human_translation: And conclude from it living animals are deferred. And conclude from it that deferral at the outset, is disqualification.
llm_translation: And hear from it, owners of blemishes are rejected, and hear from it rejection from its inception is considered rejection.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר ״חֶצְיָהּ עוֹלָה וְחֶצְיָהּ מַעֲשֵׂר״ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עוֹלָה קְרֵיבָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone concedes where one said: Half a burnt offering and half of it tithe, everyone agrees sacrificed a burnt offering,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees in a case where it says, "Half of it is a burnt offering and half of it is a tithe" - all agree that it is entirely considered a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר ״חֶצְיָהּ תְּמוּרָה וְחֶצְיָהּ מַעֲשֵׂר״, מַאי?
human_translation: where one said Half of a substitute and half of it tithe, What
llm_translation: Here where it says, "half of it is exchanged and half of it is tithed," what is meant?

hebrew_text: תְּמוּרָה קְרֵיבָה, שֶׁכֵּן נוֹהֶגֶת בְּכׇל הַקֳּדָשִׁים, אוֹ דִלְמָא מַעֲשֵׂר קְרֵיבָה, שֶׁכֵּן מַקְדִּישׁ לְפָנָיו וּלְאַחֲרָיו? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: sacrificed as a substitute, as applies to all sacrificial Or perhaps is sacrificed as tithe, as he consecrates before and after shall stand
llm_translation: Exchange offering, close, as so practiced in all the holy things, or perhaps tithe offering, close, as so sanctifying before him and after him? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זוֹ תַּחַת זוֹ״, ״תְּמוּרַת זוֹ״, ״חֲלִיפַת זוֹ״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ תְּמוּרָה. ״זוֹ מְחוּלֶּלֶת עַל זוֹ״ — אֵין זוֹ תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: This is hereby in place of that the substitute of that the exchange for that that is a substitute. This is desacralized, to that that is not a substitute.
llm_translation: Mishnah: "Harei zo tachat zo," "temurat zo," "chalifat zo" - harei zo temurah. "Zo mekhu'lelet al zo" - ein zo temurah.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה הֶקְדֵּשׁ בַּעַל מוּם — יוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין, וְצָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים.
human_translation: And if the consecrated was blemished, and assumes non-sacred is required to conduct value
llm_translation: "And if the consecrated animal had a blemish - it goes out to common use, and it is necessary to perform blood (ritual)."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּתַחַת לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַתְפּוֹסֵי הוּא, וּרְמִינְהוּ: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, אָמַר ״חֲלִיפַת זוֹ״ ״תְּמוּרַת זוֹ״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: to say that In place of [ taḥat ], is a term that associating And raises a contradiction a consecrated animal Temple maintenance, he said: the exchange for that substitute of that he has not said anything,
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the statement that is underneath the pillow, and they raised a dilemma: the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard, he said "exchange of this" "substitution of this" — he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: ״תַּחַת זוֹ״, ״מְחוּלֶּלֶת עַל זוֹ״ — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: in place of [ taḥat ] that desacralized, to that his statement takes effect,
llm_translation: "Under this," "desecrated upon this" - his words stand.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאִיתְּפוֹסֵי הִיא, מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא?
human_translation: And if it enters your mind is a term that associating what is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind to say that it is dependent on the first part, what is the difference between the beginning and the end?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״תַּחַת״ מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאִיתְּפוֹסֵי וְלִישָּׁנָא דְּאַחוֹלֵי. לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַתְפּוֹסֵי, דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Abaye said, You find In place of [ taḥat ], is a term that associating and is a term that desacralization. a term that associating as it is written:
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Tachat" you forget to her to sleep of those who are grasping and to sleep of those who are eating. To sleep of those who are grasping, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״וְאִם תַּחְתֶּיהָ תַּעֲמוֹד הַבַּהֶרֶת״.
human_translation: “But if the white leprous spot stays in its place [ taḥteha ]”
llm_translation: "And if it is beneath it, the leprosy shall stand still."

hebrew_text: דְּאַחוֹלֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״תַּחַת הַנְּחוֹשֶׁת אָבִיא זָהָב״, וְהִלְכָּךְ, גַּבֵּי קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ דְּעָבְדִין תְּמוּרָה — לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַתְפּוֹסֵי הוּא, גַּבֵּי קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת דְּלָא עָבְדִין תְּמוּרָה — לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַחוֹלֵי הוּא.
human_translation: that desacralization, as it is written: “In place of [ taḥat ] brass I will bring gold, And therefore, With regard to consecrated altar, which render a substitute, is a term that associating With regard to consecrated for Temple maintenance, which do not render a substitute, is a term that desacralization.
llm_translation: The text reads: "For it is written: 'Under the bronze I will bring gold.' Therefore, regarding the holy items of the altar where they perform substitution — it is similar to the case of the showbread, for the holy items of the Temple floor where they do not perform substitution — it is similar to the case of the showbread."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַחוֹלֵי הוּא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה הֶקְדֵּשׁ בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: Rava said: Even consecrated altar, you find is a term that desacralization. For example, where a consecrated was blemished
llm_translation: Rava said: Even in the holy things of the altar, she forgets to eat, it is like the case of the holy thing that has a blemish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַעַל מוּם נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַחוֹלֵי, וּמַשְׁכַּחַת לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַתְפּוֹסֵי. יָדוֹ אַקּוֹדֶשׁ — חוֹל הָוֵי, יָדוֹ אַחוֹל — קוֹדֶשׁ הָוֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ashi said: Even in a blemished you find is a term that desacralization and you find is a term that associating hand on the consecrated is desacralization, hand on the non-sacred is consecrated
llm_translation: Rabbi Ashei said: Even in a Baal Mum (blemished animal) one is liable for forgetting to let it rest, and one is liable for forgetting to make it rest. If his hand is sanctified - it is profane, if his hand is profane - it is sanctified.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי אַבָּיֵי: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ בַּעֲלוֹת מוּם, וּשְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין תְּמִימוֹת, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ תַּחַת אֵלּוּ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Abaye raises a dilemma: there were before him two sacrificial animals were blemished and two non-sacred animals were unblemished,and, he says: These are hereby in place of [ taḥat ] those what is
llm_translation: Inquires Abaye: Were before him two consecrated blemished animals, and two mundane unblemished animals, and he said, "These are in place of these," what is the law?

hebrew_text: מִי אָמַר לְאַתְפּוֹסֵי וְלָקֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶיתֵּרָא — לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ הֶיתֵּרָא וְעָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא?
human_translation: Did he say as association, and he is flogged Or perhaps, anywhere that there exists a permitted a person does not cast aside the permitted and perform the prohibition?
llm_translation: Who said to Atfosei and Lakei, or perhaps: wherever there is a leniency - a person does not leave a leniency and create a stringency?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶיתֵּרָא לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ וְעָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ, וְאַחַת מֵהֶן בַּעֲלַת מוּם, וּשְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְאַחַת מֵהֶן בַּעֲלַת מוּם, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ תַּחַת אֵלּוּ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: And if you say anywhere that there exists a permitted a person does not cast aside and perform the prohibition, there were before him two sacrificial animals, one of which was blemished and two non-sacred animals, one of which was blemished and he said: These are hereby in place of [ taḥat ] those what is
llm_translation: "And if you might say, wherever there is a permission, a person does not leave it and engage in prohibition, if there were before him two consecrated animals, and one of them is blemished, and two non-consecrated animals, and one of them is blemished, and he said, 'These are in place of these,' what is the law?"

hebrew_text: מִי אָמַר: תְּמִימָה תַּחַת תְּמִימָה — לְאַתְפּוֹסֵי, בַּעֲלַת מוּם תַּחַת בַּעֲלַת מוּם — לְאַחוֹלֵי.
human_translation: Did he say the unblemished in place of the unblemished to associate the blemished in place of the blemished to desacralize
llm_translation: Who said: "Perfect under perfect - to establish, blemished under blemished - to exempt."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, תְּמִימָה דְּחוּלִּין תַּחַת בַּעֲלַת מוּם דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, בַּעֲלַת מוּם דְּחוּלִּין תַּחַת תְּמִימָה דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ לָקֵי?
human_translation: Or perhaps, the unblemished non-sacred in place of the blemished consecrated the blemished non-sacred in place of the unblemished consecrated and flogged for both
llm_translation: Or perhaps, a blemished animal of mundane status beneath a blemish-free consecrated animal, a blemish-free consecrated animal beneath a blemished animal of mundane status, and both are fit?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶיתֵּירָא — לָא עָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, וּלְאַחוֹלֵי הוּא, וְלָא לָקֵי. הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ, וְאַחַת מֵהֶן בַּעֲלַת מוּם, וְשָׁלֹשׁ בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין תְּמִימוֹת, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ תַּחַת אֵלּוּ״.
human_translation: And if you say anywhere that there exists a permitted does not perform the prohibition, to desacralize and not flogged there were three sacrificial animals before him, one of which was blemished and three non-sacred animals, were unblemished, and he said: These are hereby in place of [ taḥat ] those
llm_translation: And if you might say, wherever there is a leniency - it does not create a prohibition, and it is permissible, and not liable. There were before him three consecrated animals, and one of them had a blemish, and three unblemished mundane animals, and he said: "These are in place of these."

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן, מִדִּתְמִימוֹת תַּחַת תְּמִימוֹת לְאַתְפּוֹסֵי, תְּמִימוֹת נָמֵי תַּחַת בַּעֲלַת מוּם לְאַתְפּוֹסֵי? אוֹ דִלְמָא, הָכָא נָמֵי, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶיתֵּירָא לָא עָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, וְהַהִיא בָּתְרָיְיתָא לְאַחוֹלֵי הָוֵי.
human_translation: Do we say since the unblemished in place of the unblemished to associate so too the unblemished in place of the blemished to associate Or perhaps, here too anywhere that there exists a permitted does not perform the prohibition. this latter to desacralize
llm_translation: We say, from the category of wholesome in place of wholesome to disqualify, wholesome indeed in place of blemished to disqualify? Or perhaps, here indeed, wherever there is an option, one does not create a prohibition, and that subsequent one is to permit, it shall be.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר, הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּאַכַּתִּי גַּבְרָא לָא אִיתַּחְזַק בְּאִיסּוּרֵי, לָא שָׁבֵיק הֶתֵּירָא וְעָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו אַרְבַּע בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ וְאַחַת מֵהֶן בַּעֲלַת מוּם, וְאַרְבַּע בְּהֵמוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ תַּחַת אֵלּוּ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: And if you say here too, since man not established as a prohibition, does not cast aside the permitted and perform the prohibition, Rav Ashi raises dilemma: there were four sacrificial animals before him, one of which was blemished and four non-sacred animals, and he said: These are hereby in place of [ taḥat ] those what is
llm_translation: And if you might say, here too, since a man has engaged in intercourse, he is not firmly established in prohibitions, he does not leave the fear and perform the prohibition. Rav Ashi asked: If before him there were four consecrated animals, and one of them is blemished, and four non-consecrated animals, and he said, "These are in place of those," what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: הָכָא וַדַּאי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתַּחְזַק גַּבְרָא בְּאִיסּוּרֵי (בְּכוּלָּן), לָקֵי בְּאַרְבַּע מַלְקִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Here, since certain man established as a prohibition. flogged four lashes
llm_translation: Here certainly, since a man is established in prohibitions (all of them), he is liable for four types of lashes.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיתַּחְזַק בְּאִיסּוּרָא, לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ הֶיתֵּירָא וְעָבֵיד אִיסּוּרָא, וְהָוֵי בָּתְרָיְיתָא לְאַחוֹלֵי הָוֵי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, even though established as the prohibition, a person does not cast aside the permitted and perform the prohibition. And this latter to desacralize shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps, even though he is established in prohibition, a person does not leave the permitted and does the prohibition, and it turns out that he is in a situation of "after the fact" to eat? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה הֶקְדֵּשׁ בַּעַל מוּם יֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין כּוּ׳.
human_translation: If the consecrated was blemished, is desacralized.
llm_translation: If there was a blemished consecrated animal, it goes out to ordinary (non-consecrated) status.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, וְצָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אַף צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים דְּבַר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: is desacralized by Torah law But by rabbinic law, is required to conduct value And Reish Lakish says: Even the requirement to conduct value by Torah law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who goes out to secular matters from matters of Torah, and needs to make blood from their words, and Reish Lakish said: Also needs to make blood from matters of Torah.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִי נֵימָא אַאוֹנָאָה, בְּהָא נֵימָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַף צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים דְּבַר תּוֹרָה?
human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say in exploitation Reish Lakish say even the requirement to conduct value by Torah law?
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say with regard to a miscarriage, in this case Reish Lakish also needs to perform the blood ritual of a Torah matter?

hebrew_text: וְהָא תְנַן: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה: הָעֲבָדִים, וְהַשְּׁטָרוֹת, וְהַקַּרְקָעוֹת, וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn These are matters that, are not exploitation: Slaves, documents, lands, and consecrated property.
llm_translation: And this we learned in a Mishnah: These are the things that have no onaah (unfair advantage): slaves, contracts, real estate, and consecrated items!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַבִּטּוּל מִקָּח בְּהָא נֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם?
human_translation: Rather, of nullification of a transaction, Rabbi Yoḥanan say required to conduct value by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: Rather, Avitul nullifies the transaction with this statement: Rabbi Yochanan needs to make blood from their words?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אַקַּרְקָעוֹת דְּחוּלִּין, וְרַבִּי יוֹנָה אָמַר אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, תַּרְוַויְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: אוֹנָאָה אֵין לָהֶן, בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח יֵשׁ לָהֶם!
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yirmeya say with regard to non-sacred lands, and Rabbi Yona said with regard to consecrated property, and both of them said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They are not exploitation, they are nullification of a transaction,
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Yirmeya said "Akkarke'ot of Chulin," and Rabbi Yonah said "Ahekdeishot," they both agree in the name of Rabbi Yochanan who said: "Ona'ah they do not have, they have the option of annulment of purchase!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אַבִּיטּוּל מִקָּח, וְאֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Actually, of nullification of a transaction, and reverse
llm_translation: Forever Avituil from purchase, and Eifoch.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ אֵיפוֹךְ? הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אַקַּרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: But how can you say reverse This works out well according to the one who says that consecrated property all the more so that lands
llm_translation: "And who found you saying the opposite? It is preferable according to the one who said 'holy things,' and all the more so 'flooring.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַקַּרְקָעוֹת, אֲבָל הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת אֵין לָהֶן בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח, הֵיכִי אֵיפוֹךְ לְהָא?
human_translation: But according to the one who said that lands but consecrated property there is no nullification of a transaction, how he reverse that
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "plowed fields," but consecrated items do not have annulment of acquisition, how should he respond?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: do not reverse
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: "Do not turn it over."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מְחוּלָּל. דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָה לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: Shall we say they disagree with regard to of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: Consecrated property worth one hundred dinars [ maneh ] that one desacralized, to worth one peruta , is desacralized. that Rabbi Yona is not of Shmuel, and Rabbi Yirmeya is of of Shmuel.
llm_translation: Let us say according to Shmuel, for Shmuel said: A consecration equal to a Maneh is effective for one who has desecrated an equal amount of a Perutah. Rabbi Yonah does not hold like Shmuel, and Rabbi Yirmeya does hold like Shmuel.

hebrew_text: לָא, בֵּין דְּמָר וּבֵין דְּמָר — אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָה סָבַר: כִּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל — דִּיעֲבַד, אֲבָל לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא אָמַר, וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: No; both this Sage and that Sage are of of Shmuel. that Rabbi Yona maintains when Shmuel stated after the fact, but he did not say ab initio ; and Rabbi Yirmeya maintains even ab initio .
llm_translation: Not, between Mar and between Mar - there is one that is Shmuel, for Rabbi Yonah holds: when Shmuel said - after the fact, but not initially did he say, and Rabbi Yirmiyah holds: even initially.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ מַתְנִיתִין ״אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים... הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת״ — כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: If you wish, say Actually, do not reverse And that which a difficulty for you the mishna: These are matters consecrated property, in accordance with Rav Ḥisda.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Indeed, do not reverse it, and the difficulty is for you from the Mishnah, 'These are the things... holy things' — as in the teaching of Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה — אֵינָן בְּתוֹרַת אוֹנָאָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּדֵי אוֹנָאָה חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said: Are not exploitation? they are not principles of exploitation As, even less than the measure of exploitation, one may renege
llm_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said: They do not have ona'ah - they are not subject to the laws of ona'ah, for even if less than the amount of ona'ah is returned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: לָא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּשָׁמוּי בִּתְרֵי, אֲבָל בְּשָׁמוּי בִּתְלָתָא, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָתֵי בְּמֵאָה — לָא הָדַר.
human_translation: Ulla said: said only was assessed by two But was assessed by three even if one hundred came one not return
llm_translation: Ulla said: They only said this regarding Shemui B'trei, but regarding Shemui B'tlata, even though it comes in a hundred - it does not return.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: הֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן מְאָה כִּתְרֵי וּתְרֵי כִּמְאָה? לְעִנְיַן עֵדוּת, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן אוּמְדָּנָא — בָּתַר דֵּעוֹת אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Safra say: Where did one say one hundred are like two and two are like one hundred to the matter of testimony. But to matter of assessments, we follow opinions.
llm_translation: I? And did not Rav Safra say: Where do we say one hundred is like two and two is like one hundred? For matters of testimony, but for matters of estimation - we follow the majority opinion.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ תְּלָתָא וּתְלָתָא, לָא אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר בָּתְרָא? דְּיַד הֶקְדֵּשׁ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה!
human_translation: And furthermore, three and three don’t we follow the latter that the consecrated has the advantage?
llm_translation: And if three and three, do we not go one after the other? For "the hand of the Holy One, blessed be He, is upon the uppermost!"

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר עוּלָּא: צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת דָּמִים מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם, וְכֹל דְּרַבָּנַן אַקִּילוּ בֵּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Ulla holds is required to conduct value by rabbinic law, and the Sages were lenient all rabbinic laws.
llm_translation: He held: one must make blood from their words, and all that the Rabbis were lenient with, the Rabbis were lenient with it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זוֹ תַּחַת עוֹלָה״, ״תַּחַת חַטָּאת״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״תַּחַת חַטָּאת זוֹ״, וְ״תַחַת עוֹלָה זוֹ״, ״תַּחַת חַטָּאת וְתַחַת עוֹלָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בַּבַּיִת״ — הָיָה לוֹ, דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִים.
human_translation: This is hereby in place of a burnt offering, in place of a sin offering, he has said nothing, in place of this sin offering, or: in place of this burnt offering, in place of a sin offering or: in place of a burnt offering that I have in the house, he had his statement stands,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, this is in place of a burnt offering," "in place of a sin offering" - he did not say anything. "In place of this sin offering," and "in place of this burnt offering," "in place of a sin offering and in place of a burnt offering that I have in the house" - if he had, his words are upheld.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עַל הַבְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה וְעַל בַּעֲלַת מוּם ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ עוֹלָה״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָה״ — יִמָּכְרוּ, וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶם עוֹלָה.
human_translation: said with regard to a non-kosher animal and with regard to a blemished animal: These are hereby a burnt offering, he has said nothing. These are hereby for a burnt offering, should be sold, and he brings a burnt offering with the money their
llm_translation: He said regarding an impure animal and regarding a blemished animal, "These are for a burnt offering" — he did not say anything. "These are for a burnt offering" — they should be sold, and with their value bring a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר — הָא אֵין אָדָם מוֹצִיא דְּבָרָיו לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as, if it in accordance with Rabbi Meir, didn’t A person does not utter a statement for naught.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Mishnaic teachings that are not like Rabbi Meir, for if they were like Rabbi Meir — behold, a person does not bring forth his words to be nullified.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָה״ — יִמָּכְרוּ וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹלָה. טַעְמָא דִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה וּבַעֲלַת מוּם, דְּלָא חַזְיָין — לָא בָּעֲיָין מוּמָא, אֲבָל מַפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְאָשָׁם אוֹ לְעוֹלָה — בָּעֲיָין מוּמָא.
human_translation: These hereby for a burnt offering, should be sold, and he brings a burnt offering with the money The reason that non-kosher and blemished animals, which are not fit they do not require a blemish But one who separates a female for a guilt offering or for a burnt offering, require a blemish
llm_translation: "Behold, these are for a burnt offering" - they shall be sold, and the proceeds brought as a burnt offering. The reason for an unclean animal and one with a blemish, that they are not fit - they do not require a blemish, but if one designates a female for a guilt offering or a burnt offering - a blemish is required.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תִּימָּכֵר שֶׁלֹּא בְּמוּם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as we learned Rabbi Shimon says: it may be sold without a blemish,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The Mishnah is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as we learned, Rabbi Shimon says: "It shall be sold without a blemish."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד מַעֲרִימִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you, how do we lift.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּל הָאֲסוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ אוֹסְרִין בְּכׇל שֶׁהֵן — הָרוֹבֵעַ וְהַנִּרְבָּע, וְהַמּוּקְצֶה וְהַנֶּעֱבָד, וְהָאֶתְנַן וְהַמְּחִיר, וְהַכִּלְאַיִם וְהַטְּרֵפָה, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן.
human_translation: all whose on the altar is prohibited, they prohibit in any amount, An animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality, and the set-aside, and one was worshipped, and payment or price or diverse kinds, or an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], or born by caesarean section.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All that are forbidden regarding the altar forbid in all that they are — the quartered animal, the animal with a perforated lung, the animal with a cut-off member, the animal that was worked, the exchanged animal, the redeemed animal, the animal with a blemish, the animal that is a trefe, and the offspring of a consecrated animal.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ מוּקְצֶה? הַמּוּקְצֶה לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הוּא אָסוּר וּמַה שֶּׁעָלָיו מוּתָּר. וְאֵיזֶהוּ הַנֶּעֱבָד? כֹּל שֶׁעוֹבְדִין אוֹתוֹ, הוּא וּמַה שֶּׁעָלָיו אָסוּר. וְזֶה וָזֶה מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Which is the set-aside? that is set aside for idol worship. itself is prohibited, but that which is upon it, is permitted And which is was worshipped? any that worships itself and that which is upon it is prohibited. And the consumption of both this, and that, is permitted.
llm_translation: Which is the boundary? The boundary for foreign worship, it is forbidden and what is upon it is permitted. And which is the one that is worshipped? Anything that is worshipped, it and what is upon it is forbidden. And this and that are permitted for consumption.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר מָר: אוֹסְרִין בְּכׇל שֶׁהֵן, דְּלָא בָּטְלִי בְּרוּבָּא. תְּנֵינָא: כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ בְּחַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת אוֹ בְּשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד בְּרִבּוֹא — יָמוּתוּ.
human_translation: The Master said prohibit in any amount. that they are not nullified by a majority. we learn All the sacrificial that were intermingled with sin offerings die, or with an ox that is stoned, even one in ten thousand, they must die.
llm_translation: Gemara said: Mar said: They forbid in all cases, because they are not nullified in the majority. We learned in a Mishnah: All consecrated items that became mixed with sin-offerings of the dead or with the stoned ox, even if one in the majority - they shall die.

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁיָא לַן, מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: And difficult for us: What is it saying?
llm_translation: And it is difficult for us, what is it saying?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָתָנֵי: נִתְעָרְבוּ בָּהֶן מֵחַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת, אוֹ שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל — אֲפִילּוּ בְּרִבּוֹא יָמוּתוּ.
human_translation: this is teaching: intermingled with them of sin offerings that die or with an ox that is stoned, even in ten thousand and they must die.
llm_translation: So it was taught: If they were mixed with them sins deserving of death, or an ox that was stoned — even with the majority they shall die.

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּאִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָאו אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה — אֵימָא: לִיבְטֵל בְּרוּבָּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say there, as items from which benefit is prohibited. But here, where not items from which benefit is prohibited, say: Let them be nullified by a majority teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: there, where it is regarding prohibitions of benefit, but here, where it is not regarding prohibitions of benefit — say: let it be nullified by the majority, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹבַע וְנִרְבָּע נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: נִתְעָרְבוּ רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע — יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵי יָפֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן מֵאוֹתוֹ הַמִּין!
human_translation: But we learn an animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality, as well: were intermingled an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, they shall graze until they become unfit and sold, and shall bring with the monetary value of higher-quality among them from the same species
llm_translation: And a quarter and a half of the value of the estate: If they mixed a quarter and a half - they shall graze until they become fat, and then be sold, and bring in the value of the best of their kind!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, אָמַר לִי: חֲדָא בְּחוּלִּין, וַחֲדָא בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said this halakha before Rav Shimi bar Ashi, said to me one where non-sacred, And the other where consecrated,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said it to be heard before Rav Shimei bar Ashi, he said to me: one in mundane matters, and one in holy matters.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיסִי, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי חוּלִּין — אֵימָא לִיבְטְלוּ.
human_translation: And are necessary, as had taught us with regard to sacrificial because repulsive, But with regard to non-sacred, say: Let them be nullified
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear regarding holy things — because they are despised, but regarding mundane things — one might say they should be nullified.

hebrew_text: וּבְחוּלִּין נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: וְאֵלּוּ אֲסוּרִין וְאוֹסְרִין בְּכׇל שֶׁהֵן — יֵין נֶסֶךְ, וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְצִיפֳּרֵי מְצוֹרָע, וְעוֹרוֹת לְבוּבִין.
human_translation: But we also learn with regard to non-sacred And these are prohibited and deem prohibited in any amount: Wine a libation and idol worship, and birds of a leper and hides the heart,
llm_translation: In Hullin we learned: And these are the ones that are prohibited and render everything they touch prohibited — wine libation, idolatry, the bird offerings of a leper, and the skins of the heart.

hebrew_text: וְשֵׂיעַר נָזִיר, וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, וּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, וְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה, וְשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אֲסוּרִין וְאוֹסְרִין בְּכׇל שֶׁהֵן!
human_translation: And the hair of a nazirite and a firstborn donkey and meat in milk and an ox that is stoned; and a heifer whose neck is broken and non-sacred that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard, and the scapegoat these prohibited and they deem prohibited in any amount.
llm_translation: And a hairy Nazirite, and a firstborn donkey, and meat cooked in milk, and a stoned ox, and a decapitated calf, and unsanctified offerings that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard, and a scapegoat — behold, these are forbidden and forbid everything they touch!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָתָם — דְּאִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה דְּלָא בָּטְלִי, אֲבָל הָכָא — לִיבְטְלִי.
human_translation: are necessary, as had taught us there, where they are from which benefit is prohibited, that they are not nullified; but here, let them be nullified.
llm_translation: I need, for if we were to hear there - that prohibitions of benefit are not nullified, but here - they are nullified.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הָכָא, דִּלְגָבוֹהַּ דִּמְאִיס, אֲבָל לְהֶדְיוֹט — אֵימָא: אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה לִיבְטְלוּ בְּרוּבָּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And had taught us here, as that repulsive to the Most High. But to an ordinary person [ hedyot ], say: Let items from which benefit is prohibited be nullified by a majority. teaches us
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here, that regarding one who despises, but for a layman — say: prohibitions of benefit may be nullified by the majority, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, מְנָלַן דַּאֲסִירִי לְגָבוֹהַּ? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״ — לְהוֹצִיא רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע.
human_translation: an animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality. From where do we that are prohibited to the Most High? as the Sages taught “from the cattle” to exclude an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality
llm_translation: And a quarter and a half, from where do we know that they are forbidden for a high priest? For the Rabbis taught: "From the animal" - to exclude a quarter and a half.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא, וּמָה בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֶבְדָה בּוֹ עֲבֵירָה פָּסוּל לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע שֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בָּהֶן עֲבֵירָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֲסוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ?!
human_translation: couldn’t this inference: And if a blemished with which no transgression was committed, is disqualified from the altar, an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality, with which a transgression was committed, is it not logical that they prohibited on the altar?
llm_translation: And isn't this the law? And what about a blemished animal that has not been used for idolatry, it is disqualified for the altar, but an animal that has been sodomized or bestiality has been performed with it - is it not the law that they are prohibited for the altar?!

hebrew_text: חוֹרֵשׁ בְּשׁוֹר וַחֲמוֹר יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בּוֹ עֲבֵירָה, וּמוּתָּר לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: plowing with an ox and a donkey shall prove where a transgression was committed with and permitted upon the altar.
llm_translation: One who plows with an ox and a donkey may prove, for it was worked with a transgression, and it is permitted regarding the altar.

hebrew_text: מָה לְחוֹרֵשׁ בְּשׁוֹר וַחֲמוֹר, שֶׁאֵין חַיָּיבִין מִיתָה, תֹּאמַר בְּרוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, שֶׁחַיָּיבִין מִיתָה.
human_translation: What about plows with an ox and a donkey? in that one is not liable to die you say with regard to an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality, where is liable to die?
llm_translation: What about one who plows with an ox and a donkey, that they are not liable to death penalty? You would say in the case of planting and sowing, that they are liable to death penalty.

hebrew_text: טוֹל לָךְ מָה שֶׁהֵבֵאתָה, הֲרֵי שֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בָּהֶן עֲבֵירָה בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים.
human_translation: retract from that which you cited with which a transgression was committed by two witnesses,
llm_translation: Take for yourself that which you have brought, for it has been used in them for a transgression with two witnesses.

hebrew_text: נֶעֶבְדָה בָּהֶן עֲבֵירָה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד, אוֹ עַל פִּי הַבְּעָלִים, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: From where a transgression was committed with them on the basis of one witness or on the basis of the owners?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Was a transgression committed through them based on the testimony of one witness, or based on the testimony of the owners, from where?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֲנִי דָּן, וּמָה בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁאֵין הַתְרָאַת שְׁנֵי עֵדִים פּוֹסַלְתּוֹ מֵאֲכִילָה — הוֹדָאַת עֵד אֶחָד פּוֹסַלְתּוֹ מֵהַקְרָבָה, בְּרוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע שֶׁהוֹדָאַת שְׁנֵי עֵדִים פּוֹסַלְתּוֹ מֵאֲכִילָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁהוֹדָאַת עֵד אֶחָד פּוֹסַלְתּוֹ מֵהַקְרָבָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: I infer And if a blemished which the testimony of two witnesses does not disqualify it from being eaten the admission of one witness, disqualifies it from sacrifice, with regard to an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality, which the admission of two witnesses disqualifies it from being eaten is it not logical that the admission of one witness disqualify it from sacrifice?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: I judge, and what about a blemished animal that the warning of two witnesses does not disqualify it from being eaten - the admission of one witness disqualifies it from being offered, in the case of a quarter or half, where the admission of two witnesses disqualifies it from being eaten - it is not the law that the admission of one witness disqualifies it from being offered!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״ לְהוֹצִיא רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, וְהָא אָתְיָא מִדִּינָא (לָא אָתְיָא)!
human_translation: the verse states: “From the cattle,” to exclude an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality But inferred through inference cannot be inferred
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches to say "from the animal" to exclude a quarter and a half, and this comes from the law (it does not come)!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּדִינָא פִּירְכָא — מָה לְבַעַל מוּם שֶׁכֵּן מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: because one can say that the refutation of the inference the basic What about a blemished in that its blemish is conspicuous,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Because there is to say from the beginning of the judgment, the blemish is apparent — just as the blemish of the Baal Mum is recognized.

hebrew_text: תֹּאמַר בְּרוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, שֶׁאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר יְהֵא כָּשֵׁר לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״, לְהוֹצִיא רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע.
human_translation: you say with regard to an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality, whose blemish is not conspicuous? Since its blemish is not conspicuous, should be fit for the altar, the verse states: “From the cattle,” to exclude an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality
llm_translation: You shall say in the case of a quarter and a half, that its blemish is not recognizable, since its blemish is not recognizable, it shall be valid with regard to the altar - the Talmud says "from the animal," to exclude a quarter and a half.

hebrew_text: מִן הַבָּקָר — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנֶּעֱבָד, וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא: וּמָה אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר שֶׁצִּיפּוּיָין מוּתָּרִין — הֵן אֲסוּרִין, נֶעֱבָד שֶׁצִּיפּוּיוֹ אָסוּר — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר?
human_translation: “from the herd” to exclude that is worshipped. Could this not inference: And if payment price that their coating, is permitted they are prohibited, worshipped, that its coating is prohibited, is it not logical that it prohibited
llm_translation: From the morning — to bring out the consecrated animal, and is it not the law: And what we have learned and the price of the anticipated ones are permitted — they are forbidden, a consecrated animal whose anticipation is forbidden — is it not the law that it is forbidden?

hebrew_text: אוֹ חִילּוּף, וּמָה אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין — צִיפּוּיֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין, נֶעֱבָד שֶׁמּוּתָּר — יְהֵא צִיפּוּיוֹ מוּתָּר?
human_translation: Or reverse And if payment or price as they are prohibited their coating is permitted, worshipped, as permitted its coating should be permitted
llm_translation: Or chiluf, and what we learned and the price that they are forbidden - their covering is permitted, if it was served that it is permitted - should its covering be permitted?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן בִּיטַּלְתָּ ״לֹא תַחְמוֹד כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב עֲלֵיהֶם וְלָקַחְתָּ לָךְ״!
human_translation: if so, you have nullified you shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it to you”
llm_translation: "If so, you have annulled 'You shall not covet silver and gold upon them, and you shall take for yourself'!"

hebrew_text: אֲנִי אֲקַיְּימֶנּוּ: ״לֹא תַּחֲמוֹד כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב״ — בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, הוֹאִיל (וְהֵן) [וְהוּא] מוּתָּר — יָכוֹל יְהֵא צִיפּוּי מוּתָּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מִן הַבָּקָר״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנֶּעֱבָד.
human_translation: I shall establish “You shall not covet the silver or the gold to an entity that is not alive. But with regard to an entity that is alive, since permitted might coating should be permitted. the verse states: “From the herd,” to exclude worshipped.
llm_translation: I will establish it: "You shall not covet silver and gold" - in a matter that does not have the spirit of life, but in a matter that does have the spirit of life, since it is permitted - can one say that anticipation is permitted? The Talmud teaches "from the cattle" - to exclude the consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חֲנַנְיָא: טַעְמָא דְּמַעֲטֵיהּ קְרָא, הָא לָא מַעֲטֵיהּ קְרָא — צִיפּוּי מוּתָּר? וְהָכְתִיב ״וְאִבַּדְתֶּם אֶת שְׁמָם״ — כֹּל הֶעָשׂוּי לִשְׁמָם!
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya objects to this: the reason that the verse excluded that the verse had not excluded it, coating permitted. But isn’t it written and you shall destroy their name everything made in their name,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Rav Ḥananya objects to him: The reason that the verse limits it, is it not because the verse limits it? Is it permitted to anticipate? And it is written, 'And you shall destroy their name' - anything done for their name!"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לְכַנּוֹת לָהֶם שֵׁם הוּא דַּאֲתָא: לְ״בֵית גַּלְיָא״ קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ ״בֵּית כַּרְיָא״, ״פְּנֵי מֶלֶךְ״ — ״פְּנֵי כֶלֶב״, ״עֵין כֹּל״ — ״עֵין קוֹץ״.
human_translation: That it comes to give nickname to to House of Elevation [ beit galya ], one calls it: House of Annihilation [ beit karya ]. Face of the Molekh [ penei haMolekh ], one calls it: Face of a Dog [ penei kelev ], All-seeing Eye [ ein kol ], one calls it: Eye of a Thorn [ ein kotz ].
llm_translation: That one to call to them name he that came: to "Beit Galia" they read it "Beit Karya," "Face of the king" — "Face of a dog," "Eye of all" — "Eye of a thorn."

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא: ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנֶּעֱבָד, ״מִן הַבָּקָר״ — לְהוֹצִיא רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע!
human_translation: But I reverse “from the cattle” to exclude that was worshipped, “from the herd” to exclude an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality.
llm_translation: And the opposite is true: "from the animal" - to exclude the consecrated, "from the cattle" - to exclude a quarter and a half!

hebrew_text: הָתָם מֵעִנְיָינָא דִּקְרָא, כְּתִיב גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתּוֹ בִּבְהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״, גַּבֵּי בָּקָר כְּתִיב ״וַיָּמִירוּ אֶת כְּבוֹדָם בְּתַבְנִית שׁוֹר אוֹכֵל עֵשֶׂב״.
human_translation: There, on the context of the verse, is written with regard to a domesticated animal: “And if a man lie with a beast [ behema ], he shall surely be put to death, is written with regard to the herd: Thus they exchanged their glory for the likeness of an ox that eats grass”
llm_translation: There, regarding the matter of the verse, it is written concerning an animal, "And if a man lies with a beast, he shall surely be put to death." Concerning cattle, it is written, "And they changed their glory into the likeness of an ox that eats grass."

hebrew_text: ״מִן הַצֹּאן״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַמּוּקְצֶה, ״וּמִן הַצֹּאן״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנּוֹגֵחַ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִם נֶאֱמַר רוֹבֵעַ — לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר נוֹגֵחַ? וְאִם נֶאֱמַר נוֹגֵחַ — לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר רוֹבֵעַ?
human_translation: “from the flock” to exclude set aside “or from the flock” to exclude that gored Rabbi Shimon said: If is stated an animal that copulated with a person why is it stated gored And if it is stated gored why is it stated an animal that copulated with a person
llm_translation: "From the flock" — to remove the blemished, "and from the flock" — to remove the gorer. Rabbi Shimon said: If it was stated "quartering" — why was "goring" stated? And if it was stated "goring" — why was "quartering" stated?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בָּרוֹבֵעַ, מָה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בַּנּוֹגֵחַ. יֵשׁ בָּרוֹבֵעַ, שֶׁהָרוֹבֵעַ עוֹשֶׂה אוֹנֶס כְּרָצוֹן, מַה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בַּנּוֹגֵחַ.
human_translation: because there is pertaining to an animal that copulated with a person that does not pertain to gored, There is pertaining to an animal that copulated with a person, as an animal that copulated with a person, renders forced copulation like willfully, which is not so with regard to gored,
llm_translation: According to the fact that there is in the majority, that which is not so in the goring. There is in the majority, that the majority does involuntarily what the goring does intentionally.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בַּנּוֹגֵחַ, שֶׁהַנּוֹגֵחַ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַכּוֹפֶר, מָה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בָּרוֹבֵעַ. הוּצְרַךְ לוֹמַר רוֹבֵעַ, וְהוּצְרַךְ לוֹמַר נוֹגֵחַ.
human_translation: there is pertaining to gored, as that gored, pays a ransom; which is not so with regard to an animal that copulated with a person. had to state an animal that copulated with a person and had to state gored
llm_translation: There is a "b'nogeach," that the nogeach pays the kofer, which is not the case with the rovea. It was necessary to say rovea, and it was necessary to say nogeach.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵהָכָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הָרוֹבֵעַ וְהַנִּרְבָּע (וְכוּלָּם) [וְכוּ׳]. הֵם כְּקָדָשִׁים שֶׁקָּדַם מוּם עוֹבֵר לְהֶקְדֵּשָׁן.
human_translation: And this tanna cites from here, as it is taught an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality they are like sacrificial whose temporary blemish preceded their consecration.
llm_translation: And this Tanna brings it from here, as it is taught: The one who is a quarter and the one who is a half (and all of them). They are like holy things that if a blemish preceded, it passes to their sanctification.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִין מוּם קָבוּעַ לִפְדּוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מׇשְׁחָתָם בָּהֶם מוּם בָּם״.
human_translation: And they require a permanent blemish to redeem them on account of as it is stated because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them;
llm_translation: And required blemish permanent to redeem upon them, as it is said: "For their blemish is in them."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כִּי מׇשְׁחָתָם בָּהֶם מוּם בָּם״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ׳הַשְׁחָתָה׳ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: What is the derivation is incomplete and this it is teaching: From where that are prohibited The verse states: “Because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them,” and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught Anywhere that corruption is stated, it is only a matter of sexual immorality and idol worship.
llm_translation: What is Talmuda? Deficiencies from deficiency, and thus it was taught: From where do we know that they are forbidden? The Talmud teaches to say, "For their corruption is in them." And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any place where it says "corruption" - it is nothing but a matter of sexual immorality and idolatry.

hebrew_text: דְּבַר עֶרְוָה — דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי הִשְׁחִית כׇּל בָּשָׂרוְגוֹ׳״, עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — דִּכְתִיב ״פֶּן תַּשְׁחִיתוּן וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לָכֶם פֶּסֶל תְּמוּנַת כׇּל סָמֶל״, כָּל שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה פּוֹסְלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: a matter of sexual immorality, as it is written for all flesh had corrupted idol worship, as it is written: “Lest you deal corruptly, and make you a graven image even the form of any figure” any in which a blemish disqualifies a matter of sexual immorality, or idol worship, disqualifies them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A matter of nakedness - as it is written, "For he has corrupted his ways" (Genesis 6:12). Foreign worship - as it is written, "Lest you act corruptly and make for yourselves a graven image" (Deuteronomy 4:16). Anyone in whom there is a blemish invalidates them - a matter of nakedness and foreign worship invalidate them.

hebrew_text: וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה מִן הַבָּקָר וּמִן הַצֹּאן״ מַאי דָרֵישׁ בְּהוּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ פְּרָט לְחוֹלֶה, זָקֵן, וּמְזוֹהָם.
human_translation: And the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, what derive from “From the cattle, even from the herd or from the flock” requires exclude sick, old, and filthy
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael, "From the animal, from the cattle, and from the flock." What does he expound in them? He requires it to exclude the sick, the old, and the blemished.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, דְּאַפְּקִינְהוּ לְהָנֵי קְרָאֵי לְרוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, חוֹלֶה, זָקֵן, וּמְזוֹהָם מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ ״מִן הַצֹּאן, מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים וּמִן הָעִזִּים״. וּלְתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא לְאִישְׁתַּעוֹיֵי הָכִי.
human_translation: And the first tanna , who derives from these verses of an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality, from where does he sick, the old, and filthy He derives it of the flock, whether of the sheep or of the goats” And according to the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, the manner of the verse to say this,
llm_translation: And a Tanna taught before them, that they would bring them to those cities for the majority and they would be fattened, a sick, an old, and one who is defiled, how does he count them? It was derived for him "from the flock, from the sheep, and from the goats." And according to the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael, this is the way of the verse.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ מוּקְצֶה לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מוּקְצֶה לְשֶׁבַע שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Which is the set-aside? for idol worship. Reish Lakish says: Only set aside for seven years is prohibited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Which is the boundary for foreign worship, etc. Reish Lakish said: It is only prohibited within the boundary of seven years.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא וַיֹּאמֶר [לוֹ ה׳] קַח אֶת פַּר הַשּׁוֹר אֲשֶׁר לְאָבִיךָ וּפַר הַשֵּׁנִי שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים״.
human_translation: As it is stated “And it came to pass the same night, said Take your father’s bullock, and the second bullock of seven years,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And it came to pass that night, and Hashem said to him, 'Take the bull of your father and the second bull of seven years.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מוּקְצֶה בִּלְחוּד הֲוָה? נֶעֱבָד נָמֵי הֲוָה! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: מוּקְצֶה לַעֲבוֹד, וְלֹא עֲבָדוּהוּ. רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם עֲבָדוּהוּ, וְחִידּוּשׁ הוּא, כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: שְׁמֹנָה דְּבָרִים הִתִּירוּ בְּאוֹתוֹ לַיְלָה — חוּץ, וְלַיְלָה, וְזָרוּת,
human_translation: And there, was merely set-aside? It was also worshipped. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: was set aside to worshipped, but they did not worship it. Rava says: Actually, they did worship it, But is a novelty, in accordance with Rabbi Abba bar Kahana. As Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: Eight matters were permitted on that night outside and night; and non-priests
llm_translation: And there, was it specifically designated? It was designated! Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It was designated for service, but they did not serve it. Rava said: They indeed served it, and it is a novelty, as Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: Eight matters were permitted on that night - outside, at night, and with a zarut.

hebrew_text: וּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וּכְלִי אֲשֵׁירָה, וַעֲצֵי אֲשֵׁירָה, וּמוּקְצֶה, וְנֶעֱבָד.
human_translation: and service vessels; and vessels a tree worshipped as idolatry [ asheira ]; and the wood of an asheira , and set aside and worshipped
llm_translation: Vessel of service, vessel of idolatry, trees of idolatry, and a boundary marker, are to be destroyed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב טוֹבִי בַּר מַתְנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: מִנַּיִן לְמוּקְצֶה מִן הַתּוֹרָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״תִּשְׁמְרוּ לְהַקְרִיב לִי בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ — כֹּל שֶׁעוֹשִׂין לוֹ שִׁימּוּר.
human_translation: Rav Tovi bar Mattana says Rabbi Yoshiya says: From where set-aside in the Torah? As it is stated you shall safeguard it to sacrifice to Me in its due season” anything that is safeguarded.
llm_translation: Rav Tovi bar Matna said, Rabbi Yoshiyah said: From where is the source for muktzeh in the Torah? As it is stated, "You shall keep to offer to Me at its appointed time" - anything that requires safeguarding.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, (אייתית) [אַיְיתִי] אִימְּרָא דְּצוֹמָא, וְלָא עָבֵיד לֵיהּ שִׁימּוּר, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְהַקְרָבָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא ״תִּשְׁמְרוּ לְהַקְרִיב לִי בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ קָאָמֵינָא — ״לִי״ וְלֹא לְאָדוֹן אַחֵר, וְאֵיזֶהוּ אַחֵר שֶׁמַּקְרִיבִין לוֹ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Abaye objects to this: If that is so, brought a lamb that weak and did not safeguard it, so too that it is unfit for sacrifice? said to I say “You shall safeguard it to sacrifice to Me in its due season,” for Me, but not to another master. And which is this other to which one sacrifice? You must say this is idol worship.
llm_translation: Abaye objects to him: Rather, from now on, if one brings a sacrifice of leavened bread and does not observe it, is it also not the case that it is not fit for offering? He said to him: I say, "Guard the appointed times for Me" - for Me and not for another master, and who is the other master that they offer sacrifices to? One should say: This is idol worship.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב אַדָּא, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: אֵין מוּקְצֶה אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיַּעַבְדוּ [בּוֹ]. עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד שֶׁיִּמְסְרוּהוּ לְכוּמְרֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Adda says Rav Yitzḥak says: set aside prohibited, only until it has been used for work Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan until it has been handed over to the attendants of idol worship
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Adda said, Rav Yitzchak said: A muktzeh item is not prohibited until they use it. Ula said Rabbi Yochanan said: Until they hand it over to idolatrous priests.

hebrew_text: בָּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד שֶׁיַּאֲכִילוּהוּ כַּרְשִׁינֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְבָהָא: מִפַּלְגִיתוּ אַתּוּן אַעוּלָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, עוּלָּא נָמֵי כִּי קָאָמַר — הוּא דְּשָׁפֵי לֵיהּ כַּרְשִׁינֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Baha says Rabbi Yoḥanan until feeds it vetches of idolatry Rabbi Abba said to Baha: Do you dispute of Ulla, said to No, Ulla too, when he stated was where they fed it vetches of idolatry.
llm_translation: In that case, Rabbi Yochanan said: Until they feed him like the Karshinei Avodah Zarah. Rabbi Abba said to Baha: Are you coming to deceive us? He said to him: No, deceive yourself, for he meant to compare it to the Karshinei Avodah Zarah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: יָדַע בְּהָא לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי שְׁמַעְתָּא, וְאִי לָא דְּסָלֵיק הָתָם — לָא הֲוָה יָדַע, דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גְּרַמָה לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יִצְחָק: בָּהָא מִיכָּן וּמִיכָּן הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Baha knows to explain halakha , but had he not ascended there, he would not have known as Eretz Yisrael caused him Rav Yitzḥak said to Baha was from here and there,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: He knew in this matter of the language of the Mishnah, and if he had not gone up there - he would not have known, that the Land of Israel caused it. Rav Yitzchak said to him: In this matter, from here and from here it was.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָא טְרִיטָאָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מוּקְצֶה אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, הוּא תָּנֵי לַהּ (וַהֲדַר) [וְהוּא] אָמַר לַהּ: מַאי ״מַעֲשֶׂה״? — עַד שֶׁיִּגָּזֵז וְיַעַבְדוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya Terita taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: set aside prohibited only until an action has been performed upon it. He taught it and then said its What an action? until it is sheared and used for labor
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita before Rabbi Yochanan: A Muktzeh item is not prohibited until a specific action is done with it. He taught it to him, and he said to him: What is the meaning of "action"? - Until it is cut and used for it.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ נֶעֱבָד כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: Which is worshipped From where are these matters
llm_translation: Which is served as a korban? From where are these matters?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״מִמַּשְׁקֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל״, מִן הַמּוּתָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֲסִירִי לְהֶדְיוֹט, לְמָה לִי קְרָא (מעטינהו) [לְמַעֹטִינְהוּ] מִגָּבוֹהַּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said that the verse states, “From the well-watered pastures of Israel,” from that which is permitted to Israel. And if enters your mind are prohibited to an ordinary why do I a verse to exclude them from the Most High,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: As the verse states, "from the drink offerings of Israel," it is permitted for Israel. And if you were to suggest that it is prohibited for a layperson, why do I need the verse to exclude it from the high places?

hebrew_text: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דַּאֲסִירִי לְהֶדְיוֹט — לָא בָּעֵי קְרָא? וְהָא טְרֵפָה, דַּאֲסִירָא לְהֶדְיוֹט, וּמַעֲטֵיהּ קָרָא מִגָּבוֹהַּ!
human_translation: And anywhere that prohibited to an ordinary person, a verse is not necessary But an animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], which is prohibited to an ordinary and a verse excludes it to the Most High.
llm_translation: And all cases where it is prohibited for a layman - does it not require a verse? But regarding a treifah, which is prohibited for a layman, the verse is only a minor support!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״מִן הַבָּקָר״ לְמַטָּה, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, אֶלָּא לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַטְּרֵפָה.
human_translation: As it is taught When it says below, of the herd,” there is no need for the verse to state Rather, to exclude a tereifa
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: When he says "from the cattle" downwards, the Talmud does not mean to say, but to exclude the treifah.

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֲמִינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי — דְּנִטְרְפָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְקַדְּשָׁה, אֲבָל נִתְקַדְּשָׁה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִטְרְפָה — אֵימָא (דתישרי) [דְּתִישְׁתְּרֵי] לְגָבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say: This statement, where it became a tereifa and afterward was consecrated But it was consecrated and afterward became a tereifa , I would say that it should be permitted to the Most High,
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: these words - that it became disqualified and afterwards it became sanctified, but it became sanctified and afterwards it became disqualified - say (that it is proper) to be released upwards.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא, ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲבוֹר תַּחַת הַשָּׁבֶט״, פְּרָט לִטְרֵפָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת.
human_translation: But derived from here, whatsoever passes under the rod, excluding a tereifa , which cannot pass
llm_translation: And this is derived from here: "Everything that passes under the rod," excluding a treifah that does not pass.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא נָמֵי אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֹא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר, דְּנוֹלְדָה טְרֵפָה מִמְּעֵי אִמָּהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר, וְיָצָאת לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִטְרְפָה — אֵימָא תִּשְׁתְּרֵי לְגָבוֹהַּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: That was also necessary, enter your mind to say: This statement, where it did not have a period of fitness where it was born a tereifa from its mother’s womb. But where it had a period of fitness and emerged into the air of the world and became a tereifa , I would say it should be permitted to the Most High. teaches us
llm_translation: That one, it is necessary, I say: these words where it was not its time of fitness, that a treifah was born from its mother's womb, but where it was its time of fitness, and it went out into the open air of the world, and afterwards it became treifah — say it will be permitted for high consumption, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵיזֶהוּ אֶתְנַן? — הָאוֹמֵר לְזוֹנָה ״הֵולִיךְ טָלֶה זֶה בִּשְׂכָרֵךְ״, אֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה, כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרִין. וְכֵן הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״הֵולָיךְ טָלֶה זֶה וְתָלִין שִׁפְחָתְךָ אֵצֶל עַבְדִּי״ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אֶתְנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶתְנַן.
human_translation: And which payment one who says to a prostitute: Here is this lamb as your fee. Even if they were one hundred all of them are prohibited. And likewise, one who says to another: Here is this lamb and your maidservant will lie with my slave Rabbi Meir says: is not payment and the Rabbis say: payment
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And who is considered an "etnan"? — One who says to a prostitute, "Take this lamb as your payment," even if they are one hundred in number, all of them are prohibited. And similarly, one who says to his fellow, "Take this lamb and hang your maidservant by my slaves" — Rabbi Meir says: this is not considered an "etnan," and the Sages say: it is considered an "etnan."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר מָר: וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה, כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרִין. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּשָׁקְלָה אַגְרַאּ מֵאָה בְּהֵמוֹת — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ אֲסִירִי, מָה לִי חַד, מָה לִי מְאָה!
human_translation: The Master said And even if they were one hundred all of them are prohibited. What are the circumstances? If we say who takes one hundred animals as payment obvious that all are prohibited, what to me one or one hundred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said: And even if they are one hundred, all of them are forbidden. How so? If you say that he received a wage of one hundred animals - it is obvious that all of them are forbidden, what difference does it make to me whether it is one or one hundred!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּשָׁקְלָה אַגְרַאּ חֲדָא, וְיָהֵיב לַהּ מְאָה, דְּכוּלְּהוּ מִכֹּחַ אֶתְנַן קָאָתוּ.
human_translation: No, necessary where takes one payment, and he gave her one hundred as they all come from the source of a payment
llm_translation: Not necessary, that she took a coin one, and gave to her a hundred, for all of them from the power we learn.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָתַן לָהּ וְלֹא בָּא עָלֶיהָ, בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְלֹא נָתַן לָהּ — אֶתְנַנָּה מוּתָּר. נָתַן לָהּ וְלֹא בָּא עָלֶיהָ, ״אֶתְנַנָּה״ קָרֵית לֵיהּ? וְתוּ, בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְלֹא נָתַן לָהּ, מַאי יָהֵיב לַהּ?
human_translation: The Sages taught gave her but did not engage in intercourse with her, if he engaged in intercourse with her but did not give her her payment is permitted. he gave her but did not engage in intercourse with her, do you call this her payment? And furthermore, he engaged in intercourse with her but did not give her what did he give her
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If he gave it to her and did not have intercourse with her, he had intercourse with her and did not give it to her — she is permitted. If he gave it to her and did not have intercourse with her, did you call it "he gave it to her"? Yes, and if he had intercourse with her and did not give it to her, what did he give her?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: נָתַן לָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא עָלֶיהָ; בָּא עָלֶיהָ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָתַן לָהּ — אֶתְנַנָּה מוּתָּר. וְלֵיחוּל עֲלֵיהּ אֶתְנַן לְמַפְרֵעַ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר:
human_translation: Rather, this is teaching: he gave her and afterward, engaged in intercourse with her; he engaged in intercourse with her and afterward gave her her payment is permitted. But let payment take effect upon it retroactively. Rabbi Elazar says:
llm_translation: Rather, thus it was taught: If he gave it to her, and afterwards had relations with her; he had relations with her, and afterwards gave it to her — the gift is valid. And should we be concerned that he gave it to her as a bribe? Rabbi Elazar said:

hebrew_text: שֶׁקָּדְמָה וְהִקְרִיבַתּוּ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי נֵימָא דְּאַקְנְיֵהּ נִיהֲלַיהּ לְאַלְתַּר — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּמוּתָּר, דְּעַד כָּאן לֹא בָּא עָלֶיהָ!
human_translation: where first sacrificed What are the circumstances? If we say that transferred to her immediately, obvious that permitted as up to that had not yet engaged in intercourse with her.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Shekadma v'hikrivatu. Heichi damei? Iy neima d'akneyeh nihalyeh l'altar - peshita d'mutare, d'ad kan lo ba aleiha!" English translation: "If she was betrothed and he brought her near. How much is the value? If it is said that he acquired her for later - it is obvious that it is permitted, for until now nothing has come upon it!"

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״לָא נִיקְּנֵי לִיךְ עַד שְׁעַת בִּיאָה״, מִי מָצְיָא מַקְרְבָה לֵיהּ? ״אִישׁ כִּי יַקְדִּישׁ אֶת בֵּיתוֹ קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳״ אֲמַר רַחֲמָנָא, מָה בֵּיתוֹ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, אַף כֹּל בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ!
human_translation: But rather, where he said to her: shall be acquired by you only at the time of intercourse, can she sacrifice The Merciful One states: “And when a man shall sanctify his house to be holy to the Lord” just as his house is in his possession, so too any in his possession.
llm_translation: And rather, that he said to her: "I will not acquire you until the time of intercourse," who finds her close to him? "If a man consecrates his house as holy to the Lord," the Merciful One said, just as his house is in his possession, so too everything is in his possession!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״לָא (מִקַּנְיָה) [נִיקְּנֵי] לָךְ עַד שְׁעַת בִּיאָה, וְאִי מִצְטְרִיךְ לָךְ נִיקְּנֵי לָךְ מֵעַכְשָׁיו״.
human_translation: No, necessary where he said to her: shall be acquired by you only at the time of intercourse, but if you need it acquire it for yourself from now.
llm_translation: Not needed, for he said to her: "Do not acquire for you until the time of intercourse, and if you need it, acquire for you from now."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: קָדְמָה וְהִקְדִּישַׁתּוּ, מַאי? תִּפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: קָדְמָה וְהִקְרִיבַתּוּ. הִקְרִיבַתּוּ הִיא דְּהָא לֵיתֵיהּ בִּשְׁעַת בִּיאָה, אֲבָל הִקְדִּישַׁתּוּ — אָסוּר!
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises a dilemma: she first consecrated what Resolve from that Rabbi Elazar as Rabbi Elazar said first sacrificed is sacrificed it, as is not extant at the time of intercourse. But consecrated it prohibited,
llm_translation: Inquired Rav Oshaya: "He brought it forward and sanctified it, what is it?" You should interpret it according to the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, for Rabbi Elazar said: "He brought it forward and offered it." Offering it, for it is not present at the time of arrival, but sanctifying it - it is prohibited!

hebrew_text: הִיא גּוּפַהּ קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הִקְרִיבַתּוּ, (וְהָא) [דְּהָא] לֵיתֵיהּ בִּשְׁעַת בִּיאָה — מוּתָּר, אֲבָל הִקְדִּישַׁתּוּ בִּשְׁעַת בִּיאָה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: raises this itself a dilemma, she sacrificed it and it is no at the time of intercourse permitted; but consecrated it at the time of intercourse, prohibited.
llm_translation: She, her body, stood before him: you brought it, (and) because it is not there at the time of intercourse — permitted, but if you consecrated it at the time of intercourse — forbidden.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִּלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דִּתְנַן ״אֲמִירָתוֹ לַגָּבוֹהַּ כִּמְסִירָתוֹ לְהֶדְיוֹט״, הִקְדִּישַׁתּוּ מוּתָּר, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הִקְרִיבַתּוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps Since we learned a declaration to the Most High, is equivalent to transferring to an ordinary person, consecrated permitted And all the more so she sacrificed it. shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps, since we learned "his statement to the High Priest is like his statement to a layman," if he consecrated it, it is permitted, how much more so if he brought it as an offering? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָתַן לָהּ אֶתְנַנָּה — מוּתָּר, וְהָתַנְיָא: בָּא עָלֶיהָ וְנָתַן לָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — אֶתְנַנָּה אָסוּר!
human_translation: he engaged in intercourse with her and afterward gave her her payment is permitted. But isn’t it taught he engaged in intercourse with her and gave her her payment prohibited and even as twelve months
llm_translation: He came upon her and afterwards gave her the dowry - permissible, and it was taught: He came upon her and gave her, and even up to twelve months - the dowry is forbidden!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״הִבָּעֲלִי לִי בְּטָלֶה זֶה״, הָא דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״הִבָּעֲלִי לִי בְּטָלֶה״ סְתָם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult, this said to her Engage in intercourse with me for this lamb. that where he said to her: Engage in intercourse with me for a lamb, without specification.
llm_translation: Rav Hanan son of Rav Hisda said: It is not difficult, this one who said to her, "My husband is nullified," this one who said to her, "My husband is nullified" is general.

hebrew_text: ״טָלֶה זֶה״, וְהָא מְחוּסַּר מְשִׁיכָה! בְּזוֹנָה גּוֹיָה, דְּלָא קָנְיָא בִּמְשִׁיכָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּזוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית, כְּגוֹן דְּקָאֵי בַּחֲצֵרַהּ.
human_translation: this lamb, lacks pulling, to a gentile prostitute, who does not acquire by pulling, And if you wish, say even to a Jewish prostitute, such as is located in her courtyard,
llm_translation: "this lamb," but it lacks acquisition! In the case of a non-Jewish prostitute, since there is no acquisition. And if you wish, say: even in the case of a Jewish prostitute, for example, when he is standing in her courtyard.

hebrew_text: הָא יַהֲבֵיהּ לַהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא, דְּשַׁוְּויֵהּ לַהּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי, וַאֲמַר לַהּ: ״אִם עַד יוֹם פְּלוֹנִי יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ זוּזֵי — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — טָלֶה בְּאֶתְנַנִּךְ״.
human_translation: He gave it to her at the outset, where he established for her as designated payment, and said to her: If by such and such a day I give you money well, And if not the lamb be your payment.
llm_translation: This one gave to her from the beginning, that he tied for her pouches, and said to her: "If until a certain day I will give you money - good, and if not - your pouch is hanging on your shoulder."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֶחָד אֶתְנַן זָכָר, וְאֶחָד אֶתְנַן כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת אָסוּר, חוּץ מֵאֶתְנַן אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה.
human_translation: Rav says: Both the payment a male, and the payment any those with whom relations are forbidden, prohibited. except for payment one’s menstruating wife.
llm_translation: Rav said: One, Etanan is male, and one, Etanan is all his forbidden relationships are prohibited, except for Etanan his wife is a menstruant.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? ״זוֹנָה״ כְּתִיב, וְהָא לָאו זוֹנָה הִיא.
human_translation: What is the reason it is written “prostitute,” and is not a prostitute.
llm_translation: What is the reason? "Zonah" is written, but this is not a zonah.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״תּוֹעֵבָה״ כְּתִיב, וְהָא תּוֹעֵבָה הִיא.
human_translation: And Levi says: Even one’s menstruating wife What is the reason? It is written “abomination” and this is an abomination,
llm_translation: Levi said: Even if his wife is menstruating. What is the reason? "Abomination" is written, and this is an abomination.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״זוֹנָה״! אָמַר לָךְ: הָהִיא ״זוֹנָה״, וְלֹא זוֹנֶה. וְרַב, הָהִיא זוֹנָה וְלֹא זוֹנֶה מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Levi as well, isn’t it written “prostitute,” said to you: That a female prostitute and not a male prostitute And Rav, from where does he that a female prostitute and not a male prostitute
llm_translation: Levi said, and it is written "zonah"! He said to you: that one is "zonah," and not zonah. And Rav, that one is zonah and not zonah, how does he know?

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין אֶתְנַן אָסוּר אֶלָּא (כׇּל) אֶתְנַן [כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת] הַבָּאוֹת לוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה, אֲבָל אֶתְנַן אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה, וְשֶׁנָּתַן לָהּ שָׂכָר לְהַפְקָעָתָהּ, וְשֶׁנָּתְנָה לוֹ [הִיא] בְּאֶתְנַנּוֹ — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: derives it from that Rabbi As it is taught Rabbi says: only payment prohibited is any payment whom intercourse is a transgression for him But payment his menstruating wife and that he gave a fee for her neglect and that gave him as his payment, permitted
llm_translation: He went out from Rabbi, as it is taught: Rabbi says: One may only marry off all his relatives who come to him through transgression, but one may marry off his wife who is a menstruant, and if he gave her a reward to divorce her, and she accepted it from him — they are permitted.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר: ״וּבְתִתֵּךְ אֶתְנָן וְאֶתְנַן לֹא נִיתַּן [לָךְ] (לָהּ) וַתְּהִי לְהֶפֶךְ״.
human_translation: Even though there is no proof for the matter, an allusion to the matter and in that you gave hire, and no hire is given to you, thus you are contrary”
llm_translation: Even though there is no proof for the matter, there is a remembrance for the matter: "And when you give gifts to the daughters of Israel, you shall not give them (to him), and it shall be turned around."

hebrew_text: וְרַב, הַאי ״תּוֹעֵבָה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ כִּדְאַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה — אֶתְנַנָּה אָסוּר.
human_translation: And Rav, this “abomination” what does he do with it? requires this that which Abaye As Abaye said: a gentile prostitute, her payment is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav, this "abomination," what does he do with it? He learns it as Abaye said, for Abaye said: A non-Jewish prostitute - her earnings are forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? כְּתִיב הָכָא ״תּוֹעֵבָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״כִּי כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל״, מָה לְהַלָּן עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ, הָכִי נָמֵי אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason? It is written here, “abomination,” and it is written there, “For whoever shall do any of these abominations” Just as there those with whom relations are forbidden with whom betrothal does not take effect, so too, with whom betrothal does not take effect,
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is written here "abomination," and it is written there "for all that he does of all the abominations of these." Just as there, with regard to forbidden relationships where betrothals do not take effect, so too here, betrothals do not take effect.

hebrew_text: וְכֹהֵן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ — אֵין לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״ — מִי שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו, יָצָא גּוֹיָה דְּאֵין זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: And A priest who engaged in intercourse with her is not flogged for her due to a prostitute” What is the reason? because the verse states: “And he shall not profane his seed whose offspring are attributed to him, excludes a gentile woman, whose offspring are not attributed to him,
llm_translation: A priest who engages with her - he is not punished for engaging with her as a prostitute. What is the reason? As the verse says: "He shall not profane his offspring" - one whose offspring is established after him, he has fulfilled his duty, but one whose offspring is not established after him, he has not fulfilled his duty.

hebrew_text: זוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית — אֶתְנַנָּה מוּתָּר, מָה טַעַם? דְּהָא קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ, וְכֹהֵן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ — לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Jewish prostitute, her payment is permitted What is the reason? that betrothal takes effect with her, And a priest who engaged in intercourse with her is flogged due to a prostitute. What is the reason? because his offspring are attributed to him.
