llm_translation: Talmudic text: A Jewish prostitute - her payment is permitted, what is the reason? Because betrothals are effective with her, and if a priest engages with her - he is liable for the offense of a prostitute, what is the reason? Because his seed is attributed to him. English translation: A Jewish prostitute - her payment is permitted, what is the reason? Because betrothals are effective with her, and if a priest engages with her - he is liable for the offense of a prostitute, what is the reason? Because his seed is attributed to him.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה, אֶתְנַנָּה אָסוּר, וְכֹהֵן הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? יָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי — מָה זוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית בְּלָאו, אַף זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה בְּלָאו, וּמָה אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה אָסוּר, אַף אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית אָסוּר.
human_translation: And Rava says: both this, and that, her payment is prohibited, and a priest who engaged in intercourse with her is flogged due to a prostitute. What is the reason? are derived from one another: Just as a Jewish prostitute by a prohibition, so too a gentile prostitute by a prohibition. And just as payment to a gentile prostitute is prohibited, so too payment to a Jewish prostitute is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rava said: One this and one this, if he marries her, it is forbidden, and a priest who engages with her is liable for the punishment of a harlot. What is the reason? According to the words of Hadadei - Just as an Israelite harlot is prohibited with a negative commandment, so too a gentile harlot is prohibited with a negative commandment. And just as a gentile harlot is forbidden, so too an Israelite harlot is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֶחָד זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה וְאֶחָד זוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית — אֶתְנַנָּה אָסוּר. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי! אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: raises an objection both a gentile prostitute and a Jewish prostitute, their payment is prohibited. a conclusive refutation of Abaye. Abaye said to you: whose is this It is Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothal does not take effect with regard to liable for prohibitions.
llm_translation: Challenger: One is a gentile prostitute and one is a Jewish prostitute - it was taught: it is prohibited. The objection of Abaye! Abaye said to you: Is this a dispute? It is Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothals do not take effect on those who are obligated in negative commandments.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּכׇל זוֹנָה לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, דּוּמְיָא דְּאַלְמָנָה דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And this teaches us that every prostitute with whom betrothal does not take effect, similar to widow with whom betrothal does not take effect.
llm_translation: And this is what we heard, that every prostitute does not acquire with it sanctity, similar to a widow who does not acquire with it sanctity.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״כְּגוֹן אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל״? דּוּמְיָא דְּאַלְמָנָה — מָה אַלְמָנָה לָא לָקֵי עַד דְּמַתְרִי בֵּהּ, אַף זוֹנָה — עַד דְּאָמַר ״הֵא לִךָ״.
human_translation: And according to Rava, what is different where teaches: For example, a widow with a High Priest? similar to a widow Just as a widow they are flogged only if warned so too a prostitute, unless he says This for you
llm_translation: And for Rava, what is different that it teaches "such as a widow to the High Priest"? Similar to a widow - just as a widow does not marry until she is permitted, so too a prostitute - until he says "it is for you."

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל פְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּזוֹנָה מֵעִיקָּרָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאָסוּר.
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: unmarried man who engaged in intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the sake of marriage, he has caused her to become a prostitute. But where a prostitute from the outset, so too prohibited
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: A single woman who engages in relations not for the sake of marriage - she is considered a harlot. But where she was a harlot from the outset - it is also prohibited.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחְרִינָא: כִּי קָתָנֵי הָא — בַּעֲרָיוֹת שֶׁאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: another version When that is taught, to those with whom relations are forbidden whom betrothal does not take effect.
llm_translation: Another teaching: For it was taught: In regards to forbidden relationships, betrothals do not take effect.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — אֶתְנַנָּה אָסוּר, וְהָא הָנֵי קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בָּהֶן! הָא מַנִּי?
human_translation: But isn’t it taught in the last clause a widow with a High Priest, a divorcée or a woman who has performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] with an ordinary priest, her payment is prohibited? But these betrothal takes effect. whose is this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the latter clause: A widow to a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah to an ordinary priest — we learned that it is prohibited, yet these betrothals are effective! How so? English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה. אִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי אִירְיָא אַלְמָנָה? נִיתְנֵי פְּנוּיָה!
human_translation: It is Rabbi Elazar, who says: an unmarried man who engaged in intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the purpose of marriage, he has caused her to become a prostitute. If Rabbi Elazar, why specifically a widow Let teach an unmarried woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar is the one who said: A man who engages in relations with a woman who is available for all without any commitment, has made her into a prostitute. If not for Rabbi Elazar, what is the status of a widow? She should be considered available for all!

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּבִנְיַן אָב הוּא — לָא נִיתַּסְרוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary a widow enter your mind to say: Since is paradigm not be prohibited. teaches us
llm_translation: Widow needed, as your mind thinks, I say: Since he is a son of the father - they were not separated, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״הֵא לָךְ טָלֶה זֶה״ כּוּ׳. וְהָא שִׁפְחָה לְעֶבֶד מִישְׁרָא שַׁרְיָא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֶצְלוֹ קָאָמַר, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״עֶבֶד״ — לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: one who says to another: Here is this lamb But a maidservant is permitted to slave. Rav Huna said: say with him, And as that which it teaches: slave, he employs a euphemism.
llm_translation: The one who says to his fellow, "Here is your lamb," etc. And a maidservant to a Hebrew slave is permitted! Rav Huna said: He is speaking about his own property, and when it is taught "slave" - it means a non-Jewish slave.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם עַבְדִּי, וְכִי קָתָנֵי בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי.
human_translation: If that is so, what is the reason for Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: Actually, My slave. And when teaches to a Hebrew slave,
llm_translation: Thus, what is the reason for Rabbi's statement? Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: "My servant always, for is it written in a Hebrew servant."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? שִׁפְחָה לְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי מִישְׁרָא שַׁרְיָא! הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים — אֵין רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית, יֵשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים — רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית.
human_translation: If so, what is the reason for the Rabbis? a maidservant is permitted to a Hebrew slave. Here we are dealing with where does not have a wife and children, As it is taught does not have a wife and children his master may not give him a Canaanite maidservant. If he has a wife and children, his master may give him a Canaanite maidservant.
llm_translation: If so, what is the reason of the Rabbis? A maidservant for a Hebrew slave is permitted! Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if he does not have a wife and children, as it was taught: If he does not have a wife and children, his master may not give him a Canaanite maidservant; if he has a wife and children, his master may give him a Canaanite maidservant.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵיזֶהוּ ״מְחִיר כֶּלֶב״? הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״הֵולָיךְ טָלֶה זֶה תַּחַת כֶּלֶב״.
human_translation: And which the price of a dog, one who says to another: Here is this lamb in place of a dog.
llm_translation: Mishnah: And what is "the price of a dog"? One who says to his fellow, "Take this lamb in exchange for a dog."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ, אֶחָד נָטַל עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶחָד תִּשְׁעָה וָכֶלֶב, שֶׁכְּנֶגֶד הַכֶּלֶב אָסוּר, וְשֶׁעִם הַכֶּלֶב מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And likewise, two partners who divided one took ten and one took nine and a dog. in exchange for the dog is prohibited, and that with the dog is permitted.
llm_translation: And so too, two partners who divided, one took ten and one took nine and a dog, because opposite the dog is forbidden, and with the dog is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֶתְנַן הַכֶּלֶב וּמְחִיר זוֹנָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״שְׁנַיִם״ וְלֹא אַרְבָּעָה. וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין — ״הֵן״ וְלֹא וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: payment dog, or the price of a prostitute their is permitted, as it is stated: Two and not four, their offspring is permitted, “them,” and not their offspring.
llm_translation: We have learned: "The price of a dog and the earnings of a prostitute - these are permitted, as it is stated 'two' and not four. And their offspring are permitted - 'they' and not their offspring."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מְחִיר כֶּלֶב״ — זֶהוּ חֲלִיפֵי כֶלֶב, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תִּמְכֹּר עַמְּךָ בְלֹא הוֹן וְלֹא רִבִּיתָ בִּמְחִירֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: the Sages taught: “The price of a dog” this is exchange for a dog. And likewise states: “You sell Your people without wealth, and have not set their prices high”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "The price of a dog" - this refers to the exchange of a dog. And so it says: "You shall sell your people for no wealth, and you shall not gain in their price."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא אֶתְנַן (זונה) [מַמָּשׁ], אִם כֵּן (לא קרב) הָווּ תְּלָתָא, ״גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ — וְלֹא שְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: say payment to a prostitute, if so, there are three not be sacrificed “Both of them,” and not three.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima etnan (zonah) mamash, im kein (lo karav) havu t'lata, 'gam shneihem' — v'lo shlosha!" English translation: "Say we learn (a prostitute) literally, if so (not close) they were two, 'also both' — and not three!"

hebrew_text: מִי קָאָמְרִינַן אֲנַן אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר? אֶתְנַן וְלֹא מְחִיר קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Did we say payment and price We said the payment and not price,
llm_translation: We say "we give and the price?" We give and not the price we say.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תָבִיא אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה וָכֶלֶב״, מִדִּכְתִיב ״אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה וּמְחִיר כֶּלֶב״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If that is so, let the verse state: You shall not bring the payment to a prostitute or a dog, From that it is written: “The payment of a harlot or the price of a dog,” learn from
llm_translation: If so, let us say: the verse states "Do not bring the hire of a prostitute or the price of a dog" - from the fact that it is written "the hire of a prostitute and the price of a dog" - infer from it.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ, אֶחָד נָטַל כּוּ׳. [אַמַּאי]? נִיפּוֹק חַדא לַהֲדֵי כַּלְבָּא, וְהָנָךְ כּוּלְּהוּ לִישְׁתְּרוֹ! הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן דִּטְפֵי דְּמֵי כֶלֶב מֵחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, (והאי) [וְהָהוּא] טוּפְיָינָא דְּכֶלֶב שְׁדֵי בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: two partners who divided one took Let us remove one corresponding to the dog, and all these be permitted. Here we are dealing with where the value of the dog is more than one of And casts this addition of the dog all of
llm_translation: The partners who divided, one took the whole. Why? One part goes to satisfy the dog, and the rest are all released! What are we dealing with here? For example, if a dog licked the blood of one of them, and the other licked the blood of the whole.

hebrew_text: אֶתְנַן כֶּלֶב וּמְחִיר זוֹנָה מוּתָּר כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִפַּרְזַקְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: payment a dog, or the price of a prostitute is permitted. Rava from Parzakya said to Rav Ashi:
llm_translation: We have learned: A dog and the hire of a prostitute are permitted. Rava said to Rav Ashi from Parzakya:

hebrew_text: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אֵין זְנוּת לִבְהֵמוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא (נִישְׁמוֹט) [לִישְׁתְּמִיט] קְרָא לִכְתּוֹב ״אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה וָכֶלֶב״.
human_translation: From where is this matter that the Sages stated, there is no prostitution with regard to an animal said to nothing preventing the verse from writing: the payment of a prostitute or a dog
llm_translation: The matter that the sages said, "There is no bestiality"? He said to him: It is not appropriate for the verse to be removed, as it is written, "Give not your daughter to a prostitute, lest the land fall into harlotry" (Leviticus 19:29).

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִנַּיִן לְאֶתְנַן כֶּלֶב וּמְחִיר זוֹנָה שֶׁמּוּתָּרִין? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״שְׁנַיִם״ וְלֹא אַרְבָּעָה. וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ — ״הֵם״ וְלֹא וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: this is also taught From where with regard to the payment a dog, or the price of a prostitute that is permitted? As it is stated: Two and not four, their offspring is permitted, as it is stated: “Even both of them,” “them” and not their offspring.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that the offspring of a dog and the hire of a prostitute are permissible? Because it is stated, "two" and not four. And their offspring are permissible, as it is stated, "both of them" — "they" and not their offspring.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְלַד הַנִּרְבַּעַת אֲסוּרָה, הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נִרְבְּעוּ. נוֹגַחַת אֲסוּרָה, הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נָגְחוּ.
human_translation: Rava says: The offspring animal that was the object of bestiality prohibited it, and its offspring were the object of bestiality. gores prohibited it, and its offspring gored.
llm_translation: Rava said: "The offspring of a forbidden animal is itself forbidden, and its offspring are also forbidden. If it gores, the offspring is forbidden, and its offspring have gored."

hebrew_text: וְלַד מוּקְצֶה וְנֶעֱבָד — מוּתָּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְאִימֵּיהּ אַקְצְיַהּ, לְאִימֵּיהּ פָּלְחִי לַהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: וְלַד מוּקְצֶה וְנֶעֱבָד — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּנִיפְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: the offspring of a set-aside and worshipped permitted What is the reason? the mother set aside, they worshipped its mother, There are who say The offspring a set-aside and worshipped prohibited. What is the reason? that beneficial to its girth
llm_translation: A child from the edge and was captured - permissible. What is the reason? He will cut for his mother, he will plow for his mother. There are those who say: A child from the edge and was captured - forbidden. What is the reason? Because it is beneficial to him in his nostrils.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי, אָמַר רַב: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפֶרֶשׁ שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בְּפֶרֶשׁ עֶגְלֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥadevoi bar Ami says Rav says: one who betroths with the excrement of an ox that is stoned, is betrothed. with the excrement of calves idol worship, she is not betrothed, What is the reason If you wish, say a verse; if you wish, say a logical argument.
llm_translation: Rav Ahadboi bar Ammi said, Rav said: One who consecrates with a bull that is to be stoned, she becomes consecrated. With a calf designated for idolatrous worship, she does not become consecrated. What is the reason? If you wish, say it is due to a verse, and if you wish, say it is due to reasoning.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא: נִיחָא לֵיהּ גַּבֵּי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּנִיפְחֵיהּ, גַּבֵּי שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל — לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּנִיפְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say a logical argument: With regard to idol worship, girth is beneficial to with regard to an ox that is stoned, its girth is not beneficial to him,
llm_translation: If you want, say: It is preferable for him regarding idol worship with his breath, regarding an ox that is stoned — it is not preferable for him with his breath.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, גַּבֵּי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה כְּתִיב: ״וְהָיִיתָ חֵרֶם כָּמוֹהוּ״, כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה מְהַיֶּה מִמֶּנּוּ הֲרֵי הוּא כָּמוֹהוּ. גַּבֵּי שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל כְּתִיב: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — בְּשָׂרוֹ אָסוּר, פִּרְשׁוֹ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: If you wish, say a verse: It is written with regard to idol worship: and be [ vehayita ] accursed like it” anything that you create [ mehayye ] from is like itself. with regard to an ox that is stoned, it is written: its flesh shall not be eaten” its flesh is forbidden, its excrement is permitted.
llm_translation: If you want, say a verse: Regarding foreign worship, it is written, "And you shall be banned like it," anything that you benefit from it, it is like it. Regarding an ox that is stoned, it is written, "Its flesh shall not be eaten" - its flesh is forbidden, its hide is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָתַן לָהּ מָעוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין. יֵינוֹת וּשְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁכַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ קָרֵב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ — אָסוּר. נָתַן לָהּ מוּקְדָּשִׁין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: gave money permitted that wine, or oil, or flour, or any item the like of which is sacrificed on the altar, is prohibited. he gave her consecrated their is permitted.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he gave her money - these are permissible. Wines, oils, and flours, and anything similar to them that is brought near the altar - is prohibited. If he gave her consecrated items - these are permissible.

hebrew_text: עוֹפוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אֲסוּרִין, שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: מָה אִם הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֵין אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן; עוֹף, שֶׁאֵין הַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בּוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עָלָיו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְכׇל נֶדֶר״ — לְהָבִיא אֶת הָעוֹף.
human_translation: birds, their is prohibited. As, by right, it should be If consecrated which a blemish disqualifies, payment and price do not take effect with regard to them; a bird, which a blemish does not disqualify, is it not right that payment and price should not take effect with regard to them? the verse states: for any vow” to include the bird
llm_translation: Birds - these are prohibited, as it was in the judgment: What about consecrated birds, where a blemish disqualifies them - we do not give them as a gift or set a price for them; a bird, where a blemish does not disqualify it - is it not logical that we should not give it as a gift or set a price for it? The Talmud teaches "for every vow" - to include birds.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ — וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: וְלַד טְרֵפָה לֹא יִקְרַב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁירָה שֶׁיָּנְקָה מִן הַטְּרֵפָה — פְּסוּלָה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ טְרֵפָה — אֵין פּוֹדִין אוֹתָן, שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: all whose on the altar is prohibited, their offspring is permitted. Rabbi Eliezer says: The offspring of an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ]shall not be sacrificed on the altar. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: A kosher that suckled from a tereifa is disqualified from on the altar. all sacrificial that became tereifot , one may not redeem them as one does not redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs,
llm_translation: All that are forbidden regarding the altar — and their offspring are permitted. Rabbi Eliezer says: A treifah offspring shall not be brought upon the altar. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: When a nursing animal is weaned from a treifah — it is disqualified from being upon the altar. All consecrated items that became treifah — cannot be redeemed, for one does not redeem consecrated items to feed them to dogs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָתַן לָהּ חִיטִּין וַעֲשָׂאָתַן סוֹלֶת, זֵיתִים וַעֲשָׂאָתַן שֶׁמֶן, עֲנָבִים וַעֲשָׂאָתַן יַיִן. תָּנֵי חֲדָא: אֲסוּרִים, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מוּתָּרִין. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּנֵי גּוּרְיוֹן דְּמִן אַסְפּוֹרַק — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹסְרִין וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: If one gave wheat to and made flour, olives and she made them oil, grapes and she made them wine, is taught one are prohibited and is taught another are permitted, Rav Yosef said Guryon of Aspork teaches Beit Shammai prohibit and Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one gave her wheat and she made them into fine flour, olives and she made them into oil, grapes and she made them into wine. One teaching is: they are forbidden, and another teaching is: they are permitted. Rav Yosef said: The law follows the opinion of the residents of Asporki - Beit Shammai prohibits and Beit Hillel permits.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: ״הֵם״ — וְלֹא וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן, ״הֵם״ — וְלֹא שִׁינּוּיֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Beit Hillel, maintain “them” but not their offspring. them, but not their changed
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: "they" - and not their offspring, "they" - and not their changes.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: ״הֵם״ — וְלֹא וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן, ״גַּם״ — לְרַבּוֹת שִׁינּוּיֵיהֶן, וּלְבֵית הִלֵּל, הָכְתִיב ״גַּם״! ״גַּם״ לְבֵית הִלֵּל קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Beit Shammai maintain “Them,” but not their offspring. “even” to include their changed And according to Beit Hillel, isn’t it written “even”? “even” difficult according to Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: House of Shammai holds: "they" — and not their offspring, "also" — to include their changes, and for House of Hillel, it is written "also"! "Also" is a difficulty for House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בֵּית ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״ — פְּרָט לְפָרָה, שֶׁאֵין בָּאָה לַבַּיִת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָרִיקּוּעִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught the House of the Lord your God,” excludes a heifer, which is not brought to the House the statement of Rabbi Elazar. And the Rabbis say: to include plates
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "The house of the Lord your God" — excluding the cow, as it does not enter the house, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: to include the empty spaces.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: נָתַן לָהּ זָהָב, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין עוֹשִׂין רִיקּוּעִין, אֲפִילּוּ אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת.
human_translation: Who are the Rabbis Rav Ḥisda says: It is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught one gave gold Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: One may not fashion plates even behind the Hall of the Ark Cover,
llm_translation: Who are the sages? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: He gave her gold. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: We do not make decorations, even behind the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: נָתַן לָהּ מוּקְדָּשִׁין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין כּוּ׳.
human_translation: he gave her consecrated their is permitted,
llm_translation: He gave to her sanctified objects - behold, these are permitted as well.

hebrew_text: וְיִהְיוּ מוּקְדָּשִׁין אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה עוֹפוֹת שֶׁאֵין הַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן, מוּקְדָּשִׁים שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בָּהֶן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר חָל עֲלֵיהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְכׇל נֶדֶר״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנָּדוּר.
human_translation: But let payment and price apply to consecrated by a fortiori If birds, which a blemish does not disqualify, payment and price applies to them, consecrated which a blemish does disqualify, is it not logical that payment and price should apply to them? the verse states: “For any vow.” to exclude already been vowed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they shall sanctify their value, and the price shall be upon them, from a fortiori reasoning: Just as birds in which a blemish does not disqualify them - their value and the price shall be upon them, consecrated items in which a blemish disqualifies them - is it not logical that their value and the price shall be upon them? The Talmud teaches "for every vow" - to exclude a vow.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּמַעֲטִינְהוּ קְרָא, הָא לָא מַעֲטִינְהוּ קְרָא הֲוָה אֲמִינָא: כִּי יָהֵיב לַהּ מוּקְדָּשִׁין — חָל עֲלֵיהֶן אֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר? וְהָא לָאו מָמוֹנָא הוּא!
human_translation: reason is that the verse excludes them, But had the verse not excluded them, I would say if one gives sacrificial payment or price applies to them. But is not his property,
llm_translation: Reason of that we lessen scripture, this not we lessen scripture was thinking: when he gives to her consecrated items — penalty upon them we teach and price? And this not money is!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: בְּמַמְנֶה עַל פִּסְחוֹ, וְרַבִּי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִם יִמְעַט הַבַּיִת מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״.
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya says: to one who registers for his Paschal offering and it is Rabbi As it is taught “And if the household be too little for a lamb,
llm_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: With a count for his Passover offering, and it is taught in a Baraita: "And if the household is too small for a lamb" (Exodus 12:4).

hebrew_text: הַחֲיֵיהוּ מִשֶּׂה, מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילָה וְלֹא מִכְּדֵי מִקָּח.
human_translation: Sustain him from the lamb [ haḥyeihu miseh ], sufficient means eat, but not sufficient means purchase
llm_translation: The living animal from the sixth year, for the purpose of eating and not for the purpose of sale.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַף מִכְּדֵי מִקָּח, שֶׁאִם אֵין לוֹ מַמְנֶה אֲחֵרִים עִמּוֹ עַל פִּסְחוֹ וְעַל חֲגִיגָתוֹ, וּמְעוֹתָיו חוּלִּין, שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן הִקְדִּישׁוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל פִּסְחֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi says: even sufficient means purchase as, if he does not have he may register others with him for his Paschal offering and for his Festival peace offering. And his money is non-sacred, as it is on this condition the Jewish people consecrate their Paschal offerings.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: Even from the time of acquisition, that if he does not have others designated with him for his Passover and his festival offering, and his money is secular, because of this Israel sanctified their Passovers.

hebrew_text: כָּל הָאֲסוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: כָּל הָאֲסוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִים, וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: all whose on the altar is prohibited, Rav says: all whose on the altar is prohibited, their offspring is permitted, And it is taught with regard to And Rabbi Eliezer prohibits
llm_translation: Talmudic text: All the prohibited regarding the altar etc. Rav said: All the prohibited regarding the altar and their offspring are permitted, and it was taught on it: and Rabbi Eliezer prohibits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁעִיבְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִרְבְּעוּ, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר ״עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא״, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי ״לָאו יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא״, אֲבָל נִרְבְּעוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף עִיבְּרוּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana says Rav Naḥman says: dispute where became pregnant and then were the objects of bestiality, As Rabbi Eliezer holds a fetus is the thigh of its mother And the Rabbis hold is not the thigh of its mother. But were the objects of bestiality and then became pregnant, everyone agrees they are permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chinena said, Rav Nachman said: A dispute that they crossed over and ultimately agreed, for Rabbi Eliezer holds "it is the thigh of its mother," and the Rabbis hold "it is not the thigh of its mother," but if they ultimately agreed and ultimately crossed over - everyone agrees it is permitted.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנִּרְבְּעוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף עִיבְּרוּ, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם אָסוּר, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rava says: dispute where were the objects of bestiality and then became pregnant, as Rabbi Eliezer holds this and that cause is prohibited. And the Rabbis hold this and that cause permitted
llm_translation: Rava said: A dispute that they argued and ultimately agreed, for Rabbi Eliezer holds: both this and that cause prohibition, and the Rabbis hold: both this and that cause permissibility.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עִיבְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִרְבְּעוּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֲסוּרִין. וְרָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: וְלַד נִרְבַּעַת אָסוּר, הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נִרְבְּעוּ, וְלַד נוֹגַחַת אָסוּר, הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נָגְחוּ.
human_translation: But became pregnant and then were the object of bestiality, everyone agrees they are prohibited. And Rava to his reasoning as Rava said: The offspring was the object of bestiality prohibited it, and its offspring were the object of bestiality. the offspring gores is prohibited, it, and its offspring gored.
llm_translation: But they crossed and ultimately became mixed - the words of everyone are forbidden. And Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: A calf that is mixed is forbidden, it and its offspring are mixed, and a calf that gores is forbidden, it and its offspring have gored.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁנִּרְבְּעוּ כְּשֶׁהֵן מוּקְדָּשִׁין, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר בִּיזּוּי מִילְּתָא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי לָא. אֲבָל נִרְבְּעוּ כְּשֶׁהֵן חוּלִּין, הוֹאִיל וְהִשְׁתַּנּוּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Some state another version Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana says Rav Naḥman says: dispute where were the object of bestiality when they sacrificial As Rabbi Eliezer holds degradation significant. And the Rabbis hold not But were the object of bestiality when they were non-sacred, since was changed everyone agrees they are permitted.
llm_translation: The other sages said to her. Rav Huna son of Hinena said, Rav Nachman said: A dispute that arose when they are consecrated, for Rabbi Eliezer holds that the matter is clear, but the Rabbis hold that it is not. However, if the dispute arose when they are mundane, since they have changed — everyone agrees that they are permitted.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת כְּשֶׁנִּרְבְּעוּ כְּשֶׁהֵן חוּלִּין, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: בִּיזּוּי מִילְּתָא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: הוֹאִיל וְהִשְׁתַּנּוּ — מוּתָּרִין, אֲבָל נִרְבְּעוּ כְּשֶׁהֵן מוּקְדָּשִׁין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rava says Rav Naḥman dispute where were the object of bestiality when they were non-sacred, as Rabbi Eliezer holds degradation is significant, And the Rabbis hold since was changed they are permitted. But were the object of bestiality when they sacrificial everyone agrees they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: A dispute when they were mixed as they are mundane, for Rabbi Eliezer holds: the mixing is considered significant, and the Rabbis hold: since they have changed — they are permitted, but when they were mixed as they are consecrated — everyone agrees they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְלַד טְרֵפָה כּוּ׳. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר טְרֵפָה (אינה) יָלְדָה — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּטְרְפָה וּלְבַסּוֹף עִיבְּרָה.
human_translation: the offspring of a tereifa , According to the one who says a tereifa can give birth, you find where became a tereifa and then became pregnant.
llm_translation: "And the offspring of a treifah is like it. According to the one who says a treifah does not give birth - she forgets it, like for example, if it was treifah and eventually healed."

hebrew_text: וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם אָסוּר, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And this is they disagree, as Rabbi Eliezer holds both this and that cause is prohibited. And the Rabbis hold both this and that cause permitted.
llm_translation: And in this they argue, for Rabbi Eliezer holds: this and this causes prohibition, and the Rabbis hold: this and this causes permission.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר טְרֵיפָה אֵינָהּ חַיָּה, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁעִיבְּרָה וּלְבַסּוֹף נִטְרְפָה, וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי: דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי עוּבָּר לָאו יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: according to the one who says a tereifa cannot survive, you find where became pregnant and then became a tereifa . And this is they disagree, as Rabbi Eliezer holds a fetus is the thigh of its mother, And the Rabbis hold a fetus is not the thigh of its mother,
llm_translation: To whom that said a treifah is not considered a living animal, she forgets it, for example, that it passed through and ultimately became treifah, and in this they dispute: for Rabbi Eliezer holds that the thigh of its mother is the one that passed through, and the Rabbis hold that the thigh that passed through is not that of its mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּאֶפְרוֹחַ בֵּיצַת טְרֵפָה שֶׁאָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אֶלָּא בִּוְלַד בְּהֵמָה, דְּמֵאַוֵּירָא קָא רָבְיָא, אֲבָל בֵּיצַת טְרֵפָה דְּמִגּוּפַהּ דְּתַרְנְגוֹלְתָּא קָא רָבְיָא — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer in a chick the egg of a tereifa that it is prohibited What is the reason disagree with Rabbi Eliezer only with regard to the offspring of an animal, which grows from space, But an egg of a tereifa grows from the body of the hen, even the Rabbis concede
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer regarding the membrane of a treifah egg that it is prohibited. What is the reason? Until here they did not argue with Rabbi Eliezer except in the case of an animal fetus, where Rabbi Eliezer is stringent. But regarding the membrane of a treifah egg itself, the sages even agree.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב הוּנָא: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ, מְלֹא תַּרְוָד רִימָּה הַבָּאָה מֵאָדָם חַי — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְטַמֵּא, וַחֲכָמִים מְטַהֲרִין. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ אֶלָּא בְּרִימָּה, דְּפִירְשָׁא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, אֲבָל בֵּיצָה דְּמִגּוּפַהּ דְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הוּא — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Huna: That is taught supports your a full ladle [ tarvad ] of worms that come from a living person Rabbi Eliezer transmits ritual impurity and the Rabbis deem it pure. The Rabbis disagree with only with regard to worms, which are merely a secretion. But an egg, which is of the hen’s body, even the Rabbis concede
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Huna: A teaching that supports you, when a full egg is coming from a living person — Rabbi Eliezer declares it impure, and the Sages declare it pure. Until here, the Rabbis do not argue about it except in the case of an egg, for it is explicitly separated, but in the case of an egg that comes from the body of a hen — even the Rabbis agree.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא — עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֲלַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן אֶלָּא בְּרִימָּה, דְּאִיקְּרִי אָדָם מֵחַיִּים ״רִימָּה״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְתִקְוַת אֱנוֹשׁ רִמָּה וּבֶן אָדָם תּוֹלֵעָה״.
human_translation: Abaye said to on the contrary, the opposite is reasonable: Rabbi Eliezer disagrees with the Rabbis only with regard to worms, as a person is called a worm while alive, as it is written: And the hope of man is a worm, and the son of man, that is a maggot
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: On the contrary, it makes more sense - up to this point Rabbi Eliezer does not disagree with the Sages except regarding "lifting," as a person is called "lifting," as it is written: "And the hope of man is a worm, and the son of man a maggot."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל גַּבֵּי בֵּיצָה, אֵימַת גָּדְלָה? לְכִי מַסְרְחָא, וְכִי אַסְרַחָא — עַפְרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹדֶה! וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא בְּהֶדְיָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לַחֲכָמִים בְּאֶפְרוֹחַ בֵּיצַת טְרֵפָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי תַּנְיָא — תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: But with regard to an egg, When grow when rots, and when rots it is merely dust even Rabbi Eliezer concede And furthermore, it is explicitly taught Rabbi Eliezer concedes to the Rabbis with regard to the chick egg of a tereifa that it is permitted said to If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But regarding an egg, when is it considered to have grown? When it has feathers. And when it has feathers — it is merely dust in the world, even Rabbi Eliezer agrees! Furthermore, it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer concedes to the sages that the membrane of a treifah egg is permitted! He said to him: If it was taught, it was taught.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁרָה כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִפַּטְמָא מִינַּהּ, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה הֶאֱכִילָהּ כַּרְשִׁינֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דַּאֲסִירָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: A kosher What is the reason? If we say that was fattened from if that is so, fed it vetches of idolatry, so too, that it is prohibited?
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: It is valid. What is the reason? If you say because it is from a non-kosher animal, but from now on, feeding it to a non-Jewish idolater, is it still forbidden?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תָּנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא טְרִיטָאָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֱנִיקָהּ חָלָב רוֹתֵחַ מִשַּׁחֲרִית לְשַׁחֲרִית, הוֹאִיל וִיכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד עָלֶיהָ מֵעֵת לְעֵת.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥanina Terita taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: where one gave to suckle warm, milk every morning. Since can maintain based upon for period,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Chanina Trita taught before Rabbi Yochanan: For example, if she nursed the baby with boiling milk from dawn to dawn, since she is able to withstand it from time to time.

hebrew_text: כָּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ טְרֵפָה אֵין פּוֹדִין כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״תִּזְבַּח״ — וְלֹא גִּיזָּה, ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — וְלֹא לִכְלָבֶיךָ, ״בָּשָׂר״ — וְלֹא חָלָב. מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִים אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: all sacrificial that became tereifa , one may not redeem From where are these matters As the Sages taught “You may slaughter,” but not shear “and eat,” but not to your dogs flesh,” but not milk. From here that one does not redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs.
llm_translation: All holy things that became trefah, one does not redeem. From where are these matters? For the Rabbis taught: "You shall slaughter" — and not tear, "and you shall eat" — and not for your dogs, "flesh" — and not milk. From here it is derived that one does not redeem holy things to feed them to dogs.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: ״תִּזְבַּח וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — אֵין לְךָ בָּהֶן הֶיתֵּר אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת זְבִיחָה וְאֵילָךְ, קָסָבַר: פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: There are who state “You may slaughter and eat,” you have permission from them only from the time of slaughter and onward, maintains one may redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs,
llm_translation: There are those who say: "Sacrifice and you shall eat" — you have in them no permission except from the moment of slaughter and onwards, for he holds: We redeem the consecrated items in order to feed them to the dogs.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כָּל הָאֲסוּרִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you, all the prohibited things.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁאֵין בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְיֵשׁ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁאֵין בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: There are to consecrated for the altar that do not to consecrated for Temple maintenance, and there are to consecrated for Temple maintenance that do not to consecrated for the altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There are items of the altar sanctity that do not have the sanctity of the Temple floor, and there are items of the Temple floor sanctity that do not have the sanctity of the altar.

hebrew_text: שֶׁקׇּדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, וְקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה. קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ חַיָּיבִין (עָלָיו) [עֲלֵיהֶן] מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא,
human_translation: that consecrated for the altar render a substitute, and consecrated for Temple maintenance do not render a substitute. consecrated for the altar he is liable for eating it due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure,
llm_translation: The holy items of the altar are subject to exchange, while the holy items of the Temple floor are not subject to exchange. The holy items of the altar are liable for transgressions of Pigul, Nosar, and Tamei.

hebrew_text: וְלָדָן וַחֲלָבָן אָסוּר לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן, וְהַשּׁוֹחֲטָן בַּחוּץ חַיָּיב. אֵין נוֹתְנִין מֵהֶן לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן — מָה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: their offspring and their milk are forbidden after their redemption. And one who slaughters them outside liable does not give compensation to craftsmen from that is not so with regard to consecrated for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Dan and Chalban are forbidden after their redemption, and one who slaughters them outside is liable. One may not give them to non-Jews as payment - unlike with the consecrated animals of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, שֶׁסְּתַם הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, הֶקְדֵּשׁ בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת חָל עַל הַכֹּל, וּמוֹעֲלִין בְּגִידּוּלֵיהֶן, וְאֵין בָּהֶן הֲנָאָה לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: There are to consecrated for Temple maintenance that unspecified consecrations are for Temple maintenance; consecration for Temple maintenance takes effect on all and one misuse for their by-products, and there is no benefit for the owner
llm_translation: There are in the consecrated items of the Temple, that were designated for the Temple's maintenance, consecrated for the Temple's maintenance alone, the consecration of the Temple's maintenance applies to everything, and they are redeemed in their full value, and there is no benefit in them for the owners.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּכְלָלָא הוּא דְּכׇל קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה? וַהֲרֵי עוֹפוֹת דְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הֵן, וּתְנַן: הַמְּנָחוֹת וְהָעוֹפוֹת אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה! כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: And is principle that anything consecrated for the altar renders a substitute? But birds, which are consecrated for the altar, and we learned Meal offerings and bird do not render a substitute. When was taught, with regard to animal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, and in general, is it that all holy things of the altar make an exchange? But behold, birds are holy things of the altar, and we learned: The meal offerings and the birds do not make an exchange! For it was taught - an animal." English translation:

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי וָלָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הוּא, וּתְנַן: אֵין הַוָּלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: וָלָד עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: But the offspring is consecrated for the altar, and we learned The offspring does not render a substitute. whose is this is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: The offspring renders a substitute.
llm_translation: Behold, a firstborn of consecrated animals is fit for the altar, and we learned: A firstborn does not effect an exchange. What is the reason? It is Rabbi Yehuda, for he said: A firstborn effects an exchange.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּמוּרָה עַצְמָהּ, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּתְנַן: אֵין תְּמוּרָה עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה! כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַעִיקַּר זִיבְחָא.
human_translation: But a substitute itself, which consecrated for the altar, and we learned A substitute does not render a substitute. When was taught with regard to the principal offering,
llm_translation: And behold, the exchange itself, the consecrated items of the altar, and we learned: An exchange does not make an exchange! For it was taught — the essence of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דַאֲתֵית לְהָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַעִיקַּר זִיבְחָא.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this you even say the Rabbis, when was taught the principal offering.
llm_translation: The instance where you come to say so, even if you were to say "the sages," for it is taught — I will establish the offering.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין מֵהֶן לָאוּמָּנִין כּוּ׳. הָא קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת נוֹתְנִין? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְעָשׂוּ לִי״ — מִשֶּׁלִּי.
human_translation: does not give craftsmen compensation from that consecrations for Temple maintenance are given Rabbi Abbahu said: as the verse states, “And let them make Me from Mine,
llm_translation: And we do not give from them to non-Jews, etc. Is it not that the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard we give? Rabbi Avahu said: As the verse says, "And they shall make for Me" — from what is Mine.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת כּוּ׳. אָמַר מָר: סְתָם הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְחָל עַל הַכֹּל. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: there are to consecrated for Temple maintenance The Master said unspecified consecrations for Temple maintenance, and takes effect all Who is the tanna Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: There are sanctified items in the Temple courtyard. The Master said: Regular sanctified items are designated for the Temple courtyard, and they apply to everything. Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Not like Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְכָסָיו, וְהָיָה בָּהֶן בְּהֵמָה רְאוּיָה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבוֹת — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זְכָרִים יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי עוֹלוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי שְׁלָמִים, וּדְמֵיהֶן יִפְּלוּ עִם שְׁאָר נְכָסִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: as it is taught one who consecrates his possessions and among there was an animal suitable upon the altar, male or female, Rabbi Eliezer says: Males be sold for the needs of burnt offerings, And females be sold for the purpose of peace offerings. And money their allocated with the rest of property for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who consecrates his possessions, and among them there is an animal fit for the altar, males and females - Rabbi Eliezer says: The males should be sold for burnt offerings, and the females should be sold for peace offerings, and their value should be included with the rest of the possessions for the maintenance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: זְכָרִים הֵן עַצְמָן יִקְרְבוּ עוֹלוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת יִמָּכְרוּ לְצׇרְכֵי שְׁלָמִים וְיָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹלוֹת, וּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: males themselves be sacrificed as burnt offerings, and females be sold for the purpose of peace offerings and bring burnt offerings with the money their And the rest of the property, for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Males themselves shall be brought as burnt offerings, and females shall be sold for the needs of peace offerings, and with their money, burnt offerings shall be brought, and the rest of the property shall be for the maintenance of the house.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, דְּאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: בְּעֵדֶר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ זְכָרִים, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹדֶה, דְּלָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וּמַקְדִּישׁ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rav Adda bar Ahava. As Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rav says: With regard to a herd that is entirely male, even Rabbi Eliezer concedes as a person does not set consecrated for the altar and consecrate for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rav Adda bar Ahava, for Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav: In a flock where all are males, even Rabbi Eliezer agrees, that one does not leave the holy things of the altar and sanctify only for the inspection of the house.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּעֵדֶר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מֶחֱצָה זְכָרִים וּמֶחֱצָה נְקֵבוֹת, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אֵין חוֹלֵק אֶת נִדְרוֹ, וּמִדִּנְקֵבוֹת לָאו עוֹלוֹת — זְכָרִים נָמֵי לָאו עוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to a herd that has one-half males and one-half females. And Rabbi Eliezer holds not divide his vow, and from that females are not burnt offerings, the males are also not burnt offerings.
llm_translation: They did not argue except in a flock that has half males and half females, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: one does not divide his vow, and from females, are they not burnt offerings - males too are not burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: חוֹלֵק אֶת נִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua holds does divide his vow.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: He divides his vow.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחְרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: בְּשֶׁלֹּא הִקְדִּישׁ אֶלָּא בְּהֵמָה, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹדֶה, דְּלָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וּמַקְדֵּישׁ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Some say another version Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rav says: In where consecrated only animal even Rabbi Eliezer concedes that a person does not set consecrated for the altar and consecrate for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: The other sages said to her, Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav: If one sanctified only an animal, even Rabbi Eliezer agrees that he does not leave the sanctified animal from the altar and sanctifies it for the maintenance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ שְׁאָר נְכָסִים עִמָּהֶן, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אֵין אָדָם חוֹלֵק אֶת נִדְרוֹ, מִדִּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים לָא לְקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבַּח, בְּהֵמָה נָמֵי לָא לְקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: אָדָם חוֹלֵק אֶת נִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: They disagree only where there is other property with And Rabbi Eliezer holds a person does not divide his vow. from that other property is not consecrated for the altar, animals are also not consecrated for the altar. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds a person divides his vow.
llm_translation: They did not dispute except when there are other assets with them, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: a person does not divide his vow, from the rest of the assets not for the sanctity of the altar, and not for the sanctity of an animal, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds: a person does divide his vow.

hebrew_text: וּדְמֵיהֶן יִפְּלוּ עִם שְׁאָר נְכָסִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — בִּשְׁלָמָא לְלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי: ״עִם שְׁאָר נְכָסִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת״.
human_translation: And money their allocated with the rest of his property for Temple maintenance. Granted, according to the latter version, this that which teaches: with the rest of his property for Temple maintenance,
llm_translation: And their blood shall mix with the rest of the property to check the house - for it is reasonable to say in the latter case, as it is taught: "with the rest of the property to check the house."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא, לִיתְנֵי ״יִפְּלוּ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת״! תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״וּדְמֵיהֶן יִפְּלוּ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת״.
human_translation: But according to the first version, let teach: allocated for Temple maintenance, this is also taught And money their allocated for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rather, to explain the first clause, it should be taught: "Let them fall into the inspection chamber of the house!" It was also taught similarly: "And their blood shall fall into the inspection chamber of the house."

hebrew_text: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת חָל עַל הַכֹּל. לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי שִׁפּוּיֵי וְנִיבָא.
human_translation: consecration for Temple maintenance takes effect on all What to add Ravina said: to add shavings and fallen leaves
llm_translation: The consecration of the Temple courtyard takes effect on everything. What is the reason? Ravina said: To include those that are smooth and those that are rough.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹעֲלִין בְּגִידּוּלֵיהֶן. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְאֵתוֹיֵי בִּקְדוּשַּׁת מִזְבֵּחַ, חֲלֵב הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין וּבֵיצֵי תוֹרִין.
human_translation: one misuse their by-products, to add what? Rav Pappa said: to add of consecrated for the altar, milk sacrificial and eggs of pigeons.
llm_translation: And they are disqualified in their growths. To come to what? Rav Papa said: To come to the holiness of the altar, the fat of consecrated animals, and eggs of doves.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: חֲלֵב הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין וּבֵיצֵי תוֹרִין — לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. בַּמֶּה דְבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, אֲבָל בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — הִקְדִּישׁ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת מוֹעֲלִין בְּבֵיצָתָהּ, חֲמוֹרָהּ מוֹעֲלִין בַּחֲלָבָהּ.
human_translation: as it is taught milk of sacrificial and eggs of pigeons, may not derive benefit but not misuse. In what is this statement said? with regard to consecrated for the altar. But with regard to consecrated for Temple maintenance, one consecrated a chicken misusing its eggs, a female donkey for misusing its milk.
llm_translation: As it was taught: The consecrated fat and the eggs of clean animals - one may not benefit from them and they are not considered sacrilegious. In what case are these words said? In regards to the sacrifices of the altar, but in regards to the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard - if one consecrated a hen, they are considered sacrilegious with its egg, and if one consecrated a donkey, they are considered sacrilegious with its fat.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מוֹעֲלִין בְּגִידּוּלֵי מִזְבֵּחַ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי גִּידּוּלִין דַּחֲזוּ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, אֲבָל גִּידּוּלִין דְּלָא חֲזוּ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ — אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And even according to the one who said misusing by-products of altar, this statement by-products that are fit for the altar, but by-products that are not fit for the altar, not misusing them.
llm_translation: And even according to the one who says that we may offer up the limbs of the altar, those limbs that are fit for the altar, but limbs that are not fit for the altar - we do not offer them up.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אֵין מְשַׁנִּין אוֹתָן מִקְּדוּשָּׁה לִקְדוּשָּׁה, וּמַקְדִּישִׁין אוֹתָן הֶקְדֵּשׁ עִילּוּי, וּמַחְרִימִין אוֹתָן, וְאִם מֵתוּ — יִקָּבֵרוּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אִם מֵתוּ — יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: both consecrated for the altar and consecrated for Temple maintenance, one may not alter their from sanctity to sanctity. But one may consecrate consecrated a consecration of value, And one may dedicate them And if died, they must be buried. Rabbi Shimon says: if consecrated for Temple maintenance died, they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who consecrates items for the altar and one who consecrates items for the Temple courtyard may not interchange them from one sanctity to another. They consecrate them with a higher level of sanctity, and they may annul their consecration. If they die, they are buried. Rabbi Shimon says: If one consecrates items for the Temple courtyard and they die, they are redeemed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁהִתְפִּיסָן לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם קֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים הוּא לַה׳״ — כׇּל חֵרֶם דְּקֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים הָוֵי, הָהוּא לַה׳ לֶיהֱוֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: consecrated for the altar, if one associated with dedications priests, he has done nothing. What is the reason? The verse states: every dedicated item is most holy unto the Lord” any dedicated that is most holy, that should be for the Lord,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Huna: Holy things of the altar that were designated for the priests' portion - did not make them disqualified. What is the reason? Scripture said: "Every devoted thing is most holy to the Lord" - every devoted thing of the most holy becomes, that is to the Lord it shall be. English translation: Gemara said Rav Huna: Holy things of the altar that were designated for the priests' portion - did not render them disqualified. What is the reason? Scripture said: "Every devoted thing is most holy to the Lord" - every devoted thing of the most holy becomes, that is to the Lord it shall be.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁהִתְפִּיסָן, בֵּין לְקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ בֵּין לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: raises an objection consecrated for Temple maintenance that one associated whether with a consecration for the altar, or with a dedication to the priests, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: Challenger: The sanctified items of the Temple courtyard that became disqualified, whether for the sanctified items of the altar or for the donations designated for the priests - he did not render them unfit.

hebrew_text: חֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים שֶׁהִתְפִּיסָן, בֵּין לְקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, בֵּין לְקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: a dedication to priests that one associated whether with a consecration for the altar or with a consecration for Temple maintenance, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: The cherem of the priests that were designated, whether for the holy items of the altar or for the holy items of the Temple floor, he did not render them invalid.

hebrew_text: הָא קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁהִתְפִּיס לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא!
human_translation: consecrated for the altar that one associated with dedications to priests, what he did is done, a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna.
llm_translation: This is the case of the holy items of the altar that were seized for the benefit of the priests - whatever he did is done, the statement of Rav Huna is preferable!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: כִּי שַׁיְּירַהּ — אַהָדָא שַׁיְּירַהּ, דְּקָדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁהִתְפִּיסָן לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, אֲבָל לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you that omitted he omitted to this that With regard to consecrated for the altar that one associated with for Temple maintenance, what he did is done, but with a dedication to priests, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: When she leaves - another one leaves, the consecrated items of the altar that were designated for inspection of the Temple - what she did is done, but for the annulment of the priests - she did nothing.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנְיַיהּ גַּבֵּי הָנָךְ! תַּנָּא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ תַּרְתֵּי — קָתָנֵי, דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ תַּרְתֵּי — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But let teach alongside these tanna teaches where there are two does not teach where there are not two
llm_translation: And it should have taught about Hanoch! A Tanna that has two in it - he teaches, if it does not have two in it - he does not teach.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״מַקְדִּישׁ אוֹתָן הֶקְדֵּשׁ עִילּוּי״, מַאי לַָאו ״הֶקְדֵּשׁ עִילּוּי״ — לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, וּ״מַחְרִימִין״ — לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֵן?
human_translation: we learned One may consecrate a consecration of value, What, is it not a consecration of value, for Temple maintenance, and one dedicates to dedications to a priest?
llm_translation: We learned: "One who sanctifies them with a higher sanctity," what is the reason? "With a higher sanctity" - for the inspection of the house, and "we place under a ban" - for the bans of a priest?

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְלָא שְׁנָא מַפֵּיק לְהוּ בִּלְשׁוֹן ״הַקֹּדֶשׁ״ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְלָא שְׁנָא מַפֵּיק לְהוּ בִּלְשׁוֹן ״(חֶרְמֵי) [חֵרֶם]״ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: No, this and that consecrations for Temple maintenance. And is no difference he expresses a term of consecration, for Temple maintenance, and is no difference he expresses a term of dedication, for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Not, both holy in the floor of the house, and not different takes them in the language "holy" to the floor of the house, and not different takes them in the language "(herem)" to the floor of the house.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא תָּנֵי הָכִי, דְּתַנְיָא בְּבָרַיְיתָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ עִילּוּי — קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, מַחְרִימִין אוֹתָם — חֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים! וְעוֹד, הָא תַּנְיָא: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁהִקְדִּישָׁן לְחֶרְמֵי כֹהֲנִים — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But this is not taught As it is taught in a baraita : a consecration of value, a consecration for Temple maintenance, one can dedicate them a dedication to priests. And furthermore, isn’t it taught consecrated for the altar that consecrated as dedications to the priests, what he did is done? The refutation of Rav Huna a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The text does not teach like this, as it was taught in a baraita: One who sanctifies the surplus — they are considered consecrated items of the Temple treasury, and if they are condemned, they are considered condemned items of the priests! Furthermore, it was taught: Items sanctified for the altar that were designated for the priests' condemnation — what was done is done! This is the statement of Rav Huna, this is the statement.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַב הוּנָא קְרָא קָאָמַר! אָמַר עוּלָּא: אָמַר קְרָא ״חֵרֶם כׇּל חֵרֶם״.
human_translation: But Rav Huna says a verse Ulla said: verse states: dedicated “every dedicated item”
llm_translation: And behold, Rav Huna said a verse! Ula said: The verse says, "A ban of utter destruction is heaped upon all that is devoted."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר עוּלָּא הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר עוּלָּא: הַמַּתְפִּיס עוֹלָה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — אֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא עִיכּוּב
human_translation: And did Ulla say this? But didn’t Ulla say one who associates a burnt offering for Temple maintenance has only the delay
llm_translation: And who said this? Did Ula say so? But Ula said: One who designates a burnt offering for the inspection of the house - it only has the obligation of inspection.

hebrew_text: גִּזְבָּרִין בִּלְבַד!
human_translation: treasurers alone
llm_translation: "Gizbarin bilvad!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, וְקָרָא לִמְעִילָה [הוּא] דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: Actually, the Sages; And verse comes that misuse
llm_translation: The Sages said: "Always use Rabbanan, and he called it 'me'ilah' when he came."

hebrew_text: לִמְעִילָה לְמָה לֵיהּ קְרָא? קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ!
human_translation: misuse why does one verse most holy is written in
llm_translation: Above, why does the verse state "holy of holies" in it!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֵין מְעִילָה מְפוֹרֶשֶׁת מִן הַתּוֹרָה אֶלָּא בְּעוֹלָה בִּלְבָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תִמְעוֹל מַעַל וְחָטְאָה בִּשְׁגָגָה מִקׇּדְשֵׁי ה׳״, הַמְיוּחָדִין לַה׳. אֲבָל חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם לָא נָפְקָא אֶלָּא מִדְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, that which Rabbi Yannai said: misuse are explicitly in the Torah only of a burnt offering, as it is stated “If anyone commit a trespass, and sin through error, in the holy items of the Lord” exclusively for the Lord. But a sin offering or a guilt offering, is derived only from that Rabbi
llm_translation: And to support you, this that Rabbi Yannai said: The explicit covering is only from the Torah in the case of a burnt offering alone, as it is said: "When a person sins unintentionally and sins through error from the holy things of the Lord," those that are designated for the Lord. But a sin offering and a guilt offering do not come out except from Rabbi.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi says: all the fat is the Lord’s” to include the portions of offerings of lesser sanctity in misuse;
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "All fat belongs to the Lord" — to include the statements of light holy things for burning.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי קְרָא? ״קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ! אֶלָּא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּ״קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ, בָּעֵי קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיִינְהוּ לִמְעִילָה. חֲרָמִים נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּ״קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ, בָּעֵי קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיִינְהוּ לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: Why, do I a verse “most holy,” is written with regard to Rather, even though “most holy” is written with regard to them, a verse required to include them in misuse. dedications as well, even though “most holy” is written with regard to them, a verse is required to include them in misuse.
llm_translation: "Why do I need a verse? 'Holy of Holies' is written in it! Rather, even though 'Holy of Holies' is written in it, the verse is needed to include them for a more expansive interpretation. Similarly, regarding cherem, even though 'Holy of Holies' is written in it, the verse is needed to include them for a more expansive interpretation."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ עוֹלָה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — אֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא עִיכּוּב גִּיזְבָּרִין בִּלְבַד. מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ עוֹלָה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת — אָסוּר לְשׁוֹחֳטָהּ עַד שֶׁתִּפָּדֶה!
human_translation: the itself: One who consecrates a burnt offering for Temple maintenance has only the delay the treasurers alone raises an objection one who consecrates a burnt offering for Temple maintenance, prohibited to slaughter it until it is redeemed.
llm_translation: Body: One who consecrates a burnt offering for the Temple treasury - it contains only the obligation of the sinews alone. The question was raised: One who consecrates a burnt offering for the Temple treasury - is it forbidden to slaughter it until it is redeemed!

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם עָבַר וּשְׁחָטָהּ — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי.
human_translation: by rabbinic law; This too stands to reason, from that the latter clause teaches: If he transgressed and slaughtered it what he did is done
llm_translation: From the Rabbis, thus it was explained: From the end of the Mishnah: If one transgressed and slaughtered it - what he did is done.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי מִדְּרַבָּנַן? אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּמוֹעֲלִין שְׁתֵּי מְעִילוֹת, וְאִי מִדְּרַבָּנַן — אַמַּאי שְׁתֵּי מְעִילוֹת? הָכִי קָאָמַר: וּרְאוּיָה לִמְעוֹל בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי מְעִילוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, what by rabbinic law? If so, say the last clause And misuses two misuse, But if by rabbinic law, why misuse two misuse? this is saying: And it is fit to misuse on two misuse.
llm_translation: Rather what is the ruling of the Sages? If so, say the latter part: And one may circumcise with two cloaks. And if it is the ruling of the Sages — why two cloaks? This is what he is saying: And it is fitting to circumcise with two cloaks.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מֵתוּ יִקָּבֵרוּ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: if they died they must be buried,
llm_translation: And if they died, they shall be buried, as it is said: "And if they died, they shall be buried."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַבָּנַן: אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: According to the Rabbis, both consecrated for the altar and consecrated for Temple maintenance were included in the standing and valuation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to the Rabbis: "One, the holy items of the altar, and one, the holy items of the Temple courtyard - they were included in the standing and the valuation."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לְרַבָּנַן, קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: According to the Rabbis, consecrated for Temple maintenance were included in standing and valuation, consecrated for the altar were not included in standing and valuation,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: To the Rabbis, the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard were included in the standing and valuation, but the consecrated items of the altar were not included in the standing and valuation.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה וָזֶה, מוֹדֶה לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, וְקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל, בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ לֹא הָיָה בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: And this and that agree according to Rabbi Shimon, consecrated for Temple maintenance were not included standing and valuation, therefore and consecrated for the altar were included standing and valuation, And everyone agrees, blemished from the outset, was not included in standing and valuation
llm_translation: And this and this, agrees with Rabbi Shimon, that the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard were not included in the count of the assembly and valuation, while the consecrated items of the altar were included in the count of the assembly and valuation. And the words of everyone are that an animal with a blemish from its inception was not included in the count of the assembly and valuation.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁמֵּתוּ יִפָּדוּ״. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר לְרַבָּנַן אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְפָרוֹשֵׁי ״קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁמֵּתוּ יִפָּדוּ״.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Shimon says consecrated for Temple maintenance that died can be redeemed. Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said according to the Rabbis, both this and that, were included standing and valuation this is was necessary Rabbi Shimon to explain consecrated for Temple maintenance that died, they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: We learned: Rabbi Shimon says, "The consecrated items of the Temple courtyard that became lost shall be redeemed." It is well according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said to the Sages, "Both this and that were included in the standing and valuation," meaning that Rabbi Shimon needed to explain the statement, "The consecrated items of the Temple courtyard that became lost shall be redeemed."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, לְמָה לֵיהּ לְפָרוֹשֵׁי? לֵימָא ״אִם מֵתוּ יִפָּדוּ״!
human_translation: But according to Reish Lakish, why must explain Let him say If they died they can be redeemed,
llm_translation: Instead, to Reish Lakish, why does he need it for Pharoshei? Let us say, "If they die, they shall be redeemed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא הֲוָה יָדַע מַאי דְּאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ — מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ, בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — אִם מֵתוּ יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to you Rabbi Shimon did not know what the first tanna said, And this is saying to If to consecrated for the altar, I concede to you. to consecrated for Temple maintenance, if they died they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: Rabbi Shimon did not know what the first Tanna said, and thus he said to him: If in the sanctity of the altar - we agree with you, in the sanctity of the Temple floor - if they die, they shall be redeemed.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״אִם בְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה״ — בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין שֶׁיִּפָּדוּ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: it is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: if animal, of which they bring an offering the verse is speaking of blemished that they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Rabbi Yochanan: "If it is an animal that they shall offer from it" — referring to blemished animals that the Scripture speaks of.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִם בִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה וּפָדָה בְעֶרְכֶּךָ״ — הֲרֵי בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה אָמוּר,
human_translation: Do you say speaking of blemished animals; or it is only to a non-kosher animal, When it says if it be of a non-kosher animal, then he shall redeem it according to your valuation” a non-kosher animal stated
llm_translation: You say regarding owners of blemishes, or is it only in an unclean animal? When he says, "If it is an unclean animal and he redeems it according to your valuation," behold, an unclean animal is stated.

hebrew_text: הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְאִם כׇּל בְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה קׇרְבָּן לַה׳״ — בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין שֶׁיִּפָּדוּ.
human_translation: how do I realize “And if it be any animal, of which they may not bring an offering unto the Lord, to blemished that they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: This is how I fulfill "And if any animal that you may offer to the Lord" - with blemishes that may be redeemed.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִפָּדוּ עַל מוּם עוֹבֵר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה״ — שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה כׇּל עִיקָּר, יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה הַיּוֹם אֶלָּא לְמָחָר.
human_translation: might can be redeemed, for a temporary blemish. the verse states: of which they may not bring an offering,” that may not be sacrificed at all, This is excluded, as it may not be sacrificed today, but tomorrow.
llm_translation: He could redeem on a blemish transgress? Scripture to say "which not offer from it" — that it is not offering at all, this one went out that it is not offering today but tomorrow.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: עֲבֵיד לַהּ הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: And the Merciful One states perform standing and valuation for
llm_translation: And the Merciful One said: Make for her standing and appraisal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל, אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר לְרַבָּנַן קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהֶעֱרִיךְ הַכֹּהֵן אוֹתָהּ בֵּין טוֹב וּבֵין רָע״.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: What is the reasoning of Reish Lakish, who said to the Rabbis, consecrated for Temple maintenance were included standing and valuation, consecrated for the altar were not included in standing and valuation? that the verse states: And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad”
llm_translation: Rav Gidel said, Rav said: What is the reason that Reish Lakish expounded, as he said to the Rabbis: The consecrated items of the Temple courtyard were included in the count of the standing and valuation, but the consecrated items of the altar were not included in the count of the standing and valuation? Because the verse states: "And the priest shall assess it, whether it is good or bad."

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ חָלוּק בֵּין טוֹב לְרַע? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְאָמַר קְרָא ״אוֹתָהּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: What is an item which is not divided between good and bad, You must say this consecrated for Temple maintenance, And the verse states: it.” to exclude consecrated for the altar
llm_translation: Which thing that is not divided between good and bad? One should say: This is the holy of holies of the house, and the verse said "it" to exclude the holies of the altar.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, ״אוֹתָהּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, “it” to exclude what? to exclude blemished from the outset
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, "Her" - to exclude what? To exclude a blemished animal from the outset.

hebrew_text: וּלְתַנָּא דְּבֵי לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, דְּתָנֵי לֵוִי: הַכֹּל הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, וְכֵן תָּנֵי לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ: וַאֲפִילּוּ חַיָּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ עוֹפוֹת, וְהָכְתִיב ״אוֹתָהּ״! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But according to the tanna school of Levi, who said that even blemished from the outset included in standing and valuation. As Levi taught: Everything was included in standing and valuation, even blemished from the outset. And Levi taught likewise in his baraita : Even an undomesticated animal, and even birds isn’t it written “it,” a difficulty.
llm_translation: And according to the teaching of the school of Levi, who said that even an animal with a blemish from its inception is included in the category of standing and appraisal, for Levi taught: Everything is included in the category of standing and appraisal, even an animal with a blemish from its inception. And so Levi taught in his Mishnah: Even a wild animal, and even birds, and it is written "it"! This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיוּ? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהֶעֱרִיךְ הַכֹּהֵן אוֹתָהּ בֵּין טוֹב וּבֵין רָע״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁחָלוּק בֵּין טוֹב וּבֵין רָע? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, וְאָמַר קְרָא ״אוֹתָהּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon, who said consecrated for the altar were included in standing and valuation, consecrated for Temple maintenance were not As the verse states: And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad” What is an item which is divided between good and bad, You must say this consecrated for the altar, and the verse states: it,” to exclude consecrated for Temple maintenance
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon who said, "The holy items of the altar were included in the standing and arranging, but the holy items of the Temple floor were not included?" For the verse says, "And the priest shall evaluate it, whether it is good or bad." What is the thing that is divided between good and bad? You would say: This is the holy items of the altar. And the verse says "it" to exclude the Temple floor.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״בֵּין טוֹב לְרָע״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: If so, should have between good and bad, a difficulty
llm_translation: So it is asked, "What is meant by 'between good and evil'?" This is difficult.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מֵתוּ תְּמִימִין — יִקָּבְרוּ, וּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין — יִפָּדוּ. בַּמֶּה דְבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, אֲבָל בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — בֵּין תְּמִימִין בֵּין בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִים יִקָּבֵרוּ.
