human_translation: raises an objection died, unblemished shall be buried, and blemished they can be redeemed. In what is this statement said? with regard to consecrated for the altar. But with regard to consecrated for Temple maintenance, both unblemished and blemished shall be buried.
llm_translation: Challenger: If the unblemished die — they shall be buried, and if the blemished die — they shall be redeemed. In what circumstances are these words spoken? In the sanctities of the altar, but in the sanctities of the Temple floor — whether unblemished or blemished, they shall be buried.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, תְּמִימִים — יִקָּבְרוּ, בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין — יִפָּדוּ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Both consecrated for the altar and consecrated for Temple maintenance, unblemished they can be buried, blemished they can be redeemed. a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan, from the first clause
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: One, the holy things of the altar, and one, the holy things of the Temple courtyard, the unblemished - shall be buried, the blemished - shall be redeemed. The conclusion of Rabbi Yochanan is from the beginning!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan say to you: What are we dealing with here? with blemished from the outset.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: Here with what are we dealing? With a blemished animal from its inception.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי תֵּימָא שֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן — לִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֲלַהּ, אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינָּה בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as, if you say that whose consecrations preceded their blemishes, Rabbi Shimon should disagree with Rather, not conclude from with blemished from the outset?
llm_translation: Thus it appears reasonable, for if you were to say that they consecrated the blemished animal first - Rabbi Shimon would have a dispute with him, but it is not so, for it is not heard from the outset with a blemished animal.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ!
human_translation: But let us say is a conclusive refutation Reish Lakish,
llm_translation: Rather, let it be said: "Let the argument of Reish Lakish be established!"

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּשֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן, אִי הָכִי, נִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish interprets to whose consecrations preceded their blemishes. If so, Rabbi Shimon should disagree with
llm_translation: Reish Lakish establishes for it with the earlier sages who sanctified them with a blemish, if so, Rabbi Shimon disagreed with it.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵיפָךְ אָפֵיךְ, וְהָכִי מוֹתֵיב מִמְּכִילְתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי: מֵתוּ, בֵּין תְּמִימִין בֵּין בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין — יִקָּבֵרוּ. [בַּמֶּה דְבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, אֲבָל בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת — יִפָּדוּ.]
human_translation: Reish Lakish reverses And raises objection from another baraita , like this: died, whether unblemished or blemished, they shall be buried. With regard to what stated? with regard to consecrated for the altar, but in consecrated for Temple maintenance, they can be redeemed.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish from your mouth you will be answered, and thus he responded from another teaching: "They shall be buried, whether they are perfect or blemished." In what case are these words said? Regarding the holy items of the altar, but regarding the holy items of the Temple floor - they shall be redeemed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: תְּמִימִים — יִקָּבְרוּ, וּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין — יִפָּדוּ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִסֵּיפָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: unblemished they shall be buried, and blemished they can be redeemed. a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan, from the latter clause
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The blameless shall be buried, and those with blemishes shall be redeemed. The conclusion of Rabbi Yochanan's statement is from the latter part!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן — נִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan say to you: What are we dealing with here? with blemished from the outset. So, too, it is reasonable as, if you say whose consecrations preceded their blemishes, Rabbi Shimon should disagree with
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: Here, with what are we dealing? With a blemished animal from its inception. This is reasonable, for if you were to say that they sanctified it before it developed a blemish, Rabbi Shimon would disagree.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּשֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן. וְנִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֲלַהּ! אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָכִי נָמֵי דִּפְלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: But let us say is a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish, Reish Lakish say to you: What are we dealing with here? with whose consecrations preceded their blemishes. But Rabbi Shimon should disagree with Reish Lakish say to you: Indeed, Rabbi Shimon disagrees
llm_translation: Rather, let us say that the objection should be attributed to Reish Lakish! Reish Lakish said to you: With what are we dealing here? With that they consecrated their blemished animals beforehand. And Rabbi Shimon disagreed with him! Reish Lakish said to you: Indeed, this is the reason that Rabbi Shimon disagreed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר לְרַבָּנַן: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, וְקָתָנֵי ״קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: According to Reish Lakish, who says according to the Rabbis, consecrated for the altar were not included standing and valuation, and it is taught consecrated for the altar
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: to Reish Lakish, who said to the Rabbis: the holy items of the altar were not included in the standing and arranging, and it is taught: "the holy items of the altar."

hebrew_text: בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין יִפָּדוּ״, וּמוֹקְמִינַן לָהּ בְּשֶׁקָּדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים!
human_translation: blemished can be redeemed; and we established with whose consecrations preceded their blemishes, conclude from one may redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs.
llm_translation: Owners of blemished animals shall redeem them, and we establish for it that they consecrated their blemish first, hear from it, we redeem the holy items to feed them to dogs!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּשֶׁעָבַר וּשְׁחָטָן.
human_translation: what are we dealing with here? With where transgressed and slaughtered them
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With crossing over and slaughtering.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנָּפַל בָּהֶן מוּם, וּשְׁחָטָן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יִקָּבֵרוּ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: As it is taught all sacrificial that developed a blemish and slaughtered them, Rabbi Meir says they shall be buried, And the Rabbis say: it can be redeemed.
llm_translation: As it was taught: All holy things in which a blemish occurred, and they were slaughtered, Rabbi Meir says: They shall be buried, and the sages say: They shall be redeemed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, אַמַּאי תְּמִימִים יִקָּבֵרוּ? מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזוּ לְהַקְרָבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: According to Rabbi Shimon, who said consecrated for Temple maintenance were not included in standing and valuation why unblemished shall be buried because they are fit for sacrifice
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: to Rabbi Shimon, who said: the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard were not included in the count of the assembly and the arrangement, so why should the perfect ones be buried? Because they were seen for offering.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַמַּתְפִּיס תְּמִימִים לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, כְּשֶׁהֵן נִפְדִּין — אֵינָן נִפְדִּין אֶלָּא לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, שֶׁכׇּל הָרָאוּי לַמִּזְבֵּחַ אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִידֵי מִזְבֵּחַ לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: As it is taught One who associates unblemished for Temple maintenance, they are redeemed only for the altar, as any that is fit on the altar may never leave altar.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who seizes innocent animals to inspect the house, when they are redeemed — they are only redeemed for the altar, for anything fit for the altar does not depart from the obligation of the altar forever.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רָבָא: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ דְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ דְּלָא הָוֵי בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה. וְלָא?!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye, and some say Rava According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who interprets to blemished from the outset, and everyone, holds that blemished from the outset was not included in standing and valuation, And not
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye, and some say it was Rava: To Rabbi Yochanan, who holds that a blemished animal is disqualified from the outset, and everyone else agrees with him that a blemished animal is disqualified from the outset, as it is not included in standing or appraisal. Is it not so?!

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁקָּדַם מוּם קָבוּעַ לְהֶקְדֵּשָׁן וְנִפְדּוּ, חַיָּיבִין בַּבְּכוֹרָה וּבַמַּתָּנוֹת, וְיוֹצְאִין לְחוּלִּין לִיגָּזֵז וְלֵיעָבֵד.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn All the sacrificial which a permanent blemish preceded their consecration And they are redeemed, are obligated in, a firstborn; and in the gifts and they emerge non-sacred to be shorn and to be utilized for labor.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: All consecrated animals that had a permanent blemish before they were consecrated and were redeemed, are obligated in the laws of firstborn animals and gifts to the priests, and they may be taken out to be shorn and to work in a field.

hebrew_text: וְלָדָן וַחֲלָבָן מוּתָּר לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן, וְהַשּׁוֹחֲטָן בַּחוּץ פָּטוּר, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה, וְאִם מֵתוּ יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: their offspring and their milk are permitted after their redemption. And one who slaughters them outside exempt and do not render a substitute. And if died they may be redeemed.
llm_translation: Dan and Chalban are permitted after their redemption, and one who slaughters outside is exempt, and they do not make an exchange, and if they die, they shall be redeemed.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיוּ, כְּדִתְנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אִם מֵתוּ יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says, This the statement of Rabbi Shimon, who says consecrated for the altar were included in standing and valuation, consecrated for Temple maintenance were not As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: If consecrated for Temple maintenance died, they can be redeemed,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: These are the words of Rabbi Shimon, as he said: The holy items of the altar were included in the standing and arranging, but the holy items of the Temple floor were not, as we learned: Rabbi Shimon says, if the holy items of the Temple floor die, they are redeemed.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּבַעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ שֶׁנִּפְדֶּה, מַאי טַעְמָא? דַּאֲמַר קְרָא: ״אוֹתָהּ״, ״אוֹתָהּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ הָיָה בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon concedes with regard to blemished from the outset, that it is redeemed. What is the reason? As the verse states: it” “it” to exclude blemished from the outset But the Rabbis say: even blemished from the outset, was included in standing and valuation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon concedes regarding a blemished animal from its inception that was redeemed, what is the reason? As the verse states: "it," "it" to exclude a blemished animal from its inception. But the sages say: even a blemished animal from its inception was included in standing and evaluation!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲכָמִים? תַּנָּא דְּבֵי לֵוִי. אִי הָכִי, ״זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן״ וְתוּ לָא? ״זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וּמַחְלוּקְתּוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to who is the Rabbis? a tanna of the school of Levi. If so, this the statement of Rabbi Shimon, and nothing more? He should have this statement of Rabbi Shimon and disagree him,
llm_translation: He said to him: Who is a sage? The Mishna of the house of Levi. If so, "This is the statement of Rabbi Shimon" and not? "This is the statement of Rabbi Shimon and his dispute" is required!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דְּלָא קָתָנֵי הָכִי, מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר לְרַבָּנַן: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ.
human_translation: said to him: that does not teach this because Rav holds in accordance with Reish Lakish, who said according to the Rabbis consecrated for Temple maintenance were included in standing and valuation; consecrated for the altar were not
llm_translation: He said to him: This that it does not teach thus, is because Rav holds like Reish Lakish, for he said to the Rabbis: The consecrated items of the Temple courtyard were included in the category of standing and valuation, but the consecrated items of the altar were not.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישָׁא קָתָנֵי: ״וְאִם מֵתוּ יִפָּדוּ״, וְסֵיפָא קָתָנֵי: ״אִם מֵתוּ יִקָּבֵרוּ״.
human_translation: And the first clause teaches if they died they can be redeemed. the latter clause teaches if they died they shall be buried.
llm_translation: The beginning teaches: "And if they die, they shall be redeemed." And the end teaches: "If they die, they shall be buried."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, רַב כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ ״זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וּמַחְלוּקְתּוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, אֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, And that a difficulty for you, should have this the statement of Rabbi Shimon and disagree him, say: Indeed the opinion of
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav as Rabbi Yochanan holds it likely, and it is difficult for you, "This is the statement of Rabbi Shimon and his dispute," he requires it to be said, say thus.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּקְבָּרִין: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁהִפִּילוּ — יִקָּבֵרוּ, הִפִּילָה שִׁלְיָא — תִּקָּבֵר, וְשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, וְצִפֳּרֵי מְצוֹרָע, וְשֵׂיעַר נָזִיר,
human_translation: And these are the that are buried a sacrificial that miscarried, shall be buried. miscarried a placenta, shall be buried. And an ox that is stoned and a heifer whose neck is broken and the birds by a leper and the hair of a nazirite
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are those who are buried: Holy items that became disqualified - shall be buried; if a miscarriage occurred - it shall be buried; and an ox that is stoned, and a decapitated calf, and the birds of a leper, and the hair of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, וּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה יִשָּׂרֵפוּ, וְכֵן חַיָּה שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה בַּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: And the firstborn of a donkey and of meat in milk; and non-sacred that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard. Rabbi Shimon says: Non-sacred that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard shall be burned, And likewise, an undomesticated animal that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard,
llm_translation: And the firstborn of a donkey, and meat cooked in milk, and non-consecrated animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard. Rabbi Shimon says: Non-consecrated animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard should be burned, and likewise an animal that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּשְׂרָפִין: חָמֵץ בַּפֶּסַח — יִשָּׂרֵף, וּתְרוּמָה טְמֵאָה, וְהָעׇרְלָה, וְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לִשָּׂרֵוף — ישרף, וְאֶת שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לְהִקָּבֵר — יִקָּבֵר, וּמַדְלִיקִין בְּפַת וּבְשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה. כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ חוּץ לִזְמַנָּן וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמָן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִשָּׂרֵפוּ.
human_translation: And these are the that are burned: Leavened bread on Passover shall be burned. And ritually impure teruma . And the fruit that grows on a tree during the three years after it was planted [ orla ], and diverse kinds in a vineyard, those whose manner is to be burned, shall be burned; and those whose manner is to be buried, shall be buried. And one ignite with bread and with oil of teruma , all sacrificial that were slaughtered beyond their time or outside their place, those shall be burned.
llm_translation: And these are the ones that are burned: Chametz on Passover - shall be burned, and impure Terumah, and uncircumcised, and mixtures of the vineyard, that which their way is to burn - shall be burned, and that which their way is to bury - shall be buried, and they light with bread and oil of Terumah. All holy things that were slaughtered outside their time and outside their place - behold, these shall be burned.

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי — יִשָּׂרֵף, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יִקָּבֵר. חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק — תִּשָּׂרֵף, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יְטִילֶנָּה לָאַמָּה.
human_translation: a provisional guilt offering shall be burned, Rabbi Yehuda says: It shall be buried. A sin offering of the bird that comes due to an uncertainty, shall be burned, Rabbi Yehuda says: One should cast it into the drain,
llm_translation: Guilt offering suspended — shall be burned, Rabbi Yehuda says: shall be buried. Sin offering of a bird that comes upon doubt — shall be burned, Rabbi Yehuda says: shall be thrown to the cubit.

hebrew_text: כָּל הַנִּקְבָּרִין — לֹא יִשָּׂרֵפוּ, וְכׇל הַנִּשְׂרָפִין — לֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם רָצָה לְהַחְמִיר עַל עַצְמוֹ לִשְׂרוֹף אֶת הַנִּקְבָּרִין — רַשַּׁאי. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ מוּתָּר לְשַׁנּוֹת.
human_translation: All that are buried shall not be burned, and all that are burned shall not be buried. Rabbi Yehuda says: If one wished to impose a stringency upon himself burning that are buried, permitted said to One is not permitted to change
llm_translation: All the buried ones — shall not be burned, and all the burned ones — shall not be buried. Rabbi Yehuda says: If one wishes to be stringent upon himself to burn the buried ones — he is permitted. They said to him: He is not permitted to deviate.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׂעַר הַנָּזִיר יִקָּבֵר. רָמֵי לֵיהּ טָבִי לְרַב נַחְמָן: תְּנַן שְׂעַר הַנָּזִיר יִקָּבֵר, וּרְמִינְהוּ: הָאוֹרֵג ״מְלֹא הַסִּיט״ מִצֶּמֶר בְּכוֹר בְּבֶגֶד — יִדָּלֵק הַבֶּגֶד, מִשְּׂעַר הַנָּזִיר וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר בְּשַׂק — יִדָּלֵק הַשַּׂק!
human_translation: the hair of a nazirite shall be buried. Tavi raised a contradiction before Rav Naḥman: We learned the hair of a nazirite shall be buried; but raise a contradiction One who weaves one sit , of the wool of a firstborn in a garment, the garment shall be ignited. from the hair of a nazirite, or a firstborn donkey, in a sack, the sack shall be ignited.
llm_translation: Gemara: The hair of a Nazirite shall be buried. Rav Nahman raised an objection to him: We learned that the hair of a Nazirite shall be buried, and we raised a dilemma: If a weaver weaves "full of the warp" with firstborn wool in a garment - the garment shall be burned; if a Nazirite's hair and a firstborn donkey's afterbirth are in a sack - the sack shall be burned!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּאן בְּנָזִיר טָמֵא, כָּאן בְּנָזִיר טָהוֹר.
human_translation: said to Here, with regard to a nazirite ritually impure, there, with regard to a ritually pure nazirite,
llm_translation: He said to him: Here in the case of a Nazirite who is impure, here in the case of a Nazirite who is pure.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁנֵּית נָזִיר אַנָּזִיר, פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר אַפֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר קַשְׁיָא! אִישְׁתִּיק וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת — כָּאן בְּשַׂק, כָּאן בְּשֵׂעָר.
human_translation: said to You have answered a nazirite a nazirite. a firstborn donkey a firstborn donkey a difficulty, was silent and said nothing to said to him: you heard anything with regard to this said to him: This Rav Sheshet said Here, in a sack, there, to the hair
llm_translation: He said to him, "A second Nazirite I am a Nazirite, a firstborn donkey I am a firstborn donkey, difficult! He remained silent and did not respond to him immediately. He said to him: Do you have any tradition regarding this matter? He said to him: Thus said Rav Sheshet - here with a sack, here with hair.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּאן — בְּשַׂק, כָּאן — בְּשֵׂעָר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: כָּאן — בְּנָזִיר טָהוֹר, כָּאן — בְּנָזִיר טָמֵא.
human_translation: also stated Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Here, in a sack, there to the hair Rabbi Elazar says: Here, to a ritually pure nazirite, there to a ritually impure nazirite.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Here - with a sack, here - with hair. Rabbi Elazar said: Here - with a pure Nazirite, here - with an impure Nazirite.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיבְטֵל שַׂק בְּרוּבָּא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּצִיפּוּרְתָּא. צִיפּוּרְתָּא? לִישַׁלּוֹפִינְהוּ!
human_translation: said to let a sack be nullified by the majority, Rav Pappa said: with a bird bird Let him remove
llm_translation: He said to him: Let the sack be nullified in the majority! Rav Papa said: With a bird's nest. A bird's nest? Let them shake it out!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אִם רָצָה לְהַחְמִיר עַל עַצְמוֹ לִשְׂרוֹף אֶת הַנִּקְבָּרִים — רַשַּׁאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא קַשְׁיָא לַן לְשַׁלּוֹפִינְהוּ, וְאַתְּ מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said if one wished to impose a stringency upon himself burning that are buried, permitted said to him: We a difficulty one should remove and you establish in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Is this a question? It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: If one wishes to be stringent upon himself to burn the graves - he is permitted. He said to him: We are struggling to uproot them, and you are standing by them like Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: אִם אֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁלּוֹפִינְהוּ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אִם רָצָה לְהַחְמִיר עַל עַצְמוֹ לִשְׂרוֹף אֶת הַנִּקְבָּרִין — רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: This is what I say: If possible to remove it fine; and if not, Interpret in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said if one wished to impose a stringency upon himself burning that are buried, permitted
llm_translation: So I say: If it is possible to rinse them - it is better, and if not - establish it like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: If one wants to be stringent upon himself to burn the graves - he is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּשְׂרָפִין. אָמַר מָר: חָמֵץ בַּפֶּסַח — יִשָּׂרֵף. סְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אֵין בִּיעוּר חָמֵץ אֶלָּא שְׂרֵפָה.
human_translation: And these are the that are burned: The Master said leavened bread on Passover shall be burned. the tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said the eradication of leavened bread only by burning.
llm_translation: These are the ones that are burned. The Master said: "Chametz on Passover - shall be burned." It was taught to us in a general manner like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "The removal of chametz is only through burning."

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה וְהָעׇרְלָה כּוּ׳. הָא כֵיצַד? אֳוכָלִין בִּשְׂרֵפָה, מַשְׁקִין בִּקְבוּרָה.
human_translation: ritually impure teruma And orla How so, Foods by burning; liquids by burial.
llm_translation: Tractate: Terumah, impure and uncircumcised. How so? Eating carrion, drinking grave water.

hebrew_text: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק — יְטִילֶנָּה לָאַמָּה, וּמְנַתְּחָה אֵבֶר אֵבֶר, וְזוֹרְקָן לָאַמָּה, וּמִתְגַּלְגֶּלֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְנַחַל קִדְרוֹן.
human_translation: A sin offering of the bird is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: a sin offering of the bird that comes due to an uncertainty, one should cast it into the drain. And He severs limb limb and tosses into the drain, and rolls continuously to the Kidron River
llm_translation: Sin offering of bird, etc. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: The sin offering of a bird that comes for a doubt - he shall throw it a cubit, and dismember it limb by limb, and throw them a cubit, and it rolls and goes to Nahal Kidron.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַנִּקְבָּרִין לֹא יִשָּׂרֵפוּ כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּנִקְבָּרִין אֶפְרָן אָסוּר, וְנִשְׂרָפִין אֶפְרָן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: all that are buried shall not be burned, What is the reason because with regard to buried, their ashes are prohibited, but burned, their ashes are permitted.
llm_translation: All who are buried shall not be cremated. What is the reason? Because buried Ephraim is prohibited, and cremated Ephraim is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְנִקְבָּרִין אֶפְרָן אָסוּר? וְהָתַנְיָא: דַּם הַנִּדָּה וּבְשַׂר הַמֵּת שֶׁנִּפְרְכוּ — טְהוֹרִין, מַאי לַָאו טְהוֹרִין וּמוּתָּרִין? לָא, טְהוֹרִין וַאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: And buried their ashes are prohibited? But isn’t it taught the blood of a menstruating woman and the flesh of a corpse, where crumbled, ritually pure. What, is it not ritually pure and permitted No, pure but prohibited
llm_translation: And are they buried Efran forbidden? And it was taught: the blood of menstruation and the flesh of the dead that decomposed - pure, what is it for? Not, pure and forbidden.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב פִּנְחָס: עוֹלַת הָעוֹף שֶׁנִּתְמַצָּה דָּמָהּ, מוּרְאָתָהּ וְנוֹצָה שֶׁלָּהּ יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה. מַאי לַָאו יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה וּמוּתָּרִין? לָא, יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה וַאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Pineḥas raises an objection a burnt offering of the bird whose blood was squeezed its crop and its feathers, have removed from misuse. What, is it not they have removed from misuse And permitted No, they have removed from misuse, but prohibited
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Pinchas asks: Regarding the burnt offering of a bird, if its blood, its crop, and its feathers were found, they have fulfilled their obligation through the garment. What is the reason that they have fulfilled their obligation through the garment and are permitted? No, they have fulfilled their obligation through the garment, but they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְנִשְׂרָפִין דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ אֶפְרָן מוּתָּר? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: כׇּל הַנִּשְׂרָפִין אֶפְרָם מוּתָּר, חוּץ מֵאֵפֶר אֲשֵׁירָה — וְאֵפֶר דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ לְעוֹלָם אָסוּר!
human_translation: And consecrated burned their ashes are permitted? But isn’t it taught all that must be burned, their ashes are permitted, except for wood from a tree [ ashera ]. And ash of consecrated is prohibited forever.
llm_translation: "And burnt offerings of the consecrated, Ephraim is permitted? But it was taught: All burnt offerings, Ephraim is permitted, except for the ashes of an Asherah tree - and the ashes of the consecrated are forever forbidden!"

hebrew_text: וּמִיעְרָב הוּא דְּלָא קָעָרֵיב לְהוּ וְתָנֵי לְהוּ, מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲשֵׁירָה יֵשׁ לָהּ בְּטִילָה בְּגוֹי, הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֵין לוֹ בְּטִילָה עוֹלָמִית. קָתָנֵי מִיהָא: אֵפֶר הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְעוֹלָם אָסוּר.
human_translation: And did not combine them and teach them because an ashera has nullification by a gentile, consecrated never has nullification. In any event, teaches ash of consecrated is prohibited forever.
llm_translation: And if he mixed it without intending to bring it close to them, and he taught them, because it is permitted to her in nullification in the case of a gentile, but with regard to hekdesh, it does not have nullification forever. It teaches from here: Ashes of hekdesh are forbidden forever.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כְּגוֹן דְּנָפְלָה דְּלֵיקָה בַּעֲצֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ מֵאֵלֶיהָ, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יְדִיעַ מַאן, דְּלָא הָוֵי אִינִישׁ דְּלִמְעוֹל, דְּלִיפּוֹק אֶפְרָן לְחוּלִּין.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: for example, if a fire fell by itself onto consecrated wood. Since it cannot known who there is no person who misused that its ash should change to non-sacred
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: For example, if a lamp falls into consecrated wood, since it is not known who it belongs to, no one is considered negligent until Ephraim emerges for mundane matters.

hebrew_text: רַב שְׁמַעְיָה אָמַר: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָא מַתְנִיתָא בִּתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן תַּנְיָא, דִּלְעוֹלָם אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Shemaya said: When this baraita was taught, taught with regard to the removal of the ashes In that is prohibited forever.
llm_translation: Rav Shemaya said: For it was taught in a Baraita: In the case of the offering of the ashes, it was taught, that it is always prohibited.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשָׂמוֹ״ בְּנַחַת, ״וְשָׂמוֹ״ כּוּלּוֹ, ״וְשָׂמוֹ״ שֶׁלֹּא יְפַזֵּר.
human_translation: As it is taught “and he shall put them” gently, “and he shall put them” all of them. “and he shall put them” that he shall not scatter
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And he shall place" - gently, "and he shall place" entirely, "and he shall place" so that he does not scatter.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יֵשׁ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת תְּמוּרָה.
llm_translation: We will return to you, there is in the holy altar, and a conclusion to it is the tractate Temurah.
